description:
Simon's Special = Best deli sandwich in The City!

Roxie Food Center sets the bar for all other sandwiches. Simon's Special is simply a Winner - turkey and pastrami combo with melted cheddar cheese and the fixins between a loaf of Dutch Crunch bread: Man, it doesn't get any better! Do yourself a favor and give it a try if you haven't already, it does not disappoint.

Aside from this glorious sammy, Roxie Food Center is fully stocked with all your favorites snacky snacks. It's all too easy to pick up a bag of hot Cheetos as you walk through the aisles... or peach gummies... or a Hershey's cookies and cream bar... I'll have it all, please! If you love this place like I do, take it to the next level and cop that Roxie swag: show your support and rep this hometown gem with T-shirts and hats. Roxie Food Center FTW!
author: Roderick T.

description:
The large is HUGE, definitely enough for 2 hungry people.  

We ordered the joker (asked for jalapeños on the side, but they forgot them). They do not skip on the cheese, but I wish they had not skimped on the coleslaw.

The place is a tight squeeze (ironic since the sammy are so big).  They have a good selection of chips including Voodoo (from New Orleans).

Plan to eat in your car, luckily we found a spot right across the street next to the park.
author: Amy W.

description:
Picked up a sandwich from here today. Chicken and avocado on Dutch crutch. It was bomb! So good. And so big it was enough for lunch and dinner.

Will 100% be back.
author: Erin J.

description:
My bf loves this place, he's been going here since he was a kid. He loves a good sandwich, and we would come here during our lunch break from school.

They also have nice artwork on the side of the building/convenient store, so it's hard to miss. Parking could be a pain since it's in a residential area.

Just something about these sandwiches here makes it my number 2 favorite sub shop (and I am not a sandwich kind of gal).

Maybe it's the Dutch crunch bread, or the excellent customer service. My bf says the guy cashier reminds him of Rocky, maybe it's because of his accent. 

The sandwiches are big and the ingredients inside is just put together very well. The sub is consistent. Haven't had a bad one here. Don't forget to grab a bag of chips and drink.

Will be coming back often.
author: Teena N.

description:
I recently moved to the neighborhood and today I tried Roxie's for the first time - which I am told is must-go for all Mission Terrace residents. The building space is small and cramped, there are a lot of people constantly coming and going - so if you are like me and have anxiety you can always wait outside the front door for your sandwich. 
I had the Simon Special and it was absolutely delicious. I can't wait to go back and try their other sandwiches as well!
author: Liz Z.

description:
I love door dashing from Roxie's. They have the best sandwich in the city that I've had so far anyway. :) 

I usually order a turkey hot sandwich with added pastrami and cheddar cheese on a dutch crunch roll. It's not listed on the app, but if you look through the old Yelp photos, it's referred to as the Simon special. Maybe he doesn't work there anymore? idk. I just know it's freaking delicious and I could eat it everyday. Food is usually still nice and warm even when you get it delivered which totally scores huge points for me! 

I really want to try the Roxie special, meatball mafia, and Tony's tri-tip. I need to make more of an effort to order something new. I cant get away from the turkey pastrami...will update if I do!
author: Dianna C.

description: Best pastrami Dutch Crunch bread ever. Love the options of chips and drinks but of course it is a liquor store. The service is great! I always try to come there when ever I can. Price is decent and they give you a good amount of meat. You should eat it right away once made hot. Any sandwich hot turn cold of course isn't the same. I'm in search of a good Dutch Crunch pastrami sandwich and so far this is my favorite.
author: Christy V.

description: This place use to be so good but now it seems like the people they hired to make sandwiches can't even make a decent sandwich. Even when compared to Mr pickles , Sam's sandwiches and even Ike's it doesn't fair well...  And those sandwich places aren't even that good to begin with...The Dutch crunch wasn't even heated properly the last three times I went there and the cheese was not melted..Not to mention the price is way over priced for what it is today..  I would have no problem paying if it was actually as good as it was back then. Its no where near the taste it was compare to the old days. Sadly, I would eat a Subway sandwich then to buy another sandwich from this place again. It's really sad given it was my go to spot for years. I wonder what happened to this place.
author: Herb L.

description:
WOW! Love this place! My sandwiches are delicious! The rest of the review is given and typed by my 8yr old! 

My kids love the sandwiches too! The sandwiches taste like heaven. The salami sandwiches are so good! The meatball sandwiches were tasty. All the sandwiches came with lots of filing. Make sure you know what you want because the line goes quick. You can buy chips with your meal
(sandwich)

don't forget to take some pics in front of the murals!
author: Angel G.

description: Roxie's has been my go-to sandwich spot since I was 9 years old and the 26 bus line stopped at corner and when all the sandwiches were made cold. I love this place. I flew a sandwich from here to NY for a Roxie's fan. The quality has never changed nor has the hospitality of the peeps that work there. The roast beef and Swiss on Dutch crunch with everything (cold) will always hit the spot when I'm craving a sandwich. They also have great chip/drink selection. Do yourself a favor and grab a sandwich here and then go eat it across the street at balboa park on a sunny day, it's a 415 classic.
author: Michelle R.

description: Roast beef toasted on dutch bread with pepperjack, avocado, mayo, & mustard (+chips/drinks) 100% worth 20$, great size and filling. This is my favorite combination aside from my personal favorite. 10/10 on the RB sandwich.
author: Angel B.

description:
Been going here over 15 years, never disappoints, best sandwiches in the bay
Simple and delicious ingredients that still hold up to its long standing excellence for their ever-so-tasty hot and cold turkey salami in Dutch crunch !
author: Eka E.

description:
When my friend told me that the best sandwiches in the area were sold at the corner liquor store, I admit I was hesitant. But after taking a bite of that beautiful hot pastrami on Dutch Crunch bread, I was sold. 

The store is small and is located in a residential area where street parking is available. While I waited for my sandwich, I perused the two aisles and saw that there was a decent selection of chips, drinks (alcoholic and non-alcoholic), and candy. The items are a bit expensive, but you are supporting a local store. It took about 10 minutes for the sandwich to be prepared and it was loaded with generous servings of meat and all the dressings. It's a very filling sandwich and can easily be shared between two people. Seating is not available, so it's a grab and go type of place.
author: Katie C.

description: I love Roxies I've been going there my whole life they have some of the best sandwiches in town hands down
author: Lauren T.

description: Love Roxie's sandwiches. No doubt, they're amazing. I usually go to the one in the sunset but since moving to the bay shore area it's not as convenient to get to anymore. So when I saw through a food delivery app that there was a Roxie's nearby to be delivered I was ecstatic. And then it was delivered...opened it up so excited to get all that goodness in my belly only to have my excitement completely stomped on and crushed...the entire sandwich was burnt!! Like not even just the top or lightly scorched. Like burnt on all sides burnt. Black burnt. Black. And as if that wasn't bad enough they made my sandwich wrong. Missing key ingredients. Not cool Roxie, not cool.
author: Kimmy N.

description: Best sandwiches ever! Super fast service and very nice people! The bread, the meats everything they use is so fresh! I love the Dutch crunch turkey sandwich with everything! They are big and well worth the money!
author: Bella P.

description:
Believe the hype!

Roxie Food Center is another San Francisco institution that's been feeding and serving the community for many years. The Tannous brothers, a Greek Orthodox Palestinian immigrant family purchased the corner store in 1975 and the rest is history.

Not only to they serve hella delicious sammiches to the community, but they have also been a pillar to the community by sponsoring Little League teams, baseball, basketball and football teams at Balboa High School and nearby City College. Not only sports, but they have also sponsored Thanksgiving dinners, Easter Egg hunts, Fourth of July parades and countless other neighborhood activities. 

They are also huge Giants and 49ers fans as their exterior wall has a mural of both teams and the neighborhood as well as their own. Of course the mural is fairly new as it's only been a few years as it din't look this before back in the day.

I have to admit that even though Roxie has been around for ages, I'm a Johnny-come-lately to their sammich scene. It was a co-worker who first introduced me to their sammiches several years ago when he brought some pastrami sammich on Dutch Crunch to work one day as promised. We were talking about where to get good pastrami sammiches and he mentioned this place. I was so impressed that I had to come here myself in person to experience the awesomeness. 

If it's your first time here, just go to the side counter and order from there. It's a popular place so be prepared to wait, especially if it's peak time...which may seem like every hour. The menu is posted on the wall and you can specialize your own custom sammich or choose from their specials. Honestly, you can't go wrong with what you pick as the ingredients are fresh and delicious. They toast everything so if you don't want it toasted, make sure to mention it. You can wait outside or to the side of the store until they call your order and pay at the cash register. 

Their regular sammiches cost $8.99 for a junior, $10.99 for a regular and $15.99 for a supreme. For their specialties, it cost $9.99 for a junior, $11.99 for a regular and $16.99 for a supreme. Seriously, these things are effin' huge and a regular could feed two people and a supreme could feed a village and have enough leftovers for your dog. 

This place is local and legit.
author: John G.

description:
I've been coming here since I was a little girl.  I grew up in the area and played soccer for many years at Balboa Park.  In fact, I'm pretty sure that the only reason I played soccer for as long as I did was because I got rewarded with Roxie Jr. Dutch Crunch Salami or Turkey sandwiches on the regular.  I've been food motivated from an early age.  

Because of my wonderful childhood sandwich indulgences I'm scarred for life.  I expect all sandwiches to be on dutch crunch bread.  Take that back.  I expect all sandwiches to be on dutch crunch bread that is as good as you get from Roxie.  And unfortunately for me, I have found dutch crunch bread in NJ (called Marco Polo bread fyi) that is a disgrace to dutch crunch.  So needless to say, when I come home I get my dutch crunch on.  They are still as good as I remember!
author: Justine D.

description: Went here for lunch, was referred by a patient I had on the ambulance. This is a great place to get a juicy, tasty sandwich. Everyone should try the Tonys Special best bbq sandwich I've ever had!
author: Tanesha G.

description: You can't say you've eaten a sandwich in San Francisco if you haven't had a sandwich from Roxie's! Growing up this was always my favorite sandwich shop. Always great quality sandwiches, not to mention huge portions, and always great customer service. Whats even more convenient now is that via Yelp, orders can be placed for pick up or delivery! Oh and hands down they really have the best quality of "dutch crunch" bread!
author: Sarina A.

description:
I've been going to Roxie's for about 6-7 years now. This has and will always be my favorite San Francisco sandwich shop. Sandwiches are always delicious, made to order and leave me wanting to come back for more. They have never messed up an order either!

I love the neighborhood vibe here and that it is inside a corner store. You can tell everyone that comes here is a local / SF native. Every time I have family or friend visiting, I take them here. 


The owner and workers are always friendly and nice!
author: Jordan R.

description:
The saying "never judge a book by its cover" is famous for a reason. Roxie is a sandwich stop that by no means should be ignored because of its location. 

The place is definitely a bit cramped but the wait is worthwhile. Tony, the guy in charge is kind and puts up with a lot from people so kudos to him. 

I got the Simon special regular sized and that was my dinner. 3 hours later I'm still not eating. The sandwich made fresh is so good and filling and the Dutch crunch bread is delicious. 10/10 would recommend to anyone. Who knew pastrami and turkey would be a killer combo. 

As for the Food Center itself, it has an incredibly eclectic mix of things to buy. If you're in need of a snack, for sure come here. Just don't expect to find a healthy snack. 

Bonus: grab your sandwich and walk to Balboa Park across the street and run into cute dogs.
author: Michael L.

description: When I was going to CCSF this was my go to the owners were friendly and the sandwiches were fresh definitely a destination spot for anyone the area looking for a sandwich.
author: Weyland W.

description:
Roxie is hands down the best sandwich place! I've grown up eating here and been going to Roxie for 15+ years since I used to live a few blocks away. My order usually is the Tuna sandwich or Crab Meat on Dutch Crunch with everything on it, including the Jalapenos. 
My favorite thing about Roxie is that you can smell the fresh toasted breads when you walk past. One whiff, and you will start craving for their sandwiches. All of their sandwiches are so delicious. If you are in the area or not, check this place out!

Pro-Tip: I recommend calling beforehand to place your order so you don't have to wait
author: Steph L.

description: Best mini market in the whole bay area. Not a big place, not much to look at for curb appeal, but whoa Nellie Nuggets those samwhuches are bomb. Nice friendly fun people, coffee is great, donuts great, everything a mini market should be, plus the bag 'o chips.
author: Kirk L.

description: I was craving a good sandwich so I decided to head to Roxie's. Yelp has this place listed to close at 9:00 PM. I show up and the doors are closed. It is 8:15 PM. It closes at 8:00 PM, not 9:00 PM
author: Manolo F.

description: Sandwiches are bomb. Been going here since I was 7 years old. Definitely recommend! In my opinion the sandwiches are a bit pricey but we are in SF.
author: Joseph S.

description:
Omg!!  Heard about this place from a co- worker.  Tried it yesterday.  Ordered the supreme tri tip sandwich!!  It was, by far, the best sandwich I have ever had!!  Worth every penny and could feed three people easily!!

Above all, the owner and his family were so friendly and just downright nice people!!  Can't wait to go back and it will be very soon!!
author: Janet G.

description:
This little gem has been around the area for the longest time. I remember buying sandwiches here when I was in high school, and fast forward to now -- I had their sandwich last week and another one today!

Last week, I had the Roxie sandwich with everything on Italian roll. The bread was a delicious soft roll, and inside the sandwich was filled with goodies. They weigh the meat that they put on the sandwich which I like, because they do not skimp on the meat, I got the regular size and the sandwich was bigger than my head so it became two meals for me.

Today I had the junior sized chicken breast avocado sandwich with everything on 9 grain bread. I wish I chose a soft roll instead but I was trying to be healthy. Good thing they gave more than enough chicken on my sandwich. The chicken tasted delicious and I was full off the junior.

If you never had Roxie, you definitely need to try this place. I brought my friend here and this is now his favorite sandwich spot.

P.S. It gets pretty busy any time of the day so call ahead so you don't have to wait!
author: Julian Y.

description:
Who would have thought the little bodega on San Jose, a few blocks down the road from Red Sea Market - another bodega - would be one of the best sammich shops in the entire City? Any time around noon expect a line out the door filled with a fascinating mix of high school students, college students, construction workers, locals, cops, and business people all looking to get one of the best.

As you walk in, the place is claustrophobic: against the left wall are the fridge cases with non-alcoholic drinks, and behind it some household supplies; against the far wall is the fridge case with the alcoholic drinks, OJ, milk, and a few other items. In the center are snacks ranging from chips, cookies, cereals, etc.

But you came here for the best sammich - so after walking down the left aisle, you curve around the back and walk past the sandwich counter to the front to order. Behind the counter, above the booze, is the main menu listing the types of meats, cheeses, and names of specials and the three sizes - small, regular, and large. 

I've gotten a mix of sandwiches here - some classics like ham-turkey-roast beef; I've gotten crab salad which I may have to get again; but the Meatball Mafia is my guilty pleasure. Filled to bursting with sliced up meatballs, provolone, cream cheese, marinara sauce and a few other things. Get it on dutch crunch and it is so good. 

The staff is always incredibly nice and helpful, from the sandwich masters to the cashier/owner. Everyone in the area knows Roxie's, so if you find yourself on the south side of the City, make this a stop.
author: Michael C.

description: Ginormous sammich! I got the Simon Special Supreme to share with my bf. We got it cut into 3's because it was going to be difficult and messy to eat. It was definitely  more than enough for us. Swapped out cheddar cheese for provolone. It was scrumptious! The original Roxie's is better than the one in Sunset. This place is just so goood.
author: Lucy L.

description: Best sandwiches in SF in my opinion. My go to sandwich's is the regular Roxie delight turkey, bacon, avocado, Swiss and everything on it) on Dutch crunch, pastrami w/ cheddar on Dutch crunch w/ everything, and roast beef w/ provolone on Dutch crunch w/ everything. I been going here since 1993 when I went to Denman middle skoo.
author: Mark H.

description: Love this old school deli!  Best sandwiches.  My fave vegetarian is delicious. Takes me back to simpler days in my old neighborhood. Don't miss out on this gem in the outer mission area.   You won't be disappointed.
author: Jessica L.

description:
The reviews got it so wrong, completely backwards. I hunted down the original place due to the (temporary or permanent, I'm not sure) closing of the Tanforan location that shared a space with Cinnabon. I was surprised to see on yelp that the Tanforan location had bad reviews that called the original so much better, because every sandwich I've had at the Tanforan location was consistently great. Here, though, maybe I just had one rare bad experience, because most other reviews praise this place, but compared to the great sandwiches at Tanforan the sandwiches from here were so disappointing. On its own it was just average, not great or even good but at least not bad, but with the compared experience of Tanforan I was extremely disappointed. 

Average, of course, should be worth 3 stars, and personal disappointment shouldn't be enough to knock off another star, but the prices - holy shit, the prices. I didn't see prices displayed and when they asked what size I wanted and said their largest was footlong, I was thinking why not, it's so good. They rung me up and I found out the sandwiches were 16 each. The price surprised me but, thinking of the Tanforandwich, I thought it wasn't unreasonable. Just half of a small sandwich at the Tanforan location was filling.

I get home, open it, and something looks wrong. It's not pretty, picture-perfect like the Tanforandwich, but that's okay, I thought. As long as it tastes good. Looks rather small though. I guess they pack it lighter than Tanforan. I feel a little overcharged, but whatever. Now for that first delicious bite - what? What is this? This is just a sandwich. Where's the wow? It's so... average. Am I sure this is the right Roxie's? Yes, the employees confirmed it. Oh god, what a waste of money. I've been robbed.

It's an average sandwich, but those are not average sandwich prices. That's the price of a great or at least really good sandwich, which these aren't. These prices are criminal.

I really hope the Tanforan location isn't closed, because if it is, I lost a really good sandwich place, and this original is no substitute. It's not even worth revisiting.
author: Brandon L.

description: You will be here waiting for hours for a dam Sandwitch .. customer service is rude and the store is packed very small n the inside.
author: Demario P.

description:
Best. Sandwich. Evahhhhhh....

Seriously though, other than some specialty sandwiches that are the best of their category (e.g. po-boys and muffalettas...), these are the all around best sandwiches I've had pretty much ever.

My boyfriend and I ordered the Roxie Special and the Simon Special - both on Dutch Crunch, both "regular" size, both with "everything" (mustard, mayo, lettuce, tomato, onion, pickle, and jalapeno).  The servings are HUGE - we could probably split a regular or maybe a jumbo, to the extent we want the same thing.  I did not need this much food (but we ate it all)...

The bread was really good, although one of our sandwiches had a bit of a crispier crust than the other....more crispy, more better.  It didn't change my life like it does for some people, but it's good bread, certainly.  The softness of the interior makes it easy to eat, but it's nice to have some texture from the "crust" on top.

Interestingly, we each liked one sandwich more than the other (good to keep from getting in food fights!).  He preferred the Roxie Special, which is mortadella, ham, salami, provolone cheese, and artichoke hearts.  I preferred the Simon Special, which is turkey, pastrami, and melted cheddar cheese.

Prices were a little steep, but for how much food we got and how much we enjoyed the sandwiches, I don't mind too much...it was about $9/sandwich.

I think I'd like to come back here and try something a bit more low-key and traditional than either of the special sandwiches - they're both really good, but maybe a little intense for an every time thing.
author: Tay H.

description: We have had our first sandwiches from Roxie's- We also had the pleasure of meeting Peter. The whole interaction was so positive. Our sandwiches were turkey avocado, pastrami and crab all served on the most delightfully crisp Dutch crunch bread.  Half of the regular was the pause point. I highly recommend this hidden gem. Call ahead if you are pressed for time.
author: D T.

description: I heard about Roxie's legendary subs, but only recently made my first visit. They did not disappoint. The shop is a bit cramped (not a good place for strollers), but the service was friendly, and the sandwiches were HUGE. I ordered a large sandwich to share with my husband. I could not finish my half. We will be visiting again soon!
author: Barbara C.

description: I came on a lunch break from work. Great that you get to order online and pick it up. Saved a lot of time for me. It felt like a genuine SF spot. The cashier was really friendly. I also bought a cup of coffee for $1.50. The sandwich was SO LEGIT. Dutch crunch bread was crunchy all over on the outside, soft in the middle. I ordered the BLT. There was so much bacon inside and the right amount of mayo. Lettuce was crunchy and shredded. Literally, they couldn't have made it any better. It was a bit pricey but all in all, I would come back again and again just to try the other sandwiches. Not to blow up the spot but it was the bomb!
author: Carina L.

description: Discovered this spot accidentally when I needed cigarettes and OMG they do a VERY good sandwich over here. Do yourself a favor and get the Tony's special or the other special pastrami one I think it's named Simon. Best customer service. Small shop but they get you in/out fast. Large size is enough for two people. Excellent choice. Came back two days in a row.
author: Erin H.

description: Excellent corner shop and deli, they offer lots of snack options and their sandwiches are delicious. They have 3 sizes, and the supreme is so huge, it's like having two meals in one.
author: Kye H.

description:
Growing up in the city, I used to come here all the time. My favorite is the turkey avocado on dutch crutch with everything on it. 
Four years later, I came back to Roxie's (since moving away) and ordered the same thing, and it did not disappoint. They don't skimp on the meat and the sandwiches are always loaded. The regular size is big enough for two if you grab some chips along with it. I came in at a good time and I only waited for less than 10 minutes for my sandwich. 
If you're from the city, you know Roxie's has the best sandwiches.
author: Connie C.

description: Got a chicken sandwich for $12.99. The chicken wasn't great. Sliced up, it didn't taste good. Wish I tried something else. Definitely overpriced for a regular sandwich.
author: Princess Jasmine J.

description: I've been getting sandwiches from Roxie's since I was a teenager! I'm in my forties now and they still serve great food!! I see that the people have changed but the food is still great.
author: LL D.

description: My first visit to SF was in 2011.  A friend of mine told me to go to Roxie's for a sandwich.  In 2015 I moved to SF.  Maybe it was because of these sandwiches.
author: Jacob E.

description:
I live a block away and I was raised on their Roast Beef and Pastrami sandwiches (on Dutch Crunch bread, of course!)

You know you're from SF when Roxie's is on your list of top 3 sandwiches in the city (it's obviously my #1), despite it never showing up on the gentrification/transplant/tourist-loving lists of top sandwich spots. But you know what, maybe we should keep it that way - a real underground treasure that only the locals know about.

Thank you for feeding my soul, Roxie's!
author: Arman L.

description:
Old-school SF sandwich spot. Having practically grown-up in this city I get nostalgic coming here. Man was this a different city less than a few years ago, let alone the 25 I have been here.  The place is exactly how you would expect it to have been in the 70s 80s. I do not think a new wall hanging has been put up since. 

Anyway, I can't think of many better sandwich places. This is the real deal. Right up there with Deli-board, if you're a newbie to the city. If you are looking for a classic sandwich how they made them in the 70s 80s and 90s, early 2000 and want to get a sense of what the city was like 7 -40 years ago. This is the place.
author: H K.

description:
Friendly and delicious.  They catered an event at City College of San Francisco this evening and we really couldn't have asked for anything more perfect.  Loved the vibe of the owner.  Such a sweet guy -- and the chef (Octavio, I think) was really professional as well.
Thanks, guys!
author: Susie S.

description: The new sandwiches are very excellent a little on the expensive side but really good that use great meat.
author: Willow M.

description:
It's really cluttered in there and I'm claustrophobic but the service is friendly.
They accept EBT!! Prices are fair!!
You can even call and order ahead of time.
It's a convenience store & deli.
The sandwiches are amazing.
The chips selection is awesome. They carry the Hawaiian flavored chips if you know what I mean.
If you haven't been yet, they are definitely worth trying.
author: Viv W.

description: Ive been going here since i was a kid and has never failed me. Try going during non lunch hours for no wait on sandwiches, but they are really quick here.
author: Angel R.

description: Amazing sandwiches and great service. Super quick among some of the best made-to-order sandwiches. I will recommend it.
author: Leah B.

description: Tried the Joker special for $12.99! I find it to be a good, tasty, well constructed swich. It is NOT worth 13dollars. It made it almost hard to eat. The coffee is boringly weak and flavorless. The deviled egg gross. Soooo dissappointed!
author: Katherine A.

description: I love Roxie's. One of the best sandwiches in the city hands down. I grew up eating sandwiches here after playing baseball at either Balboa park or even after a game at Crocker. We used to come here and get sandwiches all the time at lunch even if we would be late going back to class. Simon's, salami cheddar, they can do no wrong. Get Dutch crunch bread too
author: Cole G.

description: Regular pastrami on dutch crunch with pepper jack cheese, jalapeños, and avocados. Been eating this exact same sandwich for hella yeeeears and it still hits the spot. It's a local community business that's been around for years, support it. Win-win.
author: Tone V.

description:
I asked my man who he thinks makes the best sandwich in San Francisco.  His answer?  Roxie.

Roxie?  What's/where's/who's that?  I had never heard of it.

Growing up in the excelsior as he did, back when it was almost an entirely Italian neighborhood, Roxie sammies were a steady part of his growing boy rotation.  And to this day he claims that they are still his favorite, as well as being the best in all of SF.

Well!  I've enjoyed many a sammy in this fair city, but Roxie is new to me.  If I had first consulted the Yelp's Top 100 Places To Eat In America list for 2014 (#43 Roxie), I would not have been surprised.  This is a national list!  Impressive.

My man then took it upon himself to remedy the sorry situation of my being a Roxie virgin.  He told me to peruse the menu (I did via yelp), & decide what I would like.  Then he would make a Roxie run for us.  I decided on the Simon Special, on dutch crunch bread, w cheddar & everything except tomato.  Toasted.  I love turkey & I love pastrami.  Win win.

This was a nice & messy sandwich.  The way a good sandwich should be.  If you're not wiping mustard/mayo/dressing/sauce off the corners of your mouth & chin, then there's something not right (same goes for burgers).  The meats were generous & tasty.  The Dutch crunch was perfectly toasted & delicious.  Fresh, crisp ingredients.  Simple.

It was a great sandwich.  

From Roxie virgin to Roxie fan.

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: Roxie's sandwiches are good, affordable, and HUGE!  I have tried their roast beef, pastrami, and turkey with avocado with Dutch crunch.  It feeds 3-4 adults.  You really do get your money's worth.  I highly recommend this place located in the excelsior.
author: FG L.

description: All I'm going to say is THE BEST SANDWICH IN THE BAY. Service is great and love supporting family owned businesses
author: Austin L.

description: I grew up on Roxie. Love it forever. But when they started hiring all these other people to make your sandwiches, it got bad. Not in a sense of flavor (thank god they kept up) but in the sense of "paying attention" to someone's detailed sandwich order! Something as simple as "ADD AMERICAN CHEESE PLEASE" cuz I don't want provolone on my sandwich shouldn't be that hard! And when they act like they already know what to do and you get home and open up your sandwich and it's wrong, it's annoying asf. I still love Roxie sandwich.
author: Rex R.

description:
I feel bad that I have to give this place one star but quite frankly they deserve it. 

1.) ordered a turkey and pepperjack on dutch with avocado and it was pretty bad. Lettuce was shredded (I mean what kind of place puts shredded lettuce on their sandwhich). it was messy and the vegetables overwhelmed the actual deli meat. TERRIBLE SANDWHICH. 

2.) Aisles were just cramped and really small. A worker was stocking chips and was seriously in the way. I mean if you see some people want some stuff can you just not stock at this time. but that wasn't the problem. I was deciding on what drink I was going to get, then this "tough guy"  got all huffy because he claimed I had an attitude with him when I didn't. He started saying "I am going to bust you mouth open and beat your ass blood". I mean I didn't think I would have to fear for my life in a sandwhich shop but I did. The worst part was they still serviced him after he threatened me and didn't even bother to do anything. This place is terrible. I though I would come in here occasionally but i am NEVER coming in here ever.
author: Mohammad A.

description: The hype is reeeeal. Expensive but worth every damned penny. Mmmmm.... 7 meat special for the win.
author: Joe H.

description: They came early thru my order online via grubhub.  Their "regular" size sandwich can feed 2 people. I ordered my usual roast beef sandwich.  It's tasty & fresh as other reviewers have posted.  Don't forget to get a coffee, tea, or cocoa -- at $3 for a "large" which would be a small at Starbucks, it's a great deal, especially when the weather is cold.  I will Definitely order from here again -- it certainly beats Subway by 2 miles!!
author: Frugal C.

description:
I had the reg Roxie special. It was a big sandwich that could easily be shared. 

Service was fast and amazing. Everyone here was very friendly. 

For a decent price I would definitely come back!
author: Brittany C.

description: I come here for the Irish groceries, which are really good. I especially like the back bacon, which they make on the premises. The other groceries always look good, too, and the sandwiches I've had from the deli section have always been excellent.
author: Matthew T.

description:
Hand down, BEST Sandwiches in San Francisco! I'm so lucky to live in the Excelsior and have Roxie's just a hop, skip and jump away! My go to is a Regular Mortadella on Sourdough, everything on it, toasted. Some people think the bread to meat ratio is 60:40 but I think it's perfect. The guys that run the place are hilarious and never fail to make everyone feel welcome.

Although getting in line can be a bit confusing for people when they first come here, it's totally worth it. (For those who haven't tried Roxie's yet: When you come in the front door, walk along the drinks and sodas, and the line starts at the first deli case) 

Keep up the great work, Roxie's
author: Maria Francesca A.

description: I've been going to Roxy's ever since I was at Balboa High School, and even though that was a long time ago I can appreciate that they have not changed, they have the best sandwiches in town!
author: Julio C.

description: Fantastic sandwich shop! Terrific food, and Ray and the guys could not be friendlier or more helpful. Go there for some easy groceries or some prepared sandwiches, you'll be glad you got to know this place.
author: david p.

description:
Best. Sandwiches. In. SF.

You think I'm kidding, but I'm not. And it's so unexpected - you'd think in a city like SF, such a place would be in the heart of the city. Where the tourists might visit. 

But it's not. It's in the outer mission. From the outside, it looks like a pretty typical corner store... Except there might be a crowd hanging around outside. Make it in, and it's shelves of confectionary and drinks, and what looks to be a big deli selection. It's still not clear what's about to happen. 

Then order, wait 10 minutes while they wait (and toast!) your sandwich, and something approaching a football in weight and size is handed over to you. And zomg, it's so good. There's a breakfast sandwich here that is insane - I wake up hungry in the mornings and I dream of it.

If you're in the vicinity, visit. If you're not in the vicinity, visit. It's really that good.
author: James A.

description: We picked up a few sandwiches for my birthday dinner with my children today. I am leaving a review on the Vegetarian sandwiches my children had. They are Vegetarian for environmental purposes. They were so excited and amazed how delcious it was. Let me tell you, as a mom of active, hungry children, these sammies were nutriously sound and filling. Slightly expensive for my wallet as a mom of a teenage girl and three growing boys, but it was worth it! THANK YOU for feedind my children well tonight!
author: May T.

description: Been going here for over 20 years! I usually get a pastrami sandwich on Dutch crunch which is a must! Fast and friendly service and they treat you like family. Forgot my wallet once and they told me to pay on my next visit. Best sandwiches in town!
author: Anthony B.

description: my favorite sandwich spot in the city! I love their pastrami sandwich or tri tip on Dutch crunch(freshly made in house!)
author: Amanda M.

description: Sooo while I was fine after eating my Simon's Special, the hubs wasn't after he ate the chicken sandwich. We had the same breakfast prior and the only other thing he ate all day was the sandwich. I'm ok. He's not. Ended up w/ food poisoning that took him out of commission for the past day and still plaguing him right now. Threw up chunks of chicken and massive diarrhea along w/ the usual dehydration under these circumstances...
author: Julie L.

description:
Delicious! 

Little market on the corner, Roxies gives a home feel, mom and pop, not for the new gen hipster fusion crap.  Nothing fancy and your basic deli shop.

Old school and simple - we got the roast beef (as recommended by many yelpers!) with everything except tomatoes, on Dutch Crunch on a regular.  We coulda gone by on a junior size split for two.

The roast beef...delicious! Very tender and a bit shredded like, it definitely absorbed the juice it was soaked in and so soft.  The Dutch crunch bread is the best part of it all!  Crunchy on the outside but still soft on the white bread, you get that crunch but not the cuts in your mouth!

I wish I tried a turkey but oh wells, next time!
author: Laurie W.

description:
Came here for the first time with my boyfriend after my bestfriend had suggested it for years. 

A lot of people always tell me to go somewhere because it's the best and here I am with high expectations. (It was always good enough but Roxie's .. Is different) Anyway.. 

Here I am at Roxie's thinking that sandwich store on grove street is the best and that Ike's is pretty damn good too plus angelos gourmet in my hometown in Richmond.. It's hard to imagine anything else living up to that.

I got the Roxie's special and my boyfriend got the Tonys Tri tip special. Both 9.99 for juniors, yes quite pricey.. 

But damn, shit was delicious. Hands down the best sandwiches I've ever had in my life.
author: L T.

description:
I'll leave it up to you to decide to trust my judgement or not, because I may or may not have been completely sober when I devoured my sandwich. 

I didn't even realize that I already had this place bookmarked until I proceeded to check in when my friends took me here. 

I walked in and was surprised to see that this "bomb sandwich place" was in fact in a tiny marketplace/liquor store!

My friends told the staff that it was my very first time there so the guy immediately recommended the Simon Special. My 2 friends and I split the Supreme for $14.99. We walked down the street to chill and about 3 minutes later, the guy came out and walked down the block to personally deliver the sandwiches to us. He even cut our supreme into 3 and wrapped them up separately. He wanted to see my reaction to my first bite.

The sandwich was bursting with flavors. I could taste each different ingredient that was inside. It all tasted so fresh! Also, the Dutch crunch was crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside. It was comparable to Ike's sandwiches!
author: Lincy H.

description:
When Yelp decided to come out with their Top 100 list recently, like any good Yelper, I perused it with great scrutiny to see if I agreed with the results. As a culinary spendthrift, I find it reassuring to see a hole-in-the-wall outrank a Michelin-starred restaurant on such a motley list. Why else would I patronize a mini-market in the Outer Mission when there are dozens of high-quality sandwich makers closer to my home (photo: http://bit.ly/1ishso8)? Well, that's what I did and convinced Jamie W. to do the same, which was not a hard thing to do because he loves a tasty sandwich like anyone else. When we got there, we saw a couple of guys standing in the doorway obviously waiting for their orders (photo: http://bit.ly/PXUXPG).

We couldn't quite tell the routine since the sandwich prep area is well hidden. There's a menu on the back wall, but some had no accompanying descriptions (photo: http://bit.ly/1hz4XVv). Dialogue. We needed dialogue. When Jamie asked for a virginal recommendation, there was no hesitation in response...the $9.99 Simon's Special with everything. Turkey breast and pastrami on a big split Dutch crunch wheat roll. The everything part consisted of a liberal slathering of mayo and mustard with lettuce, tomatoes, purple onion rings, pickles and jalapeño peppers (photo: http://bit.ly/1g3q7vA). I was swayed by the sign next to the lotto ticket stand...the $10.99 Tony's Tri-Tip Special also with everything.

It was a hot sandwich also on Dutch Crunch with layers of beef squeezed with melted cheddar cheese, mayo , barbecue sauce, tomatoes, onions, jalapeño peppers and the true kicker, horseradish and lots of it (photo: http://bit.ly/1jq2Asu). Yep, that was genuinely delicious, but I have to give the edge to Simon for making what could be in the running for the perfect deli sandwich. There's no place to sit down and gorge on it although Balboa Park is right across the street. It was raining, so we decided to drive to South Park and take refuge on one of the well-worn picnic tables. We were the envy of skinny hipsters who sauntered by and stared at our pleasurable gluttony.

FOOD - 5 stars...world class sandwiches served up in a working class corner market...yep, 5 stars is right
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...did I mention it's just a mini-market with no seating?
SERVICE - 4 stars...friendly though slightly confused when it gets busy
TOTAL - 5 stars...it's currently #43 on the Top 100 Yelp list, so the public has indeed spoken
author: Ed U.

description:
Ordered a sandwich on Sunday, 8/9/2015, and I asked the guy making it to use provolone instead of cheddar. He said to me, "it's a crime...and I'm trying to make a sandwich." MY SANDWICH!  Who says that to a customer?!?!

I made a simple request, follow it!  Just because your store has 4.5 stars does not give you the right to be arrogant and cocky! I'm still a paying customer!

In short, he didn't use provolone and put cheddar.  What annoyed me was his cavalier remark!
author: Angelica C.

description: Their sandwiches are absolutely amazing. Can never go wrong with the Simon or the Roxie Special. I would recommend calling ahead, as they can sometimes get busy. Parking isn't too much if an issue either, and if you're eating here you're probably just picking up your sandwich to go anyway. Overall great place to grab a bite to eat!
author: Donel L.

description:
Why 5 stars? Because it's as dive-y, but also as delicious as it gets.

   ---   ---   ---

This is definitely a business that would not have seen the same success pre-Yelp. Maybe that's an ignorant statement, but it would seem that the best case scenario 15 years ago would have been a cult following in the immediate neighborhood. I made Roxie my first stop straight out of the airport... how would that have happened back when the Wiki was the Encyclo?

The shop is incredibly narrow, and there's a wall dividing the middle, which makes it the skinniest place I've ever patronized. There are two aisles, and literally room for one person to walk through. If someone is trying to squeeze by, hopefully it's before you've ingested one of those monster sandwiches.

I went with the Tony's Special: BBQ tri-tip, cheddar cheese, and horse radish on dutch crunch bread. I'm still not sure what dutch crunch is, but my mouth seems to like it.

This sandwich is juicy, messy, and full of flavor. Going into a dive-y convenient store, and walking out with a meat coma inducing sandwich is honestly about as good as life gets.

Roxie also serves a bunch of great chips, including the Zappos Voodoo, and what's a good sandwich without my favorite chips? Lastly, there are plenty of drinks, including the aloe beverages, which I can never say "no" to.
author: Brett N.

description: This family Sando spot is awesome. Been coming for years. There's 1 in Sacramento also. A little funky hole in the wall for sure, but good big sandwiches. Tony's tri tip & Simon, meatball some favz. But all good.
author: W W.

description: Love the sandwiches here. HIGHLY RECOMMEND CALLING in your order. When you get there you still will have to wait in line, but it will not be as bad as if you were ordering your food. Very small space, but lots to offer. If I lived closer I'd come here more often.
author: Cynthia C.

description: The sandwiches here are amazing. While the prices may seem a bit steep, the sandwiches are pretty big. Two people can easily split a regular.
author: Phil C.

description:
This is my ultimate favorite sandwich place ever!!!!! No other place in the SF bay area can beat it. The Sandwiches are so fresh, so tasty and so so so good!!! 

The customer service here is Awesome!!! The cashier guy sorry I don't know your name is always so friendly and welcoming always, he always makes the customer feel welcomed. Love this place and the staff.
author: Rosa R.

description:
I have several places in different neighborhoods throughout the city where I know I can stop and get a decent deli sandwich, and this IS NOT one of them. Roxie's is a couple of notches above those places and no joke, leaps and bounds over your typical fast food style sandwich shops, (I'll do them the favor and let them remain nameless since their products are so inferior). 

This place has an old time SF corner store feel to it, they aren't trying to impress anyone and that's what makes this place feel like home. There are pictures of friends and family, loved ones and celebrities that are loyal Roxie's customers. The best pictures are the ones of the kids that started coming here when they were small, and now have grown up and have families of their own that are continuing the tradition of coming here. 

Craving a meatball sub? Then the Meatball Mafia is just for you! Or try the staple on the menu, the Roxie Special - (Ham, Mortadella, Salami and Artichokes). There's also the always pleasing Simon Special which consists of Turkey, Pastrami and Cheddar cheese on a Dutch Crunch roll. No matter how you want it, they will make it for you. The Dutch Crunch bread is some of the best in the city, (no disrespect to other bed options that are available) and if you like your sandwiches hot, they will toss it inside of one of the antique ovens cranking out toasted joy. I have witnessed their sandwich craftsmen and women burn themselves, so these things are no joke! 

Your sandwich comes out toasted with the cheese melted to perfection. Anytime I am on the Southern half of the city I know where I am heading to get my sammie on! There are plenty of other great items available here such as deviled eggs to ravioli's, macaroni and potato salads. Not to mention a huge selection of drinks and chips. Some may call it a hole in the wall, but it's OUR hole in the wall and don't you forget it! 


Roxie's Baby-Baaaabaaay! And if you don't know, now you know!
author: Josh H.

description: Best sammwiches round!!!! Especially my salami and American cheese on a hard roll served HOT yummy for my tummy been coming to this spot forevvvva!
author: Erika H.

description: Hole in the wall. Awesome sandwiches. Owner is super nice too. I order the specials. But I've had turkey, pastrami and the Italian. It's all good. Breads are amazing.
author: Danielle H.

description: Roxie has by far the best sandwiches in the area period. They have different sizes of sandwiches to match your hunger. The owner and staff are awesome and very friendly.
author: Gabriel Z.

description: Yes, I echo all the great things said about the sandwiches and sides. When I visit I really hope to find the sticky honey bran muffin inside the (self-serve) baked goods box to the left. Also, In case there's a line I take my time to look at all of the pictures around. It truly reminds me to enjoy the moment positively. I selfishly wish they had somewhere to post up or lean on but I digress. (: cheers!
author: Khári A.

description: Bomb sandwiches!!! Just a lil corner store, but amazing food. Friendly staff, so convenient. I HIGHLY recommend!
author: Elizabeth A.

description:
They got the bomb sammies here, son.  No frills, all about sandwiches. They have a system; follow it and you'll be fine.

I had the iconic Simon Special: turkey, pastrami, cheddar with the works on Dutch crunch.  It was really damn good.  Their Dutch crunch isn't as good as Ike's but it did the job.  

The system: learn the menu, be ready to order at the register and specify everything you want.  They're polite but also efficient, don't waste their time.
author: Saminda W.

description:
The sandwiches here are fantastic.  I was so moved after a couple of bites that I had to just stop and write a Yelp review.  Quickly.  And then returned to eating the rest of my sandwich.

I showed up just a few minutes past 11 am and a line of people formed behind me right after I ordered.  I had read through these reviews but could not believe that a combination of bread, meat, veggies and spread could be so universally praised.  

Roxie's doesn't have the biggest menu.  There were a handful of special combo sandwiches and the rest are your standard build-your-own options.  When you order, state your preference for size (junior (normal sized), regular and supreme (that size can easily feed 3 to 4 people)), bread, cheese, veggies/condiments and whether you want it toasted or not. 

I ordered the turkey avocado club sandwich on Dutch Crunch, without mayo.  Quite frankly it didn't need the mayo.  The sandwich was really moist without it.  The bread, oh the bread, let's talk about that bread.  We have to talk about this Dutch Crunch roll.  I've had them before elsewhere but the DC here is like nothing I've ever experienced.  The crust is light, crispy and delicate, almost as if it had been deep fried (it wasn't) and the inside was soft and slightly chewy.  It did not leave a scar on the roof of my mouth, which hard rolls can sometimes do.  The ratio of bread to meat/veggie fill was perfect.   

The wait for the sandwich was approximately 5 to 7 minutes but the gentleman behind the register kept me pretty entertained.  You cannot see over or through the counter to see your sandwich being made and it's really cramped and narrow near the deli counter so waiting outside might be required.

Parking wasn't too much of an issue when I arrived but when I left customers were parking in a non-legal manner on the side street.  There appears to be much more parking on San Jose Ave though. 

Would I return?  Yes, indeed!  For now I need to return to finishing up my sandwich......
author: Melissa L.

description: I grew up eating the sandwiches from this place and still can't get enough of these bad boys! Can't go wrong with the roast beef and toasted Dutch crunch!
author: Jared V.

description: If you want a true SF sandwich then experience, you can't go wrong w Roxie. The Simon Special is off the charts. W the park right across the st you've got great places to eat and watch a pick up soccer game or watch skaters at the skate park. Regardless of where you go once you have had their food you will be coming back.
author: Cheyenne B.

description:
Some of the best sandwiches in SF. 
Close to CCSF - a little crowded. 
But it's usually so worth it. 
Nice area - on a summer day it's usually amazing. 
Can't go wrong w a place that has stayed true to the community and makes killer sandwiches! 

Things to remember: 
Be patient - it's worth it. 
Order ahead if you can - so worth it.
author: Michelle P.

description: Some of the best sandwiches I've ever had! They are delicious and HUGE! So worth it! Simon is amazing and so nice. If you want a legit awesome lunch this is the place to go!!
author: Caren W.

description: I'm a sandwich guy. I need a REAL sandwich in my life  preferably once or twice a week to maintain my you positive attitude lol.  Roxie's is def a go-to esp if you live anywhere from the outer mission/bernal heights southward.... If you live in the city and Haven't been here,you are sleeping!! Period! SF natives will tell you,  Roxie's is the spot.  I first moved to the city back in 2005 and this spot was honestly pretty easy to miss because it looks like your average hole in the wall liquor store but  nothing average about it if you ask me. If you hit that place up today, prices have definitely gone up but so has everything here in SF... at least they have a legit sign outside these days lol....so the dudes who make the sandwiches are pretty consistent. Ingredients are always  fresh and The clerk Ader is the MF'n man....he's personable and rocks a dope hairdo these days too. Easy man to get along with. I asked him what his fave sandwich was and he straight up said "the tri-tip" and then less than 6min later I was hooked.Visit Roxie's Today or you're a fool. Can't wait to go back.
author: Dominic T.

description:
Ever since I moved to SF, sandwiches have become my favorite food.  Mostly because of the dutch crunch bread which I had never heard of before.  I don't like to get messy when I eat, but I'd argue the messier the sandwich, the more likely it is going to be delicious.

Roxie Food Center has my vote for best sandwiches in SF.  I especially love the Tri Tip special...but I'd bet you'll be just as happy with whatever you choose.  

I recommend calling ahead to place your order.  Clearly, this place is favored by many as the wait can be long if you order when you show up at the store.  Either way, it's worth the wait...and the money.
author: Kristin P.

description: I have been going to this place for years and the sandwiches live up to the reputation. The owners are awesome- Tony, Simon and Peter always have a big smile on their face when they see familiar and new faces! Love that they give back to the community and know the locals on a first name basis :)
author: Tiffany S.

description:
All hail the Dutch Crunch!!!

Probably the best deli inside a liquor store to have ever been brought upon us. I always get Tony's Tri Tip Special with Dutch Crunch. If you like tri tip deli cut meat with all the assortings you'll ever desire this is the one for you. They have various sandwiches to choose from. Also beware that these sandwiches are HUGE. One sandwich would probably last me an entire day and then some.

Grab some chips and a drink and maybe small talk with the owner. You'll be glad you stopped in.
author: Lux S.

description:
This is my go-to spot to grab sandwiches 

Roxie sandwiches are more than just 5 stars. The sandwich makers all take pride in their work and it shows. Their sandwiches are beyond awesome and are so large you can save the 2nd half for later since you wont want to share.
author: Bumble B.

description:
I'm a big fan of salami/dutch crunch and this place does it right! The dutch crunch is soft and won't cut up your mouth. My girlfriend and I ordered a total of six sandwiches and although it took a bit longer, everything was made correctly! Weird thing is I didn't notice much difference between the junior and regular sizes (lengthwise they were about the same).

Inside is small and filled with an assortment of drinks/food you'd find in your typical deli. The home/local feel of the place definitely adds character. Will definitely come back to try the other sandwiches!
author: Josh L.

description: For 15 years I did environmental work at Ocean BP down the street.So every 90 days we would sample the monitoring wells after having removed and replaced the fuel tanks , fuel islands,dispensers etc.So i got addicted to the meatball, sub,crab, sandwiches! And the staff was always friendly and fast. You will never be disappointed by Roxies!Also the pixs on wall show all the mayors and celebs that have been there!!
author: Scott F.

description:
Do NOT judge this book by its cover!

Tucked in a very tiny corner market, a sandwich Mecca is there for anyone in the know. I was on a business trip and a local clued me in to what he called an "old school deli". 

I can tell you that in the 10 minutes I was inside the place waiting for my food, a half a dozen locals came in to pick up call-in orders and were all greeted by name. Very cool in my book. 

That didn't stop them from taking the time to describe a couple of different sandwiches to help me decide. I asked what I was smelling when I walked up to the place and he told me he had just finished up some tri-tip. 

Let me tell you about the Tony's Special that I ordered. Tri-tip cooked on the premises, melty cheddar cheese , tomato, onion, jalapeños, horseradish and bbq sauce. All on the best bread I have had in forever. I ordered a medium sandwich, which was probably a 10 inch roll, and it had to weigh 2 lbs. 

I didn't even mind eating it on the trunk of my rental, as there is no seating at all. 

Bottom line is this. 
Awesome sandwich + great staff = very satisfied customer.
author: Brock C.

description:
I've heard about this place for a long time.  I decided to give it a try.  Upon arriving there were several people just hanging outside waiting for their sandwiches.  I walk in  to a small liquor store, tiny and compact as the queue  was wrapped around the store.   Wow, I was amazed at how many people were inside.  The store had a lot of pictures and fundraisers within the neighborhood and seems like they support the locals.  The smell inside this small store was wonderful.  You can smell the dutch crunch cooking in the ovens.

Undecided of what to order, I had to check out the menu and also used Yelp to help me decide.  I ended up with the "Simon Special"? Might wonder what that is...[ Turkey and Pastrami, Cheddar and jalapenos on Dutch Crunch).  I usually get Turkey for my sandwiches, but i also like Pastrami so Simon Special was the way to go with best of both worlds.  The lady careful constructed my sandwich as i moved forward to pay for my sandwich.  Then waited for good five minutes for my sandwich.

The sandwich was good, a bit messy but hey if it ain't messy it ain't good!  The meat was mediocre portions.  The bread was crunchy and that help bring out the sandwich.  Most places don't really toast their sandwich and this brings the sandwiches up a notch. 

Overall, the sandwich was okay.  I wasn't really wow by it.  Their are many other choices on the menu and i will probably give it a try.  The staff their are nice and friendly and you can phone in your order too.  They prioritize the phone in orders first. 

Parking? Street or a block away?
Cash or Card?  Both, Card must be $10 or more.
Seating? none only to go.
author: Kenneth Y.

description: My number 1 go to Deli for a Sandwich. The bread they use what makes it really good. Stop by if you're near by and craving for a sandwich.
author: Junray S.

description:
Absolute gem in mission Terrance, right next to Balboa Park and the pool and along the J Muni Stop. The place has such friendly staff, even if the prices are a bit higher than Safeway. But hey, it's a convenient stop. 

Something that is definitely worth the bang for your buck is the Roxie signature sandwich on the Dutch roll. I like the tri tip. They're a small, local joint with barely any standing room so order your sandwich ahead of time and just pick up when you come to avoid the wait and standing around when their isn't really space.
author: Vy T.

description: I went to this place the other day and waited like 20 mins just to get my sandwich. I understand if they were busy but no, i was there in the morning and I was the only one getting a sandwich. I realized that the older lady who took my order forgot to make my order, really?
author: Jordan W.

description: This place is nothing special -- it's a convenience store with a deli. The sandwiches are ok but expensive -- nothing to write home about. Our sandwiches were slathered in mayonnaise and it took awhile to get them. Much of the business that they seem to do is selling alcohol to people who look pretty down on their luck. But the food was ok.
author: T F.

description: Best sandwich I've ever tried. Fresh bread and meats all the time!!! Definitely recommend this place to all my family and friends.
author: Sergio L.

description:
My absolute favorite spot for sandwiches!! My boyfriend and I have practically made it a tradition to grab lunch here on our hang out dates. The sandwiches are soooo delicious! I love the junior pastrami sandwhich, with everything on it, on extra sour dough bread, toasted (I'm not sure how many times we've said this over the phone already haha). 

Anyway, you can't go wrong at this sandwich deli. In fact, I might just get a sandwich there today!! :)
author: Laura C.

description:
Every time I go to Roxie's I hear DJ Q-Bert saying, "THIS is what the Toadman puts into his belly"--cause even Turntable TV showed Roxie some love. 
The turkey club on a Dutch crunch roll from Roxie's keeps me coming back after all these years. I am still in search of a good deli in the 707 area but until then, I will drive across two bridges to be reunited with their savory deli sandwiches.
author: Cel C.

description:
The best sandwich in San Francisco, no doubt in my mind. I've been to the others (Ike's, Deli Board, Wise Sons, etc) and they are all good, but nothing beats Roxie's!

The best bread, quality ingredients, killer local atmosphere that's always filled with Police, Firemen, and high school kids. And the meatball sandwich... Oh the meatball sandwich. It hits every note even when you keep it simple (meatballs, marinara, provolone, dutch crunch, that's it).

Bless you Roxie's, don't change.
author: Mason C.

description:
Heard all about Roxie's and decided to give it a try.

Went with the Regular Roast Beef sandwich with "everything" on it over swiss cheese and Dutch Crunch & toasted.

Dutch Crunch was amazing! One of the best Dutch Crunch sandwiches I've ever had... 

I will definitely be back to try out their other goodies.
author: Sam K.

description:
Note that was a great sandwich. I've  been here once and I'll be back. The staff is friendly and the sandwich was so good. I ordered the Simon special with pastrami and turkey w cheddar on Dutch crunch. I had all the fixings minus mustard.

I normally don't love sandwiches but this is one to try. They come in three sizes which is nice depending on appetite.  I had the regular which was a good size for dinner and cost 9.99.  I'd probably only eat half of it for lunch. I'll be back! !
author: Kimberly C.

description:
Small liquor store on San Juan St and San Jose. My boyfriend and I come here twice every 3 months. We love the sandwiches. 
The first time he brought me here I was a little skeptic. Small, packed, liquor store for some "amazing" sandwiches.....but the staff was funny and cool and yes they made me an amazing Italian sandwich!
Great place to come grab a quick sandwich, chips and drink. 
For two sandwiches, 2 drinks and 2 bags of chips the total was $24.
author: Lorena S.

description:
Wait, you thought this was just a liquor store?!! San Franciscans know that Roxies is a sandwich staple in Frisco! 

Sandwiches are a bit pricey but when I'm not trying to make the trek to Little Lucca's in South City I'm definitely going to Roxies.
author: Erick L.

description: I'm doing this review several days after the fact because I forgot so hopefully I remember this right: The Simon special was good --hot turkey and pastrami on a Dutch crunch. They toast the bread. Really good. The supreme size is pretty big and around $15. I little expensive but I didn't think it was too much considering the taste and filling effect. This is a Ma and Pa corner store with a lot of history. I'd come back and try other sandwiches for sure.
author: Ben L.

description: Was in the neighborhood and decided to have a crab meat sandwich and Simon's special for lunch with my girlfriend. Ended up with food poisoning. Aside from that, the cashier was extremely rude by throwing the receipt and pen towards me after he swiped my card. I definitely will never be coming back. Beware!
author: Vincent T.

description:
Om nom nom.... Roxie's is the crack, ya'll.

What seems to be a measly corner store may change your sandwich life. Once brought a dude I was seeing there and he "didn't think Roxie's held up to it's reputation", needless to say, things did not work out between us. 

Don't get a different bread than Dutch Crunch - why would you do that? I've had probably five Roxie's sandwiches in my life, and with each sandwich, my fondness grows. I was on a turkey-bacon kick for a while, then switched to turkey-pastrami, and now I've weeded out the turkey. They have the Roxie special which is good, but I'm a fan of ordering what you know you like. Tons of chips/candy/drinks options, and park across the street allows for some grassy enjoyment.
author: Crystal C.

description:
I've been to my fair share of hole in the walls, but this place possibly has the most holes in the wall. If you've never been, this is not actually a sandwich shop. It's a liquor store that has a counter where you can order sandwiches. I got the Tony's special (tri-tip, cheddar, mayo, bbq sauce, tomatoes, onions, jalapenos, and horseradish on toasted bread). I was willing to disregard the appearance of the store in the hopes that it was hiding some culinary gem, a true diamond in the rough. I had high hopes for this place since it ranked higher than Ike's on the Yelp Top 100 (and I love Ike's). After trying their sandwich, I'll agree that it was good, but definitely not better than Ike's. This sandwich was on par with some of Ike's less popular sandwiches but doesn't stand a chance against the big sellers.  

Price was $10.99 for a regular sized sandwich. While this was a delicious contender,  I have still not been converted from the sacred sandwich temple of Ike's. It does have the advantage of being close off of the freeway though. I may be willing to come back to sample a different sandwich in the future if there is something better on the menu though.
author: Tiffany N.

description:
Every neighbourhood needs a Roxie.

Tiny spot filled to the brim + 
Hearty sammiches +
Hilarious staff + 
Payphone available +
= love!

The payphone wasn't serious, but it adds character. 
You know the place is good when they can command $11 per sammy and people still cram in here to buy them. If you don't believe me, look at the dozens of pictures left here by FD and PD's finests - those guys ALWAYS know the best places to eat!
Roxie needs to be around forever, where else would you buy a trial sample of laundry detergent for 4.99, Arizona Tea for actually 99 cents, and discontinued Haribo candy?
author: Jade T.

description:
Roxie's! totes brings me back to the high school days. i remember it quite clearly - basketball practice at Lowell, "roxie, anyone??!!", and we'd all hop into one car and head to roxie. life was damn good. 

after last weekend, life is STILL pretty damn good. I haven't had roxie in a few years, and I'm happy to say it's just as satisfying as it was five years ago. still a hole in the wall with the cutty-looking liquor store look, still relatively unknown amongst non-locals (woop!), and still one of the best damn sandwiches in san francisco.

the store is on the corner of san jose and san juan, and parking is relatively easy. The space is verrry small, just enough room for one food shelf in the middle. i've personally never seen it extremely crowded, but i can imagine how claustrophobic it would get with a long line of ordering customers.

to order a sandwich, you have to go around the back of the lone shelf to the right counter of the store. the counter itself is pretty high - your view is pretty much only the workers' foreheads, and NOT the assembly of your sandwich. you really do have to trust that they've made it to your likings. however, I've had enough sandwiches here to know that they are on point with their creations.

prices are standard, and you definitely get a good sized sandwich for the price you pay. there are two sizes you can choose from - a junior size (~$9), or a large size (~11). for one junior sandwich, one large sandwich, and a bag of chips, the total was $22. not too shabs. to me, roxie is on the same level as ike's and little lucca.

my go-to is the Roxie Special on Dutch Crunch (mortadella, ham, and salami with american cheese)  --- TRY IT! my mouth is watering just typing that. ugh!
author: Caitlin C.

description:
Still the same old tasty sandwich. Roxie's is a San Francisco classic!!

For those who aren't familiar with Roxie's, it's basically a tiny little corner store. Order your sandwich from the staff on the side. Wait in line to get rung up at the register.
You can always call ahead your order to get in and out quicker.

GO FOR THE ROXIE'S SPECIAL!
author: Susy C.

description: I grew up in San Francisco and this is been my favorite sandwich spot since forever Peter Simon Tony all the brothers are exceptional best gentleman I ever met I take them like my uncles great food great service lunchtime gets a little crowded though because it is a neighborhood favorite
author: Teddy S.

description:
Mmmmmmm! Dutch Crunch bread!

The service is quick and their menu is simple, so it's easy to customize/order your desired sandwich. It's pretty cramped inside, so we waited outside and they brought our order out to us with napkins! 

SIMON'S SPECIAL is where it's at! Nomnomnom bombbbb!

Sandwich has perfectly toasted dutch crunch bread, extremely flavorful filling. Good amount of meat, definitely makes the price worth it. Jalepanos were not that spicy (I can't handle much spiciness). Sandwiches are comparable to Ike's Sandwiches!!

There's no seating, but my friend and I just went across the street and sat in the grassy park area to grub on the sandwiches. Looking forward to returning!
author: Eileen L.

description: I love variety in most things I do in my life. However, there are a few places that I never deviate from the first thing I feel in love with.  At the roxies, I always get the meatball sub.  Sauce,  provolone amd meatballs on a soft roll. With this sando, simplicity is Perfection
author: Stephen C.

description:
Decided for a cheat meal that I needed a roast beef and provolone on sour dough. Called and was told they only had a few types of breads left, EXTRA sourdough  being one of them. I forgot they had that flavor of bread and got even more excited! Picked up my hero and drove him home. Was worried about the juices from the ample amount of beef and condiments soaking into the bread and making the edges soggy. Nope. Extra sour kept its crunch throughout every bite. Best cheat meal ever!

PS: If you are ordering over the phone for pickup be sure to have your order repeated to you and check it before you leave. Ordered 2 sandwiches from the girl who works there, 1 on Dutch Crunch and mine on Extra Sour. Got home after picking them up and to my horror found both were Dutch Crunch! If this wasn't my dinner along with the fact that I hate Dutch Crunch I might not have been so enraged. Not only that there seemed to be a lot less meat this time as my wife and I were taking bites that had 0 meat in them AAAAAND the sandwiches weren't toasted well, so the "Dutch Crunch" wasn't even crunchy. If I go there again I'm making sure to not order from her. They lose a star from my review thanks to her, that's how pissed I am. 

Tl;dr If you order from the girl, good luck or just ask to be helped by someone else.

Edit 2: Just had their Tony's Tri-Tip special and for the first time. They've totally redeemed themselves in my eyes and gut. You guys get your star back. 5 well deserved stars!!! God Damn that was good! Definitely a dinner sandwich.
author: Everette R.

description: I grew up on Roxie's. This was the spot when my friends and me would hang out at Balboa Park as kids. As I got older and eventually moved out of the neighborhood and city, I never forgot about this place and would make it a point to find the time to grab a sandwich. The only sandwich I will ever order here is the salami on Dutch Crunch with provolone and light mayo. It's been the sandwich since I was like nine years old.
author: Vanessa O.

description: Came in today everybody is in a festive mood, it was very crowded but everyone was cracking jokes and just waiting for the sandwiches
author: Nicey S.

description: I still love this spot and I doubt any other sandwich will have my heart like this one, but we went in today and left with sandwiches smaller than before. They were much thinner and seemed to lay very flat with a lot less meat than ever before. My friend who was with us said she saw them weighing their meat so they must be controlling their sandwiches now and it's just not the exact same. Skimping out on meat makes it less tasty.. It's just not the same, but yet it's still one of my faves. Such a dilemma!
author: Tiff C.

description: I ordered the Tony special and Simon special. Both sandwiches were very bland and had no toppings. On the Tony special it had just a couple pieces of pickle and jalapeño. (See picture below) What kind of sandwich is this??? For 11$ per sandwich it should have more than just meat. Where's the lettuce that I asked for? 25$ down the drain. I don't like wasting food so I ate it because I was already home and didn't want to go back to the store to ask for a refund. I wish I can get a refund, but that's okay, I won't be returning again. Big mistake coming here, I seen all the good reviews and thought it would be a good choice.
author: Audrey A.

description:
Simplicity at its FRIGGIN' best!

Apparently, I've been living in a hole for the past 20 some years as last Friday was the FIRST time I've ever tried Roxie's infamous sandwiches after hearing people rave about it for years. Let me preface by saying that I'm not much of a sandwich person and I only eat it out of convenience. However, after trying Roxie's sandwiches, I think I've become a convert. 

What I love and appreciated about Roxie's are the ingredients. Unlike some sandwich places that overdo it with too many complex ingredients and abundance of sauces, Roxie just uses simple, high quality ingredients to make deliciously savory sandwiches.

On Friday, 7.8.11, my co-worker and I were in offsite meetings when we decided to come by Roxie's to grab a sandwich before heading over to our next meeting. We came in about 1:15 PM and there was short line that moved relatively quickly. I ordered the Junior Turkey Avocado BLT w/ Pepperjack Cheese ($8.49) and it was ready in about 5 minutes. 

JUNIOR TURKEY AVOCADO BLT w/ Pepperjack Cheese on Dutch Crunch (Toasted)
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/HRiP-_TSWvJLy3_hXVRPtw?select=_BwMBe1UdaKKUP0gg8YKVw
Although the sandwiches come in 3 sizes, the junior size was more than enough to settle my grumbling tummy and send me into a food comatose.  

The Dutch Crunch is what MADE the sandwich; it had a fantastically savory crunch with a slight salty parmesan-like crust. The toasting of the sandwich melted the creamy and spicy pepperjack cheese ever so lightly, melding all the ingredients into one cohesive sinfully delicious bundle. The turkey was soft, tender and the avocado added a rich butteryness while the bacon gave a hint of smokiness. The accoutrements of lettuce, onions, tomatoes, pickles, and jalapenos gave a pop of tangy, sweet and spicy freshness which helped balance the richness. Each bite was sublime and every flavor from the spectrum just BURST in my mouth! 

I'm not sure whether I should thank Roxie's or curse at them since eating sandwiches out of "convenience" will now be a thing of the past. So much for starting back on the lo-carb diet...*sigh*
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
The people who rated Roxie's with less than 5 starts probably didn't get their sandwich on Dutch Crunch & toasted. 

The sandwiches are delicious. That's it. The ingredients...everything just works together. 

Roxie's is more than just a liquor store that sells sandwiches. This is a place where SF natives will bump into old childhood friends. You'll definitely see a familiar face while waiting outside for your sandwich.
author: Kimmy D.

description: Love this place love their sandwiches Tony's tri tip special is my favorite!!!!!! Good customer service!!
author: Griselda R.

description:
Sandwich and liqueur anyone?  Then RFC is for you. 

One piece of advice, please try the Dutch Crunch.  You shall not be sorry you did.  Just do it!

Lot's on the menu to choose from, and the sammy's are huge.  I mean, like HUGE.  You basically get a meal for now and a meal for later.

Some of my faves include the Tri-Tip and the Rox Special... and the Simon is pretty darn good too.

Staff is cool and the vibe is anti-pretentious.  You try this place once and you will be back.
author: Craig E.

description:
I used to be a food snob-no hole in the walls and no sketchy food places. So when my bf dragged me here, I went "uh-uh!". But he swore on his life that they have to-die for sandwiches. I half-heartedly walked in and asked him to order for me.

So you go through this maze in between a couple rows of shelves of groceries. You pick up your drink and your chips right when you walk through the first aisle. Then you order your sandwich when you reach the counter, and pay at the next counter over. 

My bf got me a junior BBQ beef sandwich on a dutch crunch roll with avocado. Holy Shitzu! That sandwich blew me away! The roll itself was off the hook! They didn't skimp out on the sandwich fixings either. There were piles of tasty, roast beef smothered in smoky BBQ sauce. 
I've also had the roast beef with salame, which was also delicioso! 

You can always customize your sandwich, so go ahead and be as creative and weird as you would like. The friendly, down to earth Roxies people won't judge you.
author: Carmela A.

description: Came to San Francisco on some business. Had been to this sandwich shop once before a few years back. Being that I was in town  again  had to come. That Meatball Mafia is the shit.
author: Jessica A.

description:
Whenever I'm not in San Francisco, I always wonder why Dutch Crunch hasn't caught on anyplace else in the country that I know of.  Then I get one and I remember: it's because it ain't that good!  I'm not singling out Roxie for this, since most sandwich places in San Francisco have it.  And you can get a perfectly good sourdough or whatever else here.
