My main issue with their sandwiches is they are too wet!  I understand a sloppy sandwich is part of what they promise.  But man, it's just dripping with mayo, etc., I was tasting it for a week.  And really can't comment on the quality of the other ingredients b/c they were so 'sauced' I really couldn't taste 'em.

People are friendly.
author: Mike B.

description:
Love me some of that Simon's Special -- pastrami and turkey on dutch crunch bread toasted with yummy melted cheddar. The sandwich is wholesome, so I usually order a junior (half order).

Roxie's is a small convenient store located across the street from Balboa Park. There are two lanes with a good selection of drinks, snacks, candy, and a ton of alcohol behind the counter. I could probably walk through and pick up loads of stuff if my wallet allowed it -- dangerous if you ask me. 

For sandwiches, I'd say to call in your oder if you know what you want. Otherwise, the wait time will be about 5-10 minutes depending on the crowd and time of day. Service is friendly. Parking could be a little difficult, but you can try looking a block down or so in the residential area.

Best sandwiches I've had in SF!
author: Camille B.

description: bomb sammiches. legendary spot that most of the real San Franciscans only know about.
author: Sebastian M.

description: Been going here since my high school days. Nothing better than fresh dutch bread topped with meat. That's a man sandwich. The sandwiches are hefty, big, and filling. I had heard rumors about this place my freshman year of high school and went here on my last day of finals that year. The best. The explosion of savory flavor and mixed spices makes for an awesome meal, plus a bag of chips.
author: Robert F.

description:
Yeah.  It's that good.  Roxie food center doesn't need another 5 star review but it's that good.  

I don't even really know why.  I should say I really don't know how.  I don't know how they make what seem like just normal ingredients and make them extra ordinary.   Just like the location.   Just on a random corner across the street from balboa park.  

It's a liquor store.  At least that's how it looks from the outside.   

But the gods have bestowed some kind of magic at that location.  Some kind of voodoo that has not been duplicated.  It's really just strange.  But eat a sandwich there.   You'll see.  

Then maybe you'll understand.  Or you will be perplexed as I am.  It really doesn't make any sense but the sandwiches are that good.  My sandwich is the Simon Special.  But I've heard epic things about the other sandwiches they serve as well.  

It's really just one of those places you have to go to.  Especially if you're in the neighborhood.   It's just another quirky SF joint that flies under the radar until you actually go there.  Then, after you do, you'll go back.
author: Anthony Y.

description: I love Roxie's!!!! I've been going here for over 6 years now and it never fails to leave me wanting more. I always get the Simon Special. Must try!
author: Carmelisa M.

description: Everyone loves a Roxie sandwich! Growing up in the neighborhood, it was a staple in any kids diet! Lunch time you will typically see a line out the door as everyone waits patiently to place their order. My favorite: Roast Beef on Dutch Crunch, Swiss Cheese, everything on it. Heated of course!
author: Mark V.

description: If you don't know about this spot to get the best deli sandwich in San Francisco then you're probably not from San Francisco or you just don't ain't knowin. Not only fresh to def meat and bread and all other ingredients but the correct portions and toasted (highly recommended) if you want.
author: Randy B.

description:
Of all my years of living in San Francisco / Daly City. I've never actually came here before, today was my first day. Once I entered I felt like it was a friendly neighbor hood place. The owners and workers greet you with a smile. What i ordered the " the Simon Special' which consist of Turkey, Pastrami, Cheddar and Jalapenos on Dutch Crunch. When waiting in line the owner/ cashier keeps people entertained by cracking jokes and being super nice to everyone.

Okay enough of that stuff, now I'm going to talk about the food, the bread as many other people have stated is really good, not too crunch but not soggy. the turkey and pastrami make a wonderful combo toasting it only elevates the flavor of it. One of the best sandwiches I've had in while.
author: Mike L.

description:
Best sandwiches and the friendliest staff you'll find in San Fran. We bring all our Aussie visitors for a tasty sandwich.

My personal favourite is the Simon Special with everything + avocado. Turkey, pastrami, jalapenos, pickles, lettuce, tomato, mustard, mayo, pepper jack all on delicious Dutch crunch bread. 

I have never heard a bad thing about these sandwiches though, so give it a try!
author: Erin D.

description: I've heard so much about this place and figured it was about time I gave it a try. Split 2 supreme sandwiches ($15 each) amongst four people and it was just the right amount. One turkey avocado club and one roast beef with Swiss. Both sandwiches on dutch crunch of course. Anyways, I don't know what it is but I wasn't blown away by the sandwiches. No special sauce or anything to make me say "WOW!" Instead, just two sandwiches on some amazingly toasted dutch crunch. Little Lucca will forever be my number one!
author: Brie R.

description:
I will never eat such an amazing sandwich ever again. HOLY COW AMAZING. 
After tasting these sandwiches everywhere else seems to disappoint. My crew and I always stop here before beach or river outings in the bay because everywhere else isn't the same! 

All time favorites are the Tony's Tri Tip and the Simon Special (turkey and pastrami!)

The counter to order sandwiches is really high so sometimes it's hard for the crew to see me to order haha but everyone is really nice.
author: Kieran B.

description:
Wow, really a gem in the middle of nowhere (basically a convenience store/liquor store with incredible sandwiches!) They have great options that are affordable, fresh Dutch Crunch, and an atmosphere where you never know what you'll get (it's an interesting neighborhood for sure...)

I like this place because it feels like it hasn't been too discovered yet. Neighborhood folks know it, but since it's not necessarily too close to anything, you don't get hordes of tourists or anything. I'd definitely recommend grabbing a couple sandwiches here on a Saturday and heading out to a park for an afternoon. Great food at a reasonable price!
author: Neal C.

description: 3 Sandwich spots i love Subcenter Deliworld and Roxie.
author: David C.

description: This is one of the best sandwich shops ever.  Anywhere. It's small and busy.  Call ahead.  Get dutch crunch in whatever size you want.  I share a regular with the GF.  Get it toasted.  My favorite is turkey club, dutch crunch, jack (cheese), everything.  Nicest people.  We live on the east coast half the year.  The day we are back in SF, it's off to Roxie.  We are always greeted like returning soldiers.
author: Karen L.

description:
I've been coming here since I was about twelve years old. 
The owners are very sweet!
the sandwiches are soooo good. (Get the dutch crunch bread)
t's a tight space and can get crowed to brace yourself for a little bit of a wait. But it is worth every minute!
author: Nicky V.

description:
Alright, Roxie's sandwiches literally are heaven sent. My friends drive all the way from SoCal to have a bite of this goodness. I've even had to sometimes drive a Roxie's sandwich to SoCal because its just THAT good.

I usually get the Tri-Tip with everything on it and let me tell you, I am a small girl with a big stomach and I think I can finish about two of these if I was really trying. I have to stop and contain myself because that just doesn't sound healthy or good for my well being, but if I were given the chance...

First off, parking is tricky but well worth it (trust me). If you're a first timer you will be surprised of how small this spot really is. Once again just trust me. You walk in and pick a drink and chips and basically you fall in line to order the glorious sandwiches. Stop and chat with the people behind the counter, they are hilarious!

There's no where to actually eat but we usually post up on the newspaper stands or on top our cars or simply take it home. It'll be good anywhere you eat it!

The meatball, Roxie's special, Crab sandwich. Just try it all.

Definitely one of the hidden gems in the city that everyone should discover.

Just writing this makes me want a Roxie's sandwich.
author: Kc E.

description: I can't believe it's taken me this long to find this place. Really great sandwiches. The Roxie's special and the trip-tip sandwiches are both favs. And the people who work here are really nice. Give it a try!
author: Corey F.

description: I visite Roxie's at least once a month since 2007. I have tried all of their sandwich but Chicken breast avocado with bbq sauce on douch crunch is my usual.  I like to order by phone so I can eat it right away once I have my hand on it.
author: Tim C.

description:
I had this tiny sandwich place bookmark for a long time. Most of us know that this was and still is the hottest business in San Francisco. 

On a gorgeous Saturday afternoon, I met up with my close-friend, who works for SFPD's Ingleside Station. 

The deli/market is also a favorite lunch spot for San Francisco's finest too. 

When I got there, I was totally lost on where to order my sandwich. So I entered the left side where the cold beverage cooler is located and right off the bat, I quickly guzzled down a bottle of cold fruit-punch Powerade. I also grabbed a bag of "Dirty" chips and Arrowhead Sparkling water. I did all this in front of my SFPD friend. 

"Like, what is she going to do? And I don't mind being handcuffed by her too...ooh, baby!"

First she placed her order. And her order is for six of her fellow officer colleagues. Finally, I placed my order and I took the Regular-size BBQ Beef on a Dutch Crunch. For $7.99, I get a fat slab of slice beef drenched in BBQ Sauce, choice of cheese (I took Swiss), and the usual sandwich condiments.  

I got to tell you, that sandwich was "edible-incredible"! The thin slice of meat was very tender and tasted well with the melted Swiss cheese. The sauce was sweet with a little spiciness. And the Dutch-crunch roll had a crunchy explosion in every bite. 

I owe my friend a lot in turning me on in finding this place. 

My long years of anticipation of coming here have finally ended. And my return for another trip back and try more of the shop's tasty sandwiches will be very soon. 

The shop also sell 40 ounces beer. For a complete meal, I might try that with my sandwich too.
author: Matt G.

description:
I am very disappointed in the 4.5 star yelp rating of this deli. C'mon people there are so many better places out there. This was my first and last trip to Roxie's. All I ever heard was "oh you gotta go to Roxie's it's the best" and "YOU HAVENT BEEN TO ROXIES?!?"  

When I peaked over the high deli counter to find a young woman popping her gum while listening to her music in one ear and my sandwich order with the other I was initially turned off. I asked for 2 turkey sandwiches. One with pepper jack and Avo, the other with cheddar and no mustard. The girl said "you want it hot right?" And after telling her I would like it cold I drew a look of disgust out of her. At that moment I was still waiting to judge this place on the sandwich itself. 

I grabbed 2 sodas and went to the register to settle up. The guy asks what I ordered. I said the 2 cold turkey sandwiches. He says ok that'll be $38.00.....
WHOA! 38 DOLLARS? He said "yes, supreme sandwiches are $15.00". When I ask for a sandwich and don't specifically ask for supreme you should probably make sure that's what I want before making it. $15 for a sandwich means this better be the best sandwich that's ever been made. 

Now on to the worst part of the whole experience.... 
THE SANDWICH. it was a ton of low quality ingredients sloppily spread inside a foot long crumbly Dutch crunch roll. You would've thought I ordered an onion sandwich and asked to add Turkey. $15? You can charge a dollar fifty for this sandwich and it would still be a rip off. They probably make about $14.00 on every "Supreme" sandwich they make. I didn't know that "Supreme" meant taking the crap you put on your regular sandwiches and double it. I have about 3/4 of each sandwich left. I couldn't get my dog to eat any so maybe I'll be able to swindle the birds in the park to eat the rest.... Maybe. 

Since I stated there are better places to go I would recommend taking your business to Clancey's on Irving where you'd get 5 times the quality for half the price and astronomically better service.
author: Nick M.

description:
I have been meaning to try this place ever since some big dude at a Kidrobot event told me about it. I did hear that was a sandwich spot straight out of a liquor store so I wasn't surprised about that. There aren't any tables to enjoy your sandwich here--strictly a to-go place.

Yes, the sandwiches are pretty yummy. Is it better than Ike's? I don't think so. I think Ike's reigns supreme in the bay area. However, it does rank very high in the deli sandwich arena. I highly recommend this spot.

I got a pastrami sandwich with cheddar cheese on a dutch crunch roll with everything on it except mustard--can't go wrong with this masterpiece.

You order first from the people making sandwiches, go pay, then wait with everyone else in a cramped space for the register guy give you your sandwich(es).
author: Marlon T.

description:
I honestly felt lost when my friend brought me here. I had no idea that this place was so close to City College, and if I had known, I'd come here for lunch instead!

But their sandwiches are SOOO gooood! I had a turkey/avacado/bacon on Dutch Crunch with American cheese. (My gf ordered while I waited in the car so I don't know if there was a cool name that goes with this or if it was simply TAB with bread/cheese).

It was so flavorful and juicy, and after finishing the first half, it successfully seduced me into finishing the second half! --while I was on a (sort-of) diet!!! My bf was pretty pissed I didn't save him any. Woops.

Definitely will return, and I heard from my gf that the guy who works there is um.. pretty nice. Yep.
author: Athena L.

description:
I could've sworn I wrote a review for Roxie's about 3-4 years ago.. anyways! I was craving a sandwich one day, so my boyfriend suggested Roxie's since he's never been. At first, I was a bit hesitant because my first Roxie's experience was just okay. I decided to order a turkey on dutch crunch and the total came out to $10 and some change, which, in my opinion, is a bit expensive for a deli sandwich.

Turkey on Dutch Crunch with provolone cheese - The sandwich was pretty much the same sandwich I had 4 years ago, but a tad bit better. The bread, however, was too crunchy for my liking. After all it IS dutch CRUNCH, but the bread scratched the insides of my mouth making it difficult to eat the sandwich. We went to Lake Merced to eat our sandwiches, and even the birds didn't want to touch the bread!

Overall, Roxie's is okay, but nothing spectacular. Go to Little Lucca's to get your sandwich fix!
author: Joyce E.

description: Incredible sandos. Worth the wait. BBQ Tri Tip and the Turkey Club are amongst our household favorites.
author: Tawnee K.

description:
This place is THE convenience store I go to for all my junk food, expired baked goods, and overpriced liquor needs.

JUST KIDDING.

The sandwiches are so damn good here that the convenience store might as well not exist (although the chip selection is nice). So get your ass here, wait in line, design a sandwich and enjoy. You will love it! Try the dutch crunch or sourdough breads. All the specials are awesome! Only downside is that it can get a little busy during lunch time.
author: Nicolas H.

description: I love there tri tip special . Best sandwhich. The wait is just long. Coz its so damn good!
author: Rjay D.

description: I have been coming here since i was in college. My tennis team would always order our sandwiches from here. My favorite is the roxie's special on dutch crunch. It is one of my favorite sandwich places!
author: Karen L.

description: Theeeee best sandwich shop hands down! I always get the turkey on Dutch crunch. The sandwich masters always perfectly heat the subs to make the bread and fillings warm all the way through, while making the bread crunchy with each bite. On top of that, the shop is a family joint -- I love the feel in there. The awesome sandwiches and friendly staff keep me coming back. I've been a sandwich patron of theirs since I was in middle school. Let's just say that was a loooong time ago.
author: Maria C.

description:
Their sandwiches are to die for and their dutch crunch is amazing!

To be honest, the first time I went here I was hesitant as to how good their sandwich could be considering it's a convenience store but boy was I pleasantly surprised! I've been here quite a few times and gotten a different sandwich every time and they have all been super good!
author: Andréa W.

description:
So I've been coming here for some time now but have not gotten around to writing a review. For you newbies, yes, believe the hype. Roxie is one of the few places that can make a great sandwich. This is coming from a person who doesn't eat a lot of sandwiches. It's not located in the most ideal neighborhood, infact, I used to live up the street from Roxie's on San Jose Ave and was mugged walking home. Roxie was the only upside to living there.

Likes: The Simon Special on dutch crunch. The regular portion is pretty big so I usually get the junior size. This is about the only sandwich I've tried. It's pretty much perfection. The roll is sturdy enough to hold everything together, yet soft once you bite into it. The ingredients are fresh, loads of meat, loads of vegetables, they don't skimp out on anything. Plenty of drinks & chips to choose from. The best part is it's cheap and they take debit/credit cards.

Dislikes: The line can get long during busy hours (usually lunch time on the weekends) and it gets cramped in the tiny store.

I no longer live in that area but my bf and I still visit here to grab a sandwich. Our favorite thing to do is sit at the park across the street and enjoy our sandwiches.
author: Cindy W.

description: Im so excited to live right down the street from "the sandwich place" that everyone told me about ! Roxie's! Its been at the same location for good reason. Get the Simon special .... Or anything else. It just doesn't get any better! The owners and staff are awesome too!
author: Alisa F.

description: Having gotten sandwiches at Roxie's for the last 20 years, I'm finally writing a review for it. Grew up stopping by Roxie's to get a sandwich on my way to Giants games at Candlestick. Still tastes the same all these years. I get either a roast beef or pastrami on Dutch crunch, provo, with everything. Perfect amount of meat and fixings to bread, heated up and jalapenos for some heat. Good portion size for a great price. I know there are a bunch of sandwich spots in the City nowadays serving all these interesting meat combinations with special sauce for $12-$15, but Roxie's sticks to the basics and it's tops for me.
author: Rick T.

description: Simon special is one of the best sandwiches I've ever had. It had the right amount of pastrami and turkey the cheddar melted with peppers onion tomato lettuce mayonnaise and mustard. Delicious I would come beck here in a heartbeat.  The Dutch crunch is on point! Perfect sandwich... thank you...
author: Dana W.

description:
I LOVE ROXIE'S!!!

I grew up in the neighborhood and I've always loved this place. When I used to work across the street at balboa pool we used to race for Roxie's sandwiches paid for by the loser. 

My usual is the pastrami on dutch crunch with provolone cheese and everything on it. The dutch crunch bread here is to die for. You cannnooot go wrong with this sandwich. I've also had the roast beef, hot link, meatball sub, and tuna melt... they're all amazing.

Whenever I come home, a stop at Roxie's is a must.
author: Elaine N.

description:
Well hot damn.  This is a place I would have passed right by if not for yelp.

It is a hole in the wall liquor store that serves absolutely awesome sandwiches.  I've tried about 3 of them, and their meatball on dutch crunch is killer.  The bread totally makes it.  It paired well with the fifth of bourbon that I also purchased.

A tiny bit pricy, but well worth it.
author: Rocco B.

description: Very cool grocery shop and take out sandwich place. That sandwich is amazing! With very nice price! Must try.
author: Leonardo Sean Y.

description:
You make a darn good sandwich, Roxie. 

After leaving an appointment in Bayview this afternoon, I stopped by Roxie to see what all the buzz is about. 

It's a convenience store with a deli. There are literally hundreds of these in SF, but none of them are doin' it quite like Roxie.

I ordered the regular size tri-tip special ($9.99), which had fresh tri tip steak, horseradish, bbq sauce, red onions and jalapeños. If you come here, you're getting your sandwich on dutch crunch. I've never had dutch crunch this good. Like, I totally get why everyone is obsessed with it now. Where are they getting their dutch crunch?!?

I didn't photograph my sandwich because it frankly didn't photograph well. That thing was gooey, messy and, well... perfect. The Jr. size is the size of a normal sandwich. The regular size is IMMENSE- the other half of it is currently sitting in my refrigerator. Drunk Katie will thank me for spending an extra $2 when I come home from the bars tonight.

It's a bit cramped in there and I kept having to move for people to walk by me, but the staff are friendly and conversational. This place is across the street from Balboa Park. I don't even need to tell you where to eat your Roxie sandwich.

... no, not in your car.
author: K M.

description:
Where can you go to buy a Playboy magazine AND a made-to-order sandwich? ROXIE!! Yeah, buddy. 

The Tony sandwich is most notable. Tender tri-tip, barbecue sauce, cheddar and all the fixin's on a French roll. Served hot. Messy. Good messy, yes, but the difference between good and too much was only a few bites.

Pastrami on dutch crunch: Sorry to say it, but it was really like a glorified Togo's sandwich. Yes, the dutch crunch bread here, when toasted, is delicious. The pastrami is lean and flavorful, even nice and thinly sliced. But overall pretty boring.

These sandwiches are Yelp's top 100 worthy? That's questionable.
Definitely didn't make it on my top 5 sando list, anyway.
author: Pauline D.

description:
Omg!!! If you are ever in the mood for a bomb sandwich come to this spot. It is the bomb.com. I always enjoy my sandwich from here. They serve everything so fresh and warm. I always ask for my sandwich heated. Which makes the cheese melt. Which makes it even more bomb. 

The service is fast and the people that work their are nice. They make you feel welcomed not like other places where you feel rushed. 

To my luck I have came a couple of times during rush hour. It gets crazy packed but it is worth it. I have came here and ordered more then 20 sandwiches for my whole family when we go to the park or the beach. 

Whenever I'm in the mood for a sandwich I always come here. I'm always satisfied with what I order. I never had a wrong order. Nothing. I can even call by phone and put in my order so by the time I'm there it is ready.
author: Yasuko R.

description: The sandwich makers have so much attitude and think they are above the customer. The cashier is also very rude. The owner is the coolest of the bunch. The sandwiches are very overpriced. Not all sandwiches are good. I do recommend Roxie Special, Pastrami, and Turkey and avocado.
author: Juan V.

description: My favorite sandwich spot! The "Samaon Mafia" is my all time fave but I also love their crab sandwich. Sandwiches have so much flavor and the fellas and ladies never disappoint with their customer service. Food is Awesome!
author: CJ L.

description: Best Dutch crunch I've EVER had.  My go to sandwich is Simon Special.  These sandwiches are simple, classic and tasteful.
author: April S.

description:
The King stay the King. I got my first Roxie sandwich in 1991 as a freshman in high school and whenever I get back to SF it's one of my first food stops. Pastrami with swiss, barbecue beef, Tony's tri-tip; I've literally never had a bad sandwich at Roxie and we're talking hundreds of visits.
 Nothing changes in this place, and that's a good thing. The sandwiches are huge and delicious (jalapenos come standard!), the dudes behind the counter still remember me even though I get there about twice a year (or at least they pretend to...) and they even let locals order on credit (pay them back though, seriously; you don't want to get banned)! A San Francisco institution that keeps the city flavor going in a part of the world most newcomers never see. 
Keep your Gary Danko and whatever new spot just opened up on Valencia with $15 cocktails and artisan pork belly; I'll take a Roxie sandwich.
author: Jared G.

description: Great food! Never had a bad sandwich. plenty of choices on sides and drinks. These family places use to be  easier to find. Word of mouth is all they need. I'll be back!
author: David U.

description: Awesome food. Great prices. Very good selection on sandwiches. Good staff. Very satisfied. We will be coming back!
author: Kristen M.

description:
San Francisco institution!!!

When I first moved here and started at CCSF I had heard everyone in the athletic department talking about roxies. Finally one of my coaches told me to go get him a sandwich and finally try it myself... let me tell you, I drove up to this place and thought that this was a joke... and then I got out of the car, the smell emanating from this little 2 aisle corner store was intoxicating!! As soon as you walk in you realize that this place is the real deal! All the sports memorabilia and history in this place is epic and that is before I even got a sandwich. They are a very close knit group of people that come here regularly and it is the last of a dieing breed of neighborhood joints where just about everyone knows everyone.

I ordered a supreme roast beef and swiss on sourdough. Holy crap this sandwich was huge! Definitely worth whatever price they wanted to put on it. 
The sandwich was magical!
It was a sandwich that was made using high quality ingredients and no corners are cut here which is why this place is so popular and succesful!

IF YOU HAVE NEVER BEEN HERE.... GET OFF YELP AND GO GET A ROXIES SANDWICH... NOW!!
author: Trevor D.

description:
My boyfriend who is a local SF native introduced me to Roxie's a couple months ago now we come to get sammie's at least once a week here! You wouldn't think that this quaint liquor store can throw together such a yummy sandwich but trust me, give it a chance and you will return!

My boyfriend orders the junior chicken club with provolone cheese and bbq sauce added, its soooo yum! I on the other hand I will normally order turkey with cheddar cheese on dutch crunch. However, i recently was craving a nice salami sandwich so I ordered that today on the soft sourdough (they have soft sour or hard sour), with cheddar cheese- OMG I THINK I HAVE FOUND MY NEW FAVORITE SAMMY- I NEARLY FAINTED BECAUSE I WAS SO PLEASED YUUUUUUMMM!!!!

Love this place!
author: Courtney S.

description:
Best sandwish ever

Make sure you order
Roxie special
Dutch crunch
Toast it
Everything on it



Fresh and crunchy sandwich- yummmmmmm

All the guys are very friendly. Cant tell a liquor store can make such a good sandwish. Better than a lot of sandwish store out there.
author: Che K.

description: I haven't been here in 20+ years but same old great tasting sandwiches, maybe even better than before.  Roxie's one of the best in Frisco
author: Pat W.

description:
This place has been here a long time. I used to be a patron before the eternal lines. It used to be so simple: come in, order your sandwich, pay and leave. It ain't like that anymore. 

On our way over, my husband suggested we call in our sandwiches. I kinda shooed him away saying that wasn't necessary. I HATE being wrong. 

The guy ringing up the orders is amazing at memorizing who ordered what. If that were me, I'd have complaints up the yin yang.  He was the reason why the line moved quickly.

I had the avocado turkey club. Toasted. Less lettuce, no onions. It was delish. There were small pieces of pancetta in it, which made it even more delectable. Did I mention there were jalepenos in it as well? Super scrumptious. 

The first bite and as well as the subsequent bites were probably the best ever I had of a sandwich in a while.  I gotta start coming here on a regular basis again!
author: Sharon B.

description: Visited for the first time today, and got a MASSIVE breakfast special sandwich to split with my wife. Came to about $18, and was more than enough food. Next time I might go one size down. Still, the sandwich was awesome. And while paying, I told the man at the register that it was my first time, and what should I get next time. He said, the "Simon Special, of course." And it just happens that this was SIMON I was talking to. Then he ordered a sample of the sandwich for me and my wife. I said thanks, but he said, "don't worry, I'm not doing you any favors, you're going to get addicted." And he's right! It was delicious. Overall, great experience, and super friendly people in the shop. Plus, both sandwiches are excellent. This is exactly the type of deli I love. Thanks Simon!
author: Shawn S.

description:
sandwiches r good. the lady who picked up the phone spoke limited English I asked for French bread, she said sour dough french... i gave up and said ok sour dough french... and i really got the wrong bread. i got there and picked up my sandwiches and asked for pick up.... the people in the back doing the sandwiches were talking shit in spanish thinking i wouldn't understand... dont know if i wanna come back here again. i felt the disrespect.

i recommend GRUBBIN' @ Taraval... f this place
author: ABC Z.

description:
I really wanted to fall in love with this place but I just couldn't. First impressions are important - and my date with Roxie's couldn't hit the mark. Why? Because of the service.

The sandwich spot is located inside the local market/liquor store, so expect tight spaces when walking through the aisles and "excuse me's" getting around people in the store. Hopefully you're at least 5'2, or else you won't be seen when ordering your sandwich - food shelves block you from seeing what's behind the counter...

FOOD:
BBQ Beef sandwich on dutch crunch ($7.99) - they use real beef, not processed deli meat! Yay. So that was a plus. I asked the lady to not put onions in my sandwich...low and behold there's onions in my sandwich. I honestly didn't think she was paying attention while making my order anyways since she was talking incessantly to her coworker. Didn't even feel warm & toasty as requested, probably cause it got cold while she attempted to put everything together in a 15-minute time frame...with me as the only customer there. I did enjoy the sandwich though, but not as much as my beloved sandwich hot spot: Lou's on Geary.

Overall: 3. The food seems good so if you're in the area check it out. Don't expect over-the-top customer service though. I'll give this sandwich spot another chance if ever I'm in the area again.
author: Loriel L.

description: Not really consistent. Sometimes they're ok, but other times they're disappointing. Not really worth the price but ok if you're in the area and don't wanna go far
author: Jessica W.

description: The perfect sandwich hands down. I do wish they had a garlic spread like little Lucas though..
author: RacheL C.

description: If you want a sandwich, go here. I have had a few of them, most recently the roast beef. Always on point! Friendly service as well.
author: Eddie K.

description:
DUTCH CRUNCH SALAMI SANDWICH *heart eyes*

Growing up, my cousin and I would walk or ride bikes here as she only lived down the block. This is nostalgic, bringing back memories of my childhood. I never even knew the local corner store was popular til seeing this on Yelp's top 100. I thought it was just a local hidden gem, but hey I'm glad it has received recognition cause it surely deserves it! Love love Roxie's.
author: Valerie D.

description: I hate to say what's already been said, but I want to play homage to this amazing little corner store from heaven. I've waited in the line more times than I'd like to say to get that perfectly thin cut chicken breast sandwich lathered in honest mustard and fresh veggies on the softest freshest roll. I hope it never goes away! It's like a trip home in your mouth.
author: Laurel M.

description: Best sandwich spot in SF. I always get their junior roast beef on Dutch crunch and heated up. They usually get pretty busy, so I phone in my orders. Come here and try it!
author: Hiro N.

description:
great tasting sandwiches from a liquor/corner store? sounds a little sketchy huh? but step inside and you'll be in for a treat. 

Roxies serves gourmet sandwiches and boy are they good. everything from the bread rolls to the cheeses and meats. dont let the store front discourage you. order a sandwich and drive a bit to the park and you've got yourself a nice little date.
author: Serena L.

description: I  live in Concord now, but I used to live a few blocks from there. I make that 35 mile trip just to get me a sandwich. I love them! Everyone that works there is awesome and the sandwiches are like no other! I want one now :)
author: Rochelle W.

description: Well this morning it's very cold still so try to keep warm well I went to get a sandwich today um its alright its not kind of busy got to talk to the owner to bad gotta to meet this lady call Jessica and we talked for a little bit that was nice and I got a sandwich for lunch so we mike plan to stay in or not or we might just go out for dessert later well you guys have a good day stay warm
author: Miko A.

description:
I have always heard of the infamous Roxie's being the best sandwich spot in the city. After years of my bestfriend telling me that this place was bomb, I say this place is only okay. I don't know if I got my own hopes up, but I was just a little bit let down.

I had gotten a Regular artificial crab sandwich on dutch crunch bread w/ pepper jack cheese and everything on it. When I first bit into it, I was hoping that I was going to taste the crab meat. Throughout the whole sandwich, my bites were hit and miss. I mostly tasted all of the toppings that were put inside and not much of the crab.

Compared to Little Luca's, I would say that Little Luca's have a lot more flavor in their sandwiches than Roxie's does.
author: Audrey G.

description:
First time trying Roxi's was right after Tuesday nights class at CCSF, the hubby and I were starving and remembered this place was close by.

Luckily, there were no lines at the time so we went right in and ordered two subs. We went with the Roxie Special and the Simon Special, both on the dutch crunch.

Both sandwiches were HUGE, though, after swapping halves, I did prefer the Simon but wish there was a little less meat in it. I highly suggest splitting one because their just that filling, and we even had the smallest size!

I think the main attraction of this place is definitely, as other reviewers mentioned, the freshly baked dutch crunch rolls. I have yet to taste ones with so much flavor and the butter softness of these. They were absolutely perfect.

Will be back again on those schools days!
author: Petra S.

description:
Excellent sandwiches. Fresh bread; crunch on the outside, soft on the inside. Nothing like those sandwiches that tear your mouth up after the first few bites.

I got a regular-sized roast beef on Dutch crunch with everything. Such a great balance of flavors. So filling. Guy who runs the place is friendly and clearly runs the place well. Am so excited to go back again and again!
author: Sev G.

description: Tony's tri-tip special on Dutch crunch w/ everything. I've been getting this since I was a fetus
author: Kev S.

description: Go for their Simon Special.  You can't ever go wrong with turkey, pastrami, cheddar or dutch crunch.  Put them all together and you've got something pretty damn amazing.  Prepared to be satisfied!
author: Sam C.

description: Simon's special is my sh#t! Been coming here for years since its nearby. I've never been disappointed in the quality and flavor of the sandwiches here. I highly recommend this little shop, it's not fancy but it's fantastic. Customer service here is great, too, the folks here are awesome.
author: Bruce W.

description: This is the place I go to when I'm craving a delicious sandwich AND buy my lotto tickets at the same time ! The sandwiches are popular and talked about by ALL city natives ! It may look like just a small corner store but don't let that fool you. They're service is pretty fast and sandwiches are a good affordable price. I HIGHLY recommend you try this place before you even think about going to subway !
author: Angelique G.

description:
3.5 stars!

This is a typical corner grocery store, also known for made-to-order sandwiches. Their toasted pastrami sandwich is 4 stars worthy. But remember to check your order before leaving the store. Twice they've screwed up my orders. On my latest visit, they forgot to put avocado in my "BLT with avocado". 

The sandwich making operation is hidden by a tall wall of bagged chips/snacks and wood paneling (what are they trying to hide?). Other sandwich shops use glass instead. Then I probably could have seen when they missed the avocado on my sandwich instead of finding out when I got home. Urgh! 

Service is usually semi-cordial (I would not describe it as friendly), but that's offset by the value of having freshly made sandwiches until 9pm in this remote area. Nearby Deli World (which I already reviewed in prior weeks) closes at 5:30pm.

Sandwiches come in 3 sizes: junior, regular & super. The junior ($5.99) would satisfy most appetites. 

Pros: 
- Affordable pricing 
- Open late (until 9pm) 
- Good variety of sandwiches with many meat choices
- Bread selection: 8 bread rolls and 3 sliced breads (Deli World only has 1 bread type) 
- No extra charge for toasting the bread (Deli World charges extra for hot food) 

Cons: 
- Price is $1-$2 more expensive than nearby Deli World on Ocean Ave. 
- Greasy hair sandwich makers that behave and talk like some gumbas from NY 
- You cannot see how they make your sandwich 
- Staff mistakes, last time they forgot to put avocado in my "BLT with avocado"

My latest food pics: 

- Pastrami on dutch crunch roll - really good stuff! 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/HRiP-_TSWvJLy3_hXVRPtw?select=IFA6dy6YJHqToj64Axs4Og 

- A "BLT with avocado" that's MISSING the avocado!!! 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/HRiP-_TSWvJLy3_hXVRPtw?select=eR7ErTjQpINLyij4TiYSWw 

- Potato salad was okay (flavored with curry, eggs, olives, pickles). I prefer Deli World's simple version much better. 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/HRiP-_TSWvJLy3_hXVRPtw?select=MuD7wqfUJuxHStrp7Fgh_A 

- Small candy (nougat with pistachios) from jar next to register, .40 cents each 
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/HRiP-_TSWvJLy3_hXVRPtw?select=Bt9Y7enOEADgm4Nz4WHfYQ
author: Luis C.

description:
Its easy to write a review when something sucks, but hard to measure "how good" they are once it hits past 3 stars.

Sandwich-

simon's special, dutch crust, everything on.

Food breakdown-

Meat- Plentiful
lettuce- average shredded iceberg
tomato- soggy
pickles- lightly tart, not enough crunch
jalapeno- sour, not really spicy

pretty good, not the best i ever had. bread is pretty awesome though

service breakdown-

fast to order, took way too long to make the sandwich based on what we ordered. staff friendly.
author: Jake L.

description: Since discovering this place, I was fascinated by the variety and quality. Whenever I can, I make a little effort to go and eat a delicious sandwich with my mom and my sister... but most of the time go alone. I love the rations, bread, pastrami... everything! You could go there all the time and could'nt.
author: Elízabeth D.

description: Simon and his family has been feeding me their mouth-watering sandwiches since I was 15 years old and a student at Balboa High School.  Today, I'm 51, live in the suburbs, and cross two bridges to drive to San Francisco to get their amazing sandwich!!!! Great service, great food and Great FAMILY!!!!!!
author: Narrow D.

description: I've been going here since I was in high school. The nice guys who make the sandwiches, and the flavor of the sandwiches have never changed. My favorite go to spot for sandwiches in SF. I always order my sandwiches on Dutch Crunch and warmed!!! Heaven!! A must try!!!
author: Margarita M.

description:
In order to feed a family of 5 adults, I bought a large tri-tip, a large- Roxie Special, and a regular-sized pastrami -- all on Dutch Crunch bread as recommended by fellow yelpers.  I was able to sample them all and must say "Thank you so much, fellow yelpers!"

The owner was also very patient as I changed my order 4 times before making a final decision.
author: Linda H.

description:
Ever since I became a fan of Joey Tribbiani, I've been looking for THE meatball sandwich...the kind he talks about with his friends...the kind he dreams about in his sleep..... the kind he would choose over saving Chandler from a gunshot... 

Roxie's is where I found the one.  Toasted bread, melted cheese, fatty meatballs... mMmmMmm... so that's why he choose the sandwich over his best friend!
author: Miss Maggie C.

description: It was ok at best. I've been here a few times before n it was pretty good. Seems like it depends on who is making the sandwich.
author: Paul G.

description:
I have been going to  Roxie's for a while now, and must say they are incredible!! 
It was easy to get hocked the first time I had a one of their sandwiches, it was fresh, only the best ingridients etc.. However the best part of it was how they treat you, just like a returning good friend. I love a well prepared sandwich and these guys are heard to beat!!! 
Ely - San Francisco
author: E W D.

description:
Please see my Nobel Prize winning theorem in the field of Quantum Restaurant Mechanics applied onto Roxie's with particular mention of the Simon Special on Dutch:

Taste x [($Price/(.)(.)Portions)]
___________________________
Service x [(Ambiance x Location^)]

=BSHMK2 {BEST SANDWICH IN THE HISTORY OF MANKIND SQUARED}
author: John E.

description:
A true secret of the city. 

Legit sandwich joint. Father took me here as a child, I'll take my kid here as well, Roxie Dynasty.
author: Wayne B.

description:
Understanding that this review might upset some Roxie Food Center fans, this is a classic example of why Best of Yelp is dysfunctional.  For weeks in fall of 2006, Roxie Food Center has been NUMBER 1 in restaurants category (with zip code set in downtown SF) (See pic).  Are you telling me that Roxie out ranks all other restaurants as the best restaurant in the area?  The best among 5000 restaurants rated in the area?

Being a food nerd, I drove from SOMA to Balboa Park area just to check out the heavily raved Roxie's sandwiches on Dutch Crunch bread.  As you can see from the pics I've posted, the place is very much like any old mini-mart/liqueur store with a counter for sandwiches.  Inside, there was limited space to walk around.  The customers in line to order, people waiting for their sandwich to be made, and people waiting to pay the cashier, were all mixed up like a chaotic zoo.  Don't go here if you are claustrophobic.  

SANDWICH:  I sat there gravely puzzled at my inability to see the greatness in Roxie's sandwiches.  I trust Yelpers, so I knew that 39 Yelpers could not be wrong, so I knew the problem must be with me.  Bread was good, but I think ACME Bread (http://www.yelp.com/biz/I19ntZQrZxMn9gYOOK1rhg) and Boulangerie Bay Bread (http://www.yelp.com/biz/tQE4SPlX9ZlFSbF4JPU4pg) is better.  Pastrami was o.k., but ones at Miller's East Coast Delicatessen (http://www.yelp.com/biz/4NInBK_67cLRyUS7sq0CEg) is significantly better.  Turkey was average at best, better ones at Tommy's Joynt (http://www.yelp.com/biz/0YPcBWiU-8t2kGe-DOhW5g) or even at Lee's Deli.  Roxie's meat quality was no better than what I get at Safeway.  

Summary:  Roxie is a good neighborhood sandwich shop.  However, they do not have the best sandwich in the city, and for sure it's not the best restaurant in Yelp.  Grab a sandwich at Guerra Quality Meats (http://www.yelp.com/biz/jK1_pM6U50seuco7Tvhing), grab one at Roxie, compare the two, and let me know if Roxie Food Center should be #1 on Best of Yelp.
author: トモ T.

description: I been coming here for years. The owner and staff are super friendly and make sure to help you get out quickly, since there is always a line. I usually call to place my order and they have it done in about ten mins. Everything they have is fresh and all their sandwich are awesome. I usually get the turkey club sandwich with everything on it on Dutch crunch bread, and I have to say is a little peace of heaven.. Absolute love this place!!!
author: Chiara M.

description: This place is an institution! Some of the best sandwiches in the city. They don't skimp on anything and the house dressing on the sandwiches is amazing! I have been going here since I was a kid and it has only gotten better.
author: Niels R.

description:
I have been ordering sandwiches from here for almost 20 years, and the staff remember me to this day. If you want to avoid the line in the store, I do recommend ordering by phone.

Some reviews have said that the sandwiches are pricey, but I think for the size of the sandwiches, the prices are fine.
author: Adam G.

description: Great little neighborhood market. Great sandwiches my favorite is Toni's tri-tip special. Store owners and staff are super chill.
author: Aaron B.

description:
A wild and wonderful adventure.  This is not a sandwich shop where you take mom for lunch...Actually,  this is a value added corner liquor store on steriods.  Who would expect that beyond the food shelves, assorted pints, candy, zip papers, sleezy magazines and lottery tickets, you would find a counter where a friendly guy was making great $10 (large) sandwiches to order? 

We tried the roast beef with tomato lettuce and hot peppers, topped with fresh ground pepper and dijon mustard, and the barbeque beef with the same toppings, both on crunch rolls.  They were great...(Warning:  their barbeque is really hot, and if you don't like mayonaisse or cheese, speak up, or you'll get both) . The constant banter of the sandwich chef reminds everyone that the personal touch still counts. Don't be put off by the girlie magazines  just inside the front door... It's a piece of Americana, well worth going out of your way  to patronize.
author: Lynn S.

description:
Loved it!! Food was simple and amazing! I ordered the Simon Special, and it was amazing!! This place should be featured on any "Diners and Dives" show. Amazing food, and very friendly people! 
But don't be shocked when you walk into a convince store. It's a hole in the wall. But the sandwiches are so worth it! 
I even had the bonus of meeting Simon! Awesome guy. Gave my dog some turkey slices. Oh yea, they say dog friendly, but what they really mean is tie your dog to the door, and have the animal wait outside while you order. Simon came out and gave my dog a few scraps. I never feed him table food, but I couldn't be rude and reject so doggie ate too. There is also a nice park right across the street. So me, my babe and the dog all sat in the park and chowed down! There is no seating at Roxie's so bring your own chair. But since it's a liquor store, have a beer and eat one of the best sandwiches in your life!
author: Tamara F.

description:
Dittos, mimeographs, xeroxes galore to all of your reviews. Jr turkey on DC, Roxie special on extra sour, cramped, chaotic, tasty... yup, yup yup, yup and yup. 

I get the sense that toasting the sammies must be some heavenly next level, as I've been twice now, each time receiving an unfiltered surprised look when I request my order to not be heated. (Sorry - they were for future consumption so toasting wouldn't really matter at present. Are you mad at me?)

There are some resto virginities you just want to lose with a specific person, Roxie was one of them.
author: Jen H.

description: I remember my homie told me about this place way back when I was a 6th grader in 2001..sandwiches are always Top Tier.. The Best in the District or even The City.   I hope they stay there in that location for years to come.
author: Josh B.

description: This place has gone down hill since the last time I was here.  My sandwich had no meat in it, and for 11.95 I expect more than bread and condiments!!  I received the worst service ever!!  The man making my sandwich was extremely rude didn't listen to what I ordered and got it wrong, the worst was the guy at the register.  Totally ignored me as he's having  conversation with someone else, pulls the money out of my hand doesn't look at me or say thank you!!  The worst customer service ever and the sandwiches suck now.  Save your money and go elsewhere!!  Calabria bros maybe.
author: Angelina C.

description:
Shared the biggest size pastrami on Dutch Crunch. Yum, it was good, not too saucy. It's the bread that makes everything work so well. I would probably opt the jalapenos, not because it's spicy, but it's a bit salty for my taste buds. 

The people are friendly and very upbeat. Very cool corner store.
author: Mandy D.

description: Been coming here my whole life. Since I was a young kid, and the taste of the sandwiches never changed! Word of advice, when there's a long line (which happens often) just step outside and give them a call and order your food over the phone. You basically just cut the whole line.
author: Jason J.

description: One of the best in San Francisco! You would never guess walking past it, it's pretty unassuming, but it's a local legend in the neighborhood. My favorite is the polish sandwich, it's very tasty, but the meatballs are pretty awesome too. It gets really busy on the week-end, but it's well worth the wait.
author: Jean-Max V.

description: The best sandwiches! I've been coming here since I was 14!  The turkey in Dutch crunch is my favorite!
author: Shaunte B.

description: I ordered a jr chicken & avocado on Dutch crunch for my daughter before her evening class at CCSF..it was 5:15pm and the place was packed with customer ordering sandwiches..all the employees were friendly and plenty of street parking..My daughter was able to finish half her sandwich before I dropped her off for night class..
author: Art D.

description: Decided to stop by here to get a sandwich on our way out of the city. Got turkey & cheddar on Dutch crunch. The bread was awesome! It was toasty and warm with just the right amount of crunchiness! It was a very delicious sandwich indeed! This place is just a tiny hole in the wall. The staff was very friendly. I will definitely be coming back here!
author: Geannie M.

description:
Great place for a big sammy after a 60mi bike ride!  I'm not sure if it was my depleted state but the meat combo they use is incredibly good.  The place is all business, it's nearly claustrophobic inside as you weave around to place your orders but they are fast and even the "standard" size sandwich is daunting.

I believe it's the owner working the register and it always friendly.
author: Doug M.

description:
Quick Tip - Oder over the phone and pick up the "Roxie's Special"

Pros: Amazing tasting sandwiches. The way they make their sandwiches is done with such art and papering! Roxie Special is my favorite. It is basically all the different deli meats put into one sandwich. Their DUTCH CRUNCH BREAD is the THE BEST!. Crunchy outside and soft on the inside. 

Cons: They take about 7-8 mins per sandwich. I recommend ordering over the phone and its about 15 mins till its ready for pick up. The prices have gone up in the past 10 years. Regular order will run about $8. At this quality it is still well worth it. 

Roxie's and Little Lucca's are my favorites sandwich spots. I like they for two separate reason. Lucca's is a sandwich you want to get your nasty on! Roxie's is a sandwich you take home to your mother! LOL if that makes any sense.
author: Ryan R.

description: Great quality food and service! We get the Roxie Sandwich on Dutch Crunch Bread, toasted. So bomb!!
author: Justin B.

description:
Wow Roxies really does sell the freshest, yummiest sandwiches everrrr. 

The place is SUPER tiny, its feels crowded when theres more than 4-5 people. When I go swim at Balboa Pool, I always have to come and grab a sandwhich, chips, candy, or a drink. 

Dutch crunch + Avocado + Turkey Breast = Heaven

I feel so fortunate that I live about 2 minutes away. This is the place I go to for a sandwich crave.
author: Sophia G.

description:
I am a huge huge hugeeeee fan of deli sandwiches and I gotta give it up to Roxies for being up there on my list of go to places to satisfy my cravings.

It was my first time, so I wanted to try everything. I ended up getting a salami sandwich and they threw in pastrami for free! As for bread, their dutch crunch is a must. I you Roxie!
author: Charisa N.

description: Turkey with swiss on Dutch crunch with everything and pepper= life If you're looking for a good sandwich this is definitely the place.
author: Nael M.

description:
Pastrami on Sweet w/o mayo... 

yumm.. location is sketchy but simply adds to the ambience... or lack thereof....
author: sandrita j.

description:
BEST SANDWICHES IN SF PERIOD!!!!

plus they have a 100 out of 100 health score! cant beat that.
author: Lizzie D.

description: I've been eating roxies sandwiches since I was 5.. my favorite sandwich in SF! I would advise to call in your order ahead of time because the deli is always packed.
author: Terese V.

description: Just finished eating here. Had a great roast beef sandwich on soft roll. So tasty. And they are super nice.
author: Bowen P.

description:
The place is small, cramped, and really messy. There are random singled-out chewing gums, Poor gum! There are a lot of alcohol and chewing tobacco if you are into that.

Came here just for the sandwiches. My second time here. The sandwiches are big and tasty! Scrumptious but not extraordinary. Their system is extremely unorganized. My friend and I waited 15-20 minutes before receiving our sandwiches while all these people just came in and got their sandwiches. Maybe they ordered and left and came back. Who knows! 

It is worth the try if you are in the area but I wouldn't go out of my way.
author: Sarah C.

description: This place is located on a corner in a market front store.I ordered the turkey pastrami on Dutch crunch. Over all the sandwich  was delicious but I wish it wasn't overly stuffed.
author: Sonia D.

description: Great, HUGE sandwiches. Nice people working. The turkey BLT was delicious. Close to CCSF campus for an after school sando.
author: Summer M.

description: I take my visiting friends here when I want to show them how cool I am for knowing joints like this. Sandwiches are always great and parking isn't extremely limited for street parking. People are in! People are out!
author: Sweets N.

description: My family has been going here since they were first opened my dad grew up with Peter  Simon tony costa Abraham and I still go there even though I live far away I still crave it
author: Teddy S.

description: It's only the best place to get a sandwich! Call in your order if you plan to go here during lunch hours because the line gets long and they get a lot of phone orders! Parking is also a issue so bring a buddy to hop off and hop on with your delicious subs! Regular size can feed two people, just an fyi! Enjoy!
author: Raul G.

description:
I like how their sanwiches aren't 70% and 30% meats. Good combos and fresh flavors. They do get a lil busy in the afternoon so you might want to order over the phone if you dont have time to wait that long.

The guy that rings you up is also very friendly, sometimes a little flirty so watch out! Haha
author: Jean T.

description:
i just signed onto Yelp to give my review, and i'm as lazy as they get, so you Yelpers need to listen up

Roxie's is now my religion. the Roxie Special on Dutch Crunch has led me to want to change the name of the store to Sandwhich Orgasmica. 'cause thats what it gives you ;]

such a complexity of so many different flavors: the saltiness of the pepperoni, the creaminess of the mayo and their special cheese, the heat of the jalepenos, the tanginess of the mustard and what appears to be white artichokes?, the butter-iness and crunch of the Dutch crunch bread...

i thought to myself that I'll need to be carried out on a stretcher before i finish this sandwhich, b/c your body almost cannot handle so much taste buds pleasure loaded into one sandwhich ;] ROXIE YOU ARE MY RELIGION!!!

ok now onto my experience: near a kid's park  - when i walked in the environment was very happy and freindly - all the customers were happy b/c they knew they would be chowing down on a Roxy's sandwhich soon and the cashier and his family? working behind the counter were all so corteous and humble, like they didnt kno they were responsible for the creation of the best sandwhich plce in san francisco - yea i said it - sorry ike's. the store is very small - its a corner liquoer store with the standard chips and sodas and candy bars and they run the sandwhich section to the side of the store. very no nonsense menu - there are so many choices you mite get overwhlemed, but like i said - ROXIES SPEICAL on DUTCH CRUNCH bread! ;] took about 5 minutes and i was patiently waiting the entire time - i value quality of sandwhich over convinience.

 once i got my sandwhich in its brown paper bag, with a small wad of napkins inside (once again generous of the store) i exited and immediatly unwrapped my sandwhich to eat on the way back to my school. sadly to say, in my excitement i dropped half on the concrete sidewalk! i watched it sail to the floor in slow motion while a horrified oh shit escaped from my lips. i didn't even conisder leaving it there or throwing it away (for more than half a second) - i picked it right back up and happily dug into that sandwhich. i tell you, the first bit had me literally rolling my eyes back into my head with ectasy. 

ya'll need to go try this place.
author: Vicky T.

description:
Roxies tho. My friend first introduced me to this place when I was younger, and not a lot as changed over the years. Thank goodness! 
Their sandwiches are excellent and filling. I always get a regular Roxie Special on Dutch Crunch, which is an Italian Combo with artichokes, and it's delicious. Their Dutch Crunch is what dreams are made of.
The people working here are kind and hardworking individuals. I am glad places like this are still around
author: Dale S.

description: Definitely the best traditional delicatessen in San Francisco. Quality is always at the highest caliber. The consistency in correct orders made to perfection is unparalleled. Roxies food center is the quintessential place for the critically acclaimed "Mafia Meatball" , "Simon special" and the coup de gras "Roxies Special". If you are in the mood for a phenomenal sandwich that will bring you to ecstasy, this bodega is the place to go.
author: Julie M.

description:
This may be it.

My most visited lunch-time spot in the city.  As far as numbers are concerned, that is.

It's a difficult thing to do, satisfy your customers so consistently with the most decadent and mouth-watering products available!  Roxie does it though.

It's crammed and unorganized, which only makes the whole experience more enjoyable.

Get the Roxie Special, thank me later.
author: Tim P.

description:
One of my favorite sandwich places, my favorite is the roast beef with dutch crunch and you need to have it in DUTCH CRUNCH cause it's the bomb diggity! Going there for more than 4 yrs, the prices had increased and the portions did get a little bit smaller but like I said it is bomb diggity! It's convenient and there's usually parking outside or around the block. People there are always nice :)

One experience I had was through the phone. My bf called 10mins prior and when we got there we guess they forgot our order but no biggie. My bf was tall enough to see over the counter and saw a Mexican lady mid 30's -40's put on lotion before making the sandwich. After my bf ate a couple of bites he said "OH HELL NAHZZZZ...... I F*cking smell and taste the lotion, FML shouldn't have made the order through the phone." Lesson learned, make sure a young gentlemen pick up the phone prior ordering the sandwiches or order in person. 

Bomb Diggity.
author: Diana H.

description:
WOW. Roxie's is delicious. The dutch crunch was so warm but crispy. It literally melted in my mouth. I got the pastrami. I was trying to reverse engineer the sandwich, but the odd thing was, there was no special sauce or anything, it was straight up melted cheese, lettuce, mayo, the norm. But it was O so good. Oh Miss Roxie, I will be visiting you more frequently. 

And the guys there are real cool.
author: Tam T.

description: Ok I feel bad doing this but I'm hoping that maybe the owners might possibly see this and take note. I've been getting the same sandwich from here for 8 yrs. The last 2 times I went to Roxie's it wasn't good. The sandwiches just aren't the same. The avo is never perfectly ripe the way it always used to be, the bread breaks apart and there is significantly less turkey in the turkey avo. My friend and I both noticed that they just weren't as yummy last time. Today I went in and they had this guy on the register who I'd never seen before and he didn't know the price of ANYTHING, working at a snail's pace he would quietly ask other ppl prices and if they didn't respond he would wait for agonizingly long and then ask quietly again. I waited for 20 mins, my sandwich was just sitting there getting soggy and cold while this guy helped ONE GROUP of (stupid lameass) girls. Once I get home and FINALLY get to eat my cold mushy sandwich THERE'S MUSTARD ON IT. That was literally the ONLY specification I made. My order was suuper easy! Turkey avocado on Dutch crunch, Swiss, no mustard. The guy even said "u want everything?" And I said "I do not want mustard so everything except for no mustard". Ew. Mustard and avocado do not belong together. Mustard just dominates the whole sandwich and ruins the buttery smoothness of the avocado. On top of all that, I'm practically positive they are using a different kind of Swiss cheese. It's got a more pungent and sweet and aggressive flavor and weird texture.
author: Emma H.

description:
My coworker would seldom stop by this place to buy one of their sandwiches for breakfast and would offer to get me one as well. Sure why not, skipping breakfast is a big nono.

So I've been trying their turkey sub with the dutch crunch bread, pesto, pepper jack cheese, and everything else. It's bigger than a Subways 1 footer, and heavier too. This thing definitely packs a punch, and while I'm rarely able to finish it all for breakfast, I was not "satisfyingly" filled up. It lacks something, and has too much of something else.

First of all, I think the downfall of this sub is the bread. The dutch crunch packs too much flavor that it overwhelms the lettuce and tomato. It goes well with the pesto and cheese, but that also caused it to almost completely wipe out the turkey meat's flavor. When I eat a sandwich, I rely on the flavor that comes with the veggies and meat mostly, so it's a bit strange for me to have the condiments and bread be the dominant one. 

Second, again with the bread, it's either too hard or crunchy. Sticking this shit in my mouth pretty much engulfs all the other ingredients. Everytime I chew, I chew mostly the bread first, and the rest of the insides get "mixed" with the bread; you don't get to chew those individually. Don't get me wrong - their bread isn't bad, but a sandwich shouldn't be focused so much on the bread. What do you think of when you eat a Big Mac, a Whooper, or Big Jack or whatever the hell you call those? Exactly! The meat and the veggies! You don't eat those then think "oh wow, the buns sure were good!" 

Lastly, again with the sauce, it's a bit overwhelming. I just opened up the remaining of the sub to confirm this - EVERYTHING is drenched with the sauce. My turkey is white-green from it, my lettuce is white-green from it, the tomato / onion is white-green from it, the inside of the bread is white-green from it... you think you get the picture? Well picture THIS - it's like someone did a skeet skeet into my damn sandwich yesterday and now it's starting to mold. That's fucking nasty man! What sick fuck would even have the appetite to eat this now? In my opinion, sauce shouldn't be this heavy where it covers the flavor of all the other ingredients. So when I bite down on the bread, all the other ingredient squishes out... and they're ALL drenched with the sauce. If I'm not tasting the exterior of the bread, I'm tasting the interior which consists of nothing but sauce.

So in conclusion, I do think this is a filling sandwich, but as a breakfast sandwich, it felt "unsatisfying" because I usually expect something more "fresh," like fruits, veggies, something mellow and soft, unlike the heavy bread / pesto flavor. There's too much heavy flavor in this sub, and I conclude that this would be better off as a late lunch - dinner type of meal.
author: Calvin D.

description:
BEST DELI SANDWICHES EVER!

i usually order toasted/hot roast beef on Dutch Crunch bread w/ everything plus AVOCADO!

when you order it with everything...it include jalapenos =)

Love their Dutch Crunch bread!
author: Sarah F.

description:
Ordered: Smoked Ham on Soft Spanish Roll

Wait Time: 15 Minutes After the order was taken. 15 minute wait line, so 30 mins all together.

Price: $8.00

Service: They don't seem to smile or speak much.

Food: It wasn't bad, but it wasn't all that great. It was just a sandwich. Nothing too special, tastes like something we could all put together at home.



I don't know if its what i ordered, but i don't think this place is as great as everyone else says.

I've had better sandwiches, maybe because i'm from Los Angeles, and there's more competition down here.
author: Tommy H.

description: Really good sandwiches from really nice people, I recommend The Sams Special!!! Delicious
author: Sydnie S.

description:
3.5 stars 

Roxie Food Center is located in my old hood, near my old school. I'm surprised at how much Yelp attention this corner store has gotten. I love that a local haunt, with a mostly blue collar clientele, has gained some notoriety in our online world. 

Unless you haven't eaten in a week, the junior size will do ya just fine. I ordered a junior turkey avocado on dutch crunch w/ the works (~$6.50, lettuce, tomato, pickles, onions, mayo & mustard.) Pretty delicious & tasted the way I remember from back in the day (please excuse over-usage of that term; when you get to be my age, everything reminds you of back in the day, you young 20-somethings!) 

My bf has tried the BBQ beef & the tri tip & said they weren't generous enough with the meat & that the sandwiches tasted too similar because of the mayo/mustard/bread. 

Unlike when I was in school, I don't eat sandwiches very often anymore. Reason for 3 stars instead of 4 is I really enjoy the garlic spread from Little Luccas in SSF, so I prefer their sammiches. Still, Roxie is a worthy of your lunch money so give it to them!
author: Fancypants X.

description: It was confusing to figure out how to order and all that, but the sandwich I got was solid. Nothing special, but good. I would definitely go back. Although, there is no seating, so eating was really awkward since I had no place to sit.
author: Benny L.

description: I had the smoked turkey on dutch crunch and it was f*cking amazing!  Nice staff, they have been there for years and good vibes.  I like the spray-painted exterior and the local vibe.  Great place for sandwiches.  I highly suggest.
author: Cynthia B.

description: I've been going here for years and I love their sandwiches. Everything from the meatball mafia, pastrami, and crab!
author: Lala D.

description:
Gawd...do you know how happy I am to know that I don't have to drive all the way to Ike's at Castro for a sandwich that sets your taste buds in crank mode?

Roxie Food Center has a deli located in the Mission Terrace area (about less than a 10 mins. drive from my place...and near Balboa Park Bart station...convenient!)

I ordered a gargantuan ham sandwich on toasted dutch crunch with lettuce, pickle, tomato, mayo, ham, avocado, salt, pepper, etc

Yum! The toast...was NOT burnt, the tomato & other condiments didn't sog up the sandwich, there was just enough amount of mayo, American cheese, pickle, avocado for the whole sandwich 

Great customer service too....I had forgotten to tell them no mustard on my sandwich & notified them as they had spread mustard already. I felt bad that they started over but they were pretty cool about it & gladly started over with a smile

Plus extra points that it's hidden in a residential area & so no one can spot this fitness freak about to pig out
author: Charmian D.

description: I love the portion of the sandwitch. I usually eat half and save half for later, the sandwitch tastes really good heated up in the oven.
author: Javier R.

description: Oh it shouldn't be this good but it really is! Believe all the reviews the sandwiches at this place are the BEST I've ever tasted. Had the Tri-tip special twice now and it's hands down the tastiest creation ever to have been put between 2 pieces of bread. Great staff too, super friendly and hilarious. Worth the detour and justifies many return visits!
author: Edward B.

description: The best sandwich in San Francisco! It may take a little while for them to make it, but it is worth the wait. They're busiest around 12-1 and 5-6, and at that time I'd recommend coming into the shop to order rather than trying to get someone on the phone. The staff is friendly and will always put a smile on your face. The only thing that could put them over the top would be a delivery service :)
author: Emma M.

description: Extremly good food. Dutch Crunch with a Raspberry Ice Tea Arizona hits the spot everytime. Definitely try the Simon special!
author: Ryan M.

description:
Every neighborhood has its favorite old school corner signature sandwich and grocery store and this is the ONE in  this part of the city. After hearing about this shop for a long time, I was in the area and my yelp extinct kick in and here I am. Lines are not to bad even at 11:30 am and it move quickly as they had 4 people behind the counter working, unbelievable for a very small corner store.

A regular avocado turkey club was all I needed to break me in as a rookie patron. Ultra nice & friendly sandwich makers are fast with the orders. The owner likes  to joke around with you and makes the waiting time a breeze.  The owner hands you the custom sandwich which I swear weights a pound. Fantastic fresh rolls and thick sliced avocado and thinly sliced turkey, I must say a perfect sandwich to satisfy your lunch hunger.
author: Wolfy W.

description:
Grew up in this area, used to buy Trolli gummy candies here, never did I imagine it was a sandwich place!  So after years of passing by, I decide to give this place a try!

I love their Dutch Crunch - its fresh, but not toasted.  It's different from Ike's DC, really depends on how you like your DC!

I got a meatball sandwich from Roxie's and they sure do flavor their meatballs + marinara sauce, it's somewhat spicy but not extreme MELTED with cheese. mmMmm

I want to try their other sandwiches!
author: Steph L.

description:
The sandwiches at this cutty location are an obvious 5 stars (GOTTA get 'em hot) and for some indefinable reason just a little better than the ones from the Kirkham St. store. Real city shit.

I give it extra love because it carries 2 of my favorite terrible junk snacks, Cactus Cooler and Takis, the latter being a chip-like Mexican tortilla snack that I imagine tastes like "Sabor de Soledad" (for all you 30 Rock nerds).
author: Trav W.

description: One of the best sandwich spots in SF! Sandwiches are huge. Toasted Dutch crunch  is soooo good! A little expensive but worth it.
author: Rebecca M.

description:
A few months ago, I picked up a Turkey on Dutch Crunch before my long lonely drive home to L.A. I swear this sandwich MADE my drive bearable. 

I didn't care that crumbs were all over me and my car. I could not stop eating. I got the largest sandwich they offered and ate the entire thing. Savored it as long as I could within the 6-7 hours down. Then wished I ordered another one to save for the next day. 

Buttery turkey... Crunchy bread... MMM I AM DEFINITELY GETTING THIS this weekend when I visit. It's the bread.. seriously. so freakin' addicting. 

I gotta say though... the first time I had it, I wasn't too impressed. The second time.. I fell in love. So.... Remember guys... give everyone and everything a second chance! You never know....
author: Christine L.

description:
I've had both Ike's and Yellow Submarine.  Both are great places, but where Roxie's has them beat is SIZE.  Even though you might be throwing down $13-$15 for a Supreme, it's WORTH IT.  Same quality as Ike's, but BIGGER.  The Dutch Crunch has been hyped up in San Francisco 7x7 and it does live up to the hype.

My faves are the Tri Tip and the Chicken.  Sanwiches are also heated up in an oven. Debit friendly .  Don't let the small size of the place or the long lines intimate you.  It's totally WORTH IT.
author: Richie W.

description:
Another solid sandwich spot, close to where I grew up. I used to come here back in the day, but had to refresh my memory.

I got the turkey club on dutch, toasted. Good bread, and nice ratio of ingredients. Generous on the avocado, and didn't feel too stuffed from the Junior size $7.99.

Old school spot, they've been doing it for years and still do it well.
author: Derrick V.

description:
A hidden gem in a city of a thousand sub sandwiches. 

It's a corner market... with super friendly customer service and amazing sandwiches. As first timers, we asked a few questions and were met with smiles, laughter and complete answers. My friend and I both went for the Simon's Special (hold the mustard on mine) on a sourdough roll. Nice crunch to the roll but nothing so crazy you worry about chipping a tooth. Good seasoning on the pastrami. Fresh veggies and just the right amount of warmth from the oven to make it melt in your mouth.

It's a corner market, so no seating and a bit claustrophobic while you wait for your food but Balboa Park is right across the street. It was a nice day so lunch in the park was perfect. I'd suggest taking it elsewhere on a drizzly day.

I'll def. be back soon Roxie's... you make me drool thinking of you right now.
author: Sabrina B.

description:
My favorite sandwich in San Francisco. Anything is good as long as you get it on Dutch Crunch bread. For some reason we can't get good Dutch Crunch in LA. Must be a regional thing.

The place is pretty divey - it's basically a liquor store with a sandwich counter. Calling in your order will save you some time. Also, there is no place to sit and eat so be prepared to take it to go or eat it in your car.
author: Matthew D.

description:
Before a trip to the SF Zoo, we seriously pulled over to YELP up a nice Sandwich place. For we didn't want to pull a wild-card and settling for nasty zoo over-priced food.

I'm sooooooooooooo glad we YELPed and found Roxie Food Center!!!!!!

Pastrami on Dutch Crunch is my new love. And the best part we just ate our food at Balboa Park right across the street.

Roxie Food Center I'll be back again!!!
author: Tiffany M.

description: My mouth waters thinking about this place!! When I moved away no place compared to this place in the East Bay! Make sure you beat the lunch rush as it gets packed. On game days this place is also packed. No matter what you get its guaranteed to be mouth watering good. I was so convincing that I have my friends from out of town making stops here now.
author: Patricia G.

description:
How do they project that delicious smell of sandwiches outside of the market?  My nose drew me in on a Sunday afternoon, an odd hour (between lunch and dinner) and yet, there was a small crowd waiting for sandwiches.  Most of them ordered the meatball sandwich, so I decided to try it as well.  I learned a little more about the rolls there.  Spanish is their softest roll and it's sour.  I went with the Italian roll which is soft and toasts up very nicely.

Mmm, what a meatball sandwich (Jr: $5.99, Regular: $7.99).  They are so good at toasting their sandwiches.  The outside was very hot and toasty.  The bread was lovely and crispy on the outside while still soft inside.  The bread to fillings ratio was spot on.  The delicious meatballs flecked with generous amounts of parsley weren't too firm or too soft.  They came doused in a lovely zesty tomato sauce.  The sandwich came with mayo, mustard, lettuce, tomatoes, onion, pickles, cheese (your choice, I chose mozzarella) and jalapenos.  The veggies were fresh and unlike many places, they didn't go crazy with condiments.  While the sandwich was messy, the bread didn't get soggy.  They know how to construct a flavorful, balanced sandwich.  Everything melds together into a gooey (but not soggy), scrumptious mess.

This is one fine sandwich, one of the very best in SF.  Get one in honor of National Sandwich Month (August).
author: Lolia S.

description: Pastrami sandwich Very good , nice Dutch crunch bread, clean, a little location in a liquor store or deli market,  one concern is do they leave the bread out overnight open  on the counter? Also you can't see the meat products & fixings because they are hidden from view behind a long rack of potato chips, cookies, etc. unlike other deli's.
author: Ron P.

description:
My weekly go to place with the bf for lunch every weekend and occasionally on weekdays!

Great corner liquor store/deli with very nice people who own the place and make your sandwiches.
I love how you grab your chips and drinks on one side then walk around to order your sandwich, everything is very organized.

Sometimes it gets very busy so people call in to order and just pick up their sandwiches unless you have patience and don't mind waiting awhile.

Their pastrami on dutch crunch is to die for! Add avocado, pick your cheese (mm.. provolone), the works and you're all set.
Their crab sandwich is good as well, many different choices on the menu to customize your sandwich to how you want it.
They also have potato salad and a bunch of other stuff you can order.
