The only downside is that sometimes they skimp out on your meat, I like my sandwiches fat, but all the other stuff make up for it. It's really a hit or miss. Sometimes they give you a decent amount, sometimes it's not as much, but all good.

You also have the option to get your sandwich HEATED! Who doesn't love a hot sandwich with melted cheese?

I love how they're also close-by, Keep doing your thing Roxies and don't change cause your sandwiches are freaking great!
author: Jenny Y.

description:
I first heard about this place through a old coworker of mines when I use to work at the bank. I finally gave it a shot because I was craving a sandwich and it was pretty late and the sandwich shops I wanted to go to was closed. So my boyfriend and I gave Roxie a try. I ordered the tony's tri tip special and my boyfriend ordered the turkey sandwich. 

So I'm giving this place a one star because, the tri tip special was not good, the barbecue sauce was over whelming and drenched. I took a few bites and had to trade with my boy friend for the turkey sandwich that didn't taste all that awesome for a sandwich that cost almost $10. Seriously it's overpriced and not delicious at all. I can get a better and delicious sandwich at a lower price. On top of that, after I ate the sandwich, I had a really bad stomach ache. Seriously, what is all the hype about, this isn't the place for me.
author: Susan K.

description:
Love them! Their sandwiches are the best. I usually order a pastrami with provologne and on dutch crunch bread with everything but pickles! Toasted of course! So yummy! 

They always got my order correct until they hired this Asian chick who always messed up my order. I ordered 3 sandwiches for my family on the phone and when I came to pick it up, she only made one and it was the wrong size. I ordered again a different time, she messed up my cheese and it tasted different. If it weren't for he messing up my orders and flirting and chasing her co workers, they would have gotten 5 stars!

Doesn't stop me from ordering... I just make sure everything is right before I leave, esp if she is there.
author: Reese E.

description: HUGE sandwiches... and delicious.  Definitely a new place to head to on a sunny day if you want to enjoy the sunshine at Balboa Park.
author: Julie B.

description:
I have tried the other sandwich places all over the bay area and they don't even compare to Roxie.  The bread they use is top notch, they give you a ton of meat, and they toast it to perfection!  The store has a great neighborhood feel to it and the staff is friendly!

I recommend getting a pastrami sandwich on dutch crunch with pepper-jack cheese.  The Simon Special, Roxie Special, and Meatball are also great!  To be honest, I haven't tried a sandwich there that I didn't like.

I think what makes Roxie irreplaceable is that it has been making sandwiches for over 30 years (probably a lot longer than that).  Over that time, their ovens have accumulated  decades of flavor in them which get added on to the sandwiches that get toasted.

This place is hands down the best place to get a sandwich!
author: Ryan N.

description:
Pastrami...Provolone...Dutch Crunch. Pretty darn good! I got it with everything, and it was YUM. They even toast it free of charge (or, if they charged, I didn't notice cause it was SO CHEAP!). My food was good, but awkwardly places. I started on the low-meat end and was thinking "that's sure a lot of extras" until I got past the 1/2 way point and realized...OH. Here's my MEAT!  Not sure how I liked that surprise. If I started on the other side, I'd be going "Hey, where'd my meat go?!"

So I've heard of Roxie's, and came in one day to try it.  Stupid me...stood at the front of the line for a minute. OHH...so I go AROUND the two aisle corner store to the frozen area as the "start" of the line. Really wish I skimmed through other reviews so I didn't look like a doof.  Meh.

I go up...and had my order pre-planned. They were super nice and got my order out pretty quickly. Good thing about them - they actually go in order. Like, the guys behind the counter are synced so that if you ordered first, you get your order first (weirdly, not like this everywhere!).  The regular is HUGE. Order it if you're hungry. If you're at an average sized eater, go for the small. If you're Texas sized...go for the big one. It looked HUGE (as viewed by me looking at what I assume to be the entire CCSF basketball teams order. Dayam).

Line wasn't too bad, about a 10 minute wait. Parking is available outside, which is a plus.  No need to circle the block, cause a lot of people actually drive here to get food!  There's no place to sit and eat here, so come on a sunny day and walk to Balboa Park (or...that park by the Balboa Swimming pool). 

They do pre-orders over the phone, so if you're REALLY anxious to get it and go, then order in advance. Its not a bad wait though...at least not for me.  Roxie's, I would normally give you a 3.5, but for the good service and decent food (and the fact my sandwich stayed between the bread), I'll give you a 4 on yelp.  3.5 in my mind though.
author: Lily W.

description: Best sandwish shot in the city forsure, i love to come here when im in the mood for a sandwish. The simon special is my favorite is a must have if u around the area.
author: Armando G.

description:
Decent/Good sandwiches, but I feel like it was a bit overpriced for what you get. We paid $23 for two regular sandwiches and a bag of chips. Personally, I would probably stick with Monterey Deli on Monterey where I feel like overall it's a better value, but i'm willing to try Roxie's once more for good measure (see below).

I was debating between 3 and 4 stars but 3 stars just seems too low!

Anyway, we got a turkey on dutch crunch, and also a hot roast beef on dutch.

The turkey on dutch was good but I felt like there weren't enough fixins. The dutch crunch bread was fresh. I ordered it with 'everything' (except for jalapeños). As I started eating it, I decided I didn't want the tomatoes after (nothing wrong with them but I just wasn't in the mood). So I removed them and immediately realized that the sandwich had a lot of turkey, and a lot of mayo which drowned out everything else -- which there wasn't a lot of. I couldn't help but feel like it was missing something. And mind you, I opted for salt, pepper, oil and vinegar. That said, I would be willing to try Roxie's again but would probably order something else -- OR, add avocado to my turkey sandwich ask that they go light on the mayo.

The hot roast beef sandwich was very good. No complaints there. 

The workers were very, very friendly -- cracking jokes, being pleasant and thanking people for their business.

Downsides: parking can be a bit challenging. Had to park 1.5 blocks away and it's a very, VERY tiny market deli. When you wait for your sandwich to me made you're basically blocking the aisle. When other deli customers, or market patrons try to navigate it is a very tight squeeze!
author: M. A.

description: Great tasting sandwiches.  A little pricy unless you get the larger sizes though.
author: Javier G.

description: YYYEeeeeaaaahhhhh!!!!!!!!     Love this place.   Never had a bad sandwich.  I like the way Ray makes my sandwich with care and lots of love.  U guys are the best .  Keep up the good work.  Subway hahaha,  yeah right.
author: Joe B.

description:
Holy Sandwich Goodness!
This is what sandwich love is all about.
Thanks to yelp, my husband and I went to check this out for a Sunday afternoon lunch to go.  I'm so glad we found Roxie!!
We both ordered the Simon Special on their AMAZING dutch crunch roll.
This is a HUGE sandwich.  You could really share with someone else, only if you can bring yourself to do so.  
We happened to be lucky enough to chat it up with who seemed to be the owner a lady with dark hair behind the counter who gave a taste of their pastrami.
Man this place is a find.
I can't wait to go back and try their other sandwiches.
author: Bethany D.

description: Tried their crab meat sandwich and let me tell you it was the best sandwich I have ever had it was BOMB.COM. I live out in San Jose and I come down just for their sandwich wish they had a location closer to me  I have been craving so bad... Try without the mustard. I will be coming back soon
author: Mariam G.

description: This is one of my fav places in the city. No pretense, just good sandwiches. Definitely get it on Dutch crunch. Nothing like a big sandwich, a cold drink, and relaxing in balboa park nearby. Good way to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city.
author: Charles L.

description: This is the best deli in the city. The food is fantastic, I am having the pepper turkey today decided to change it up from the pastrami today, you can have it hot or cold. The service is awesome, it was fun watching them work today, it's real fluent motion and everyone is super nice. Just know what you want before they ask. Oh and they have Zaps chips!
author: Travis B.

description:
I have tried every sandwich place imaginable: sub sandwiches, little luccas, Ikes, etc. This place bests them all. Nothing describes the crunch and flavor of a warm Roxies' sandwich. Pure heaven. 

Just mentioning Roxies to any Roxies' fan elicits an "Ohmahhgahhh....Roxies..."
author: Alyssa P.

description:
So my first review for Roxie's was before I even knew what I was doing on Yelp. I thought it was time for an update.

Roxie's is STILL the ish. Roast beef on dutch crunch, warmed. Thats my usual and it NEVER gets old. Look out for the specials they come out with cause they DO.NOT.PLAY. They know what's good and will tell you which sandwiches are bomb. 

I have to admit. I been checking out other sandwich spots to see what they have to offer. Some are good, some are ok...but Roxie's is a sort of comfort zone. Though its nice to check out the other places I always end up back here.
author: Heather P.

description:
1st experience with a Roxie sandwich..Grabbed some sanwiches before heading to Dolores park.
Hubby got the tri-tip and I got the Turkey special..both sanwiches were very delish...Store owner & workers very personable upbeat friendly..There was a line but not too long..TOTALLY WORTH IT..next time I will try it on dutch crutch...
author: Dana V.

description: Anything on their dutch crunch is great, but I pretty much love their bread. It's ridiculously soft on the inside and crunchy on the exterior. It really makes for the perfect sandwich bread when toasted. Dutch crunch or weath, do it. The meatball is freaking delicious, and is the bbq beef. Service is decently paced, and a junior sandwich at $5.99 (or $6.99 for a special) makes for a meal in and of itself. Get here after the rush around 12-1, and you'll get a quick sandwich. Service is really friendly, but the clientele is kind of funky sometimes. You get all sorts here. Good sandwich for the area, but the cheese isn't really melted well.
author: Danny C.

description: I've been getting their sandwiches for years. The Dutch crunch rolls are so good. Each sandwich is very satisfying. I tend to get two sandwiches, one for right now and one for later. Definitely try and share a sandwich or keep it to yourself.
author: Rigel A.

description: Great sandwich place. Turkey club is a solid option. Pretty big portions as well
author: Kenneth Y.

description:
A great sandwich from a corner store?!?!  

Roxie Special on toasted dutch crunch = YUM ;P

A MUST TRY!!!!!
author: Lisa H.

description: Best sandwiches in the world, hands down! I didn't think they could beat Ike's, but they put it to shame. I had the roast beef with cheddar, jalapeños and the works. I highly recommend this shop if you want a delicious sandwich that's become a San Francisco tradition.
author: Ramz A.

description:
Recently visited the spot when I rolled thru the city the other day. Brings back memories growing up. I compare other dutch crunch made sandwiches to this eatery and this place is hard to beat

If your looking for a tasty toasted sandwich made on dutch crunch you gotta check em out. I usually order turkey, pastrami, or ham. Meats and veggies always served with quality. Yea the store is organized so that you can make a round and grab your sodas and chips while you order. What makes this place stand out is because they know how to marry the ingredients together....

$10 gets you 6" sub, soda, and bag of chips, parking is around residential homes
author: R O.

description: One of the top deli's in San Francisco. What makes a sandwich? not only the combination of ingredients but also the fresh Dutch bread toasted nice and warm. Also when you need a good deli sandwich fix, most delis close around 5pm. Roxies stays open till 9 which is cool. A little on the pricey side. A regular is 7.99. But i guess that's what a good sandwich cost these days.
author: Michael L.

description: This place rocks! Corner store vibe with lots of friendly locals. I came in today and had the Tony sandwich which included BBQ tri- trip, American cheese, hot peppers, onions, lettuce, and tomatoe on a crunch roll.  The place was packed so I bought a few scratchers while I waited for my food and won a few bucks!!  Give this place a try!!
author: Daniel G.

description:
If you just want a great sandwich stop on by. They are a bit overpriced in my opinion, but they are tasty. I'd say it's a toss up between these guys, The Sentinel and Ike's Place on the best sandwiches.

Get the Simon's Sandwich. Pastrami, turkey with melted cheese toasted with extra jalapenos.
author: Ryan E.

description:
Omg! I use to live just 3 blocks away from here! I saw the price raise from a little below 5dollars to now, being near 6 dollars for a junior sandwich. All I can say, THIS IS THE BEST SANDWICH...EVER.

The wait for a sandwich to be done, if heated is around... 10 mins. The shop however is VERY small, so sometimes it is best to wait outside while your sandwich is being made. I would always get Dutch Crunch OR Sourdough bread, along with ham (yes a little plain, but it's my favorite!) American cheese, and pretty much everything but peppers. Get it heated up too! The cheese will be a little melt..but oh is it worth it.... 

Can't wait till I can drive, cause I can finally come back here for my favorite sandwich! :]
author: Jenny N.

description:
Roxie's a little convenient corner store that sells awesome sandwiches. There's really no parking around this place. The place is tiny and gets crowded, which makes the wait around 20 to 30 minutes for the sandwich. They take phone orders so I would totally recommend calling in your order first. The wait just sucks so much since this place is tiny.

I had the Simon Special, which was turkey, pastrami, and cheddar cheese on dutch crunch. Like other reviewers have said, their dutch crunch bread is great! Turkey and pastrami were soft and tasty. The have the standard issue toppings you would find in any sandwich place (lettuce, tomato, onion, etc) and nothing more.

The sandwiches comes in junior, regular, and supreme. Junior is a 6 inch sandwich, regular is a 8 inch, and supreme is a foot long. Prices are pretty fair for the quality and size.

The only sad part is they don't have some kind of sauce that makes their sandwiches truly stand out. Bottom line is you'll get your plain standard issue type of sandwiches on great bread.
author: Steven B.

description: This place has served up great sandwiches since I can remember and my memory goes back to the 80s! If u live in the outer mission or excelsior it's the place by default. My personal favorite is the roast beef with cheddar cheese on Dutch Crunch with everything including salt&pepper and oil&vinegar and make sure u ask em to toast it! Sooo bomb, taste and see for yourself.
author: Robert Q.

description: This place is legit!! They have amazing sandwiches! The one warning I have is that you'll wanna go everyday!! Try it! It won't disappoint!!
author: Athena E.

description:
ROXIES!!!!!! You have my heart. One pastrami on dutch crunch please! 

I've had Ike's.
I've had Subcenter.
I've had Gene's.
I've had Little Lucca.
I've had Yellow Submarine. 

But, Roxie's - you are my #1. 

This place is a cutty little corner store that doesn't look like it would have THE CITY'S BEST SANDWICH (Yeahhhh, I said it). Roxies sandwiches are good eaten right away or 30 minutes later...it must be the bread, because they won't get soggy like Ike's sandwiches. Dutch crunch is a must!
author: Denise L.

description:
Oh god. My eyes always are bigger than my stomach, and my boyfriend doesn't help. I always end up getting the regular size, and it clearly is too much food for me.

I can't help it though! Look at all the other reviews! You can clearly see why I go against my better judgement at this place!

Their BBQ sandwich is no joke, and their tuna sandwich... oh my goodness, I was completely blown away. I always thought that tuna sandwiches were humble things, but these people made me think twice about tuna... and this is coming from a person who already likes tuna. Yea, I don't think I'll ever want to buy tuna sandwiches from other places again, not when this place has blown them out of the waters.

This is also one of those places where I just gotta have my own order. Like, seriously, I HAVE TO. I'm greedy with this place's sandwiches, especially when they taste so good the next day. No sharesies... ok I'll make exceptions. But seriously, this is a place where I'm glad my boyfriend doesn't like mustard and pickles.

I really wish they made wraps too, not because I actually like them, but because there is too much delicious bread, and that makes it even more fattening.
author: Hayne P.

description: Shocked to find such high quality sandwich in a liquor store. We tried the tri-tip special with jalapeno, bbq sauce, cheddar cheese, and most importantly, the dutch crunch bread. It was perfectly toasted, enough chilly kick to it. Great experience. Highly recommend it. Not a place to sit, though.
author: Sasan A.

description:
I got the regular Roxie special, the size is huge!  I would recommend eating half then saving the rest for another meal.  I got it on dutch crunch, it had the right amount of mayo, mustard.  Veggies tasted fresh.  Overall very good sandwich!  

I'll be trying the Simon Special next time, definitely won't eat the whole thing in one sitting.  Left me bloated.
author: Ben S.

description: Roxie's - still flawfree in every way. Also, I see a lot of complaints about long lines and waiting times. You know you can call ahead and order a sammich right? Ready in 5-10 minutes and you skip the line... no duh.
author: Xochitl C.

description: Turkey on dutch crunch bread, mayo, mustard, lettuce, tomatoes, and can't forget the jalapenos! Their sandwiches always taste good. The first time I have ever tried Roxie's was in 2007 when I started dating my boyfriend. I love spicy food but was always scared to eat jalapenos but since I've been dating my boyfriend, I love them in my Roxie's sandwich. Same goes with mustard, not in love with it but it completes it and gives it that extra oomph of taste. I always get the same sandwich and toppings. Lately, all I've been drinking is water but I used to always get my sandwich with a Mango Madness Snapple, lol. I've brought Roxie's sandwiches to Baker Beach and AT&T Park in the past. Great to bring anywhere or just to eat at home.
author: Jessica R.

description:
If you live in San Fran, you know what a Roxie's sandwich taste like, right?! If you haven't had Roxie's sandwich, then you must  be living under a rock like the guys in that Geico Insurance commercial!! Haha!! And if you are traveling to SF and feel like having a great sandwich, then do your taste buds a favor and go to Roxie's!!

They have all fresh ingredients and their bread is delivered fresh to them. With that said, I suggest you call and order over the phone from the times of 12pm til about 130pm as they will be VERY busy. I have waited almost 30 minutes one time for one of their sandwiches!!!  My favorite is the "Simon Special"!! I should've taken a picture but always end up forgetting until I am almost done with it!! Well, the Simon Special has both turkey & pastrami on dutch crunch bread, all the trimmings that you want, cheddar cheese AND I always add avocado to it because I am a slave to it!! Ha!   

The only reason why I didn't give Roxie's a 5 star rating is because at times, they will mess up on your order, due to the fact that they are so busy. For example, today, I went in and ordered a Simon Special with avocado, no onions, no pickles... To my disappointment, it had NO avocado and  they put onions and pickles!! THANKS!!!! Nevertheless, it was still a great sandwich and I ate it all! My tummy was happy and that's all that he wrote!
author: Cesar N.

description: go with the specials. changes all the time.  no seating.  it's a corner store with a deli inside.  just expect that.
author: PJ T.

description:
One of the reasons why i cant stay vegetarian...regular turkey club on dutch crunch. provolone. heated. everything on it no mustard extra mayo.

Its fuck'in fantastic everytime! EVERYTIME!!
author: Lazylibra A.

description: My 2nd visit to a Roxies. First time was at Tanforan Roxies 5 strars........This time 3 Stars or 2.5 Stars if i could.Roxies is my opinion is second in taste to Little Lucas.  Unfortunately we hard horrible service. My friend had to repeat himself saying no mayo 3 dman times & 30 mins later when we sat down to est thete was STILL MAYO on the sandwich.  I ordered my sandwich but wanted to csncel mine cause I was in a hurry. I knew this wasnt a big deal cause there was people on front of me that didnt have there's done yet. When my friend goes up to pay for his our sandwiche. Of coarae I am weak & still bought my sandwich best believe if my sandwich wasnt perfect we would have a problem. Also no where to sit inside at least put some chairs outside!
author: Danny F.

description: This place owns.  I had the Simon Special and boy did it live up to its name.  It was totally Simon I mean special.  I don't know this Simon but his dream of turkey and pastrami with fresh vegetables on Dutch crunch is a reality we can all enjoy.  I had a hole in my life and in my soul.  Simon filled that hole, with his special.  His very special sandwich.
author: Matthew M.

description:
Sandwiches are huge and tasty. 

They were toasting their sandwiches years ago when I was a kid! 
Recently tasted their prime rib sandwich and it was delicious. Their chicken club is also a good choice with chicken, cheese (of your choice), avocado and bacon. The dutch crunch bread is super crunchy and soft inside! A Junior is big enough to suffice most appetites, but they have like 3 other sizes! 

Oh and the owner is always friendly, funny and pleasant!
author: Yva D.

description:
I finally tried this place a few weeks ago. Can't believe I didn't know about it before. 

It's a pretty good sandwich. I ordered a turkey club and it definitely satisfied my hunger and tasted great in the process. 

The menu is all over the place with specials on different walls so it can be very confusing for first time customers, and the line moves like everyone there ordered before. It is a deli, so most people have a go to deli sandwich but it's nice to try to check out their specialty sandwiches. Overall this didn't bother me at all.

The counter is pretty high up so you can barely see them make the sandwich and it can be hard to communicate with the person making yours too. There was a line, but it moved pretty quickly. Anytime you're going somewhere for the first time a line is a good thing. shows you people actually go here and gives you time to check out the menu before you utter those infamous words, "So what would you suggest"

I find the price a bit much. I got a regular which was a good size.  I forget the exact amount but I paid around $12. I don't know their costs but I've had other deli sandwich shops of equal quality for a few dollars less. I'd give them a 4, but for this reason I'm giving them a 3.

Tough to become a regular with the price, but I'd make trips to go there, and eat there if I was already in the area.
author: Glenn M.

description:
This is my absolute favorite place to get a sandwich. On the outside, Roxie's looks like a small corner store, but it's much more than that. The sandwiches are amazing. There's a huge variety of sandwiches you can order, and they all taste great. My favorite is the BLT avocado on dutch crunch with pepper jack cheese.

The actual place itself is small, but there's a lot of items and snacks and treats to buy like any other corner store.

What I love the most about this place are the people here. They are some of the friendliest people I have ever met. The wait time is long sometimes, so the owner frequently converses with customers. Roxie's is just a really nice place to be to get some great sandwiches and talk with some really awesome people.
author: Marjorie M.

description:
Can you believe I've lived nearby in Daly City, and this was my first time ever having a Roxie sandwich?! 

Roast beef on toasted sourdough - done deal. Sooo freakin' good with the perfect veggie-to-meat ratio. I typically can't finish a sandwich on my own, but I had no problem devouring this junior size sandwich!

IMO, you MUST get your bread toasted! The bf got turkey on sourdough, not toasted, and mine was better =) And I love how they don't need a "special sauce" to make their sandwiches so delicious.

Lucky for me, I came here at 1:30 on a sunny Saturday afternoon and there was no line. But I can see why calling in your order would be better - this place is way tiny, with barely enough room in between the aisles for just two people to slide by.
author: Kimberly S.

description:
A gem near the Sunnyside neighborhood.  From the outside, you'd have no idea that this convenience store housed a great sandwich operation!  We ordered:
   
-Pastrami with provolone on dutch crunch
-Tri-tip with everything on a sweet roll.

The Pastrami option was good.  And dutch crunch is my favorite roll for sandwiches like this.  It would be nice to pick-up some sandwiches for a summer picnic or a quick meal before going out.

TIP: Bring someone at least 5'6" with you if you want them to watch the sandwich-making action on the counter for you.
author: Bonnie S.

description:
After so many reviews, I think people get the point that this is the spot!!

But I just had to give them their props and throw in my 2 cents, and tell them "Thank you Roxie, you set the mark for letting SF know how a sandwich should be made!" (and taste!)
author: Rob C.

description:
Roxie's is the best sandwich spot in the city, hands down. I've tried Ike's, Lou's..yeah yeah yeah. Roxie's has always been my number one and will always stay to be my number one. No I haven't tried Little Luca, my friends want to take me so maybe i'll update this later, but we'll see.

I ALWAYS get a roast beef on sourdough with everything, (no onions, i hate raw onions), toasted = BOMB!!
author: Rachel K.

description:
"You've never had Roxie's?! We're going. Right. Now."
This is what a friend said to me a couple of weeks back after we had gotten out of class and were starving.
Now, seeing the plain old liquor store, I'll admit I didn't have high expectations. The small store was PACKED with people ordering sandwiches though so I went ahead and ordered a veggie sandwich with everything on it. 
Needless to say, it was one of the best sandwiches I've ever tasted!

If you're in the area (hell, even if you're not in the area) and in the mood for a delicious sandwich, check this place out. It's worth the time and money.
author: Catherine E.

description:
i love ike's for their dirty sauce and i like little lucca's for their garlic sauce, but i just love roxie's for the sandwich, no sauce needed!

if i pass by this place without knowing what it is, i would have never thought such a great sandwich place would be located inside a corner store. couple friend and i went to try out this place on saturday. reviews had said the line was really long, but we were able to place our order fairly fast and waited no more than 10 minutes for them to make it. my only complaint about roxie's is that its pretty crammed inside. next time i will just phone in my order.

being our first time there, all of us just went with a regular roxie's special. a regular is huge and very reasonable priced. we knew we wanted dutch crunch and the guy who was making our sandwiches recommended we get it toasted, and i am soooo glad we went with it! even though the sandwich sat in the car while we drove to sunset to grab starbucks and then all the way to ocean beach, the bread was still crunchy still. best dutch crunch i've had soo far.

the roxie sandwich comes with ham, salami, and another meat i cant remember (starts with a M though, taste like ham with something that looks like pistachio in it?) we got everything in it. it comes with a good amount of meat and i really liked the artichoke.

i always thought, how can a corner store sandwich place be thaaat great? but roxie's definitely lived up to its hype!
author: Katherine C.

description:
Sandwiches in a liquor store... sounds appetizing right?!  How about HELL YES!! The sandwiches here are SO amazing!! First of all, its in a liquor store... so you have a large selection of chips, candy, drinks, etc that you can grab to go with your sandwich. 

We ordered a pastrami on dutch crunch with pepper jack to share. The Dutch Crunch bread is a must try! I remember taking a deep breath before my first bite, heaven, then licking the sandwich remains off my fingers. Sadly, even writing the review about this sandwich is making my  mouth water. I would highly recommend everyone trying Roxie's!
author: Lana P.

description:
So I was thrown off because I was lookin for this place by being given directions by my GPS, and didn't know I was being lead to a small corner store, liquor store, however you wanna call it, haha! But I was super happy to finally find this place with a sandwich shop inside! Cha ching! Found golden sammiches. 

Got the Simon's special. And duh, it is a must to get a sammich on dutch crunch. Ordered the mini version and the thing was still monsterous! As a special request I asked, "Would it be weird if I asked for pesto as a spread?" and he gave it to me! Soft, tasty, warm, delicious sandwich if you're just around the Balboa Bart station or don't feel like eating along Ocean Avenue just go to this lil corner store. 

It's quite different than most sandwich places such as Little Lucca's and Ike's.  There's a WOW factor, just don't be thrown off that it's in this lil corner store. Plus side you can get any size chips and necessities like mints or floss, alcohol or etc. in there while you're at it! Must've been lucky too bc there was no line, unless it's usually like that.
author: Christine F.

description: Man this place is the spot if you are in the area!  Dutch crunch with roast beef toasted! oh hell yeah!!!  Thanks for not changing the way you make sandwiches over the years!  I'm definitely a fan!!
author: Akiliano T.

description:
As ALWAYS -- the Best Deli Sandwiches in San Francisco!  The line can be long, but it moves pretty quickly and the sandwiches are more than worth the wait.
My only wish: A Table outside where I could enjoy my Delicious Sandwich!
author: Mrs. Dawn H.

description:
This is probably my all-time favorite sandwich spot, and I'm not even from San Francisco! Judging from the outside, the place looks like a normal liquor store, but the inside holds an area devoted to making these delightful sandwiches. 

You can customize your sandwiches to your heart's content: choice of meat, cheese, bread, condiments, if you want your sandwich toasted,etc. I've tried the pastrami, turkey club, and Roxie special, and I've been pleased with every one. Their dutch crunch bread is the only way to go. 

My only complaint is that the counters are so tall! I can't even see the person behind the counter when I'm placing my order. Or you can just blame it on the fact that 'I'm too short (I'm 5'2", for those of you wondering).
author: Elizabeth B.

description: This is my top deli place to go in SF. Their meatball marinera is off the hook and their sandwich sizes is no joke, HUGE!. I usually get the junior size cuz its big and can problem feed two people but i rather not share. NOM NOM NOM! Check it out if you love deli sandwiches.
author: Migz T.

description:
i had my first car accident in front of this place! i was in high school and it was during halloween night when some dumb beezy made a u-turn on the right lane while i was on the left, and she was obviously drunk! that b**** didn't even have adequate insurance. 

but alright, onto roxie's sandwiches. THEY ARE SO GOOD. i've tried all their specials and they give you the right amount of meat and toast their bread to perfection. i think my go to sandwich is their house special on dutch crunch. and i ask for no tomatoes because it gets too soggy for my liking. this place definitely beats ikes. but i wish they have some sort of seating outside because i'm always reduce to eating my sandwich in front of the small shop.
author: Andy H.

description:
Used to stop by Roxie's all the time back in grade school, they still make some mean ass sandwiches.  Especially the toasted roast beef and pepper jack on dutch crunch w/ everything except mayo..that thing will make yo' toes curl.  And do a little dance.  HELLA good!  Very comparable to Little Lucca, only thing missing is the garlic spread.  Prices here aren't as cheap as Lucca's..roughly $8-9 a sandwich, but the portions are equivalent.  I don't know about other breads, but the dutch crunch rolls aren't as thick at Roxie's, which is a good thing.  Perfect blend w/ the rest of the ingredients.  

I'd have to rank this place in my top 3 sandwich spots in SF...they got the selection, value, and taste all down pat.  The appearance of the place is a tad sketchy, but ultimately nothing should deter you from stepping inside.  Do your tummy and taste buds a favor and pick up a damn sammie from Roxie's!
author: Jeff S.

description:
Best. Dutch. Crunch. EVARRRRRRR.

Done.

Get Simon's Special. A hint of spicey, great balance of fresh produce and absolutely no complaints.
author: Maggie H.

description:
People love surprises and I think that is driving force behind the great reviews of this liquor store slash sandwich shop. 

You would never (and I mean never) in million years stop by this place if there weren't 40+ yelpers telling you to drop by. This store is so well camo-ed, I mean how many sketchy liquor store slash sandwich shops are in this town? But what I'd really like to know is who was the first brave soul to actually order a sandwich here?

Well that's a question for the ages, like who was the first man on earth, or why is the sky blue? But I digress, this place is truly a hole, but it's also a good sandwich shop. Sure the beef might not have been cultivated in a luxury barn or maybe the cheese didn't come from the happiest of happy cows, but the sandwich was really satisfying (not all that dissimilar to the nearby Submarine Center).

So maybe it's not the best place to bring your Mom (oops!), but it sure is a great way to impress your non-yelp-enabled friends.
author: Jeremy S.

description:
I remember as a kid, we'd head over to Roxy's and get their big ol' sandwich after swimming at Balboa Swimming Pool. 

Roxie's has got to be one of my favorite sandwich joints, right next to Colombos(",) 

I've never been disappointed and I've been coming to this joint for years.

Pastrami is usually my go to sandwich but you should try the Simon and Roxie special on dutch crunch.

Should be eaten right away or within 30 minutes.

Usually plenty of parking outside but most of the time there's always a line for the sandwich.
author: Anna P.

description: They have the best sandwiches period. They are the gold standard of any sandwiches ever created. When you think sandwiches you think Roxie's.
author: Dwight N.

description: yummy yummy fresh sandwiches!! this sandwich shop is located inside a small liquor store and is definitely a local favorite from the looks of it. i recently moved around the area and was looking for a delicious sandwich place, which i absolutely found. so far i've tried the simon and tony's special. come get your sandwiches here! ikes is a little overrated now, isn't it? (:
author: Hae Rim H.

description: This place has FANTASTIC sandwiches.  You'd never guess by the locale or the even the looks.  It's a little corner convenience store, but they're obviously well known for their sandwiches.  Hot, toasted, cheesy, fresh. YUMMMM!!!  I can't wait to go back, my combo sandwich with pepper jack on wheat was cheessy-rific goodness.  If you're near by, you have to stop off.  You won't regret it.  And every kind of drink or chips you need to accompany.  A must try!
author: Susan Z.

description: WOW!!! I am like, the sandwich queen of SF, and I do declare that this sandwich is the KING of all sandwiches!! 'Twas sooo good, my god.
author: Chloe W.

description:
So so so yummy! Simply put, the best sandwiches ever! Easily a fan

I go to school at CCSF so Roxie's is nearby and everyone at school raves about it. My friend had a huge gap between classes that day and I was waiting for the boyfriend to pick me up so we both decided to pop our Roxie cherry, so to speak. We drove down, walked in, ordered, and grabbed some drinks around the store. I ordered a junior sized Roxie's special on sourdough and she ordered a regular BLT avocado on Dutch crunch. The bacon smelt so delicious! The junior size is not that small to begin with but I wouldn't mind some nommy leftovers :)

The cashier is the coolest guy ever! He took my credit card while I was paying and waived the 50 cent fee because he could recognize it was my first time there. He then asked us if we're from City and fully conversed with us. We shared some laughs with him and cut but we'll definitely be back.
author: Danielle Cheri R.

description:
Best sandwiches in the city.  It's pricey but worth every penny.  Call it in. the lines can be long. 

Hot Pastrami on Dutch Crunch.  Jack Cheese.  Everything but jalapenos. 

Awesome.
author: Jason D.

description:
Just got back from the Yelp Dodgeball Event and we hit this place up after a few drunken rounds of tossing balls at eachother. Thanks Carlos and Lauren for putting it together!

I knew about this place from all the Yelp hype but had no idea it was all the way out here. Some newer Yelpers Miles and Jan (sp?) told us that it was near by so we hit it up.

I got the Roxie special and that mofo was HUGE! It was loaded with all sorts of quality meats and veggies and served on some tasty sourdough too.

It was a little strange ordering out of a corner market (where I ended up talking to some strung out dude who was chasing another strung out dude for a debt he owed) but that ain't nothing on me. Some summer work takes me near this place so this definitely won't be the last time I'll be hitting up Roxie.
author: Art O.

description:
this place is my favorite sandwich spot. I've tried ike's, and little lukas and this spot i've always keep coming back too.

 because im on a special diet. i always order turkey with onions, lettuce and mayo. on dutch crunch. 

first the dutch crunch here is the best.. i mean its slighty sweet and has that big crunch feel. i mean you can look on your plate and see on the crumbs from the bread. 

the turkey meat is sweet or somethin. but its hella good.. 

cost; i believe the smallest size is 7 or 8 dollars. but the size is at least a foot long.

wait time: i always call in but at lunch time i  know the wait is long.

other good stuff: Trip Tip and i believe crab looks good too.
author: Scotty L.

description: Best sandwiches in SF!! Always order the turkey club on dutch crunch. Perfect! Place gets really busy. So call ahead if your running low on time. Everyone is really friendly and welcoming.
author: J R.

description: Had the Roxy special junior size. Great sandwich's, awesome bread and loved that it wasn't soggy at all like some deli sandwich's can get. The junior is their smallest size but it was more then enough for me!  Place is small but they have at least 4 staff manning the deli counter. Super friendly and quick. Would def eat here again next time I'm in the area.
author: Ry B.

description:
Their Dutch Crunch bread is by far the BEST I have ever eaten -make sure to get it toasted! It's crispy and fluffy, just perfect. Their sandwiches good too; more traditional and less crazy/"innovative"; a comfort food of sorts. You can customize your sandwiches to your liking. The junior size is already really huge and I can tell their ingredients are fresh.
I got the Simon's Special which is pastrami, turkey, and some yellow cheese (cheddar? not sure) and I've got to say that I prefer the Roxie's special (Ham, Salami, Mortadella) although the Simon's was really good too.
The reasons for 4 stars is their so-so customer service (I mean, what can you expect from a random liquor store), the fact that their shelving is so high (I'm short and couldn't see anyone over it :[), and they skimp on the meat (unacceptable!!).
author: Kat H.

description: Regular, roast Beef, and Swiss on Dutch with everything...cold! I've been ordering this sandwich for 22 years before they started heating their sandwiches, and for 22 years it's never ever let me down. I am lucky enough to work very close to roxie's so it's always a special treat when I have one for lunch. It's a San Francisco institution. For a city that is constantly changing it's a great comfort that Roxie's remains the same. Roxie's keeps it real, you have to get the dutch crunch bread no matter what kind of sandwich you get. It's always fresh! It's a very tiny spot no seating, so be ready to take your sandwich across the way and have an awesome picnic at balboa park, which always go hand in hand with roxie's. They also have a great soda and chip selection! Go there!
author: Meesh S.

description:
Been coming here for years.. Best deli sandwich spot hands down! This is your classic corner store withe nomb sandwiches! There aren't deli's like this around anymore. Sanwiches are super stacked,super big and super long. Meat is fresh, veggies are crisp, cant ask for more. Super Roxie special, only thing I ever order there, never unsatisfied during and after eating.

At times it can form a short line here but best if you call in your order. I heart roxies!
author: Patrick L.

description:
I only go here for the sandwiches, the clerk is very nice. The sandwiches are fresh, warm, and taste so amazing. It's a little cheaper than Ike's and Mr. Pickles, it's also closer to my house so it's more convenient to go here. The wait isn't too bad either, since it's such a small place I feel more patient with them, it definitely doesn't take as long as Ike's. ALL THEIR SANDWICHES ARE WORTH TRYING. 

Only thing I wish is for them to expand their deli, decrease their "liquor store" setting, and to make it a little more sanitary. Don't get me wrong, they are clean when it comes to serving you, but the store is just old and could use some renovations.
author: Victoria L.

description: I forgot what I used to order when I lived In the area but when I walked in today and was having trouble on what to get. One of the workers recommended a sandwich for me and I took his word for it. By far thee best sandwich I ever had from Roxie's. I'm blown away, takes me back to my elementary school days when I used to get sandwiches from here for lunch. Thank you for the recommendation! These guys are professionals. Seriously, best sandwich place in the Bay Area. Hands down.
author: Edward B.

description: Widely known as one of the best sandwiches around for many years. I have never been disappointed with any that I have tried. A must try if you are in the neighborhood. If you want a fancy spot to sit and be waited on, this is not it. It's all about the sandwich- take it to go and enjoy at your  destination of choice
author: Paul O.

description:
You are the best sandwich place in the CITY hands down Roxie. Here is what I say every time the wonderful sandwich makers ask me what I want.
"Super Salami on Dutch Crunch, everything on it except for onions and jalapenos, cheddar cheese and HOT!" That right their folks is HEAVEN. Roxie your the best sandwich place in the City don't let anyone tell you different. 

You were the first place I went too after I got back to the City from Afghanistan and there is a damn good reason for that. You Rock MY WORLD!
author: Patrick H.

description:
The store and the sandwiches are filled to the max.  Before you think about ordering a sandwich, let me tell you how to enter the store.

Enter and walk immediately towards the back of the store, make a right, and another right and your in line to order.  The list of sandwiches are stacked above the top shelf of liquor, which is extremely dusty and totally not 'top shelf'.  Bread options are posted separately to the right above the cashier.  

There's lots of bread and meat options here, and like places that move food orders quickly, they expect you to do the same when they ask "who's next?".  So order it with everything, minus the automatic jalapenos, unless you want a visit from a special friend later.  

When you get that hearty sandwich urge, come out to the Excelsior and do your soul, not your heart, some good.  And if you feel guilty about the whole thing, you can cross the street and swim some laps at the Balboa Pool!
author: Colleen C.

description:
Best sandwich I have had in San Francisco...by far.   Yes, better than Ikes.  I know it sounds crazy, but it is true.  

Get a pastrami sandwich with provolone on dutch crunch.  

UNREAL.
author: Toby R.

description:
Went here the other day to grab a sandwich for lunch.  After having heard so many good things, I had mixed feelings about the place while in line and felt that it was a lukewarm experience until I saw my sandwich.  Okay, I guess it's all about the food.  Ordered a meatball sandwich on dutch crunch and wow, it was the best meatball sandwich I've had in a long time.  Huge too!

After having ordered my sandwich, I waited with the others in the narrow aisle of the store.  I thought I heard my name called (hey, it was an honest mistake), so I went up and the guy working the register talked down to me and said, "Calm down sir, slow it down, it's not your sandwich."  Hmmm, getting clowned definitely takes the yum factor out of a meal.

Anyway, per tradition, I ordered mine without vegetables or other extras.  For me, a meatball sandwich should be just that...cheese, meatballs, sauce, and bread...a virtual pizza sandwich and this one did not disappoint.  The Simon looked really good too.
author: Roy N.

description:
I'm all for sandwiches and everytime i head anywhere north bay i stop by Roxies at some point.  My very first sandwich ive had from there was a Hot roast beef with porvolone cheese on DUTCH CRUNCH. simply amazing!! I havent ordered anything different for as long as ive been going there.  I've tried other sandwiches that other people have ordered but its not as perfect as the roast beef.  

Its not the thin ass roast beef you buy from the grocery store, this stuff is legit. all the fixin's are perfect then they put it in a toasted that smooshes it a little. omg. again, simply amazing. 

it really is a mini corner grocery shop that has a lot of everything. chips, drinks, candy, alcohol, meds, cheese, eggs, milk even. hahaha, i never get any of it except drink n chips w my sandwich. 

family owned and everyone who helps out are nice.  i always call my order in on my way there from san jose (roxies is usually my first stop into the city). and stop by and pick it up.  there is usually a good amount of people ordering there too so its best to call it in. 

a perfect sandwich if you love flavor and texture. enjoy.
author: Jennifer O.

description: I really not a sandwich eater, but I must say the sandwich was good. Plus it's around the corner from my house.
author: Saint S.

description:
I have cravings for these sandwiches all the time!
They are so good it's unexplainable! They at best hot, but great even eaten cold hours after.  Their Dutch crunch is the Best I've ever had.  The sandwiches are huge :)! But worth it because you always want more ! I've never met anyone who hasn't liked their sandwiches! Even the vegetarian is stuffed with goodies that make your mouth water . Love the staff as well, they always strike a convo and create laughs with their customers  :)
author: Natalie B.

description:
If I'm rating Roxie just on the sandwich alone it would be 5 stars, hands down. In this review that missing star is due to the very limited space once you enter the shop.

This shop around the corner has been around since the beginning of time but their sandwiches are timeless. Turkey, roast beef, or pastrami on Dutch crunch with American cheese, TOASTED (please pass the towel, I'm drooling) are just a few of my personal favorite. Throw in the Arizona Ice Tea and some Sun Chips, 30 mins later and I'm ready to go to sleep.

Now the shop itself is great. Great people, authentic look, car & nudy magazines (if your into that), and some grocery needs. But the cramp area, with the usual tons of customers, not to mention the very limited parking makes it challenging. It's not exactly like McDonald's drive thru but the food is a million times worthy. So if your in the Ingleside district in San Francisco hit this corner of San Jose and San Juan Ave for an awesome Roxie sandwich!
author: Mel B.

description:
So Roxie's is pretty much my FAVORITE sandwich place in the world! I mean, I really only always get the same thing each time... Salami on Dutch Crunch with american cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, mayo & jalapenos. But still. I've really never tried anything like it.

SO freaking delicious. 

Oh and it has to be toasted. If you don't get it toasted then you haven't really experienced this magical sandwich at its true potential! 

My friend lives literally across the street from Roxie's so every time I'm at her house I try and take advantage. Or sometimes I go to her house just so I can have someone to eat my Roxie's sandwich with. She understands. Oh yeah and as a regular there for most of her life she taught me to always try and phone your order in, or else you'll be standing around for about 15 minutes or so.. Which is not really fun because that place is tiny, so you are kind of forced to wait outside. I mean, unless standing on street corners is your thing then you should be cool.
author: Riza E.

description: A local favorite with the friendliest people working the store. Get anything as long as its on the dutch crunch bread.
author: Jamie P.

description: I've been going to Roxie's for over 20 years!  They never disappoint!  Love you guys!
author: Maria C.

description:
Roxie's might be considered THE holy grail of sandwiches. 

My favorite is the junior turkey club on dutch crunch with everything - I always ask them to toast it so it comes out all flaky, warm and melt-in-your-mouth delicious. Their pastrami and roast beef are also amazing, and they have a plethora of freshly sliced deli cheese options. And there's no skimping on meat here. They slice all their cold cuts fresh on the spot. You only need a Junior to fill you up - a regular will feed two people...or one really hungry one.

Even their house spaghetti is awesome - sprinkled with parmesan and drizzled with ground beef crumbles.

Buying a sammie here is an experience in itself. You walk in, and the lowrider mags (i.e. nudie mags) are front and center. Aisle are super narrow, so there is only room for a single file line all the way around the store. And there is ALWAYS a line - proof that the place is amazing.

I often end my visits to Roxie's by sitting in the car and diving face first into my sandwich. Because anyone who's bought a sammie here before can tell you...there's no worse torture than smelling warm dutch crunch on turkey on your car ride home and not being able to take a bite.

Oh, one last tip - since the place is always packed, just call your order in and you can pick it up and pay at the register.

Roxie's, I totally love you.
author: Mariela D.

description:
Good experience.
Prices are reasonable and the service is very friendly.
I recommend roast beef on Dutch Crunch.
author: Sunflower N.

description: Delicious sandwiches, great prices. New this place was going to be great when there was a line out the door, and the owner greeting lots of customers by first name. Located in a very unassuming, plain looking convenience store location. Try the Simon special, or the Tony's try tip. You won't go wrong!
author: Susie M.

description:
I don't understand how I lived in this area for about 2 years but never ventured into Roxie. I am seriously shaking my head at myself....

Their dutch crunch bread is delicious and whatever you get, get it toasted.

I wish, I wish, I still lived walking distance or at least a muni trip away. 

Le sigh.. I'll have to admire your street corner charm and drool worthy sandwiches from a far.
author: Myrel F.

description:
Dutch Crunch brings me back to happier days when I was an undergrad at Cal and Roxie's does it just a little better than nostalgia.

We were on our way home from an East Bay road trip when we made a point to stop by Roxie for a sammich pit stop, when we spoke with the owner, Simon. I told him that we were in the area to visit places that we missed as well as find a few new spots to add to the repertoire. 

Simon was very friendly, talkative, and offered us his signature sandwich, "the Simon" on the house. I wish there were more shops like Roxie closer to home,but next time we're up north, we'll definitely be back.
author: Ricky A.

description:
Okay, upon having a discussion about who makes the best sandwiches in the Bay Area, my boyfriend said Roxies.  Roxie's?  "What?!?  You haven't  heard or had a Roxie's sandwich before?!"  he shouted.  Nope, so that's how it started. 

We went to Roxie's the very next day since it was so heavy on mind about this "great sandwich".  Driving up to the place I was in total disbelief.  A LIQUOR STORE?!?!?!  Are you kidding me?!?!?  The best sandwich in the Bay Area is coming out of a liquor store!  Paaallllleeeeezzzzzeeee!  Give me a break already.  (getting ready to put my foot in my mouth).  Stephanie trust me he says.

Okay so, walking inside there wasn't anything different from any other liquor store.  It was small, crowded, chips, cigarettes, lotto, etc.  Then I see the menu for sandwiches on the wall.  So, I looked at the menu and inquired about the Roxie's Special (mortadella, ham, salami, artichoke hearts and jalapeno's).  Sounded good to me so I ordered the regular size on an extra sour hard roll with provolone heated with everything.  OMG  YUM YUM YUM!  I couldn't believe how good this sandwich was.  It was humongous, tasty and the bread was just right!  This was the perfect sandwich.  The flavor of the meats and condiments were married together perfectly.  

Sooooooo, what happened next?  I went back the following week and ordered another sandwich!  LOL.  I'm hooked!  

Overall, this place is a winner in my book.  Yes, it's crowed because of all the people ordering.  Yes, it does take some time for you to receive your sandwich after you order it.  BUT, it is well worth the wait, TRUST ME!    After all, good things come to those who wait!  OMG!  Delicious things at that!  

Believe it or not, a liquor store that makes the best sandwiches in the bay area!  Go figure!

Thanks Marcus  for looking out for your girl ;)
author: Stephanie J.

description: Been coming here for years.. great Sandwich spot and yes there EBT friendly!!! Cant ask for more.. peppered turkey bacon avocado club wit cranberries is my personal favorite. .
author: B A.

description:
Great meatball sandwich, but man 

Fuck the currly haired guy with the glasses so rude
author: Anthony M.

description:
I'm hardly ever on Yelp anymore but the sammy I devoured from this place yesterday is definitely worth mention.
Had a hot Chicken/avocado, Pepperjack, bbq sauce, everything on it, on Dutch crunch.
It was amazing.  Great balance of tastes, constructed perfectly, and the best Dutch Crunch I've had anywhere ever.
Definitely worth seeking out.
author: Barry A.

description: Wicked good sandwiches. Can't believe I forgot about this place because it's that good. Better than Little Lucca, Mr Pickles and I dare say Ike's.
author: Loretta G.

description:
In this little-hole in the wall-outer mission corner store they provide sandwich addicts with their one true fix. No place can even compare to their friendly, warm, efficient service, 'hooked up' sandwiches, and then a wide selection of the fixings..kettle chips, organic drinks, soda, beer, to go along with...

Turkey, dutch crunch, avocado, toasted. 
Tuna, cheddar, melted. 
Pastrami, monterey jack, jalapeno, french roll. 
Ham, turkey, swiss, heated up. 
Crack cocaine, silver spoon, light it up. 

Might even have to join a sublimely delicious sandwich support group after you try them. Fair warning.
author: Daniella B.

description:
They make a mean sandwitch.  Wouldnt expect that from a convenience store.  Its nothing gourmet - so dont expect an Ikes sandwitch dripping with savory sauce from the gods - its just one of the greatest deli sandwitches in the City.


Aside from the sammies thry also have a very large hard liquor selection.  And your expected selection of cigs, soda, and beer.
author: Raman S.

description: Nothing more to say.  if not a big eater- get a regular and split... This place is great for exactly what it is...
author: ein bier bitte k.

description: After my third visit to Roxie Food Center I can safely say this charming liquor store institution where everyone has been coming to for 20+ years does not belong in the upper echelon of SF sandwich spots. Sorry. I received dry, crumbly dutch crunch holding together a very ordinary turkey club for $9.50. Not bad, but not great- and certainly not the best this city has to offer.
author: Anthony R.

description:
If it weren't for Yelp, people would never find little gems like this...

The sandwiches are awesome, and this being a corner grocery as well, there is no shortage of chips/drinks/snacks to go along with your selection.  I had the Simon's Special and ate it across the street at the park...

The area in front of the sandwich counter can be a little chaotic with so many people waiting to order or pay, but the end result is worth all of the confusion...
author: Nathan W.

description:
A great place to get your sandwich fix. Especially now that Ike's is closing. 

I happened upon this liquor/corner store when I was Yelping for a good sandwich spot close by to my boyfriend's place. It's easy enough to find but you wouldn't expect it to have a deli inside. 

Everyone there is super friendly and chats it up with you while they're making your sandwich. There was no other customers there when I went to order my sandwich but it still took a good 5 minutes for them to make my order. I got the Simon Special (recommended by the people there) because it was my first time. I asked for pickles and jalapenos on the side but in the end I never got them. It's alright though. 

Prices are reasonable compared to Ike's. For $12.99 I got a Supreme, which was basically 2 decent sized sandwiches. Plenty for me and my boyfriend. Roxie's will accept credit cards for orders of $10 or over. The Simon Special was on Dutch Crunch and filled with ham, pastrami, and the usual fixings. The sandwich was a little on the salty side in my opinion because of the pastrami. There also wasn't a good distribution of meat along the whole sandwich. My boyfriend's half had barely any meat in it while mine got the bulk of it. The cheese was nice and toasted in the sandwich and the bread was nice and crunchy.

Overall, an excellent, friendly place to grab a reasonably priced sandwich.
author: Stephanie L.

description: This place has never, ever failed me. I always get the roast beef with cheddar on dutch crunch- toasted! Maybe its the mayo, or maybe its the bread, or the meat, but something about these sandwiches make me come back for more. I can probably recreate the sandwich in the comfort of my own home, but it just wouldn't be the same. I don't know why?! I mean there is no special sauce like Darby Dan's or Little Lucca. It's just a damn good samich!
author: S Y.

description: Best Sammy's in excelsior for sure - but quality just isn't there for top stars... I've been going here 5+ years and it got old waiting in long line crammed in a small store for a Sammy that was 'cool' - I tried so many - never could figure what was up with their flaky Dutch crunch, it was weird. Anyways, I always order no mayo in my Sammy's especially when heated up (warm mayo no good 4 me) -- I can handle paying extra fee to heat it up but i seriously have taken apart/dissected over 5 Sammy's from them cuz they always b putting hella mayo in them esp when heated - bread funky, long wait, no parking ... Hit em up mid week during a off hour if ur gonna, I don't think folks reviewing 5 stars really get outta the outer mission/dc to try other spots
author: John O.

description: Roxie is the best! I grab the extra large Simone special and it can feed me and my wife. Ensure to add extra jalapeño!!! Eat it in your car while it's hot while double parked or blocking someone's driveway. Your car will be filled with their sandwich aroma and you won't stop thinking about it for a week. Don't forget to grab a root beer to wash it all down. Their staff are super nice as well!
author: JM S.

description:
Oh my god. Sometimes, I don't have the patience to drive out to the Mission to get an Ike's sandwich. During those days, I'm thankful that my friends have introduced me to Roxie's

The outside is very deceiving, as well as the inside. When I first walked all, all I saw was the typical liquor store.

But, they make a damn good sandwich. I got the turkey, no pickles, with provolone on dutch crunch, which was good. It was also huge and was good for 2 meals. (cost ~9 bucks).

Delish. Delish. Delish!
author: Jessica H.

description:
I love this place and it's also so close to my home. What I do recommend is to call in your order before you head there since they are always packed specially for lunch. Most of the time I get a hot pastrami on a Dutch crutch and it's so delicious my next favorite is the roast beef the meat is so nice and tender extremely mouth watering. 

This time I went I called in my order and glad I did cause I was not trying to wait in there for so long. Any ways I bought a supreme pastrami to feed 3 my mom, sister and myself. I was able to get 3 good sizes from 1 sandwich. I also ordered the potato salad; I must say it's real good it was my first time trying it. So to complement the sandwich it was a good idea and it's not expensive. 

Overall I would recommend this place and try the potato salad with your favorite sandwich you won't be upset you did.
author: Scarlett F.

description:
The sandwiches at this place are great! 

I thought it best to coat my stomach in a layer of food prior to the Yelp softball game and this place was right around the corner.  Score!

Definitely try their BBQ sandwich.
author: Sofia H.

description: We love coming to roxie's!  I usually get the turkey avocado club on dutch crunch.  Roxie's sandwiches are meaty and delicious, and we always have to come back for more!
author: Alicia Q.

description: ok, ok, I finally tried Roxie for their sandwiches.  I wasn't impressed at all.  1.  The place is very cluttered.  2.  A "junior" size sandwich is $8.00.  I can get the same thing at Safeway for $5.50.  3.  The "sourdough roll" wasn't too fresh.  Also, it didn't have any sour taste.  Tasted like typical white dough.  4.  The meat is weighed!  Come on, don't be so cheap since I'm paying $8.00.  Sorry Roxie, Darby Dan's, Little Lucca and Subculture, all in South City are "far more" better.
author: Victoria M.

description:
It is confirmed, I will be buried with a Roxie's sandwich in my hand.

In the past couple of months i tried out, Darby Dan's, Little Luca's, Yellow Sub, and Ike's. all three doesn't even come close to Roxie's. Those places have good sandwiches but Roxie's is still my favorite and will probably always be the best sandwich shop in the city.
author: Rio A.

description: This place deserves the good ratings, very excellent sandwiches. Would stop by often if I lived in the neighborhood. A bit unpretentiously pretentious but they kinda earned some bragging rights.
author: Bob M.

description:
This is one of those places that you can drive by thinking it's nothing but a mom and pop grocery store.  But then you notice a constant stream of people going in and out at lunch time.  I missed the pastrami sandwich at Quincy's on Market since the closed down.  Been looking for a replacement since.  I still think Quincy's was best but this is second best!  The pastrami on dutch crunch with swiss cheese.?? One of these days, I'll try their special. 

It does take a while (longer for a warm sandwich) and the place is small.  They got 3-4 people back there making sandwichs but there are a lot of phone orders and people ordering more than one sandwich.  

oh!  And they are good size sandwichs!!  There's a junior size and and large too but the regular is good enough for two if you're not a big eater.
author: Ray Y.

description: I have been going to Roxies since high school, I use to come here almost everyday for lunch when I attended Balboa. They make the best hot pastrami sandwiches on dutch crunch bread. Plus, they don't skimp on the meat.
author: Luna C.

description:
As my daughter and I journeyed into the city for the EB / SF softball game we were looking forward to Henry's BBQ. But coming from another game in the south bay we both needed something to get us over the hump.

Growing up in this neighborhood Roxie's has been here as long as i remember so before the game we decided to split a roast beef sandwhich on dutch crunch that was heated it melted in your mouth the workers were friendly and served you as soon as they could between phone orders and walk ins it does take a few but well worth the wait.  It was so good that we went back after the game and we both got a sandwhich for dinner....  Yup it was that good.
author: Mark G.

description:
When you walk into this place you'll be like "OMG, it's a liquor store" Don't let it fool you, this place is great. They make the best sandwiches in that area. 
 I've been going to this place since I was a kid. I'm fortunate that I grew up by the place. It set an expectation for me how sandwiches should be.

Any sandwich you get will be good.
author: Ness C.

description:
Been going to Roxie's for years but had a gap from when I moved out of SF to the East Bay where I didn't go very often, maybe twice a year.  Went back with a friend a few weeks back and the sandwiches are exactly as I remember, huge and delicious.  My favorite is the turkey with cheddar and avocado, for the price (about $10 for the regular size) it's definitely a deal.  Long day so I ate most of it and didn't want anything else all day.
Plan on going back soon and getting their junior size, love Roxies!
author: Tiffany T.

description:
Came back to try the Simon's Special as my friend told me it's really good with pepperjack cheese.  The Simon's Special is Turkey and pastrami with cheddar on Dutch Crunch. 

It was very good indeed! The sandwich was just as I  remembered it. I think I'll be  visiting again soon!
author: AhLin C.

description:
I'm totally a sandwich person. I was introduced to this tiny deli/food market by a friend who lives nearby 5 yrs ago in high school. And til this day, I'm always excited to eat their sandwiches. 

THEY'RE SOO GOOOOD! My favorite is the Simon special on dutch crunch bread! MMMM Their dutch crunch bread is SO good and actually crunchy unlike a lot of other sandwich places.

The workers there are always really nice and friendly! The only complaint I have is that sometimes it takes awhile to get your order, but the wait is totally worth it! & the guy at the register always checks up on your order when he sees that you've been waiting for a bit w/o you asking him to do that. How nice!

And I think they're BETTER THAN IKE'S PLACE! The only reason Ike's might be "better" is their selection and they have like interesting stuff you can add to it and cool names. But seriously, Roxie's has better sandwiches (in my opinion).

And the regular sized sandwich is pretty big! But they offer a junior size one which is more than enough to fill you up!

Oh, fyi: there is no place for you to sit and eat in there.
author: Sandy M.

description: Sooooo gooooood... seriously there are no words to fully praise this place cuz of its awesomeness... you just have to try it for yourself. I do reccommend calling in your order and just pick it up bc the place gets pretty packed and crazy.
author: Mary Ann B.

description:
There is nothing more I can say about this place than what's already been said. Whenever I feel like life is not worth living anymore, I just call Dr. Roxie Food Center and he talks me out of it and gives me my prescription.

Roast Beef on Dutch Crunch with everything. Toasted. 

I hear the pharmacist at Walgreens will throw you out of the store and ban you from ever entering again if you try bringing in this prescription so unfortunately, I still have to drive out of my way to get that delicious sando. 

I will do it. Why? Because it's good. 

"But young, it's only a roast beef sandwich. Can it really be that good?"

YES

"I dont believe you"

SHUT YOUR FACE AND DRIVE THERE RIGHT NOW. OR BART TO BALBOA STATION AND WALK 10 MINUTES. I DONT CARE WHAT YOU DO. JUST DO IT
author: Young L.

description:
I'm gonna go out on a limb here and say todays sandwich from Roxie's was one of my better lunches in the past year.

I got the Chicken Club with avocado, bacon, chicken, and TWO types of cheese. I got American and Pepper Jack which I HIGHLY recommend. I LOVE AMERICAN CHEESE.

The cheeses and meat melt sooo good on Dutch crunch, mixed with some mayo, mustard, lettuce, tomato, pepperocinis, bacon. Mmmm Mmmm Mmmm... a little far for my lunch break but WELL WORTH IT and not soggy (which deserves 5 stars in itself. I dont do soggy).
author: Sarah A.

description: Service is unbelievably good. Taste is also awesome.
author: Dustin H.

description:
Sandwiches are simply but good.  $8-9 for a regular size sandwich (about 10" long).  I got a Simon's Special (which i believe included, Pastrami, Turkey, Cheddar, Swiss and other fixings).  They do have a decent selection of drinks including different bottle rootbeer and cream sodas. 


Location has a decent amount of parking.  This is a corner store so you can grab what you need (Drinks, snacks, etc).  Please check the dates on the Point of Sale items (random snacks etc).  Before going to the Giants' game, I grabbed a pack of sunflower seeds and the expiration date was March 2009!  That's 1.5 years past its due date!!!!!!!!!  The only reason I checked was because the package was dusty.
author: Eddie C.

description:
BEST sandwiches in SF hands down!  I first came here when I was 14, freshman in high school, and working for a non-profit in the Mission.  It has a neighborhood and family feel.  I still see some of the original staff making my sandwiches.  My usual order is (drum roll) a regular turkey with provolone on extra sourdough bread, everything but pickles and heated up!  You MUST get it heated up.  So they put a secret sauce (I think it's olive oil, pepper, garlic, and other heavenly ingredients).  Hella good!  

Recently I've been ordering the turkey club, which is equally tasty to my usual order.  I LOVE this place.  It brings back memories of back in the day.  It's better than Ike's and the crowd has more people of color, which is another reason why it's an SF landmark.  I only go to the original location, which is a corner store by Balboa Park.  Can't wait for my next Roxie's sandwich!  It's more than 5 stars!
author: Chad A.

description:
Roast beef, on dutch crunch, jack cheese, with Er'thing but no jalapenos. Oh wait.....please add avocado! Heat it up? Hell yeah. Along with martinellis  apple juice with some kettle chips and hostess powdered donuts. WORD.

Anywhere were there are Samoans lined up around the corner is sure sign that it's a good.  It's that neighborhood spot where it feels like families have been there for generations. In a city of trend setting eateries and fads,  Roxies is genuine SF.  Any Excelsior local will enthusiastically praise Roxies, and will tell you their favorite sandwich in every detail. 

Good freaking stuff. That's all I gotta say.
author: Christina Y.

description: Hands down the best sandwich ever! I always get the turkey club on extra sour and it is AMAZING! It is perfectly crunchy and warm on the outside and doesn't get soggy like little lucca.  Best for hangovers!  Best to call in your order ahead of time so you don't have to wait inside, because it gets really cramped! The staff is really friendly too :)
author: Ella K.

description:
If I had to choose one word to describe a Roxies sandwich it would have to be AMAZING. I used to live and go to school in their neighborhood and Roxie's was always a treat! They have been making their sandwiches the same way since I was a kid: HUGE and DELICIOUS. I now go out of my way whenever I have a craving for a really good sandwich. The freshest bread (dutch crunch is BOMB), hearty portions, and their BBQ chicken... don't get me started! I think I know what I am having for dinner tonight...

Anyways, I have never had a bad experience and will keep going and introducing Roxies virgins to the best sandwiches EVER!
author: Miranda L.

description: This is the spot when it comes to sandwiches especially if you like them hot. My favorite is the turkey swiss with all the fixins sandwiches rabge in sz from junior to regular to HUGE. If you just want a regular sandwich go with the junior if you need a real big meal go regular. If you need dinner later or your splitting it between two people go with the XL.
author: Michael W.

description: I've been looking for a sandwich spot and haven't really found a place quiet like Ike's until I found Roxie. Their sandwiches are amazing, and I can't get enough of one of their specialty sandwiches called "Tony's Tri-Tip" (on dutch crunch). Highly recommend this place, you won't be disappointed.
author: Jeff J.

description:
The Best sandwhich in the Freakin world !! Stopped in today to grab a sandwhich to bring in to the Niner's game today. Now that is another story. Anyhow it took me over 10 years to find this place again.

Back again today still Number 1 in my book. It's going to take something special to even come close.
author: Nathan M.

description: Move over Little Lucca, there's a new sheriff in town and it's name is Roxie. I've heard from everyone this is the authority and I have no problem proclaiming the best sandwiches ever are made here. A pastrami on Dutch Crunch w/ cheddar, salt & pepper, oil & vinegar all nice and toasted up is a guaranteed winner. A friend of mine says their pastrami is the best. I agree, even though I haven't tried everyone's pastrami. Don't need to. This is serious as a heart attack.
author: O'Shea J.

description: Get here early!  How early?  Before the sun gets up because the lines literally go around the block all hours of the day.  Any true San Franciscan will tell you this is the spot for sandies.  Anywhere else is a place just because you couldn't get into Roxies.  I like to mix it up with the BBQ beef on soft, the simon's special on dutch, and lately on  Friday's the tuna sandie.  You can call in your orders too but don't make it too close to lunch hour unless you want to watch a line wrap around Santa Ynez and into Balboa Park!  This place is original SF, not frills, no thrills, strictly business.  And don't even think about not having your order ready once you're up or no sandie for you haha.  So go ahead and treat yourself to an SF original, you will not be disappointed.  9/10 customers have been going there since they were kids, including me so their clientele of Roxie faithful loves our little sandwich spot secret.  Start off with a junior, maybe a regular if you dare, the portions are humungoid.  If you're a soldier, order teh supreme and watch the two foot sandwich with your name on it roll out.  You might want to wear sweatpants that day.  Wow, I'm hungry for Roxies already.  I think you'll know where to find me today!
author: Myke Y.

description:
Came here once years ago when a friend brought me. I didn't feel like having a sandwich at that time, but shared half with my friend anyway and I LOVED IT!!! I never thought a sandwich could taste so good because I wasn't really a big  fan of sandwiches. 

Recently, I found this place again and went back with my boyfriend. I got a roast beef on dutch crunch. SOOO yummy! The spicyness was just right. DEFINITELY BETTER THAN IKE'S!
author: Denise C.

description: I've been going to Roxie's since 2001 and it's the best sandwich shop in the city by far. I used to do turkey back then, but nowadays I do Tuna on Dutch Crunch with provolone cheese and everything on it except mayo. Dutch Crunch tears the roof of your mouth to shreds but its soooooo good. The awesomeness of Dutch Crunch bread is it takes a certain climate to make and SF is one of those climates. The guys behind the counter always recognize us and that gives us locals born and raised a great feeling. One of the last great sandwich shops!!
author: Rich T.

description:
When we decide to serve sandwich for client lunch on Tuesdays... we go here.  I fax them order and they're quick to confirm and quick to make it.  Pick it up and voila... enjoy your sandwich!

Meatball sandwich on wheat bread!  soo muy bien!  I know everyone is raving about the dutch crunch roll, don't get me wrong, I like that bread.  But gotta choose wheat bread to be a little healthy with the unhealthiness you'll get from the meatballs.  I put veggies and no cheese coz it's just sooo good!  

Other sandwiches are good too, but meatball sandwich is MmMmMmmm.
author: Claire J.

description:
THE BEST SANDWICH I HAVE EVER TASTED!!!

My boyfriend and I heard about Roxie's from a friend and since we were nearby, picked up a sandwich (a pretty darn BIG one at that!) We had the Pastrami and swiss on Dutch Crunch, the owner was there and recommended it to us. MAN was that DELICIOUS! We basically swallowed the whole sandwich while we sat in the car and ate. We couldn't believe how amazing it was! 

Not only was the sandwich DELISH, the owner was HILARIOUS! He was standing there cracking jokes like there was no tomorrow. HE's a great and funny guy. I guess the little sandwich shop has been family-run for over 20 years! They have pictures of customers and friends all over the wall. Knowing that they treat everyone like family made me want to come back even more. 

I wish it wasn't so far from where my boyfriend and I stay at, but we'll be making the drive out there SOON!
author: Sylvia N.
