description: Roxie's has been holding Frisco down with the best sandwich in town since Sly Stone was doing coke in the fitting rooms at the Gap on Ocean Avenue.
author: Curtis E. G.

description:
I heart sandwiches and one of my girlfriends told me about this place. I had to go try it. OMG it's pretty bomb!! I got the Roxie's special on wheat roll....YUmMmY!! 

I would've given it 5 stars, but the roll was just slighty too hard and it kinda made the inside of my mouth hurt a lil. No biggie tho, I'm def going back to try the other sandwiches! 

Feening for a delish sandwich?! This is a must try for sure! Now I'm gonna go to Gene's on Taraval to see if this is comparable.....to be continued....


update: I tried the Roxie salad the other day. I thought to myself...how good of a salad can a corner store deli make?! To my own amazement, the guy who made my salad is a chef at the Marriot? (I forgot, but its somewhere downtown). He made my salad very pretty and tasty! It looked yummy and it def was. So, now I got a new salad AND sandwich spot! Very pleased with the staff here as well! They always seem to make me laugh!
author: Christina T.

description:
Have never had luck here. 

Skip the tuna sandwich (soggy), skip the meatball sandwich (meager).

If you are ordering sourdough or smoked turkey, you may just get french roll and regular turkey. Ask for swiss cheese and you may get none.

Flavor? Add your own when you get home. 

Disappointed in a sea of folks who love this place. 12 years later and I still don't get it.
author: robin s.

description:
This isn't a food center as much as it's a small family owned corner store that makes some of the best sandwiches you'll ever eat.  There is pretty much always a line, but that's ok because the end result is a warm and tasty bundle of goodness.  It is pricey, but the sandwiches are so big you can eat half and save the other half for later.  

The service is great and you get the feeling that if you were to go there everyday, you'd be part of the family.
author: Landy G.

description:
saw reviews on this place & was very excited to try their sandwiches.  walked in & no one would wait on us.  it was unclear as to how to order since no one acknowledged us.  while in line, we tried to observe how people ordered around here.  some ordered at  the check out register,  so then we got into that line.  as soon as we left what we thought was the sandwich line,  they took orders from the guy's in back of us.
really disappointed in this place,  felt discriminated on as we were an asian/white couple.   i will never come to your establishment, let alone will tell others to not to frequent your business.   too bad since i love to give my business to small businesses vs. large corporations.   hate writing bad reviews,  but you deserve it & in these difficult economics times,  this kind of service will hurt your business.   remember,  there's always somewhere else to go!
author: sandie g.

description: I heard a lot from this place so me and my boyfriend decided to go here especially since he is a big fan of sandwiches.  Right when we were inside i didn't realize how small the place was. I ordered the junior BBQ Beef, which is delicious by the way, and didn't realize till i opened the wrapper and saw how big a junior was. I thought it was gonna be the size of a 6' inch from Subway but way bigger with more stuff inside.  This place beats all those sandwich food chains like Subway.
author: Janice V.

description:
Let's put it this way - I drove round trip 30ish minutes in the pouring rain to get a heated turkey, swiss, on dutch crunch sandwich. We used to come here a lot during the summer months of teen sports camp. Roxie's is right across the street from Balboa Public Pool and Park. When the weather is nice, you can picnic in the park with your sandwich. 

I parked around the corner, and smelled the deliciousness of sandwiches as soon as I got out of my car. I walked in a little after 1:00 and luckily for me (as it was raining) I didn't have to wait in line. I picked out some RC Cola, which is extremely hard to find in the bay area, and headed to the sandwich counter. 

I ordered a junior turkey with swiss, mayo, and pickles on a dutch crunch - heated: $5.99 
My 2 RC Colas - one for now, one for later: $2 
I never carry cash charge (fine by me): $0.50 
Waiting for my sandwich: AWESOME 

I always have the most interesting and entertaining conversations in line. Everyone from the guy making my sandwich to the guy taking money to the two guys waiting in front of me in line was super friendly. 

In addition to the money sandwiches, Roxie's has a great soda collection - next time, I'm getting the Welch's sparkling grape soda! 

Roxie's doesn't disappoint - as always, I'll be back!

PS. Either the guy who made my sandwich thought I was a hottie, or their junior subs are ridiculously large. Though I prefer it was the first option, I'm pretty sure it was the second...
author: Jennifer L.

description:
This was my go-to sandwich place as a teenager, and for a long time thereafter you could still walk in and order the "David" and they'd make it for you.

Sadly, that era is gone and even more sorrowful one of the original sandwich jockeys has passed away.  He used to do magic with the coins from your change and he was pretty solid.  Their 4th of July bbqs are also the things of legend.  

In any event, fresh dutch crunch bread and all the toppings you could want make for a gem of a corner store.  Highly recommended although not exactly convenient for much of the city.
author: David K.

description: Best Sandwiches in ALL SAN FRANCISCO! I love the vegetarian on a soft sourdough roll! YUM!!!
author: L P.

description:
Great sandwich.  Been coming here since the early 80's.  Don't let the price fool you.  the sandwich is huge.  Even the small is enough for 2.

Try the Roxie special on dutch crunch, heated, yummmmmmmm!
author: Gary N.

description:
I don't want to give a bad review to one of my favorite sandwich deli, but lately the help that Simon and Peter have hired to make their sandwiches are not to the old standards. The staff seems more preoccupied in making small talk among them. On several occasions they neglected to prepared the sandwiches as ordered, Like not giving you condiments on the side. Sliced tomatoes have  been soggy  and wilted lettuce
.Disregard prior review. 

 Roxie still rocks! Back to the old standard of making clientele happy.

Roxie is the best and once you become a regular they will remember you forever!
author: Hum V.

description:
I went to try this place based on the great reviews on Yelp. 
Well I feel like let down. 
This is not really a food center, it's a convenient corner store, that sells sandwiches too. 
So I still went in, and ordered a sandwich, don't remember what. Then I stood there to watch my sandwich be made and what do I see: the bare hand( no gloves no nothing!!) is going to pick up my bread, then the bare hand is putting lettuce!! well I could not go on, the thought of all the germs on my sandwich made me sick. Who knows what goes on in the back when they prepare everything, when this is what goes on in front of customers. 
I asked them if I can cancel my order, they said yes and nice enough not to charge me. 
Sorry, I need everything to be either with gloves or use utensils!!
author: Nina Z.

description:
Roxie Food Center is quite the misnomer. It is a corner convenient/liquor store that happens to sell sandwiches. Plus it is on San Jose street just off the Ocean exit on 280 where it should be more residental than anything else. Wouldn't have found it, but thank goodness for google maps.

Don't get me wrong, I like this place.

It is very crowded in there as there are basically two aisles when you walk in. The aisle furthest from the door is where the magic happens.

There are two sandwich dudes behind a very high deli bar and an older lady that you can barely see the tops of her head strolling back and forth.

At the end of the deli bar is a meat slicer with a chunk of meat being sliced into thing slivers by itself and unattended. Interesting.

Asked sandwich dude which one to get and he said either the Simon or the Roxie Special. Fortunately, I had my trustworthy eating buddy with me and we got one of each. They have sizes from Junior, Regular to the Supreme. The Regular looked like the footlong while the Supreme was probably pushing 18 inches. Not that you need to ask, but I went Supreme all the way...the addage of go big or go home.

The sandwich maker offered to make it to what he thought was good. The Roxie was made with sourdough. The Simon was made with Dutch crunch.

Hands down the Simon was the better of the two. The Simon had a more distinct flavor of meats and were easier to distinguish flavors from.

The Roxie had a nacho cheese flavor to it with Jalapenos, but the sourdough didn't do it for me. Should have got it on dutch crunch as well.

Either way, that is a lot of sandwich to eat. But for ~$13 a piece that isn't too bad. 

This place wasn't as good as Ike's place, but the concept is basically the same. I actually think the bread was not as fresh as Ike's but still solid. 

The guy behind the counter is very quick, funny and just all around pleasant. The family memorabilia and pictures add to the charm.

It's good stuff and would love having a sandwich again if in the area.
author: Andrew C.

description: let me be bold and clear........ CRABMEAT ON DUTCH CRUNCH FTW!!! this place is cheap and their sandwiches are really good. I thought of little lucca and ike's too but Roxie is one of which I have to show some support. Their friendly, great sandwiches and cheap too! after having been to other sandwich places like little lucca i thought that's it I found the best sandwich place in the city but NO! THIS IS THE PLACE TO GO!
author: Mara G.

description: My husband's childhood stomping grounds, and now, it has become a family staple!  Right when I was given the green light to eat deli meat again (post-pregnancy), I have eaten two Roxie's Specials in the past three days.  I also traded half of my Roxie's special with hubby for half of Pastrami and Avocado.  Of course, all the sandwiches were on dutch crunch bread.  The sandwiches are indeed monstrous, and everyone in the neighborhood is in love with this place!  The sandwiches are good for cravings or to take to say, an Alice Concert to satisfy my out-of-towner friends!  Roxie's will satisfy almost anyone!  While you're at it, why not buy some other items at the store? Thirty-six years and counting, Roxie's continues to be a gem in the neighborhood!
author: Steph W.

description: The only place to get a sandwich in SF !!! I recommend the pastrami or tri-tip special
author: Trev C.

description: Roxie's, you are really starting to piss me off. I live right up the street and frequent fairly often and the past TWO times I've come you've messed my order up -- and when I say messed up I don't mean you forgot to hold the pickles -- I mean you gave me a completely wrong sandwich. What the heck?
author: Jennifer P.

description:
My brother had been raving about Roxie's subs for awhile, so I finally got around to trying them a couple years ago. I waited too long.  The subs are excellent. My personal favorite is the turkey club on dutch crunch. Everything you could want on a sandwich: the "works" plus cheese, avocado, and bacon. They throw it in the oven to warm it up and melt the cheese (if you want them to, and I highly recommend you do).  These sandwiches come in three sizes, and all of them are huge. Great for sharing. A little on the expensive side, but you can save half for later or share with a friend.

The store is a corner market that can get pretty cramped around lunch time. But no prob, just wait outside and take in the lovely street traffic of San Jose Ave. and they will get your sandwich to you as soon as it is ready. If you are in a rush, I recommend you call ahead. The employees are all friendly and strike up conversations with anyone who comes in.  There are many regular customers, and for good reason.  It is a family owned and operated store, and they include you in the family.  One of my favorite places to get a sandwich. Ever.
author: Amy C.

description: Best sandwich I've had in years! Meat Ball Mafia!! It was a really amazing sandwich! The bread was toasted perfectly, the provolone, the meat, the sauce... Really just a perfect sandwich! Weird that it's in a little mom and pop convenience store, tho.
author: Spencer Y.

description: They have really good sandwiches here.  Yum.  I think it's the mayonaisse.
author: James C.

description:
Really good, really large sandwiches.  The junior is even too big for me, but having a leftover half is always a nice bonus for later!
I love their pastrami...tender and delish!
author: Debbie T.

description:
Junior Bacon Club on Dutch Crunch please! 

Also, the salami, tuna and meatball all DELISH. 

I have been going to this deli since I was a teen :) So good and the ingredients always fresh. I usually get all the fixings with extra jalapenos. 

I suggest calling in your order bc during lunch and after school whoa long line. The store is TINY. Cramped in with all your fav snacks and drinks. 

Nom nom nom

My taste buds get piss when I eat another sandwich bc nothing can compare to Roxies.
author: Rose L.

description:
I finally got to visit this place the other night to see what all the hype was about.  I must say it wasn't what I was expecting at first. I've read some of the previous reviews and agree their toasted dutch crunch bread is great. I ordered hot pastrami with all the fixings and was not disappointed. I'll be back for sure to try their other sandwiches!

P.S. Special shout out to Ms. AAA for bringing me to this place! :)
author: Gilbert A.

description:
I live two blocks from this place and come here usually a couple times a week, not just for sandwiches but just about anything. It's my corner store after all. 

I feel honored to have them in our neighborhood. The sandwiches are absolutely amazing, no gimmicks, just good old fashioned goodness. I'm partial to the pastrami and meatball subs, but I've had on occasion just about every combination and they're all delicious. I've only had good experiences with the staff, the owner is a great guy. They sponsor the only 4th of July parade in the city and do lots of other things to support the neighborhood (Mission Terrace) that they call home.

It's not up for debate. Best Sandwich Shop / Corner Store in the City.
author: Russ N.

description:
Hands down one of THE BEST sandwiches I've ever had. My only regret was  not having it toasted. BF had his toasted, and it just elevated the dutch crunch roll to near heavenly. 

I went with a salami with provolone, everything on it. Total man sandwich, but it was SO GOOD.
author: Ahna P.

description:
They sell the most delicious sandwiches here. Turkey or pastrami are the best in my opinion but the main thing is to get the sandwich heated up and that just makes it be even more delicious. 

Small liquer store that has a deli inside it but they have great service, are very friendly, and are quick. It's easy to call ahead and order your sandwich ahead of time because around lunch time it is usually packed!
author: Emilio P.

description:
Walked here from the Balboa Park BART - it was about a 10min walk.  Had wanted to try their sandwiches for a while, after consistently seeing this place in the top 5 on here.  It took about 7-10min for the sandwich to be ready after I ordered - there were two people before me.  The people working here were nice and gave good service.  

Don't get me wrong, their sandwiches are quite tasty, but for around the $6.56 I had paid for their junior/small turkey on Dutch crunch, I was honestly disappointed at the size of the sandwich.  From all these raving reviews on here, I expected something that was out of this world good - as in going out of your way to come here good, to justify the price of the size of their sandwich.

Yes, it was a junior/small that I ordered, but my point is I've been to places where you can get so much more of a small version for just as good - you know, those ones that you can eat the other half for later.  If you've never been to Roxie's, it's worth trying, so at least you'll know if you'll like it or not, but if you ask me, I'm still looking for a place that gives you a better bang for your buck; once was good enough.
author: Kahanalei M.

description:
Roast beef on dutch crunch.  Toasted, please!!!  I love their sandwiches, and have been coming back to this little deli for yearssssssss now!!  I've tried their other sandwiches, all very good, but I tend to gravitate back to my usual.  

It's a small corner liquor/ deli store that's been around forever.  The people that work there are very friendly and funny.  It tends to get pretty crowded.  However, if you don't have time to wait you can easily pre-order your sandwich over the phone.  

I love this place!
author: Joy A.

description:
Me and my friend split a turkey club and a simon's special. The turkey club was good... but not 10$'s good. I only have to say 2 words - LITTLE LUCCAS. 

At little luccas you can get a sandwich twice as delicious, for around 7 bucks. IMO it's the spread that they put on the sandwiches at luccas that sets the sandwiches apart. Hot pepper and garlic sauce provides the bit of moisture that the dutch crunch needs. 

If you're in the neighborhood and don't have time stop by here, otherwise little luccas all the way.
author: Colin H.

description:
I'm not very much of a sandwich person, but Roxie's has made me addicted to their sandwiches. Yumm. I feel like I'm betraying Little Lucca Sandwich Shop & Deli because I live right there, but Roxies.. Their sandwiches are wonderful.

& I really love how this place is within walking distance from City College. On a hot, sunny day I love to buy a sandwich pull out my blanket and eat at Balboa Park across the street.
author: Emily V.

description: if you aint knowin bout roxies u slipping forreal forreal. beeeesssssst sandwiches period!!!!!!
author: Phil D.

description: Roxie sandwich's are the bomb. Get the pastrami and swiss,mmmmmgoodness.
author: Richard A.

description:
Unbelievable sandwiches.

You know when you order food and when you actually get it you look at it and say to yourself "Awesome! I am going to have leftiovers for two days!" that is exactly what will happen when you get a Roxies sandwich, but no matter how hard you try, you WILL eat the whole thing. You deny it now, but you will. 

Roxies reminds me a lot of the small shabby delis in New York. There is no glitz or glamour to the place which makes me like it even more.  Prices are totally fair and you will be full for quite some time.

The sourdough and dutch crunch are delicious! And I highly recommend getting everything on it. The veggie sandwich is one of the best in the city.  The guys who run the place are nice and efficient! 

Definitely a great place to grab a sandwich before you hit the beach/ball game or just because you are too freaking tired to cook dinner.
author: Jean K.

description: bomb ass sandwiches, dutch crunch bread, good people. so fucking good!
author: Jonathan M.

description:
From the outside, you would assume that this is just a typical corner liquor store. There is nothing fancy about this place, I don't think they even have windows. This impression doesn't change once you get inside. The store is really snug, you wont believe how much food/candy/drinks they're actually able to pack into this small store. 

But behind a tall counter, you can see the heads of workers busy making the famous sandwiches they are known for. I personally order the Junior roast beef sandwich all the time. SO GOOD. I love everything about this sandwich, everything from its delish bread to the savory meat. I've been here about ten times, everytime I order the roast beef sandwich. Next time, I need to try their other sandwiches, which I'm sure will be just as awesome. 

So conclusion here, don't judge a book by its cover (or I guess the appearance of the store) or else you could miss out on something truly awesome!
author: Richard W.

description:
THE BEST SANDWICHES IN THE WORLD!!!!

That's pretty much the gist of it!  What else can I say?!  

I always order my sandwiches with dutch crunch bread, and no one ( I mean NO ONE) toasts their bread the way Roxie does!!  I'm in heaven each and every single time I even think about it. 

Don't under-estimate the power of a sandwich shop!
author: Marvin R.

description: The Simon is the best. Drive out there from vallejo just for it!
author: Juan M.

description:
This was the spot in high school after baseball games and today is still the spot after a game in balboa park or on the way to a giants game... no matter how much out of the way it is...

  do yourself a favor and grab a sandwich on your way to a giants game. 

Definitely get it on dutch-crunch bread.
author: Yuri M.

description:
If it wasn't for my fellow yelpers, I would have had no idea this unassuming corner market would contain one of the best sandwiches in the city. Thank you yelpers!

I realized right away the secret is definitely out. This was like the Ruby Skye of sandwich joints - popular "artists", lots of people, not a lot of room. I quickly figured out the line protocol and awaited my turn.

The selection is incredible - bread, meats, toppings, you name it. Almost every combination imaginable is yours for the choosing. I went with turkey on a wheat roll, complemented by lettuce, tomato, pickles, mustard, salt, pepper. It was delivered, toasted, just as ordered. And it was delicious.

Sealing the fifth star: 1) My "junior" for $5.99 was massive. I can't imagine the size of the regular ($7.99) or super ($11.99). And 2) the service. Confident and friendly. These guys know what they are doing. And they are funny. When I asked what kind of bread the brick oven was, the guy held it up, smiled, said it was a roll so hard it could kill a man. Noted.
author: Jason B.

description:
This place is a hole in the wall for sure! I found this place from a friend that live nearby. When i first saw it, i was debating whether or not to eat there. The place just doesn't look appealing to eat at, but since i was too lazy to find somewhere else to eat at, i decided to walk in. 

This place is like a liquor store that sells sandwiches. After walking into the designated ailes, i got myself a drink and chips and ordered my sandwich. I forgot what i ordered because i didn't order it. The owner recommended it to me. The name of the sandwich sounded like it came from an italian mob or something. Whatever it is, It was delicious. If you ever come here, the name of the sandwich is posted to the left of the register. It has pastrami and some other stuff with dutch crunch bread. 

The owner is super nice, i believe his name was Tony. It's rare to find a nice owner working at a liquor store but this place got it! If you're not having a good day, tell the owner Tony to tell you a joke. He got jokes for days.

5 stars to the best sandwich i ever ate at. Even though the price is slightly expensive, i think it's still worth it. I wish i lived nearby so i can stop by this place every 2 days or something.
author: David T.

description:
LOL i have to explain to you.

sure i've all ready reviewed this place.  BUT if you haven't tried it, you're missing out on a perfect sandwich.

someone else said it and i'm going to reiterate it for you.  don't let the store, location, line, people, or anything intimidate you.

this place is full of GREAT people.  they get you what you want and it really sounds like a DELI is supposed to be.  yelling back and forth what did you order?  what do you want?  what size?  how do you want it?

today, i had the roxie special.  its chosen meats along with MARINATED ARTICHOKE HEARTS.  ITS WHAT YOU SHOULD ORDER!  I order mine on an Italian Roll because i love how soft it is and how good it tastes.  its magic, it always leaves me with a feeling that this particular sandwich is heaven sent.

they have all the mixtures you want.  turkey and pastrami, bbq beef, meatball, salami.  you tell them how you want it and thats how you get it.  its listed on a piece of paper but you can ask what goes on it also.  they might seem like they're mad but they're not.  they're there to serve you.  in fact, they were open today, on LABOR DAY...serving sandwiches by the 2's and 3's.
author: Bing D.

description:
I've been coming to Roxie's since 1990 and still haven't found anything better. I don't know what mojo they're putting into their sandwiches but, they can keep putting it in the mix! LOL!

Favorite: Smoked Turkey and Swiss on Dutch Crunch with extra mayo and all the toppings.........HEATED!

The Best! I always get a junior because that's all it takes to fill me up and get my fix.

Love it!
author: La Toya B.

description:
So I heard from some friends that his place was VERY good so naturally I was interested from the get go.

We make the trip out there and I'm shocked to see that it's a little hole in the wall corner store....except that it can't really be a hole in the wall if it's a "corner" store but you catch my drift.

I'm not going to lie, from the looks of it, I wouldn't think that they would have great sandwiches but boy was I wrong.  I ordered the biggest Pastrami with Swiss on a Dutch Crunch that was baked to perfection.  

Being that this is a corner store, I was able to purchase some drinks and some chips go along with my sandwich.  Bought a beer and a Fanta Strawberry, but in all honesty I should have just stuck with the beer  but I'll save that bit for later.  

The price came out to almost $20 because the sandwich alone was about $11 along with the rest of the things that I got.

So I get home and am about to enjoy my beautiful sandwich, I open the wrapping and feast my eyes on one of the more well put together sandwiches I've seen in a while.  

I open up my soda which happens to be a Fanta Strawberry and just my luck, it explodes and leaks ALL over my sandwich.  I'm sure that my sandiwich is ruined now and am severely disappointed but I still eat the sandwich and find out that this strawberry infused masterpiece is still delicious and one of the better sandwiches that I've had.  

So to say that my strawberry soaked Pastrami sandwich was still one of the better sandwiches that I've had is to say a lot.  I can only imagine what it tastes like without the Strawberry soda.  Overall the place is great and have lots of condiments and a lot of meat packed into a sandwich.  I would highly recommend this place to anyone.  

Just be warned that if you're feeling hungry, be prepared to break the bank.
author: David B.

description:
I dont care what other people say Roxies is the BEST SANDWICH EVERR!!! they do not need any special kind of sauce or spread like other places because they are delicious all on their own! I LOVE THIS PLACEE!!! There was a month where I literally ate there every Saturday!

I always get a Junior Turkey with dutch crunch with no onions or peppers or mustard TOASTED. You MUST MUST MUST get it toasted! its sooo delicious!

Only down side is it gets pretty packed in there. I always call in my order and pick it up. When you pick it up you have to wait sometimes too. But def the best deli ever. No one compares to Roxies to me.
author: Annie L.

description:
I just recently ate a sandwich from this place, and I will most likely not order sandwiches from any other place again. Hahaha, no but seriously.. try this place just once and I assure you that you will be satisfied. Dutch crunch bread all the way!

I also appreciate how Roxie's supports high school sports as well! Giving back to the community is a must!
author: Christl A.

description: I love this place, the sandwiches are delicious and the staff are very welcoming. My favorite is the Roxie special.
author: Foshow O.

description: Love this place.  Been here 3 times now thanks to my sister who gave me the heads up.  Have tried their Tri Tip sandwich and a Simon special sandwich.  I like how they take phone ahead orders and how they press down your sandwich.  The place looks unassuming since its a convenience store in the middle of a residential area but truly a gem of a spot.
author: Gilbert C.

description:
BBQ PORK SANDWICH. get it!!

Moderately priced sandwich, but it is indeed worth it. Delicious.
Parking isn't too bad, pretty close to city college. It's one of those things that you eat once and wind up still thinking about it for weeks to come until you have another.
author: Neek W.

description:
Hands down, Roxie makes the best sandwich that I've ever tasted. This place might look sketchy to some who drive by, and it certainly doesn't look like they would make such a great sandwich. But like the old saying goes, "Don't judge a book by its cover." Parking can be a hit or miss depending on how lucky you get and what time of the day it is. There's usually gonna be some people ahead of you, but that's to be expected cause it's delicious! Their Dutch crunch bread is off the hook! I didn't  even know that kind of bread existed until I stumbled upon this place with my ex on a cold, rainy SF afternoon in the dead of winter. "Do you want it toasted?" asked the guy behind the counter with slicked back hair. Heck yeah! It makes a world of difference how they toast the bread. I have only tried their Roxie Special (without onions) but it's so good that I almost don't wanna stray to another choice. I'm not a fan of jalapeños but Roxie makes me love it in my sammich! With the cheese all gooey and drizzling over the salami and ham. YUM. Every friend that I've introduced to Roxie has fallen in love with the sandwiches, my parents love it too, what more can I say?

I love the neighborhood vibe of this place;  it's a hole in the wall and not pretentious. It's cramped, it's a liquor store. Everybody is really friendly. I love the guy who rings you up haha. But inside that candywrapper-like packaging lies the key to my happy food coma. So, thanks Roxie, for being 1.8 miles away from my home (according to my iPhone)!
author: Olivia V.

description:
Great sandwiches. Small place, great food. It pretty-much acts as the local market for the neighborhood, so they are fitting a lot of stuff into a small space. Full market and they get a good flow of people coming in because it is the only real food in the area.

Couldn't ask for a better sandwich and service was great. Seems family run, so it is great to support a small business that is supporting the neighborhood. I will be back!
author: Jonathan M.

description:
Best sandwich I've had in the city so far. Better than Estelle's, better than Love n' Haight, better than Ike's *gasp*....yeah i said it. Don't get me wrong, I like Ike's a lot, but it takes sooooo long and a turkey club with everything at Roxie's  hits that special sandwich craving. AND coming from Noe to Roxie's to get a sammy takes less time than going to Ike's for one. The neighborhood may not be as scenic and not close to DP (which is where you eat your Sunday sandwich), but you won't regret your trip here (besides you'll be back at DP after having found parking before Ike's will have your order). 

Also, the owner of the shop is a very cool guy and sells those strange sweets you thought you'd only find in the old country (you either know what I'm talking about or you'll never know).

The moral of the story is to go to Roxie's and get any sandwich with everything and heated, then head back to DP to eat it. I didn't mean for that to rhyme, but it does, so that means it's true. :)
author: Aristocles P.

description: Best chicken avocado sandwich anywhere!!! I prefer it without the BBQ sauce and made by one of the owners Tony or his cousin Addie. ( best sandwich artist there) with the works, writing this review is making my mouth water. Try it out for yourself, awesome family owned business lines can get long call ur order in ahead of time
author: Mimi W.

description:
Man, when I think this place can't get any better, it outdoes itself!  

I returned with three friends after I raved about it.  We got a supreme size of the Simon's Special (knew it was amazing from the last time around) and also the Roxie's Special (Ham, Mortadella, Salami, Artichoke and Jalapeno peppers).

Both were excellent (I did prefer the Simon's Special a little more).  But what was amazing was that we had asked half of each sandwich without mayo and then to cut each into fours.  They did so with no problem and then separately labeled them ("Simon's w mayo," Roxie's w/o mayo," etc).  Awesome. Just awesome.
author: F. P.

description: If Jesus Christ would come down from heaven just to make you a sandwich it would taste like this...
author: Miss T.

description:
Delicious sandwiches!  Crowded corner store--more so, with the line of patrons waiting to place a sandwich order.

Needing quick meals (in the midst of moving into a new home), I've ordered here 3-4 times in the past few days, trying the various Specials sandwiches.  The Meatball Special on their crunchy roll is my fav.

Sadly, I'm just now discovering this neighborhood gem--now that I'm moving out of the area.  All those times I took quick/cheap meals at the other neighborhood eateries, I could have eaten here--arrgh!
author: Quyen L.

description: Does this place even need a review ?!?!?! My goodness!!! It's the best sandwich in SF by far. That is quite the statement considering there is Sub Center, Ike's and plenty of other top notch places! I grew up on those sandwiches and regularly make trips out there,  just for the sandwich.
author: Tema B.

description:
After a day of walking, we stopped by to pick up the two main specials: Roxie special (mixture of meats --ham, pastrami, smth else, and two kinds of cheeses, hot) and Simon special (turkey and pastrami with cheddar, hot) both on Dutch Crunch.  These hit the spot very nicely.  Personally, the regular sized sandwiches here are quite large, so I'll probably get the mini next time.  The olive oil and vinegar is a must, but the other sandwich items are optional since some make the bread quite soggy looking.

Around the store, there are the other convenient store basics like chips, gum, and sodas --they even sell home cleaners and the like. 

Minus one star from 4 because of the price -- two regular sandwiches alone were $18.  Since it's not everyday that I eat here, it's definitely o.k. and I am a fan of the fast service and basic, but tasty menu.
author: Jennifer Y.

description:
This place has been voted as the best corner store in Outer Mission.

Not because it looks like a hole-in-the-wall place although it IS. 
Not because the prices are cheap because it is NOT.
Not because there are places to sit because there are NONE.

This convenience / liquor store, close to Balboa BART Station, is best known for the "crack-tasting" sandwiches.  They have been around for more than twenty years and even the police and city workers come here to get their regular fix.

If you want to try one of the best-tasting Dutch crunch sandwiches, come here!  Make sure you ask the sandwich makers to toast it.  During lunch hours, the wait is long, so call in your order 15 minutes ahead.

Although the sandwiches here are smaller than the legendary Little Lucca's in South San Francisco and costlier than legendary Ike's Place in San Francisco, this place is worth trying.  Please be warned that you may be hooked.

My favorites are still the Samoan Mafia (meatball sub with sour cream) with avocados and the chicken avocado sandwich with BBQ sauce.  Best to eat it when the bread is crispy and warm.  So delicious when the cheese is melted along with the meat.  You will see a lot of regulars who eat in the car, since there are no tables and chairs.

The junior size sandwich is the smallest choice (about $8 for 8 inches).  They have an interesting way of securing the sandwiches: the wrap ends are twisted instead of using a rubber band or tape.

The service here is casual, while the store is cramped with many items, like chips, drinks and convenience items.  Prepare to hold your tummy in when other people try to go past you on the aisles.

You definitely see some local flavors here.   Tony, who usually mans the cashier, is a friendly smart-ass, while the sandwich makers look like harmless gumbas from NYC.

One time, a regular customer comes in and cracks a comment about the girlie magazines in the front rack.  Tony replies, "I would rather look at them instead of your ugly face."  The other customers in line were just smirking without busting up.
author: CT L.

description: One of the best sandwiches I've had in the city.  Certainly plan to visit this place again when in the neighborhood.
author: Leo S.

description:
It seems to be that Roxie is expanding! Did you know they had another business? Well if you didnt now you know.. The other spot is located 3 blocks away from Golden Gate Park at Roxies Market & Deli . BY: 500 Kirkham St San Francisco, CA 94101.
And the way i found that out was cause of a trip to the Park They have the exact same deals. Same Taste, but in 2 seperate locations. I always order their Pastrami! ITs oh so GOOD! So when ever your by Balboa Park watching a Baseball Game they are nearby so you can enjoy 2 good things at once. But if its a nice sunny day Go to the one by GGP and go eat it by the pond.
author: Silvia C.

description:
Pleased to see them on one of the yelp special lists, so now I am writing a review...ah Roxie's...a neighborood favorite. I love it when people that are not from the area come all the way to Roxie's for a sandwich.

Their vegetarian sandwich is unbelievable! Never had one like it from a sandwich shop. They put all sorts of fun things on it like kidney beans and artichoke.

Now Im hungry
author: Chelsea M.

description:
This location is one of my accounts for my profession.  The guys there are AWESOME.  I LOVE SIMON and his "SIMON SPECIAL" sandwich.  If you just add BACON to it...omg...IT IS DELICIOUS!

You HAVE TO EAT it and not have it sit out too long because it TASTES THE BEST when it's crunchy and warm.

I always get the Simon Special w/ the Dutch Crunch Roll, No peppers, and add Bacon.

The store may look small but I'm telling you...sandwich making is THEIR SPECIALTY and business is BLOOMING for them!

And you can CALL IN your order because the line there gets long sometimes even when you're just trying to PLACE your order.
author: Wendy T.

description:
Hm dutch crunch warmed up with any meat and you can't go wrong.  I got the roast beef and it was good.  The cheese was melty and the bread had a little crunch, it was quite a good sammy.  

Pros: won't disappoint, must haves: dutch crunch, warmed.

Cons: none that I can think of but I did see the guy making the sandwich from outside and he wasn't using gloves (for germaphobes out there).
author: Amy C.

description: My ultimate favorite sandwich place of all time. Nothing beats Roxie's delicious sandwiches. The shop is small, but their sandwiches are so good that there is always a line of folks out the door. Luckily the wait time isn't long since they work extremely quickly. I like to call in my order and have it ready for pick up. One word sums it up... Delicious!
author: Vanessa C.

description:
OMG, seriously Roxie sandwiches are the best that you will ever get!

There are numerous sandwich shops in the city, but NOTHING compares to Roxie. No one else can toast their bread like Roxie, and no one else can stuff a sandwich like Roxie. 

You'll be in pure heaven taking one bite! Now, that's making me hungry...
author: Milz T.

description:
I love Roxie's! Just like pretty much everyone else who has reviewed and waxed nostalgic about this place, it invokes the same memories and sense of City pride. My grandparents have a house a few blocks away and whenever my Lolo (my gramps) and whole fam were always out on the Baboa park tennis courts, you knew a Roxie's  sandwich was in order for that day! 

It hasn't changed much since then. The sandwiches are good as always and the junior size will fill you up if you're can't cop or finish a regular. Anything on dutch crunch from here is the best, but the other rolls go too! My recent fav has been the Roxie's special but you can never go wrong with roast beef and provolone either! 

If you've never been, it's a small tiny corner store with barely any room to maneuver, but locals and OGs always know which way to enter, exit and ppl in line usually let you pass thru if you're cool about it. Nothing but love for the neighborhood! These guys have been holding it down forever and hella support Balboa and the neighborhood. Definitely worth the wait!!!
author: Chris M.

description:
Yum Yum Yummy Yummy Yum. The hot sandwiches here are so good! 

Plus good tip, if you ever need to serve a big group of ppl with lunch, this is a great option. They have delivered sandwiches to CCSF and our office uses Roxies all the time! We've used Roxies to order over 50 sandwiches! And the kids we serve it to LOVE IT. We order the typical cold sandwich selections: ham, turkey, roast beef and vegetarian. 

Five stars! for the convenience, reasonable prices and punctual delivery and of course...THE YUMMY SANDWICHES.
author: Jen L.

description:
Roast beef with pepper jack on Dutch crunch bread with everything.  Don't forget the jalapenos!  Oh, and toasted please :)  Now, THAT's a sandwich made in Heaven...

I don't have to be a professional food critic or food connoisseur, nor do I have to travel the globe, to know when I've found a really great sandwich.  Even to call Roxie's sandwiches "great" is an understatement.  Their sandwiches are exquisite, one of a kind, phenomenal, out of this world.  No sandwich in the nation - maybe even on the planet - can compare.  Maybe that's why I've been coming here for the past 8 years.

What makes Roxie's sandwiches so delicious you ask?  In my opinion, they got it all right, on point.  They have the perfect balance of bread, meat, cheese, veggies, and pickles & jalapenos.  The toasted Dutch crunch bread has the perfect ratio of outer crunch to inside moistness and chewiness.  The amount of melted cheese is perfect - not too much to make you feel like you're going to need Gas X for the next few hours, nor not too little to make you think, "Hello? Are you in there cheese?"  No single ingredient overpowers the others.  I admit, I'm not much of a pickle or mustard lover, but here at Roxies, I get it all.  It's that good, and these guys seriously have it together.  They surely know what they're doing, and they've been doing it right for decades.

San Franciscans, if you have not experienced the awesome goodness of Roxies, I'm sorry to say that you are not yet a true SF patron.  So, go to Roxies and make it official already! :)

You haven't had a real sandwich until you've had Roxies.  Trust me!  This place is by far my favorite sandwich place of all time.  I love you Roxies!
author: Brenda R.

description:
I've had better sandwiches (i.e. freddies and little lucas)

Roxie's sandwiches are pact full of meat, great sauce and jam packed with loads of condiments. I love how their sandwiches are so huge, but taste-wise, i've definitely had better. Maybe it's the combination of the goodies between the dutch crunch bread, but it just didn't float my boat... i think a second visit maybe in order to settle this 3 star debate. 

anyways, the store looks crappy, the guys are friendly and the sandwiches are a bit pricey IMO. it's definitely worth a try if you are trying to find your sandwich niche...

i'll keep you guys posted about the very soon second visit! this is also going on my default eats list! check it out! :D
author: Alex C.

description:
The real San Francisco Treat is a Roxie's Sandwich.  I grew up eating these sandwiches and now my kids are growing up eating them as well.  I absolutely love the dutch crunch bread and depending on my mood I would get either a meatball on provolone, turkey on swiss or a pastrami with jack.  it's a small place so call in your order and pick it up.  

** Roxie's Sandwich The San Francisco Treat ** Ding **
author: Michelle D.

description:
I've been coming here since I was 10 years old.  Simply the best. During the summer, I ride my motorcycle here from the financial district during lunch (phone in my order, of course) because the trip is absolutely worth it. 

Epic sandwiches.
author: Jorge S.

description:
I wanted to like this place, I really did - good ratings, word of mouth raves, etc. However, the fact that a) this place is very out of the way and b) the line is slow even when it's not long kind of killed it for me. They make decent sandwiches, that's for sure, but nothing that I would want to drive all the way back here for.

I ordered the Simon's Special on dutch crunch - a good sandwich with thinly sliced pastrami, turkey, and it's warm with gooey cheese. Definitely hits the spot when you're craving a well crafted sandwich that isn't from a oversized supermarket chain deli. While the sandwich is definitely the best place about here, it wasn't good enough for me to put up with the slow sandwich making and the very long drive. And you can't exactly eat your sandwich there (it's literally a corner store) - I saw people standing in the streets or sitting in their cars eating their sandwiches.

If I were in the neighborhood or hanging out with friends who wanted to eat here, I wouldn't hesitate to go, but on my own, I'd think twice.
author: Katherine P.

description: Maybe this is a good place for the area but not good when comparing to SF as a whole. $11 for Tri top sandwich that was good but not great. There is no place to sit, it is a crowded, tight corner store.
author: Peter S.

description:
Maybe I'm biased,  because I've been eating here since I was 4 or 5 years old, but this is THE BEST place around to get a sandwich. The best part about it is how small and cramped it is. I always end up meeting cool people while waiting in line, and then I rush out of there with my sandwich because I cannot wait even a minute before I have a bite. I don't think I have ever left Roxies without at least one bite taken from my sandwich before the car has even started. 

It can be a little intimidating with all of the people in line and not really being able to see the sandwich maker you're talking to behind the glass and chip/candy racks. It's my FAVORITE place.
author: Jaime S.

description: I only get the crab salad sandwich here. Bf tried the pastrami but always goes back to crab. Yes, it's imitation crab but something about it has that craving factor. You know those foods that you just crave sometimes because it left an impression for whatever reason. It's definitely unhealthy because so much mayo but sooo good how they make it. I knocked a star off because the deign of the store is not like I've ever seen. It's a corner liquor store, when you go in, there's a huge rack in the middle and you go around it from the left side there's snacks and things against the wall. When you get around to the back there's some beer and drinks and on the right side is where the magic happens. Sandwich makers are there waiting to take your order. I noticed their dirty rag they use for the cutting board which kind of turned me off one time. Made me wonder if they pass the health inspection okay. But if I just rate the sandwich it would be a solid 4! With the cleanliness, it would probably come down to a 3. But that's why it's a neighborhood sandwich shop and local I guess.
author: Christina P.

description:
Service: 4/5
Food: 4/5
Wait: 3/5
Price: $$
Portions: 3/5
Presentation of food: 4/5
Presentation of restaurant: 3/5
Overall: 4/5

THEY GOT SOME BOMB ASS SANDWICHES, I USUALLY GET: TURKEY WITH EVERYTHING ON IT BESIDES PICKLES + JALEPENOS. BUT THEY'VE BEEN REALLY STINGY WITH THEIR PORTIONS NOW. IT SEEMS ALOT LESS THAN BEFORE, THE BREAD PORTION IS SMALLER AS WELL TO THEREFORE YOUR ENTIRE SANDWICH IS SMALLER TOO.
author: Eva H.

description: This is the best sandwich place in San Francisco, California. The sandwiches are so good and there healthy because they put vegetables and I hate vegetables but they are so good
author: Samuel B.

description:
I love Roxies!
Roast beef & provolone on dutch crunch toasted with everything MMMmmmmmmm THE BEST!!
author: Alyssa S.

description: Roxie's is my favorite place to get sandwitches. From the outside it looks like any other deli or corner store to grab something quick. I grew up in the area and have been going to Roxie's for 20 years and the quality has always been excellent. It's a great place to grab a few sandwitches and head out to a day at the beach, a ball game or whatever. This isn't a sit down type of place, it's best to get the sandwitches for takeout. I've heard of several football teams in the area ordering from Roxie's and everyone I've taken has liked it. The Roxie Supreme is huge, so if you have a big appetite I recommend that one, if you just want to try it get a Junior sandwitch, for me it's still big -- so you might have some left overs. Love this place!
author: Ivannia D.

description:
Great sandwiches and friendly neighborhood staff.   

Very small/cramped space.  You really have to squeeze/dodge to get into the place if there is any sort of line, and most times there is a line on account of the sandwiches being so good.  Sometimes, I've stuck my head in the door saw a long line and then walked away--if not for the line+cramped quarters, I'd likely give Roxie five stars.

Plenty of neighborhood flavor to look at while you wait.
author: Drew D.

description: These guys always come through.  They're like the hometown heros for San Francisco sandwich making.  Not only that but they have a secret sandwich called the Samoan Mafia (meatballs and sour cream - yes that's right).  AND - i think they may just have the best veggie sandwich in SF.  I mean - it's got this warm and vinegary/sweet bean salad on the sandwich with artichokes too.....and melted cheese.  GET SOME!  I SAID GET SOME!
author: Jenn B.

description:
ahhh Roxie's.... the local liquor store deli. your like the girl next door that grew up to be really pretty and believed all the hype. 

she makes a great sandwich...but she read her 600+ reviews on Yelp and jacked up the price. kinda wack. 

nonetheless, I'll still swing by when I'm craving a good sandwich.
author: W R.

description: Meet the owner, Simon, the nicest person.  The employees, too.  It must be that they bring a little happiness in this world with their sandwiches.  You feel like you're visiting family.  He'll introduce you to his proud son and the neighborhood's athletes who have gone to bigger (NFL drafts) things. Choosing a sandwich is like choosing what to wear in the morning.  I ordered a meatball sandwich and of course, it melts in your mouth.  I got a complimentary sample of Simon's special (Turkey and Pastrami with melted cheese).  It hit the spot since I was starving.  It's just nice to be in the neighborhood!
author: Helen L.

description: Having now consumed several, I now declare Roxie's Tri Tip sammie to be The Best Sammie in the City. There are some great contenders, some close calls, but nothing else quite compares to Roxie's Tri Tip, the way they make it.
author: Lisa M.

description: I LOVE LOVE LOVE LOVE this place! I've tried many different sandwiches but they are all hard to compare. They all have their own unique taste but no doubt about ROXIE's being my favorite!! :)
author: Annie V.

description:
I had to rewrite my review!  I haven't had a Roxie sandwich in years and man was it good.  I don't remember which one I had but it made me want to try every sandwich in there!  

Roxie Food Center, I apologize for my initial review.  You rock!
author: Eleanor L.

description: Moved from SF a while ago and nothing makes me want to hop on a plane more than the thought of dominating a Meatball Mafia.  Every sandwich is unreal.  I have still never had a sandwich like to date and probably will never.  I will see you soon delicious liquor store/sandwich shop.  This October to be exact and I plan on purchasing every sandwich on the menu to bring to Hardly Strictly Bluegrass Festival.
author: Peter B.

description: It dosen't matter what sandwich you order...You will win every time. The dutch crunch is really where it's at though.Just walking in to Roxie, the aroma of the bread hits you like a delicious wall. If I go in for simply a soda, I might end up hypnotized by the smell alone and walk out with one of the best sandwiches EVER! If you don't know, now you know.
author: Mel Z.

description:
For the record, I want to give this place a 4.5 stars but can't have everything we want, can we? =P

Anyways....

Checked out this place today in response to a review I did for Ike's Place. (http://www.yelp.com/biz/ikes-place-san-francisco) First off, I like how Roxie is in a fairly secluded place. You wouldn't expect to find a great sandwich place in a grocery store. This made the whole experience that more intriguing, making me wonder more how great of a sandwich it could be. I must say that they did not disappoint. I ordered a hot Roxie Special on Dutch Crunch and I was pleased with the results. The flavors of the meats and condiments really worked well together with the bread. The guy who rang me up was very friendly and chatted it up with some of his regular customers. Though it took a little while for the sandwich to be made, it was definitely worth it. 

This place is no Ike's, which I still stand by is one of the best places in the city but Roxie is a place everyone should check out.
author: Jonathan L.

description: Fan for life just giving proprs to my old stomping grounds growiong up as a kid. brought my son here for the 1st time yesterday and his picture will be on the wall very soon. Don't sleep support your local business'
author: Richard G.

description:
Dutch crunch, provolone, all the fixings incl. jalepenos, pastrami AND heated up. *drool* This place is AWESOME. I come here and get the SUPER, and yes, i do share it even though i think i could eat a super by myself. The sandwich is awesome toasty warm. To make sure YOU can have the full 100% experience i recommend eating the sandwich at the following places (roxie's does not have seating unfortunately).
- Bus stop across the street
-Baseball field a 1/2 block away
- half in/ half hang out of your car (you dont want dutch crunch crumbs in there do you??) 

Its best to call ahead your order unless you like waiting 10-15 min to get your sandwich made.
author: Julie F.

description: Awesome staff. The sandwhiches are amazing.. better than togos and quiznos combined. The bread is super fresh and the meat is out of this world. If ever in the area.. go.
author: Sunni B.

description:
I HEART ROXIE'S SANDWICHES!!!!!

Depending on the meat you like, get that with additionals! My personal favorite, Salami with everything on it and add avocados on soft roll. Sometimes i'll switch it up a bit and get it on dutch crunch roll.

MMMmMmmm is all I can say when i hear about the sandwiches here. ;)
author: Nancy N.

description:
Judging from the outside....you never would think that this corner market/liquor store would make such delicious sandwiches.

I typically order a Junior Turkey with Provolone on Dutch Crunch. Always make sure that you get your sandwich heated in the toaster. It makes a HUGE difference.

The sandwiches come in 3 sizes....but I find that the Junior is more than enough for me. The best thing about this place is that you can pick up a sandwich here...and its still delicious even a few hours after you bought it.

There is usually a line during the lunch rush....I recommend calling in with a phone order to save some time.
author: Lester W.

description:
the sandwich in the game has been picking up for the past 10 years or so, with ike's, numerous banh mi spots, pal's, the rise of tortas, and the other fancier spots.  this is probably due to the economy too.

but you have to go back to one of the sf originals, roxie's on san jose.  i always get the veggie heated on dutch crunch.  dont get it twisted, this veggie packs a punch.  they put a bean salad in there that adds the right amount of sweetness.  this is a good healthy sandwich that will make you full.

the other sandwiches with meat are very good, esp. the turkey club, but i always get the veggie here.  bomb.
author: o g.

description:
When it comes to sandwiches, Roxie's does not mess around. Seriously, all I can say is that you will find sandwich heaven. Whenever I had time between classes I would walk the overpass with a certain glee in my step. Images of toasty, crunchy bread and melted, stringy cheese , and hot meatball sauce enticing me the entire way. The regular size sandwich is just a bit much for one sitting, so unless you want leftovers go with the junior size.

My usual was a junior meatball sandwich on a toasted dutch crunch, with provolone cheese, and everything on it. The ultimate brain food, in my opinion.  Yes I know, technically meatball sandwiches do not equal brain food. 

But imagine this: you are up late, attempting to glue together two pieces of foam core for the fifth time in a row, your sanity is out the window, and you find yourself talking to your project, and it's responding back. 
You are way past the sleepy-yawning-nodding off stage, the exhaustion is deep. You don't even feel your body, except for the slight tingle in your stomach telling you that some food might be a good idea. You just might find yourself reaching for that leftover Roxie sandwich that's carefully nestled in your bag.  One bite of this lovingly crafted meal to-go and you just might reconsider; meatball sandwich=brain food. Yes- that makes perfect sense, perfect sense.
author: X marks the spot ..

description:
I feel like a beached whale.. 

Someone please roll me to the computer...

Ok.. i'm ready now..   ugh.. 

I just ate my reg Hot Pastrami w/ Pepper Jack on Dutch Crunch..  I'm 'bout to pass the eff out. They had the perfect amount of pastrami, veggies, cheese, and sauces. Crumbs were falling, juice and sauces were squeezing out, but I managed to keep my sandwich intact. Halfway through I thought I felt a fart coming, but it dissipated, so I continued eating until I could no longer stuff the sandwich in my mouth. 

Rewind to 30 minutes ago.. I was getting hungry and no one was responding to my desperate texts. Sadly, I wondered where I would go by myself. I can enjoy eating alone, but I'm not a fan of eating dinner by myself at a restaurant. It just seems odd to me. So, I rummaged the house looking for the take out menu that I'd picked up from the railing outside, but it was nowhere to be found. And then.. it hit me.. the craving for a good ass sandwich. E and I had driven by Roxie's recently and he had pointed it out to me. For some reason I thought it was closer to Ocean Ave. I had heard so many good things, but had never been by. Wasn't much of a line, but there was a continuous flow of people. Just as I was about to get my sandwich, my phone goes off. It's my friend.. too late... Oh well, at least I have my sandwich.. 

The cashier guy was pretty funny and talkative. But I didn't really want to chit-chat too long.. I eyed my sandwich lovingly and hissed at him, and he inched away slowly..

Kinda like Little Lucca's only pricier and smaller in size  -- can't beat that, but it is closer to home. 

4 sandwiches!
author: Donna H.

description:
I have never had a sandwich that has lived up to one by Roxie's. And you will not know what a real sandwich is until you have been here.

I've been coming here since I was in grade school. It started one summer, when my cousins and I began taking lessons at the swimming pool across the street. We'd stop by Roxie's to get two sandwiches to share between the four of us. I have very good childhood memories of Roxie's, the big man who'd always be slicing lettuce on the big machine near the register, the police who'd stop by the chit chat, the old ladies who came by to pick up small groceries, and the regulars who craved a sandwich by Roxie's.

It's so rare to find a place that offers Dutch Crunch bread, I discovered  as I was trying out other sandwich places. No other warm, toasty bread with melted cheese and a heaping of meat could satisfy me like this little store on San Jose Ave.
author: Selina C.

description: Still loving Roxie! I had the roast beef, american, and avocado on toasted dutch crunch with lettuce, tomato, onion, pickle, jalapeno's, mustard and mayo. It had been over a year since I had one so I savored every precious morsel.  I didn't even give a shit about all the mess I had made while eating it. I had to get out of the car and shake myself clean and wipe the avodaco and onions off of my face. I didn't even care who saw me!  It's still my favorite! Seriously- these are the best sandwiches EVER! I challenge anyone to find a better spot!
author: Yvonne C.

description:
I LOVE ROXIES!!!! 
we go here all the time for lunch and it never seizes to amaze me! especially since they toast the sandwiches, got to love that! 
i get the Roxie Special and it is the BEST!!!! a def must try! We usually fax over our order or call it in before we pick it up because this place gets PACKED!
author: Coco R.

description: This isn't the classiest place to get dinner but damn it the sandwiches are delicious. Sandwiches are the only kind of food that you can eat at any time of day. Any breakfast foods is acceptable as well. This place is a liquor store, but it's all good because they know what they're doing when it comes to making sandwiches. I ordered the tri-tip sandwich on dutch crunch because, honestly, is there any other kind of bread that could elevate a sandwich to a heavenly level?! The answer is no. The meat was surprisingly tasty. Let's be honest, I didn't have high expectations for this place. I mean, tri-tip from a liquor store? Girl please. Anyways, if you haven't been here, give this place a go.
author: Lauren L.

description:
Located across Balboa Park, an extremely busy alternative liquor store, mostly known for delicious sandwiches, booze and the gangster, rim and big booty magazines that pull you in.

This place is awesome, I usually get a juicy, tongue satisfying junior Tuna sandwich on dutch crunch with American cheese, everything, but no PICKLES! Perfecto. Priced at about $5.50. The Junior is the smallest sandwich, but can fill up even Rosie O'Donnell's monstorous appetite. Now just imagine how big the Senior sandwich is, and how big three Rosie O' Donnells' appetite would be.

...but I never have sandwiches here without my lovely lady, Chow Mein Ninja I. She loves the sandwiches here (and off course chow mein and ninjas). She always get the warm welcome when we visit this establishment, never me though. 

"Haaah! Nice to see you guys. it's the Beauty and the Beast," (refering to Sani as the beast.) Haha Nice guy.

So eat Happy at Roxies and make sure to have jalapenos on your sandwich.
author: Sani S.

description:
Me: What's the difference between a regular and a super?
Guy: *Holds up two hunks of bread*
Me: *Looks at the super* DAMN! That's huge! Wait...Actually, I think I've had a sandwich that size before.
Guy: Really? Where?
Me: Little Lucca's in South City. I actually finish them in one sitting.
Guy: No way! Serious?
Me: Hell Yeah!!!


Today, I think I might have damaged myself playing dodgeball and drinking a "few" brewskies over at Balboa Park. It was fun. A couple hours of senseless violence that was displayed through the launching of rubber balls at peoples heads and other extremities. I threw like a girl because my repaired right shoulder still doesn't have 100% strength. Which meant I was out a few times and couldn't really hit anyone. I was still able to catch the ball but what fun is that, right?

So after the games, we decided to walk over to Roxies, a place I know of by name but not by consumption. You walk in and the first thing you notice is how tiny the place is. Typical deli/corner store style place. The walls are fridges for drinks and maybe a freezer. One wall is where the food and deli counter is. Simple and easy and works great. So I order the Roxie special. Had a nice conversation with the guy and then with a lady that worked there that knew the original owners of Little Luccas. Since the place was kinda tight, we ordered and waited outside for them to get done after paying for them.

What we weren't expecting was a free show. Almost like something out of Cops! Freaking hilarious shit! This skinny bony dude walks in and orders a sandwich and is leaving the store after paying for it. Then this other guy on a bike, kinda heavy set and looking kinda out of it starts talking shit to the skinny guy. Skinny dude walks backwards across two cross walks while talking smack back at bike guy, navigating their way through on coming traffic. Eventually, the guy with the bike came back and decided to tell us the reason why without much prodding from us. It turns out the skinny dude broke into bike guy's mom's house. Small world...Apparently too small...

So after the drama ended with a fizzle, our sandwiches slowly got done and we picked them up in order. After we got the food, we turned our attention the park and sat on the grass. The sandwich was amazing! The meats and the surprising melted goodness of American cheese on the sandwich was incredible! It's been a while since I've had American cheese. I never knew it could taste this good melted and on fine Italian deli meats. So we all ate and knocked back a few more brews before heading our own separate ways. 

Now that I know that they make good sandwiches, I will be back to the other selections they have on their menu. Maybe even try my hand at attacking the super sized one. I know I shouldn't but it might happen. It'll be like the Arby's Olympics all over again...
author: Anthony L.

description:
yummy yum.  yum is my answer. :)

This is a sandwich place within a grocery.  I didn't expect a service.  However, the cashier was very accomodating.  food yum yum.  5X better than quizno, 10X better than subway.  3X better than specialty sandwich shops.  yum yum.  

Only sandwich shop that I'm willing to travel. :)
author: E P.

description:
This is the best, BEST, and AGAIN, THE BEST SANDWICH place in SF!

Oh, my god! I usually eat their sandwich with dutch crunch.
Just thinking about it, I want the sandwich NOW!

Their sauce or mayo or whatever they do.
It just works! and works SOOOOOOOO well and addictive!

It's actually good the place is far from my home because otherwise I will eat their sandwich too often and become a balloon!

My co-worker used buy their sandwich for me because he lived near there. Then when I visit the place by myself one day because my co-worker quit working with us and I missed their sandwich sooo much, I was quite surprise the place is just a corner store! I couldn't believe they make such a great and fabulous sandwich out of the small place like that!

Love you guy~s! I will be back sooooon.
author: Green Mango Y.

description:
I am now receiving treatment for my addiction to Roxie's sandwiches.  I grew up mere blocks from this dingy little liquor store/deli so I basically came out of the womb eating Roxie's. 

Word of advice: ALWAYS call in your order 10 min before you get there.  

There is nowhere to wait if you walk in place your order.   This place can get crazy busy (especially when school is in session (there are at least 5 schools within a couple blocks radius).  If you call in and an older sounding woman picks up the phone just hang up and try back in a few minutes.  The person who answers the phone is the person making your sandwich, and she is super stingy.

If you called in, when you get there just saunter on up to the register and tell him "pastrami on the phone" (or whatever you ordered).  Unless the other patrons physically have sandwiches in their hands and the cashier is actively helping them, there is no one in line.  You can waste a lot of time in there 'waiting in line' when all you've been doing is standing around with all the suckas who didn't call in their order.

I always get the hot pastrami on soft Spanish roll (I know everyone sings the praises of the dutch crunch, but unlike you folks I like the roof of my mouth uninjured, so I go with the soft Spanish roll, kind of like a Cuban roll; soft on the inside and crunchy crusty on the outside).  Hot pastrami on soft Spanish with with everything, extra pickles, add avocado, with provolone or pepper jack.   

True New Yorkers would weep at what we do to Pastrami here, but its is the best California style pastrami sandwich around.  I personally don't really dig NY pastrami because its not cut thin enough, and I don't really need to be eating four inches of stacked pastrami on boring ass rye bread.  

I have tried the Roxie special which I don't believe to showcase Roxie's deli skills, I have had an awesome tuna melt  on the aforementioned roll with extra pickles, jalapenos, and of course, avocado.  The veggie sandwich is the shit too, with your choice of cheese; they automatically add the avocado for you on this one, plus marinated mushrooms, artichokes, bean salad, plus all the other sandwich goodies.  

I now live in the sunset so I don't eat them nearly as often, but Roxie's IS the premier SF sand which joint.  The location on 9th and Kirkham is aiight, but if you want to do it right, get your over to San Jose ave., and call in 10 min before you get there.
author: Emily X.

description:
I grew up in West Portal and figured the sub center was the best sandwich in San Francisco.  While I can still afford the sandwiches in the big WP, the houses are far too expensive for me, so now I live in Mission Terrace.  

Enter Roxy's.  These sandwiches are incredibly good.  You might not know it from the outside, because it just looks like an ordinary liquor store.  However, this liquor store sells tennis balls and excellent sandwiches, two things that may come in handy next to a nicely refurbished balboa park.  

Quick hint: do not try to play tennis or any other sport for at least 4 hours after eating one of these sandwiches.  Unless you plan to eat vast quantities or split one, just get the small.  Then you could play tennis after maybe 2 hours.
author: Geoffrey B.

description: Probably the best sandwich I ever had. I had the turkey club on a regular basis when I worked close to there and it is excellent. Granted there is no place to sit but they are quick behind the counter and quite reasonably priced. I don't make it out there that much anymore but really need to go back because as I am writing this review, my craving for the turkey club is growing. I should stop before I get in my car and have a second dinner.
author: Chris D.

description:
I've been going to this place for 6 years now but I've lived in the area my whole life!  Why did I not know about this place sooner??  I do not know.  The sandwiches are super super delicious.  I either get the Roast Beef on dutch (no pickles, no mustard and extra jalepenos) or a deviled egg sandwich...mmmm....

The dutch crunch bread is just like the good old days!  Don't forget to have it toasted!  5 stars for this place.

Tip: Call in your order so that once you get there you go straight to the counter, let them know what you ordered, get it bagged and pay!
author: Mary-Anne C.

description:
About a 4.5. 

It didn't amaze me, but it was still a very good sandwich, and I love that in the era (and area) of small portions, you can get a ridiculously-sized Super sandwich. 

My favorite part about this place is the general unpretentious feel. Despite the fact that it's regularly rated on Yelp as the top restaurant in SF or 2nd best (behind Gary Danko), there are no "People Love Us on Yelp" stickers, Zagat, CitySearch awards, or anything.

But the walls are far from empty. Instead, the walls are lined with recognitions from local organizations for their numerous charitable efforts.


Roxie is totally out of place in San Francisco, and I love it.
author: Mark A.

description: A bit overrated. Had the simon. The taste was fine. But where was the beef. The meat portion was a little light considering what they charged for a regular sized sando.
author: Aj S.

description: just finished my sandwich literally like 10 minutes ago. The tri-tip sandwich on toasted dutch crunch is bomb! I also tried the turkey but a little too cheesy. This is definitely a to go sandwich joint when I'm craving for a flavorful toasted sub. If you're on a diet though, this isn't the place for you their sandwiches are pretty greasy! soo not good for my waistline =X but definitely a very satisfying sandwich!
author: A L.

description: If you never been here, try the hot pastrami on dutch crunch, it's what I always order and never fails to satisfy me. The good thing about this place too, is you can order over the phone.
author: ben s.

description:
I went to Roxie Food Center based on what was being said here on yelp.  I decided to go and try the BBQ Beef and the Pastrami, both on Dutch Crunch rolls.  The BBQ Beef was very good - I really liked how the BBQ sauce made the sandwich nice and saucy.  The Pastrami was a little bit of a disappointment to a girl used to the fresh pastrami from Katz's Deli in NYC.  It was pretty good, though a little on the dry side.   

The toasting of the bread was a big plus.  My only complaint is with the lack of a menu that tells you which toppings are included and what cheeses they have on hand.  I felt a little lame asking them, although they were nice about it.  Overall, I think these were very good sandwiches, though not quite the best I've ever have (that would have to be Little Lucca in SSF).
author: Angela H.

description:
Ditto Euge l

ask to have the sammy heated/toasted...even better!
author: A P.

description:
Yum. Yum. ...and more Yum. 

On our mission to find really good sandwiches in the month that all we wanted were sandwiches, we re-discovered Roxie's. I used to live pretty close to this fine establishment, and remembered how yummy the hot sandwiches were. We went back.

Upon going back, we realized that the regular sized sandwiches are huge, stick with the smallest size and you won't feel over-full afterward. 

The bread is good, i like the dutch crunch. The meat isn't anything special, but it's fresh and weighed, so its the same every time, no matter who's behind the counter. The topper is that they toast the sandwiches - the bread with the meat and the cheese. The result is pure deliciousness. 

The fact that it's also a corner store makes adding chips, drinks and candy easy. Next time we're craving sandwiches, we're coming back here.
author: kristen b.

description:
The sandwiches are excellent. People lined up out the door. Nice and toasty breads. And Simon and crew remember you forever. Anything with Dutch Crunch bread is good! I used to go when they only had 2 ovens and a Mr. Slushee machine.

Cons: Pricy nowadays, Regulars used to be $3.25. I wonder if they still blame it on the price of bread. And not that anybody buys it, but some of their actual grocery stuff is ancient and expired.
author: ToAsTy T.

description:
Where do I start with Roxies..... I've been coming here since i was a child. Yea it's a freakin hole in the wall liquor store/ deli but there sandwiches are one of the best that I've eaten. 

I'm more of a hot sandwich person so i order the hot pastrami on dutch crunch with peppercino's and extra garlic sauce. It is horrible for your breath but are sooOoOooo Good! 

I would most definately call in my order though cause this place gets pretty packed. But all in all Roxies is still once of the best.
author: Nette A.

description:
I know that I could legally marry a man now in California...can I legally marry a sandwich? (--- Edit since Nov. 4.  I guess I can't legally marry a man anymore, but the joke is still funny---)

my roxie story (abridged):

I had just moved to San Francisco a month ago.  I wanted a sandwich (desperately!)  I went on Yelp.  The best sandwich place I could find was called ROXIE!!  I looked at the address..."that can't be right, that's right on the corner...there isn't a restaurant there...wtf?"  

I read a little more...

"You mean the most legendary sandwich in SF is at a convenience store less than 2 blocks away?!?  Gotta check it out!"

I enter the store...

"8 bucks seems steep for an 8 inch sandwich...that's like a dollar an inch.  this better be one bomb-ass sandwich!"

I get my sandwich, go home, and take bite...

"OH GOD!!! OH GOD!!! IT'S SO GOOD!!! MY BRAIN IS GOING TO EXPLODE!!"

I digest, I wait a few hours, I go to Roxie and get another sandwich.  NO JOKE!!

worth every penny and more!  Wanted to subtract a star over the price issue, but my stomach will not let me.

LOVE THIS PLACE!
author: Garrett C.

description:
I'm somewhat of a regular at Roxie's for the past 7-8 years, maybe 12-14 times a year.

First parking is hard to find. 
Roxie's is small, dark and almost always busy. A 10-15 minute wait.
Hands down the BEST sandwich I've ever had. 

I don't care about the parking, or the wait..............just get my order right.

Just came back from Roxie's and they got the order wrong AGAIN!!!
It seems like they get the orders wrong 30% of the time.

I was the only customer, so there should be no excuse why my order was wrong, except the guy was too busy talking to his co-workers to make the correct sandwich. 

I always leave a tip because I'm sure they don't get rich working there, but that ended today. 

The customer service leaves a lot to be desired, but when made correctly....it's an excellent sandwich.
author: Steve K.

description:
Yeah, yeah, I'm jumping on a Yelp bandwagon by reviewing this place.  Believe me, as a web developer I'm all too aware how a quirk in the algorithm can promote some place to the top of the list on the front page, causing everyone to go check it out, causing its number of reviews to go up, causing more people to go, etc.  Internet popularity is a funny phenomena.

But I'm not (just) coming here because of that.  I'll have you know that I've taken a keen interest in the Ocean Ave/Excelsior area since I moved to the city and noticed it was conspicuously missing from pretty much all neighborhood-by-neighborhood guides of any sort (including *ahem* Yelp).  And besides, Roxie is only 7 minutes from my house (two rock songs), so I qualify as a local.

I had heard of the crowds, so I phoned in my order *and* picked it up at 11:20, so I got right in and out.  I have to say that a liquor-store-cum-sandwich shop sounds awfully sketch on paper, but in practice it's brilliant!  Somehow the whole experience is more fun when there are rows and rows of dusty (and mostly flask-sized) liqour bottles behind the guy making your sandwich.  Could I get that sandwich toasted, and with a pint of SoCo? Nice.

As I walked out I noticed that this is right across the street from Balboa Park.  Mental note: I gotta get around to checking that place out.  Will start with Yelp-assisted recon, of course.

Anyway, the sandwich turned out to be fantabulous, especially the Dutch Crunch bread.  (I had the Roxie special, by the way.)  Definitely tied for best SF sandwich so far, along with Estella's, but whereas Estella's sandwiches are fresh, airy, and bright, these are packed with soul, but not in a too-greasy or messy way.
