Essential for the sandwich lovers, and not just a one-Yelp wonder.
author: Wes M.

description:
dang how did i not know about this place growin' up not only in sf but close to this hood!!!!!

DAMN GOOD!!!!!    great spot to pick up a hot sandwich for a picnic down hwy. 1.........  tiny neighborhood corner store deli that always seems to have a line....  don't think i want to go there when i'm starving & need to eat NOW.......

only had 1 sandwich so far......but very promising.......

chicken avocado w/ provolone & everything on it on a spanish roll.  will come back to try many more hot sandwiches...........on dutch crunch.........would love to try their potato salad......
author: Cindi N.

description:
Look the sandwiches are great when certain employees make them, there are three guys there that make them great, but here is the problem. They have these other employees there that are terrible, when u call in an order there is atittude and secondly not always made like u asked of them. Especially the lil fat short ass old bitch that answers the phone like a man and goes on full speed ahead making sandwiches with out washing her hands after everyone grabs that phone rubs there nose. I've told them about her and she's still being a asshole. One night with my lady i damn near went back out to my car to get something because these lil assholes making the food were laughing and sniggling like a couple of bitches talking about people and dont realize customer can hear them like the night my lady walked out mad and crying because these assholes were talking about her nose when just 4 days previous she had been in a big car accident with a 1.5" shard of glass just puncturing her nose and a stop sign pole missing her head by 1 foot, when i asked her did i do something wrong she said those guys and that old ugly bitch  talking about her nose and laughing not realizing that she heard everything. When i got to my trunk my lady convinced me to leave.
DISRESPECTFUL BUNCH OF FREINDS AND FAMILY BUSINESS!
author: keepit r.

description: Mafia meatball sandwich is crazy good!!!!
author: Bruce A.

description:
Food Rating: 5/5 (in terms of just sandwhiches) 
Price/Value: 4/5

I learned about this place over 12 years from my brother when I used to live in San Francisco. It's a convenient store and doesn't even look like it sells such yummy sandwhiches on the outside. 

My usual order is the "roast beef junior sandwhich, with DUTCH CRUNCH bread, and swiss cheese, toasted." I can't emphasize enough about the DUTCH CRUNCH BREAD, this bread is what makes the sandwhich!! I've never found a place that makes such great dutch crunch. Where do they get it?  I live in san jose and I can't find a place that sells really good sandwhiches. When I go to the city, this place is one of the places I suggest for quick, fast and cheap.

The sandwhich is better toasty. the dutch crunch is crispy and delicious. you can customize it and tell them you don't want pickles or add some pepper etc.  There are lots of other meats, like meatballs, turkey, etc.

If you do decide to go here, don't expect to dine in, you usually just order your sandwhich and go home. They don't have any tables and chairs to sit around. 

I love Roxy's sandwhich's!!
author: Mae L.

description: I've never had a better toasted roast beef sandwich on dutch crunch ever! And I eat a lot of sandwiches from other places and nothing compares to Roxies. I've been coming out here since I was in middle school going to the Balboa Swimming pool across the street. Although the prices have gone up, the taste and satisfaction has not. Best thing to do is call ahead before ordering, so that you can just walk up to the front and pick up instantly. Otherwise, you are waiting for about 10 mins after you have placed your order.
author: Jeff C.

description:
They have a decent veggie option. Lots of cheese, avocado and string beans, a single garbanzo and some canned mushrooms. Bizarre but tasty all the same. Had a junior with everything on dutch toasted. Will get it with no bean salad, toasted bread but unmelted cheese and extra jalepenos next time. Took on an unpleasant sweet taste after sitting around for an hour but you know, hooray for veggie options!

I will say that when I used to eat meat I had an amazing turkey and salami  on dutch toasted with everything once. Roxies is way better than SF Meat.
author: Nadia P.

description:
From 5/16/06
It's places like this that restore my faith in humanity, in the Land of Mickey D's somewhere on Planet Starbucks there still exists humans not plugged directly into the Matrix. This is Zion for me; greasy, dusty bottles of liquor, enough black and white photos to tell 100 lifetimes, shelves so cramped you can barley turn around and the best sandwiches in the city. I'm awaiting one now and my stomach grumbles in hungry appreciation of that first bite of flaky dutch crunch, moist, freshly folded roast beef and crisp veggies, all perfectly spiced, oiled and condimented. Add some jalapenos and avocado and it is true bliss for the palette. 

   Grab an icy cold drink from the cooler in the back, a jr. (trust me your a jr.) sandwich of your choice, some white rabbits and sesame honey candies by the register and you have in your hands the perfect picnic. I type this with one mustard stained hand as my other clutches the remains of my poor desecrated sandwich. I'm being torn between half wanting to stuff it's remains into my gob in a explosion of rampant deliciousness and half wanting to savor each and every delicious nibble. Ahh let's here it for life's simple pleasures. The world almost seems a better place with my belly content and full. As i lick the last of the oil and vinegar from my lips and gum on my creamy white rabbit, i close my eyes and smile, ommmmmmm, as is bliss...
author: Artimus I.

description:
Coming home for the holidays means hitting up all of the foody gems that I hold close to my heart.  


Roxie's is one of thos places that only locals go.  GREAT, amazing, fabulous sandwiches!  Huge!  Good for lunch and dinner!

The dutch crunch is unbelievable and I'm a sourdough kindof girl.  I am hooked on the hot pastrami with melted american cheese (sounds a little gross to me normally) but it is sooo good!

If you are in San Francisco you would be missing out by not enjoying one of their mouth watering sandwiches!
author: Jennifer M.

description:
I'll take a table for two in the "I just don't get it" corner, please.

This place was recommended by a co-worker of mine and I saw that that it was very well-reviewed on Yelp.  So, the bf & I set sail for Balboa Park.  

Um, yeah, they're just sandwiches.  Mine I would give two stars and the bf said his got 3.5, hence the three rating.  I had pastrami on dutch crunch with some mustard.  The meat was dry and had the taste of some spice that I could not put my finger and do not wish to taste again.  Mustard on pastrami should be brown not yellow.  Personally, I believe yellow mustard should be outlawed.  The bf had turkey, bacon, lettuce & tomato on Spanish bread.  He asked for wheat but they don't have wheat rolls on Sunday just day old sliced wheat which I thought was weird.  

Not worth the trek to Balboa Park to stand in a cramped, dingy little place while you wait for a so-so sandwich.
author: Jeff P.

description:
If I didn't teach at the high school down the street, I would never know that this nondescript corner store actually produces some of the best sandwiches I've ever had.  It's tied with Genova Deli in Oakland for best veggie sandwich ever, I think . . .

When I first started teaching at Balboa, the principal ordered us (staff) Roxie's sandwiches for one of the teacher work days in late August right before the kids get here.  I was blown away at the deliciousness of the veggie sandwich on Dutch Crunch (I don't even know why they have any other kind of bread).  Most veggie sandwiches have lettuce, tomato, and cheese, pretty much, but the Roxie's veggie sandwiches come with all kinds of amazing things like three bean salad, marinated artichokes, and mushrooms (I get mine without mushrooms).  They make it slightly hot so the cheese melts but the whole sandwich isn't too hot--it is perfect.  The sandwiches are pretty huge; the smallest size (junior) is plenty for me.

The owners/people working there are so friendly and nice; if going to Roxie's every day wouldn't make me gain ten pounds, I definitely would!
author: Claire K.

description: By far the BEST SANDWICH on God's green earth! While I was at Stanford doing my Master's my girlfriend at the time lived a block and a half from Roxie and she introduced me to this place. I stop by every chance I get whenever I'm in the bay area. My favorite is the turkey avocado on dutch crunch, toasted of course.  I'm a huge fan of sandwiches and bread really makes the sandwich for me and you just can't beat Roxie's dutch crunch.  The bread is the bomb and a perfect compliment to the delicious meat.  Oh Roxie how I miss you so.  I'm gonna have to take a road trip up to The Sco just to hit up Roxie's and The House of Prime Rib.
author: Jesus P.

description:
i'm drooling before i even type this. 

a friend of mine hyped up this place a couple years ago, and i never got the chance to try until i moved to SF. 

HE WAS NOT LYING. 

i have no idea what makes these sandwiches so freaking delicious but they hit the spot every single time and they're HUGE. i go for the simon's special, which is pastrami and turkey on dutch crunch with everything [if you don't get everything on it, you're missing out]. what's even more awesome is you can walk around while they're making your sandwich and pick up any other necessities, ie drinks [i haven't seen the 1/2 ice tea 1/2 mango arizona ice tea anywhere else so far], chips, candy, milk, eggs, magazines full of skanky girls, or tampons just to name a few. 

the guys that work here have been nice every time i went, and last time i received a free piece of candy because he noticed the roomie and i eyeing it. awesome.
author: Angela L.

description:
Good sandwiches.  Not great, but good.

Their Dutch Crunch is AWESOME.  I dunno where they get it, but seriously, it's really f'in good - better than any other DC I've had thus far (and I've been  on a bit of a sandwich quest lately).  However, everything else about the sandwich was just good (but not great / awesome / omgwtfbbq).  Meat quality was nice, veggies a bit bland/limp, ratio of fillings:bread was okay.  Maybe I just needed a longer toast or something...  As someone else mentioned, they may have changed counterpeople not too long ago.

If I was hungry and in the area, I'd drop by, but otherwise I don't think I'd make the trip out there again just for their sandwiches.
author: T C.

description:
YUM! Going here for a sandwich is always a treat. Gotta love their veggie sandwiches. 

Grab one of those, pick out a drink, maybe some chips, take a seat in the park, and enjoy the day :)
author: Jillian J.

description:
They make the best sandwiches ever. A first glance, the menu may seem as if the sandwiches are expensive, but when you get it in your hands ready to eat you realize that it is well worth it. They stuff the most ingredients into a sandwich that i have ever seen from any sandwich shop, ever. they are very fulfilling, if you get a regular sized sandwich you may get full with half of it and save the other half for later, as i did. Great, fast, and friendly service.

I didn't give it 5 stars for one reson. The isles in the store are only about 2 feet wide, and its very hard to navigate around if there is more then 3 customers in the store (always) if you actually want to shop around, its extremely frustrating when you just want to grab a bag of chips and a soda to go with your sandwich
author: Eric N.

description:
Roxie's is the SHIT! Best sandwhiches in San Francisco hands down! I've been going there since I was a lil person and will never stray. I even got my boyfriend hooked! Turkey sandwhich on dutch crunch warmed up.... 

only downside it's super crowded BUT if you are smart place a call ahead order. =)
author: Lisette E.

description:
I am uber-biased to Roxies because I've been eating their sandwiches since the day I learned how to walk!  I live down the street and Tony, Peter, and Simon have watched generations of us grow up as we ordered our sandwiches weekly from them!  I still remember when a Junior sandwich was $2.50!

I've converted all my friends and even strangers to this infamous deli and never has anyone thought otherwise that their sandwiches are to die for!

I still order the same: junior roastbeef on dutch, cheddar cheese, everything on it but onions, pickles, and peppers.
author: Jen R.

description:
After some extensive research, I've concluded that Roxie's sandwiches are made from the following:

1)  deli meats
2)  deli cheeses
3)  vegetables
4)  sandwich bread, usually toasted
5)  condiments
6)  designer drugs

This is why they are as delicious and as addictive as they are.  


Roxie's Special on Dutch crunch with everything, hot.  Reckonize.
author: Caroline E.

description:
Man I've been coming here since I was in High school, that's 8 straight years almost!  Their the nicest and most genuine people around.  Their sandwiches are awesome.  Get the warm Dutch Crunch with anything.  I Love the Turkey Club with Avocado.  Before I discovered Ike's this was my favorite sandwich shop in the city, Definitely on par with some of the best sandwiches I ever had in my life.  

I would have to say they do have the best Crab Salad Sandwich in the bay.  I always call in, so I don't have to wait, but wouldn't mind going in and chatting with the workers.  This is one gem in my neighborhood I'm proud to represent.
author: J Y.

description: You have to go here.  Best sandwiches around.  small hole in the wall corner store with great food.  if you get there during lunch hour be prepared to wait outside the store, it gets really packed.    Dutch crunch pastrami is my choice.
author: Paul O.

description:
Simply stated, this place is a nice out of the sandwich shop that caters to the neighborhood as well as those outsiders that venture past the Balboa BART station and find themselves hungry on San Jose Avenue and craving a crispy sandwich. 

I give this place 5 out of 5 stars because it's just one of those places that has been making sandwiches and for reasonable prices for quite some time. Yes, yes, for the consummate food critic, this may not be the best place to order a prosciutto or some cured spiced exotic meat or turkey with cranberry with a slight hint of spicy Dijon but heck, it's a place with a lot of memories for a lot of folks and it's always been a place to get a great comfort sandwich!
author: Dorothy S.

description:
TOASTED DUTCH CRUTCH SANDWICHES!!!! YUMMM....

You drive up and wonder if you have the right spot. Yes it's a liquor store with a deli....I guess that's why it's called a food center. If I'm craving a good sandwich to go in SF, I'd definitely come here. I love how they have baby pics of their customers all on their walls. The guys who work here are cool cats.

There is usually a short line each time I go here. This is definitely a legendary place to grab a sandwich in SF on the go.

Solid 4.5 stars
author: Cathy D.

description: Subs are great, nice selection of drinks, store is a bit grimey & cramed but it's worth it though.
author: Matthew R.

description:
Classic Sandwich Spot in San Francisco 

I haven't been to this place in like a year but from what I can recall, this corner store makes one of the best if not - the best sandwiches in the city.  Great selection of meats, bread and condiments.  The prices have may feel alot but after eating your sandwich you're gonna feel that it was worth it.  Also the people there are pretty cool, I recommend checking it out.
author: Mario T.

description:
Yum Yum!  I didn't think I was that hungry when my friend brought me here but he convinced me to get the Regular Size Hot Patrami on Dutch Crunch.  Guess he was right cause I ended up scarfing it down quicker than him.  I've been here in the past but didn't make my way back again until recently.  Deli Sandwiches are definitely on my crave lists off and on and I will certainly try to put Roxie's into the rotation a little more often.  

Sandwich was $7.99.  They also have a mini size for a little less and a large size for a little more.  And the staff there were all very friendly...  

Thanks for that GREAT Sandwich Guys!
author: Mark W.

description: Been coming here for over 10 years and there is NO better place for sandwiches in the Bay Area (or the rest of the country for that matter).  Only real SF heads know about this spot!  I love other places too, but the pastrami w/ swiss on dutch crunch here blows all competitors away.  Pricey, but so are all the other good sandwich shops in town..you get what you pay for!!
author: Jeff M.

description: Roast beef w/avocado ,swiss cheese on italian bread,w/everything,hot = CRACK
author: A R.

description:
I love sandwiches like a basset hound loves cheese.  Slap something tasty between a couple of slabs of bread, and I'm there.

So when a friend told me about Roxie's, I hit them up post haste.  And boy, am I happy I did.  Their dutch crunch bread toasted is almost enough without any fillings. BUT OH MY GOD THE FILLINGS!

From their meatballs (massively yummy with provolone) to the Roxie Special (meat, meat and more meat, with cheese and veggies), I've never been even *mildly* disappointed.

Yes, it's a bit run-down and slummy, and you have to stand near the rack of hot-rod-and-porn mags while you wait. But it's 100% worth it.

Added bonus: British chocolates near the register. Hurrah for Maltesers!
author: Rod B.

description: Yuumm!!!! This place is so yummy! Little corner store, with friendly ppl and great sandwiches! I always get a jr turkey, avocado on a dutch crunch roll toasted. The prices are kinda high but hands down they are good!
author: Irma R.

description: Hands Down the Best Classic Sandwich in San Francisco. I enjoy the Roxie Club on extra sour with pepper jack and the works, heated. No Gimmicks, Simply great sandwiches made from the best and freshest ingredients.
author: Andres M.

description:
Seriously, this is my favorite sandwich place ever. I mean, good sizes, packed full of everything wonderful and delicious, and at a totally great price! My favorite is their roast beef sandwich, which I could probably eat forever until the end of my days. And their Dutch Crunch bread? Amazing! I've had the chicken once too, and it blew my mind away. 

The service there is super friendly. The guy that runs the place thinks my friend and are twin sisters, and every time I'm there asks me about her, which I think is super sweet that he remembers. Everyone there is so friendly and loves to joke around and make people smile. 

Honestly, I don't think a better sandwich place exists.
author: Samantha O.

description:
I've been to Roxie's probably a dozen times since moving out these far reaches of San Francisco.  The sandwiches are fantastic, plus a really great chip and drink selection.  My wife likes the hot crab sandwich; I'm partial to the Roxie's special.  My dad has tried the liverwurst and said it was great.

Staff is really friendly, service is quick, food is tasty - what more could you want?
author: Chris D.

description: I've been coming to eat at Roxie's since I went to CCSF years ago. Best sandwich joint in S.F period. Ingredients taste fresh and when they warm it up it taste way much better. The only down side to the joint is that it's a bit pricey and the place is very small since it's a liquor store and a sandwich place mixed all together. Overall, great sandwiches.
author: Nelson D.

description:
There are those deli's that get love because of the people who own them....there are deli's who get love because of great location....then there is Roxy's. 
A place where the owner's don't talk too much (been going there since '96 and I still don't know his name) becuase they know that your there for 2 things...the Roxy's Special (I get mine on Dutch Crunch with swiss and jack) or the alcohol. 
Many a day have passed where I crave a great sandwhich....and Subway/ Quiznos (Viking's almost) don't have anything on Roxy's!
author: Paulo L.

description:
The sandwiches here are off the hook!!!! They are the best in sandwiches!!! I usually order the roxie's special with swiss and provolone on a sourdough, heated please. mmmm I always visit once a week. 
Note: I visited the other roxies in the sunset, ordered the same thing but it was awful. Came back to this location, they apologized and made my sandwich exactly how I like it. 
Who knew you could find such happiness in a sandwich!!=)
author: Nancy K.

description:
Ever since High School, when my buddy said I wouldn't finish a supreme sandwich (and I did!), I've loved this place!  I work downtown, and I've been known to call in and drive out here to pick up a sandwich!  Great place to grab something for the park, ball game, class, work, anything!  It's been well over 10 years since I've been going here, and I still look forward to it each time we decide on it...

Supreme Pastrami on an italian roll, easy mayo, double mustard, pepperccinis on the side!
author: ROB L.

description:
Don't toast dutch crunch...it's the worst nightmare for the roof of your mouth.

Thanks to yelp, I found another sandwich place close to home. Pretty decent sandwiches. Shouldn't have toasted my roast beef on dutch crunch. It was like biting on eggshells only to get to luke warm beef. I will have it cold next time. Kinda pricey, but I'm probably just spoiled by Little Lucca on El Camino.  Will try again!
author: Jack L.

description:
I've been hearing about this place from my family, my coworkers, but never made the trip out to San Jose by Balboa park, not quite my regular walk down the neighborhood, but when i was doing some field work, i tried steering towards this area so that i could stop in for lunch with some other coworkers of mine.  

walking in, i would have never thought that this place made amazing sandwiches.  The Jnr is about $6, Reg $8 and Super $13 and by super, that sandwich is indeed super (like 2 feet almost and best shared).  if you're by yourself, even a junior will do you good as a regular can put you into food coma, this coming from a 6'1" gentleman with a very very large appetite....believe me.  

But all sandwiches should come in the Dutch Crunch.  Amazing...absolutely amazing.  I had the meatball mafia, oMG.  if you thought subway's meatball sandwich was pretty good, this is heavenly.  the cheese is dripping, the dutch crunch toasted around the flavorful meatball and oozing juices/marinara sauce coming out is absolutely great.  Had to be careful about not dripping on myself though, like the Carls Jr commericals.
author: Vincent K.

description:
I can't believe I haven't reviewed Roxie Food Center!  Seriously, I should have done it.  Then again, there are a ton of reviews about this place so perhaps I didn't think that adding one more matter.  But what do I care, if you read it and don't like what I have to say, file it under who cares.

Oh, pardon me, I'm in that headspace again.  On to the review!

This is a sandwich shop and more.  It's tiny and yet manages to fit everything you need inside.  A convenience store with made to order sandwiches.  So good!  

Really consider if you want anything more than the regular size sandwich.  It's seriously a good amount of food.  

Favorites here:

Pastrami on dutch crunch or soft roll with provolone, jalapenos, and everything else.  Regular size.

Hot links with avocado on dutch crunch with jalapenos, and everything else.  Regular size.

Meatball on dutch crunch with provolone and everything but tomato.  Regular size.

I think they have spaghetti and meatball and if they do and if I remember correctly - it was good.

Another favorite - ask the guys making the sandwiches what their favorite sandwich is and if I haven't tried it I'll ask them to make it for me.   :)

Parking can get a bit tricky but its SF so get used to it!
author: Luci C.

description:
First off, let me start by saying that I am a health freak. To the point where it may not be "healthy!"

That being said, I will gladly get fat off of Roxie's! I Just had the Simon's special, and it was the best sandwich I have ever had. I'm glad my roommates and I took our pilgrimage here instead of Ike's (which I have never been too, and may never get to after having the Simon's special)!
author: Ivan D.

description:
At first sight, it looks just like a local neighborhood corner liquor store.  But little do they know, inside holds the key my happiness....a great sandwich!  

Roxie's makes one of the best sandwiches in the city.  I always get the roast beef on dutch crunch with all the fixings.  Prices are moderate.  I think the regular size is $8 and the super is $11.  But the super can definitely feed two people.

It always seems to be a little wait for them to make your sandwich.  Usually because they are so busy or I am always very hungry when I get there and 5 mins seems like an eternity.  But you can always call in first and have them make your sandwich before you get there.

Parking is never a problem.  They have a green zone right out front.  And while you wait you can always play some scratchers!

Of course there is no seating.  So most just bring the food home then chow down.  Or if you are like me, just start eating right on the street corner.  Especially because the sandwiches are toasted!  Gotta eat them while its hot.
author: Eric W.

description:
BEST SANDWICH SHOP EVER!! Friendly staff, good size portions and good price. What more can I say...I heart Roxies & their dutch crutch sandwiches! Mmm... 

ps. A lot of my friends love Little Luccas in SSF, but I think Roxies sandwiches are so much tastier!!
author: Michelle F.

description: The last part of the bay area trifecta  for awesome sandwiches. The simon special is the first sandwich I had. Simply amazing! Roxie special is awesome as well. The bbq beef sandwich was recommended by a friend, and it definitely did not disappoint! Love roxies!
author: Alvin P.

description:
Their sandwiches here are dreamy!!!!

I love their meatball sub mafia style and have managed to order one each time I visit there.    Their Roxie Special is pretty great, too everything on it and dutch crunch.  They heat the sandwiches, its crunchy and juicy at the same time.  Everything is super fresh.  

There is always a wait, not too long, at most 15-20 minutes.   They have about 4 people behind the counter making all the yumminess.  

I love this place.  Love Hubby even more for opening my palate to this great find.
author: Regi K.

description: Love this place! Tony, Peter, and Simon, and crew do an amazing job everyday with great sandwiches and fabulous catering. They are our go-to guys for office events and parties at home. Check out the deviled eggs!! Thanks Roxie for being so great!!
author: Jay D.

description:
I used to live right down the street and they have the best deli sandwiches that I've had ANYWHERE hands down.  Back then I got roast beef on dutch with cheddar cheese and everything on it heated up.  Now I get smoked turkey on dutch with provolone and avocados heated up.

I would have given it a five except the sandwiches vary depending on which "artist" makes it: if it ain't Peter, Simon or one of the OGs, you might get skimped.  Also, there's a lot of cops that come by since the police station is up the street so make sure you aren't riding dirty or disturbing the peace!

Here's a couple tips: program the number into your phone and call them ahead during business hours or when you're 15 minutes away.  Make sure you remind them when you walk in.  Go straight to the back and to the right and order a sandwich.  After you order it, move to the right and hang out outside, or near the door and pick up a mag.  If you lean on the ice cream machine, make sure the sliding door is closed!

Anyway, I love love love this place and it hasn't sold out yet 
X fingers crossed X
author: Krishtine D.

description:
When I hear "Roxie Sandwhiches" what else can I say but "Oh hell yes!"

Best. Dutch. Crunch. Period. Over.  Those other delis can go cry in the corner or work on some other niche.

It's a tiny hole in the wall (and I mean tiny--only one person can navigate the aisles at a time), but it's a neighborhood place.  They do all kinds of cool deals for the local schools and sports teams, so how can you not love a place with community spirit? The folks here are rad. 

Support them with your business.  You'll be glad you did when you take that first bite of your dutch crunch whatever.
author: Jen D.

description:
I live down the block from this place and always notice the super long lines around lunch time. Although i've never tried a sandwich from them, i have heard by ALL my friends that they're delicious!

I have bought many other things from the store and love the workers! They always have some story or something to make you smile!

I'm sure that one day i'll try a sandwich!
author: Maria M.

description:
Here's how you know Life is Good: 

Grab a friend.  Go in (don't be afraid; you brought moral support!).  Stand in line.  Grab some French Onion Sun Chips.  Get a 32 oz Tecate.  Order a regular meat ball sandwich (mafia style, on dutch crunch).   Pay $10.  Walk a block down to the Park.  Brown Bag Picnic!!!

This is a little convenience store--complete with 40s of Old English, strange looking beef jerky, and day-old danishes.   Everything you could EVER hope for in a sandwich shop!!

They toast the bread...the cheese is melted and the veggies are fresh!  (Finally!  A tomato that is the proper color of red!!).   The counter guys are nice; they work as fast as they can...but the line is always long.

But, baby, is it worth the wait!!!

P.S.  little secret?  Difference between junior and regular is not the size of the sandwich, but the weight of the meat.
author: Val K.

description: Even after 39 years you can still come in, get a 7 meat hot sandwich on their world famous dutch crunch bread and be the happiest person alive. The best deli sandwiches in all of San Francisco. Thank you.
author: Nelson R.

description:
Going to Roxie is a ritual in my house. The planning and the excitement are all part of the build up. Maybe we'll try this or that, and then we get the same thing every time! 

My sandwich is called The Simon Special. Turkey and pastrami with cheddar toasted on dutch crunch. The way they toast the sandwiches in those little ovens and then add the cold condiments afterwards are what make them unique and fantastic. 

I remember when a friend was looking to buy a house in Mission Terrace. The real estate agent mentioned that it was in the neighborhood of the Roxie deli as a selling point. And that was over ten years ago.
author: Alona G.

description:
Oh only have a few words to say about this place.

THE BEST SANDWICHES IN THE BAY AREA!!

To me it surpasses the 5 STAR rating....
author: MysticZ T.

description:
I seriously LOVE this place.  I use to live a mile down and came here every day for 3 months during my tenure at City College. I now live across town but would make the drive out to Roxies for the WORLD'S BEST SANDWICH!  

It brings me so much joy and comfort knowing that the same people that use to make my sandwich 5 years ago, are still there.   That means the quality is just as good, if not better.

I hope you guys don't expand, that seems to be the curse of death.
author: Claire C.

description:
Ok this is a corner store.  And yes, it has the best hot sandwiches by far.  Perfect date...he calls to say he has 49er tickets and he's about to get sandwiches for us at Roxie's for the game.   

OMG...panty drop.  Serious.  It's that good.
author: anna l.

description:
Ahh Roxie's- The flaky crispy Dutchdcrunch bread is their claim to fame. When I add an avocado to that bad boy and the avocado oozes out of that warm crispy bread, it's heaven.  They will put any sandwich through the toaster if you request.  This is a corner store, don't get it twisted.  My family is some deli sandwich loven fools.   I found out the hard way that good mom & pop style delicatessens is unique to the Bay Area.  Only folks from the Bay even know what Dutchcrunch bread is.  I'm glad to be back home!  

I have 3 top deli choices and the combination of the three would be the best sandwich ever, starting with the Dutchcrunch bread at Roxies.  (See my reviews for my complete wishful sandwich.  Include Sweet Maui Onion kettle style potato chips for the ultimate combo.)
author: sonia m.

description:
GREATEST.....SANDWICHES.....EVER!!!!!

Yes, it looks like your typical liquor store from the outside, but inside you'll find what real deli's look like.  Cramped, loud, line booming with different kinds of people, and the smell of fresh sandwiches being made.

Yes, there is a line there depending on when you go there.  But believe me when I say the line is well worth waiting in.  Anytime anyone suggests sandwiches, best believe I'm suggesting Roxies.

Only complaint: they need to start wrapping their sandwiches in aluminum foil, cause if you take too long to get home to eat your sandwich, it really won't taste as good.

This has been another Mike Vuong PSA!!
author: Mike V.

description: What's the big hype? Over priced deli sand which.  I was expecting a signature sauce on my first bite but ended up with a load of bland and boring sand-which for a hefty price $9? All I can say is WTF? How much did I pay? Oh m gee. First and last time for me. I'd rather go to little Lucas.
author: Mimi S.

description:
I LOVE ROXIE'S! Here's the back story. When I used to stay at my Aunt's house on San Jose Avenue my cousins & I would sneak out of the house and put our money together to go to Roxie's for a sandwich even if it was just the junior size. They would always hook it up! Even if it was just a slice of meat.

I always get the roast beef, hot, on dutch crunch, with swiss cheese. Thinking about it right now gets my hungry!

The place is pretty small, I mean come on it's a little corner store. But the food is really worth trying. The employees are nice and if it's busy just wait for it! I always say, if a place is busy then you know it's good.
author: Jenny U.

description: A sandwich shop...in a liquor store????  HUH???? Are you confused too??? Well, don't be...you must go and you must go now!  Their sandwiches are absolutely delicious!!  I've had several different sandwiches from Roxie's, Roast Beef, Smoked Ham, Turkey, but my favorite, my all time favorite is the 7 Meat Special on Dutch Crunch.  My mouth is watering just writing about it!
author: Ashley J.

description: Nothing much to say, other than the sandwiches being God's gift on earth. Nice people working there, and for 6.50, the junior sandwiches fill you up to the brink!
author: Thankie S.

description:
*Try the meatball sandwich on Dutch crunch, provolone cheese and spicy peppers. Mm mm... It's so good. I eat their Jr size because it is too big to finish.

*Place a phone call to pick up your sandwiches to save some time. It's so easy they will be done in 10 minutes, the store is always busy with customers. 

*Definitely gets an A+  in my opinion.
author: Kelli H.

description:
I used to go and eat the hot link with pepper jack on dutch crunch at least once a week after my M trip back from the school house. 
It was DELICIOUS. 
so i decided to switch it up one day and try the beef with bbq and cheddar on dutch.....yuuuuummmmmmm. couldn't get enough.
until i tried the turkey......eh.....didn't impress me. it was too dry for my taste buds. 
so im sticking to my hot link sammich :)
author: Brenda S.

description: I love this place and it's location!! I'm not a fan of fancy sandwich places!! And Roxies is NOT fancy!! Just a typical liquor store with an amazing deli!! They probably have the best dutch crunch bread in the city!! Get the pastrami on dutch with everything heated up with swiss cheese!! Soo good!!
author: nabil s.

description:
A friend of mine recommended Roxie's as she insisted the flavor-bombness was on the verge of flavor bombness to that of Ike's Place. So I say, It's on!

Headed towards the place and I seriously would have never guessed this was a sandwich shop. Well, it isn't. Its both sandwich eatery and liquor store. Well that is quite neat!

Walked inside and one of the dudes asked if it was my first time eating there. I nodded and He suggested the Simon or Roxie's Special. Alright, MAAAYYYBEEE I would try it, but I wanted to know what these names consisted of...So I looked all around and couldn't find a description of ANY of the sandwiches until I glanced at the register and found two descriptions of both the Simon and Roxie specials...hmm. I would have really liked a description of what each sandwich they offered and this is why I have deducted a star. I know I know, who the hell do I think I am? Listen, if you get angry at anyone, it should be my friend who hyped the Roxie sandwich experience and continues to compare it to Ikes. And I know this is terrible, but I am rating it compared to Ikes for this same reason. Eeek! Sorry! I just cant help myself! Ok, so I would have asked the guys what was in 'X' sandwich, but everyone looked super busy and as I saw people waiting for their food, I quickly ordered the Simons special on dutch crunch bread. After my first bite, I already knew this was a good sandwich, and it continued to be til the very end :) HOWEVER, this is no Ike's place experience (again, sorry for the comparison, the thought continues to go through my head and processes itself through my fingers onto this keyboard. Bleh). BUT BUT BUT , a definite plus, I will say one thing this place does not have, that Ikes does...long.ass.waiting time. So for that, I just changed my star rating from 3, to a 4.

Oh yes, and I will say that their customer service was also a good experience. Everyone was real nice. I appreciate a friendly smile and good ol' courteous manner!  

Overall, I am glad I tried a new sandwich experience!
author: Yess M.

description: I love Roxies. Ever since I was introduced there I always crave the Simons special--which I believe is the pastrami turkey and cheese. On dutch crunch. I think this place has the best dutch crunch ever. Im kinda craving their sandwiches right now and i might drive myself 30 minutes just to get some. so BE RIGHT BACK. this place is good end of story
author: Floyd H.

description: Real solid sandwich shop, which seem to be few and far between in this city.  Pretty standard pricing (Large sub is big enough to feel stuffed, $9).  I had the pastrami and it was definitely above average.  Would def recommend
author: Brian W.

description: I haven't been here in awhile they now have tri tip sandwiches . There ham slices are getting thinner by the year...
author: Michael m.

description: Their cold sandwiches are yummm and super chunky but I go here mainly for one HOT sandwich... SAMOAN MAFIA  on dutch crunch! Def a must-try!!!
author: Resa N.

description:
Best Sandwiches Ever!!!! been going there for years now.. 

If you know exactly what you want... you should call in advance and pick up.  If not, there's a chance you may have to wait some time for your sandwich.  

Pastrami with everything except onions on a toasted Dutch Crunch.....YUMMMMMMMMMM!!!
author: Porsia B.

description:
Good for sandwiches, go anywhere else for anything else...

Their sandwiches are pretty good, and the dutch crunch rolls are always a winner.  For a neighborhood with few markets, I love that they sell their cheese and meats, deli style, by the pound. 

My main gripe about this place is that I am not comfortable with the guys that work there, specifically those working the register.  Their eyes wander, and I'm never safe from comments.  This place also seems to attract a loitering crowd out front.  

While this place is great for sandwiches on the go, I'd advise most people to take the time to walk two extra blocks to the Red Sea Market.  They have a better beer selection, they deliver anything they sell, and you don't feel the need to have a buddy for safety.  Their pizza is mediocre next to Roxy's sandwiches, but the guys that work there treat you like you a dad, and not that creepy uncle we dread during the holidays.
author: Candice S.

description: By far the best Sandwich you can get in the City.  I always get the smoked ham on dutch crunch.  I've tried the tri-tip a few times, which is amazing as well.  I love this place!  Great staff, in n' out in no time.  What more can you ask for?
author: Tony A.

description: I don't always write yelp reviews, but when I do, its because this place rocks.  Just get something on their dutch crunch bread, anything.  I personally roll with the Simon special as of lately, but I live half a mile away so I'm there all the time and I try to switch it up.  One thing remains the same though, dutch crunch bread.
author: Jake B.

description:
When did you last have a Roxie Day?

Best Sandwhich shop in the US!  
The sandwhiches are always big and fat. The dutch crunch bread always perfection.  I always get a Vegi and a Seafood, both which blow my mind with each bite. I love that the sandwhich had bits and peices falling out of it because it is so ginormous.

The guys behind the counter are all rough, but very sweet!  I love the attitude and atmosphere at Roxies.

If you haven't tried it, you should!
author: Dangerous T.

description: The colorful history on the walls will keep you company while you wait for the smorgasbord of flavors that IS a Roxie Sandwich. Without a doubt, your stomach will be beyond satisfied after indulging in one of these somewhat superflous creations. May I suggest the Breakfast Sandwich, ladies and gentleman. With a hot link instead of bacon. This was one of the concoctions introduced to me by a friend who brought me here! Conveniently delicious. When you're done, I assure you at least one of your thoughts will be, "Now, THAT'S an *insert expletive here* sandwich!" Foodies, enjoy.
author: Mina S.

description: Amazing sandwiches! I get the turkey (hot) on dutch crunch w/t cheddar or american (mayo, mustard, pickles, red onions, jalapenos, and avocado) and grab a juice and I am good to go! When I was a kid I would go there for a $1 pickle afer a swim across the street, now I just go for the yummy sandwiches! Everyone that works there is way cool and just like extended family.
author: Bella B.

description: Junior Chicken Club with soft sour dough and cheddar cheese. Enough said......
author: Benjamin M.

description:
Some of the best sandwiches I've ever had, although its kind of a pain in the ass when they get busy it takes a long time to get the sandwiches out.
They are also a little pricey.

My recommendation, dutch crutch california chicken melt? Avacado chicken and cheese
author: Steven C.

description:
Roxie's out-sandwiches all the other convenience store deli's. Rarely do you get good sized, good quality sandwiches from what technically can be called a corner store.

Roxie's Special and the Simon's Special are the highlight of their abilities. I've had the Simon Special a lot more times, and it never disappoints. I'm not as big a fan of their dutch crunch since it tends to be a little dry and dense. Otherwise, great, solid sandwiches can be found at Roxie's. 

Call ahead for your sandwich orders so that you don't have to stand in front of the liquor store and get odd looks from the cops passing by.
author: Chris E.

description:
Awww... my favorite comfort food. Ive been coming here ever since I could remember and believe me nothing compares. Now this litte hole-in-the-wall place isnt known for it culinary arts but they do make one hell of sandwich.  No fancy meats or cheeses but just a great simple deli sandwich. Warm toasty bread, ooy  gooey melted cheese, proportionate amount of meat and crispy condiments...  its making my mouth water just thinking about. Try the hot pastrami or the bbq beef....on dutch crunch.....yuuuuummmmm


ps. to toro e. (a couple comments down):

get in your mini cooper and go back to soma!
yuppy
author: Natalia J.

description:
What else can be said about this place that hasn't already been said? Roxie's is one of the best places to get a sandwich in SF. The sandwiches for my graduation were even ordered from here, so it'll always have a special place in my heart. The guys who work there are super nice and the sandwich choices are infinite. They sometimes do get your order wrong, but the mistakes are usually minor, like adding mustard when you requested not to have any. Still, give Roxie's a try! Preferably not around lunch time!

Tip: There is no tax added to unheated sandwiches!
author: Enari L.

description:
This place has the best hot dutch crunch sandwiches in the bay area. My favorite is the chicken avocado sandwich with bbq sauce and it is so tasty that you could skip the mayo. A junior size sandwich would more than satisfied my appetite. If you want a sandwich during lunch time best to call 15 minutes ahead of time and pick up that way you avoid the long wait. 

Pro: The best dutch crunch sandwiches in town about $7.00-$7.50 for a junior size sandwich

Con: More costly and smaller sandwich compared to Litte Lucca's and Submarine Center
author: Allison H.

description: I am a Little Lucca fanatic & to say another place has good ass sandwiches is a big deal! Roxie's has some good ass sandwiches & they don't even have a sauce..that's major! Another fabulous hole in the wall! (love ole school hole in the walls)!
author: Danielle W.

description: Awesome sandwiches from a small little deli..Been going here for years and the flavor and quality just continues to satisfy! The owners are like family and are very welcoming and helpful.
author: Squ E.

description:
Best sandwich place in SF hands down. nothing beats this place. The store is a corner store so you can pick up some stuff while you are at it. Dutch crunch salami sandwich is win.

On the down side it's pretty small store, but it's worth the wait :]
author: Brian H.

description:
Splendid toasted sandwiches (did you know I love them?) 
for the working man and woman in a vintage neighborhood corner grocery store in a no-nonsense, non-frufru, unsnooty part of town that serves the needs of the locals. No one from the financial district comes here.

I eat my sammy in the park there (Balboa? don't ask me, I grew up on Telegraph Hill). 

Rawk!
author: Mark G.

description:
One thing to understand is that I love, love, love, love the sandwiches. Especially on heated dutch crunch. I used to come there after school just to get one. But that's clearly not why I'm giving it three stars.

It's small. And I mean SMALL. There isn't enough space for you to even walk properly, really. You have to pretty much side-shuffle your way down the aisle.

And to get to where the sandwiches are, you walk down the aisle, turn, turn, and then stand in line. Not that it's bad but when you've got a long line of people waiting to put their order in, it's ridiculous. 

Then after you fill your order out, there's a near 45 minute wait just for your sandwich. 

The sandwiches are ALMOST worth the obstacle course it takes to get 'em. Almost.
author: Thea G.

description:
Kickass sandwiches in the middle of nowhere. I used to walk 20 minutes in each direction through the goddamn densest SF fog to obtain my daily sammy. 

My usual: Pastrami/provolone/dutch crunch/JALEPENOS!!/toasted.

Don't even bother to try it untoasted, or without jalepenos, or minus the dutch crunch. That's some crazy talk (and might explain outcomes of anything less than 5 stars).

As far as value (I like my money, don't you?), I recommend buying multiple small sandwiches over a single large. For some reason, 2+2=5 in this joint.

Bonus points for the adorably grouchy staff! According to numerous dusty photographs clustered around the counter, they donate significant monies to local soccer teams. Aww, they really are sweethearts on the inside.
author: T.Z. R.

description:
I was poking around yelp to see what others thought of the best sandwich shop in the northern hemisphere. As I was reading through the fawning and adulation, I looked up a bit to notice that the "Write a Review" button was there instead of the "Edit your Review" button. That's curious... Then I stopped in my tracks. A brief panic overcame me. Adrenaline was immediately secreted for my body to better handle the situation that my negligence had gotten me into. 

Have you ever been cackling and cavorting with friends, oblivious to the world around you and then froze suddenly because you realized that you were supposed to pick someone up at the airport 2 hours ago? (not that I've done that) Or dreamt that you're going to your locker in high school....people are staring at you, but you don't know why...until you look down and notice that you aren't wearing any pants? That feeling is the same feeling that hit me when I noticed that button.

To Yelp and Yelp about tons of restaurants and shops (I even Yelped about sandals w/ socks for chrissakes!) before Yelping about my favorite place in the city to eat, is a crime. Well, I don't actually eat THERE since there's no place to sit. Unless you indian style it on the sidewalk or cross the street to Balboa park. I take that shit  home where I can ravenously devour it like a pride of lions devours a gazelle carcass (and by shit, I mean a polish on dutch with swiss. Everything on it.).

I don't need anyone to see me eating like a wild animal. That's private. Now I will post this thing so I can right my wrong and enjoy seeing the proper button.

UPDATE: Ahh...there it is.
author: Gabe M.

description: Roxies used to be my favorite sandwich ever. they sandwiches are hella good but the price is kinda expensive. plus i also liked cuz my friend used to work there and i got a little discount off shit wen i got something there. but i think that there are other place i can rather go to for a cheaper sandwich
author: Jeremy B.

description: Saying it simple says it best: SOME OF THE BEST SANDWICHES IN THE BAY AREA!!!!
author: Chris C.

description: Roxie Roxie Roxie, what can I say about you? Your sandwiches are amazing! I usually stick to the Simon Special because that's my favorite. I am sure their other options are just as good, but the Simon Special is to die for. Nicely toasted and the cheese oozes out of the sammie (my mouth is watering as I write this).  It is a little on the pricey side, but it is definitely coming and giving it a chance. Every time I crave a sandwich, it is usually from Roxie's.  The sandwiches are packed with flavor and very juicy! I think that everyone needs to come check this place out, if they haven't yet.
author: Jessica H.

description: Roxie has some really good sandwiches. I was first introduced into this subway sandwich joint when I played for the CCSF mens baseball team. They make great sandwiches and have good customer service. Their sandwiches are a little pricey though. But its worth the meal.
author: Rueben R.

description:
FACT: I am barely a whopping 5'1'' tall

and this is how it went down at Roxie...

Cashier: That'll be $15,923 for the meatball on sourdough with everything!

Me: Oh, I guess I'm a little short !!

Cashier: Ho, ho! You guessed right! You are a little short! GET IT?!

I appreciate the not-so-subtle jokes and reminder Roxie man but I appreciate your sandwiches even more. I practically grew up down the street but wasn't blessed enough to have a sandwich from Roxie's until I was 14 -- what had I been missing all my life?!? But then again, who would've thought this unassuming, little liquor store would be slanging one of the best sandwiches in all of SF?

The pastrami is great and the famous dutch crunch is worth the hype but I rarely stray away from the meatball - on a toasted sourdough roll with melty pepperjack and all the fixin's! My stomach is growling for one now -- so I'm glad the phone number is programmed in my phone under "Best Sandwich EVER"

The employees are really nice and will walk your order out to your car if you request it. Some of the goods on the shelves are a little dusty but you're not going there for mints and beef jerky -- get straight to the business and order the sandwich. 

And if you decide to order turkey, the sweet man behind the counter will swiftly and generously offer up one of his younger employees to you. "TURKEY? You want TURKEY, right?! Here you go! TURKEY! -- GET IT?!"
author: Chelle Y.

description:
When you think Mom and Pop's sandwich shops, this is definitely one of the places you would want to go.  
Right across the street from Balboa Park, this liquor store brings in a big crowd probably almost everyday for one reason, the sandwiches.  From their roast beef to the ham and cheese, you cannot go wrong with any of their sandwiches.  The bread(especially the dutch crunch)is heated and ready for you to indulge.  
The chains stores like Subway, Togos, and Quiznos maybe pretty good but in comparison with Roxie, their is no comparison.  Roxie's better hands down(or maybe up when I am holding a Roxie's sandwich).
author: Kris A.

description: Hands down my favorite sandwich shop! I LOVE their dutch crunch bread... YUM-O. Ive had Ike's and i couldn't help but compare to Roxies. I love me my roxies.....
author: Nghi Thu H.

description: yum................y! the greatest of greats! period!Go try a hot sandwich! YUMMMMMMMMMM! i can go for one right now
author: Jovanna A.

description: Roxie's got one of SF's best and inexpensive sandwiches. been going there since high school back in 2000. small store but shit do the lines get long sometimes.
author: Kenneth C.

description: Guess what !  I had my first real sandwich today. I order roxie special.   with everything.usually I don't put onion on my sandwich. However, It just fit with meat and veges. I even didn't taste any onion in it. It was so good and cheap. Subway's footlong is equal to the 6 inch size there. I am sure it is the top 3 sandwich in SF
author: Oscar S.

description:
Best sandwich shop in the city. Bar none.

I have been going to Roxie's since I was 10 years old.  I used to go swimming at Balboa Pool and head to Roxie's afterwards for a Jr Roast Beef and a side of ravioli.

I recently tried a veg sandwich and they are also great.  You can't go wrong with a Roxie Sandwich.
author: Jesson d.

description: This place is the BOMBAY!! F what everyone else says on here. I have been going to this place since I was able to eat solid food. I have never had a bad sandwich from this place. I might have walked out with someone else's sandwich, but even that was good. Shame on YOU if you have never been here. I myself like the Smoked Turkey, Roast Beef and Salami, american cheese, mayo, mustard lettuce and black pepper, warmed. Give it a try!--Did I mention that they get thier bread from 3 different bakeries in the morning. You just cant beat that.
author: Jorge P. G.

description:
Love this place! My favorite sandwich spot in the city.... Can you say delicious? 

I can't even describe how delicious and satisfying one of their sandwiches are! Everyone should have a Roxie Sandwich at least once in their life!  

And when you do, make it an event! Invite a friend, or that special someone (wink wink) and tell them "this one's on me"  You can't go wrong, there will be smiles all around! .....  Mm mm Roxie's!
author: Lady L.

description: When this place dies (hopefully not until the apocalypse) I shall commit seppuku. Have been coming here since in diapers, and it has ALWAYS been tops. Get a Junior Simon. Don't let that name decieve you -- it's the size of a safeway sandwich, only 5000^e^2 times as good. GO THERE. GO THERE NOW. I COMMAND YOU.
author: CHRISTIAN P.

description: OMG! This is sandwich heaven!!! Not only do they make kick ass sandwiches, but they even gave me some Emergen-C when they found out I had a cold! Who does that besides Mom? Made me feel better......
author: Danielle G.

description:
Walk in, turn left, turn right, turn right again, and there it is: the Deli Counter.

I didn't really have an idea of what to get. It would make sense for my first sandwich from Roxie's Food Center be the "Roxie Special" but, 1) I don't eat red meat and 2) My feeling towards meat (turkey, chicken) is the same as some people's opinion of onions: I'd rather not.

I ordered the Vegetarian, Junior-sized with no mayo or jalapenos on toasted Dutch Crunch bread and was very satisfied. The Junior size is a hefty sandwich that I wouldn't associate with the word little. The bread was...OMGSOGOOD (I'm a sucker for good bread and today, I was suckered) And MUSHROOMS and KIDNEY BEANS?! I was very happily surprised when I came to the realization that this was not a "vegetarian" sandwich, this was a VEGETARIAN SANDWICH. Most sandwich shops like to throw in an extra heaping of "the works", slip in a few slices of avocado and call it a day.

I am always one to ask questions and since I didn't know what "Mortadella" was, I asked. The guy working behind the counter willingly answered, "It's like bologna, want to try some?" and offered me a slice. Since I don't really eat meat, I had to decline.

So overall, I'd say, good sandwiches, and good service.
author: Virginia C.

description: Great sandwiches, but I wished they were a little cheaper. Regular size sandwiches go for $7.99+tax. Bought 2 regular's and 1 junior for about $27. My favorite has to be the roxie special with cheddar on dutch crunch.
author: Robin L.

description:
Roxies was just okay for me. The sandwich was indeed huge, but I have had infinitely better pastrami sandwiches at many different places.  Keep in mind that I used to live in LA....where I had easy and frequent access to Tommy burgers, The Hat and Pinks and many many awesomely great delis and sandwich shops.

I hate the inside of Roxies. Is there any sunlight in that place? The aisles were tiny, correction, the aisle (singular) was tiny and everyone was just hanging out inside waiting. People behind the counter were friendly, but I could've had a better pastrami dip in a nicer environment for less.

Three stars for the taste of the food, minus one because I hate small, dark, dingy food places. I can't deny that there's a reason why this place is popular, but hey, I guess I'm just a picky eater.
author: Leilani A.

description:
My favorite warm sandwich.  

- Call ahead if you can to save waiting in the cramped store or outside
- I love crab sandwiches and they make the best:
       Dutch crunch/wheat, swiss, toasted, no jalapenos
- regular is pretty big, super is pretty damn large
- weekend lunch times are rightfully packed. 
- parking can be hit or miss, but keep looking
author: Don B.

description:
Roxie's has the best sandwhiches I have been going here since I 
was a youngster and although the prices are high and I was living  in the East Bay I would still get a sandwhich whenever I was in the
area...

It's oldschool I can still go in there and see some photo's of my younger cousins posted up in there or  someone I know.. Now that im older and impatient I try and call ahead for pick up cause it's always crowded..

You can order a Jr which I used to but they don't put as much meat on them anymore so I order the regular

Check it out you won't be dissapointed
author: Kim R.

description:
Good lord. How in the heck did I not get to review this place first!

I've been going here literally my whole life! I  remember going there as a kid with my great grandma. A few of them actually went to her viewing when she passed a couple years ago. My grandpa still goes there and he's actually allowed to carry a tab at that place. He had me go there one time to get him cigarettes, I was a kid, and he sent me there with a note asking them to give me the the cigarettes, and to put it on his tab. They knew I shouldn't be getting it for him, but they still gave it to me because they knew I was his grandson. Enough with the stories though.

They are obviously known for their sandwiches. Still when I walk in the original guys remember me at some point and know what I want. Roast beef on Dutch Crunch and american cheese. This place gets even more packed than before. Word of mouth got people to know this place more and more. Luckily my grandparents house is down the block across the street from the park. So I can walk there with ease. Everything is fresh. I've never gotten a sandwich from there that's been questionable on ingredients. The sandwiches did get a little smaller than before, and the prices did climb a little, but that doesn't stop with their consistancy in making a good sandwich.

It's still the same ol' store I remember. Ice cream freezer on the left, Driinks in the back, chips isle on the left with breads and what not, and on the other side the candy and other stuff. All packed in a tiny store. I think I'll pay them a visit later actually to get my fix, hahaha.

Advise: Order for pick up! Saves you a whole lot of time!
author: Jay V.

description: One of my favorite go to sandwich shops.  Simple but amazingly tasty and exactly what you would expect when you think great deli sandwiches. The Veggie sandwich is best I've ever eaten, no veggie sandwich compares.
author: Daniel P.

description:
i was introduced to this place by my boss as this was his favorite sandwich spot.  when i first saw it, i thought, "are you serious?  this is a corner convenience store."  i only saw the small counter after we walked in.  he swears by the bbq sandwich but since i don't eat beef, i got the tuna salad.  very good!  their bread was amazing too!
parking is good since it's residential.  the prices of the sandwiches are decent too!
author: Serena L.

description: Inside a liquer store. Place takes cash only unless you meet minimum for debt, parking can suck, sandwiches are pretty good, prices arent cheap $9 per specialty sandwich. lines can be long and cramped as you will twist through the liqueur store. Hmmmm, sandwich, chips and a 40oz?!
author: Cee B.

description: Great sandwiches. Looks like it's another random corner store but seriously has the best sandwiches. I'm a fan of the BBQ beef on Dutch crunch and I usually have trouble finish their jr. Size. Every sandwich is good just make sure you let them make it their way because they know what to do. Don't come in asking for a sandwich with mayo and tomato.. This place is made for people who like a real sandwich.
author: Craig B.

description: I've been teaching right next to Roxie's and never realized how close it was. So far this has to be the best sandwiches I've had in this particular area. I do miss the days when it was still more of a secret and called roxie's deli or store. But i guess that's what happens when you produce great stuff. So far I love the pastrami with provolone on a Dutch crunch loaf. Make sure to bring cash because there a charge for credit.
author: Aldrich S.

description:
Enough has been said bout this place. It's rocks. 
Get the largest size sandwich and it's your lunch and dinner.
author: Alex M.

description:
BEST SANDWICH IN THE UNIVERSE. And I've been everywhere.

I always get a pastrami on dutch with provolone, toasted. Best. Shit. Ever.

I usually like to give reviews that are a little more thorough and elaborate, but there's really not much else to say. If Roxie is too far for you, then try the Sunset location, but the original Roxie is where it's at.
author: Edmund C.

description:
Was looking for a quick good sandwich on a trip to San Francisco. Roxie Food Center came up on Yelp, and decided to give it a try. 

Pulled up and wondered if this place was for real. It doesn't look like a restaurant; It looks like a convenience store. I was in for a surprise. 

I had the crab meat sandwich on extra sourdough bread(warm due to the sandwich maker's recommendation), and I was blown away. I really don't understand how a simple sandwich was so good. My SO had the avocado turkey club and was equally blown away. 

I'm still kind of dumbfounded at how good the sub was. Initially we thought it was kind of expensive for just a sandwich, but our minds were changed afterwards. I got a regular and saved half for later just because I wanted to experience it again later. I'm 6'3" and ~190lbs., so this is not a common occurrence and is probably the best testament I can give to this place. 

Also, the guys running the shop are really friendly. It's truly a gem.
author: Jared M.

description:
Arggggghhhhhhhhhhh! Why?! WHY?! Why do you have to be so good?!

After trying the Roxie's on Kirkham, I had to try the original one today. It's a small, cramped hole in the wall, with about 5 people behind the counter making sandwiches and one guy at the register. Phones were ringing off the hook and there were about 3 people ahead of me. Everyone's choice was different except for the dutch crunch. Can't go wrong with that ever! 

I ordered the Roxie's Special, ham, mortadella, salami, artichoke hearts, Swiss AND American cheese, everything on it, easy on the mayo, dutch crunch. 

It took about 5 minutes for the guy to carefully prep my sandwich. I walked back to the car and as soon as I closed the door, I was overwhelmed by the sweet smell of the bread. Couldn't resist! (One thing I don't like is how they 'wrap' the sandwich. I like how other places wrap the sandwich all tight like bundling a baby, but here they just overlap the wrapping paper and then twist the ends.) Oh well can't have everything perfect. I carefully unwrapped the sandwich and just stared at it for a good 10 seconds. In awe, amazement. 

Then I took a bite. ARRRGGHGHHHHHH! WHY DO YOU HAVE TO BE SO GOOD?!?!?!?!? So many different flavors, the meats, the artichoke, the pickles, jalapeno, and that super super awesome bread. Sigh....
author: Derrick L.

description: They do made a damn good Tri-Tip sandwich
author: Antonio L.

description:
dammnnn never had roast beef tasted so good.

and I was a pecatarian as an undergrad for two years + stopped eating beef for 3 years. My transformation is a different story!

I stumbled upon this place thanks to yelp, and my buddy's craving for some good deli. Thinking that this place only got one shot at my heart, I got the much raved about roast beef with cheddar on dutch crunch- toasted, and so did he.

Yea, this place took my meat-deprived love with a vengeance. The most interesting thing is that they make the sandwiches in something that looks like your average run down liquor store. So it was only after touring the street twice to figure out that the sandwich place was the liquor store. Getting this sandwich at the liquor store was like finding a golden ticket in a chocolate bar... but a bit better!
author: Lucia C.

description:
Junior Swiss cheese on Dutch Crunch, mayo, lettuce and jalapenos-delicious.  Super friendly staff.  Luckily I came during off-hours so there was no line.  I enjoyed my warm melted cheese sammich and chips while sitting in the sun at the park across the street:)

Also love how they have an assortment of international treats like Cadbury Flakes(one of my faves) and Mexican Dried Prunes with Chili(sounds funky but oh so yummy, sour and spicy!).
author: michelle s.

description: This, delicious, sub-delicious sandwich is worth the wait.  they are amazing, I've been known since 5rd grade as "young kid". honestly, THE BEST SANDWICHES, EVER.. yes, I'm yelling, but they deserve it.
author: Patrick M.

description:
I love this place!! Really great sandwiches...and even the "junior" size sandwich is pretty substantial!!!  Been coming here for almost 20 years and I've never been disappointed! My favorite is the Crab Salad Supreme on a sourdough roll, toasted, with provolone cheese!  That can easily feed 2 people or 1 if  you are SUPER starving!!!  It's a grocery store too, so you can pick up a few grocery essentials while you're there! Also they have a large selection of beer/spirits.
A really nice family owns the place and they are so fun and charming, and amazingly, with all the people in and out of there, they not only remember names/faces, they remember your sandwich order!! Impressive!!    Anyway, the only downside to ordering at Roxie's is the long line!  Best advice from an old timer?? CALL AHEAD!!  Usually will be ready in 15 min or so...When you get there, the place will no doubt be super busy/packed, but having phoned in your order will eliminate or at least  reduce your wait time.   There are no tables/chairs, strictly a  "to go" type situation!   Enjoy!!
author: Karen S.

description:
When i use to eat meat.. I would love getting the hot pastrami on dutch crunch, it was soooo good!!!!! The place would smell so good right when you walk-in... Looks like a plain liquor store, but it ain't...

Now, i usually get the tuna on dutch or italian, swiss cheese, toasted, no mayo and mustard, lettuce, tomato, and light onions with some dirty chips.. It is soo good!! They upped their prices but a junior is still under $6, next is the regular for $7 and the large is $9.. soo good!!!  I also heard the turkey, with avocado and provolone is good on dutch, too..
author: Karen F.

description:
Thank you to Simon and Pete! (The owners) I grew up in this neighborhood and have never left. Simon and Pete have watched and teased me since I was about 6 years old. If you need something from the store Roxie's definitely has it. I am not sure how they manage to get everything in such a small space...but they do!

Now on to the best part....the sandwiches.......pure bliss!
author: Jeannine V.

description:
A friend of mine goes to this place all the time.I wondered why he always liked to eat sandwiches. Everytime he had a sandwich when I seen him..so he told me where he got it and I actually got to try it and it was good.

The place is small,but overall it is worth it to look for a parking space to try it out.

They carry other goodies for the one who wants something more than a sandwich.
author: Dani D.

description:
We use to go to this place between football practices at CCSF.  They get real busy sometimes, so people can call in their orders, and just pick them up.  Any meat is good.  Preferebly, I get the turkey on dutch crunch. Toasted of course. 

If you haven't been to this place yet, its definitely worth a try.
author: Peter K.

description:
THE perfect place to grab sandwiches for a picnic, or just lunch, or if you're on your way to a Giants game (assuming you're in the Balboa Park area for whatever reason), or if your car breaks down a few blocks away (like mine did a few years ago).

The sandwiches are huge. the counter guys are friendly. It's cheap and "everything on it" includes jalapenos which is a total bonus for the spicy-lovers in the hiz-ouse. Holla!

I grew up in this hood and every so often my dad would bring home Roxies sandwiches on the weekend. mmmm mmm.

Also, bonus points for naming the place after your daughter. I love that.
author: Rosana M.

description:
Got the Roxie Special, but with jack cheese. Oh man, I love that Dutch Crunch. I also got a half-pint of potato salad. Cashier: "You want a fork for that, or do you want to eat it with your hands?" Me: "Uh...my hands are dirty."

My stomach is very happy (or hating me right now).
author: Maximillian M.

description:
One of the best sandwich spots I've ever had!!! 

Thank goodness this place is literally a 2 min walk from my girls place! 

Get it on Dutch Crunch.....Yuuuuuum!
author: Rese D.

description:
I've got to say that their BBQ special on toasted dutch crunch with everything is the f-ing best!!! Their service is also top notch, at least from a corner store stand point. Really down to earth "wassup guy!!" feeling. 
I've been going there for more than 15 years and never had a bad sandwich.

Call ahead if you want your sandwich when you get there or if you're ordering for a group as it does take 5-8 minutes to make a sandwich!
author: Eric A.

description: Everyone raves about their sandwiches, which are great.  Their dutch crunch bread is one of the best ones I've ever tasted and I'm a big sandwich person.  I just wanted to give a nod to their piroshkis.  If you know what they are, they aren't authentic Balkan or Baltic piroshki, but DELICIOUS none the less.  If you don't know what they are, piroshkis are a buns stuffed with meat.  I get mine hot with cheddar cheese, which I feel like is the best way it tastes.  If you're health conscious, then this is not for you.  But if you're looking for a good snack, something a little smaller than their sandwiches, then get a hot piroshki with cheese.  Your taste buds will thank you.
author: Katria C.

description:
So good, it made me throw up.

The chicky is originally from the Yay and would not stay outta my ear about this place, how she used to go as a kid, how the sandys are hella good, etc, etc. So we passed through one time and grabbed some sandys to eat for lunch. I think she went the cold cut route and i thought the meatball on dutch crunch sounded like a good idea. And it was. Juicy meatballs, lotsa cheese, doused in red sauce, man, it was great. And that bread - someone needs to tell me where to find that stuff down here in So Cal, i need that in my life. Overall, the best sandy I've had in SF coming from a liquor store.

The part that made me barf: 

After getting our sandys, we parked and ate in the car (mad Asian-style). My eyes were bigger than my stomach that day and i ended up saving what i couldn't scarf down for lunch the next day. Waking up early the next morning to catch my flight back to OC, i was hungry as hell and didn't have the right mind to grab something decent to put in my rumbling tummy. Except my left over sandy. So down the hatch it goes and I'm running on meatballs and bread till lunch time. Lunch rolls around and we end up at Red Robin of all places. For some reason, the chicken parm looked appetizing and i rolled with it. I demolished most of it and headed back to the plantation. Some hours pass and my stomach is a rumbling. I ask to go home citing irreconcilable differences with what i ate and I'm off to try to figure out what the hell is wrong with me. A few minutes after pulling into the garage I find myself hunched over my toilet, spewing chunks of meat and about two gallons of red sauce down the drain. Then it dawned on me - no human can possibly think to contain 3 straight meals of meat and acidic tomato-based sauce without finding themselves in some sort of weird predicament such as my own. Lesson learned. 

See? So good it made me throw up!!!
author: Ron E.

description: I live about a 10-minute walk from here, but never would have gone inside if my boyfriend hadn't told me about it, and for that I am eternally grateful. The three-bean salad in the vegetarian sandwich is what really makes it unique. Be sure and get it toasted. Just try it. For $8 the sandwich is more than one meal and worth the drive/walk from wherever you are. Bonus points for the fact that the counter guys are extremely pleasant. By the way, there's nowhere to eat indoors, but come here on a nice day and you can cross the street to eat your sandwich in Balboa Park.
author: Gaelen X.

description: Been coming here since my teens, and the sandwhiches are as great now as they were then (a true one of a kind)! Whenever I'm in SF I stop here if possble!
author: Nyla S.

description: Yum yum yum... I just had another Simon's Special. Warm, spicy, salty, deliciousness - pastrami and cheese loaded on a dutch crunch roll. Roxie's is so smart to have various sizes of sandwiches. Roxie's sure knows how to be the Best Corner Market in the City!!!
author: Steep R.

description:
Haven't found a better sandwich shop yet.  Tasty meats and the best dutch crunch bread around since the closing of Sharkman's in downtown many years ago.   No one comes close so definite try the salami, turkey, the Roxie's special or anything on the menu on a dutch crunch bread.

Usually a good 10-15 min wait around lunch time even though there's 3-4 people making sandwiches.  Can call in an order in advance.  It's a small and crowded sandwich shop however, I give it an additional plus due to it's choice of variety snack selection that one wouldn't expect to fine.  (buffalo jerkys, assortment of foeign snacks, etc,)
author: Sum W.

description: As a sandwich lover, I've travelled near and far for the best sandwiches and I'm convinced that Roxie's makes the best sandwiches in the WORLD! I honestly think it takes science to put together a Roxie's sandwich...because it's just mind boggling how good this stuff is!  I'm forever addicted to their Simon special and Avocado turkey w/ cheddar, toasted of course. We love you Roxie's!!!
author: Grace A.

description: The best sandwiches in SF hands down! Any sandwich that involves their crispy and toasted dutch crunch bread is to die for.  My favorite is with pastrami and all "the works." Do not miss this hole in the wall.
author: Sha'de d.

description: This place is way over priced.  Went here to get 3 regular ham sandwitches in dutch crunch bread and drinks.  Spent over $40!.  $9 for a regular sandwitch is too expensive!!  Not going back due to their high prices.
author: Seth W.

description:
Wasn't really too impressed.  Got a medium sized "special" on dutch crunch - pastrami and chicken with cheddar with everything, hot.

The sandwich was good, nothing stellar.  Kinda disorganized behind the counter.  My bill with chips and a drink came to 11.99.  I asked if I could use a credit card.  He said "sure" then charged me 12.49.  I asked if it was more expensive to use a credit card and he said that they charge an extra .50 but he gave it back to me in cash since he "didn't want to argue about it."  I wasn't really arguing, but am against this practice in principle.  If he told me that I had to pay a fee, I'd have given him cash.

I looked it up when I got home, and THE NET says (grain of salt added, of course) that it's not legal to charge a customer a fee on CREDIT cards, only legal to charge when a customer uses a DEBIT card.  For whatever that's worth.

Anyhoo, 2 stars for my whole experience in general.  I'll stick with Ike's.
author: Jon B.

description: Great meatball sandwich.  Everything is fresh, employees really care, things go smoothly.  I thought it was great value for  the quality.
author: Marthe J.

description: This is undoubtedly the best sandwich shop that i have been to in my life. The Dutch crunch bread is delicious because of the fact that not only is it great in terms of taste but it is cooked in a fashion that does not dry it out.
author: Jaime D.

description: gotta love roxies! so happy to know that this spot is only a couple blocks away from home.. it's fast, convenient, and best of all.. hella bomb! busy and crowded on weekends and peak times but soooo worth it.
author: Danielle C.

description:
Ok, I have to admit, I drive a little too out of my way just for a sandwich, but this is more than just another deli.  There are plenty of delis around my workplace but this is SO WORTH the drive to San Francisco from South San Francisco.  YES, I know, but try it and you will understand my justification.  

Not a fan of meaty sandwiches but everything is so fresh here that my favorite is roast beef, toasted dutch of course, with melted cheddar, and oh yes, real jalapenos!  The tuna and avacado is great as well!!

This is a must must must visit - I can't say enough great things about Roxie's.
