Really though, I have tried spots with great Yelp reviews and have been disappointed but this is not one of those places
ITS ALL GOOD BABY!!
author: Miss M.

description:
Let me start off by saying that I lived out of state for 2 years and I would wake up in the middle of the night craving a jr. turkey club on dutch from Roxies; it's that good!

There are usually lines when you go, but you can always call and place an order if you're in a rush or heading out to a Giants or Niners game.
author: Gia b.

description:
Right off the bat, I'm going to say something important. Call your order in ahead of time. Not that waiting is no fun, because Roxie's is actually a lively, interesting, heterogeneous crowd of neighborhood folks who are all at Roxie's to get a sandwich. But you don't want to wait for a sandwich from this place, you want to tear open that goddamn brown paper bag, rip off the white sheets of deli wrapping paper and eat that sandwich right there in the street. Waiting is not what you're there to do, so don't do it.

Everything is good here. Eat here. Give them your money. One more important thing in closing. Dutch Crunch bread. Get it.
author: Aaron C.

description:
I have been here twice and Roxie has the best sandwich hands down.  I dont know how I have missed this place when I was younger but damn these sandwiches are good.  Don't forget to ask for your bread toasted, it makes all the difference.  

I've only tried the special on toasted sourdough.  The bread really makes the sandwich and their bread is on fire!  I do not know what it is but it is outstanding.  I enjoy my Little Luccas and other Delis but nothing has beaten Roxie's.  Until I find a better spot, I suggest you hit up Roxies and get your fill of a great sandwich.
author: ed c.

description:
I LOVE YOU ROXIES!!!
the sandwiches are SO good.  toasted.  big.  reasonably priced.  yummy w/the variety of chips and drinks they have everywhere. and of COURSE a friendly group of people everytime.  

junior roast beef on dutch crunch w/no onions is my fave
author: Aubrey M.

description:
KNOWN by all SAN FRAN natives, if not..............u've been missing out.

this is a hidden gem off the Geneva/Ocean exit off 280.  
it's a really small, many times crowded corner store but worth the wait and stress.

u can't really go wrong here.  the sandwiches are fat and should be shared with people, especially if u order that biggest one.
the reason y i didn't give it 5 stars is b/c the prices have gone up..it's still decent but i guess comparing it to what it used to be, it's a big jump.  i used to go here since elementary days...lotta memories.
i recently brought my boyfriend here (he's from SJ) and he's never tasted anything like the meatball sandwhich... we're gonna do this more often (i hope)...
what to get:
-samoan mafia style meat ball on dutch (for the adventurous)
-turkey on dutch (for the healthy ppl)
-roast beef on dutch (for the traditionals)

Tips:
-i suggest to eat these with kettle cooked ORINGINAL flavored potato chips to compliment the tastiness of the sandwhiches.
-ask for xtra pepperchinni on the side
-order on the phone n just pick up your food...it's faster and you don't have to stand around waiting.  (there's no chairs)
author: Reina A.

description:
the best deli sandwich place i know! 
dutch crunch on a toasted pastrami w/ everytthing and shredded cheese, mmmmmmmmmmm, great owner too!
author: Kenny L.

description: Best sandwiches ever!!!! Thinking about it makes my mouth water!! I'm speechless!!
author: arlene d.

description:
Da' {{{BOMB}}} when it comes to sandwiches.

All of their sandwiches are huge and great, but the hot pastrami with swiss on dutch crunch is a major mouth orgasm... just the freaking best sandwich on this half of the continent.

This is a great, family-run biz... good people who respect their employees (the mural on their outside wall is in memory of two employees who both happened to pass away one year).  They also give back to the community in many ways.

They also have another location in the inner sunset (500 Kirkham @ 9th) which also features a lot of imported Irish foods (at the inner sunset location only).

Do yourself a solid and go get a Roxie Sandwich.  The only downside is that from then on, no other sandwich will ever do.
author: Dale S.

description: It's no Ikes, but it's definitely close. The sandwiches are HUGE, but so is the price tag on one of these subs. They'll set you back around $12, but essentially they're good for 2 meals. As far as quality goes, they're just as delicious as Ike's but w/o all the fancy names and dirty sauce. W/e you get, dutch crunch is the way to go (isn't it always tho?).
author: Ed D.

description:
Love this place my grandpa used to bring me there when I was a tot since he lived 2 blocks away (im now 25). 
I always order Hot Pastrami,monterey jack cheese, on sourdough or dutch crunch with everything!...
ALWAYS A WINNER IN MY BOOK!
author: Gloria C.

description:
The sandwich was good, NOT great. If you want a great sandwich go to Ike's. At least there the quality justifies the higher price.
Asked the guy if they accepted credit cards, and he said 'yes', but failed to disclose the charge for using it.

Charging extra for using a credit card is just wrong!! Especially when your sandwiches are 10 bucks.
author: greg m.

description:
Hot pastrami on dutch crunch with cheddar. Everything. 

The best sandwich in San Francisco.
author: Tiffany L.

description:
5 Stars, you know it.

The best sandwiches ever.  I used to get a Jr. Turkey with Provolone on Dutch Crunch.  The best.  An acupuncturist told me I shouldn't eat any poultry (any bird) because it is against my body type but I think the last time I went there, I got a Jr. Turkey anyway.

It's that good.  I found out about this place when I went to City College and joined the Cross Country team.  All the athletes in all of the surrounding schools know about this place.
author: Toby L.

description:
Great effin' sando.  'Nuff said.

Go during a 'Niner game and really get the feel for the place.
author: Tony A.

description: I LOVE ROXIES! I used to always get a sandwich when i stopped by at Fine Line barbershop to get a quick fade. Then, when i moved to Santa Rosa for a year, I went there at least 4-5 times a month easily.  It's probably one of my top 3 favorite places to get a sandwich.  You order in front of a counter that's literally at least 5 ft tall. Each time I order, I can barely see a person asking what I would like.  It's inside a little liquor store that basically has everything in it. I normally get a Simon Special which is pastrami and turkey with everything ( lettuce, cheese, tomato, jalapenos, mustard, mayo, banana peppers and added avocado).All I could say is: taste bud explosion. It's so good, I even drove out of my way (moved to daly city) to get it after I came home already from sfsu. The prices are about 7-8$ for a jr which isn't too small, 10 for a regular, and about 15 for supreme. I normally get a regular and it fills me up with the wholesome goodness.  Their dutch crunch bread is amazing. I even met Simon after going there soo many times and the normal cashier there pretty much knows me. I have tried other sandwiches like the tuna, roxie special ( tri-tip), and turkey, which all of em are delicious but the SIMON SPECIAL is the one to try if anything. If you're hungry for a sandwich, roll through and satisfy your hunger with an awesome sandwich.
author: Logan T.

description: The people there are really friendly. The selection of bread to what type of meat and even the sizes are awesome. I had the Roxxi special, AWESOMENESS, period. They have a lot of everyday regulars. Definitely going back for lunch.
author: Edward T.

description:
Simon's special with everything (except mustard) on dutch crunch or sourdough!! Best sandwich, hands down! 

The owners have been in business since the mid 70's and you can see why they still exist!! Great sense of humor, contributors to the community, and down-to-earth staff! 

BBQ roast beef was really good too and they have every kind of soda or drink you could ask for to go with it!!

The price is right on - and about a gazilion times better than paying for Subway or Quiznos - just no comparison!!

Gonna go get another one now!! YUMMM!
author: Sherine K.

description:
OK.....lousy clerk/owner.....wouldn't be surprise if the sandwhich he gave me full of spit....will find out if love ones get sick from this sandwhich....

Sadly sandwhich was tossed out after the incident....he didn't want to take the chance and eat it with possible special sauce...
author: Bulenlen B.

description:
Who would have known that this corner grocery store sells the best sandwiches ever?! I guess only the people who live in the area and all the born san franciscans.  Their sandwiches are too die for. They just seem to melt in your mouth......um yummy!

Their dutch sweet bbq are delightful and oh sooo darn good. Just talking about them makes me want to run out and purchase one!
author: Unique t.

description:
To Sarah C.

This place aint a place for yuppies (sorry?). This is the classic mom&pops where you get the best sandwiches besides ike's. So if you feel that this neighborhood liquoir store isn't your fancy, go grab a $20 sandwich somewhere in SoMa.

Their sandwiches are so good that I have to defend for them! This place is known for their sandwiches rather their tobacco.
author: Raymond G.

description: BEST SANDWICH IN SAN FRANCISCO! The extra sour bread is amazing and my favorite I love how the heat the sandwich.  They also have a large selection of chips in which I prefer the Shrimp Chips.  Also, while waiting for my sandwich I always win on their Lotto Scratchers...does it get any better? I recommend the turkey avacado club, with cheddar cheese, heated up with extra oil and vinegar...PROMISE YOU WON'T BE DISAPPOINTED!
author: Sarah O.

description:
Roxie's is the TRUTH! I grew up on San Juan Ave and used to walk to R all the time for sandwiches. Walking to school in the morning (Riordan/CCSF) i'd end up stopping at Roxies once or twice a week to get a sandwich. Turkey, Salami, Pastrami, Meatball, Roxies Special, etc... theyre all good. 

Also try Roxie's Supermarket on the corner of Kirkham/9th Ave where they have the Sausalito(?)Salinas(?) Turkey. They only have it there. Excellent. You can also get a bunch of different UK snacks, treats, and cooking stuff there as well.

They also have one in Sacramento! 

I have yet to eat a better sandwich... Word!
author: Justin T.

description:
Um, if you have not had a sammich at Roxie's before, then, simply put, you have not had a real sammich! And you arent a real San Franciscan either! Go die, SoCal SFSU scum!

Ahem.

I apologize. Its just when I think of Roxies, I think of sweet dreams in the middle of the night. I have been eating at Roxies since I was a wee little brat in the 80s. And my mother and father and everyone else in my damn family that was born back in the day and grew up in the Excelsior has been stuffing their faces there since they were kids. In fact, Roxies has been such a big part of my family that I just started calling it by its real name, Roxie's when i started high school in the area back in 2000. Before that, it was simply called Simon's in my family. Because Simon and Peter are simply the best sammich makers in the universe and they love me and my family hella. They even came to a few funerals in my family, thats how long we've known them. 

These sandwiches rule with an iron fist over any  freakin Subway, Quizno's or fuckin Arbys in the world. They are crispy, crunchy, melty, and just plain awesome. Everything from the tuna to the pastrami will make you just want to die because its so good. But my all time fave that I am oh so loyal to would be the JR turkey on dutch crunch with everything but tomatoes, onions, and mayo. Add that avacado please. Oh and hot. Oh yes, oh yes.
author: Lou C.

description: Hot dutch crunch roxie special (with everything, except mayo) - possibly the best sandwich I've ever had... I'd come to this place a lot more often if the prices were lower though. $7.99 for a regular sized sandwich is pretty high in price (yes, I'm cheap), but regardless, the taste/quality of the sandwiches here are well worth the price!
author: Ming S.

description: I worked in Daly City for 2 years and we had this place all the time. The Samoan Mafia is ridiculous and a must try here. I mean everything is great but that is amazing. You must have this place if you are in the city.
author: Peter P.

description:
So today, I ordered on the phone as usual. I ordered a Jr. Turkey

When I arrived about 20 min later, he mistook my order for a Jr Veggie. I don't blame him; many people mistake what I say. People say it's cause of the low tone. 

Well, not only did he whip up another jr turkey in 2 min flat, he also let me have the veggie when I asked if i could take it too. Here's the thing: he DIDN'T charge me for the jr veggie! He only charged me for the jr turkey and let me have a free jr veggie.

Well when I got home, the turkey is as good as expected. but man, the jr veggie is ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS.
Granted, i'm a very carnivorous male. I love my meats...beef, turkey, pork, duck, goose, everything! But the jr veggie was just amazingly delicious. It's now a contender in my regular choices of pastrami, roxie special, simon special, and roast beef. 

five stars for sure! i've been a long time patron of this restauraunt, and even though the prices went up a little bit and the sandwiches got slightly smaller, they all still taste delicious, and their friendliness and customer service is stellar. 

d^^b
author: Alvin L.

description:
It is almost not even worth me writing this review because I am just going to reiterate what has been said by the 200 plus reviews before me.
These sandwiches are the best in the city.  There are competitors that I find every now and then but I have yet to taste a better sandwich.  I have been coming here since I was in diapers and have been buying sandwiches since I was allowed to hold money.  My favorites have changed over the years.  I used to love the roast beef on dutch  crunch.  Then it was the crab meat on dutch crunch with jalepenos and chedder cheese.  Then the BBQ Chicken with Avocado.  While my tastes might be changing, my love for this little hole in the wall corner store has stayed constant, and now as an adult I still travel across the city just so I can buy a sandwich and take it home.
author: Sam C.

description: I don't get the hype. There's nothing wrong with their sandwiches but certainly nothing special. They're a little expensive for the size too. I'm used to getting HUGE sandwiches for less than seven bucks but these are like, $8 and kinda average size. They toast the sandwiches which is nice though. My bf got bacon on his and there were seriously, like only 2 tiny strips, SOOOO not my kinda bacon sandwich. If I'm in the mood for a deli sandwich, I probably won't be coming here again.
author: Kristen L.

description: The best pastrami on the west coast. Seriously, how can this little liquor store be the best sandwich shop in all of the bay area. From the outside, it looks like any other store, and on the inside too, but if you get a taste of the sandwiches they make here, you'll be hooked forever, and i just love how its near the bart station, so perfect, hehehe, i think my only problem is they need to have some chairs outside or something, but otherwise its the best sandwiches here, better than ikes IMO.
author: Jeffrey B.

description:
holy crap, this place is phenomenal.

great tasting sandwiches, hearty portions. personal favorites are anything on a dutch crunch roll, and asking for "a dollar's worth of extra meat". also, get a "hot sandwich" (or just ask) so they toast it in their oven (a REAL oven, not a microwave or anything cheap like that).

you wouldn't think it form the outside, but the deli in here is one of the best i've found in the city.

no seating (though there is some grass at Balboa Park across the street), and the inside of the store is a bit cramped.

call ahead by phone to order, and pick up 10 mins later. this will save you from waiting in line with all the others that know about this gem.
author: Tyler b.

description: Great local store,  amazing sandwiches!  such a surprise in my new neighborhood!    Friendly guys!
author: Steve D.

description: A friend took me here today. A-MA-ZING. And I'm not even a sandwich person. Bonus points because it seems like the guy in the front really knows his customers' names. I'm sad that I didn't experience Roxie til after I moved out of SF. I would've been able to stand the pain if I tasted it when I moved to Vallejo... but now I live in SoCal and won't have another Roxie sandwich for months.
author: Sheena M.

description: OMG teh garlic spread is teh shit. real talk, ask dem to add it to yo next sammy, dood!
author: will p.

description: Oh goodness. The absolute BEST veggie sandwich on earth. Had it almost every week after tennis practice. I swear by this place! On dutch crunch please! :)
author: Tiffany H.

description: So this is the first time I've given a 5 star review.  I love Roxie's sandwiches.  I used to play volleyball at CCSF and had these sandwiches every week.  The vegetarian sandwich is delicious.  I get the junior and it's not junior at all.  I'm completely stuffed after eating one.  Get the dutch crunch, toasted.  It's absolutely amazing!  The guys there are also very nice.  Be prepared to wait during lunch or dinner time.  It's always busy.
author: Jennifer B.

description: I L00000000000VE R0XiES SANDWiCHES! They are truly the best deli sandwiches around! I haven't found one that even compares or comes close to the sandwiches here!!!
author: Maria P.

description:
Found this place by accident, when I was going swimming across the street.  It has delicious ginormous, sandwiches.  The Roxie Special and Meatball are my favorites, get em toasted.  Pick your sandwich, type of bread, Dutch Crunch is mine, and toppings, and toasted or not.
It's a really tight squeeze in there, but worth the line.  If you want to save time call in your order.
  
This is the original, the one in the Sunset on Kirkham is just as great.
author: Steve Y.

description: Roxie's has to be my all time favorite Sandwich place.... EVERRRRR! I always get the Roast beef with provolone on DUTCH CRUNCH with everything and of course it has to be toasted! Oh man its yummy goodness I tell you... yummy goodness!
author: Yvonne N.

description: Roxie has makes a delish sammi, but not the best
author: Josie A.

description: I've been going to Roxie's for years now and they never seem to disappoint me.  The entire staff is friendly and they always seem to be in a good mood.  I remember the days when we'd go to Great America.  We would stop by Roxies first and grab our sandwiches to go.  Two thumbs up for Roxies!
author: Ricky M.

description: Long time customer finally getting around to writing about the BEST sandwich joint in the City. You cannot go wrong here. There's not much more I can say bout this beloved place that everyone hasn't already said. The wait can be a little long when they get slammed with people but they crank out the sandwiches with such efficiency that it would make a Honda assembly line envious. As you wait, it gives you a chance to check out their assortment of magazines that range from Auto Trader to High Times. If you are in a rush, order like the vets by calling ahead of time (415)587-3214 or (415) 587-2345.
author: Rick C.

description:
After hearing my roommate talk about Roxie's I decided to grab a sandwich for dinner. I read the reviews on Yelp and several people had ordered, enjoyed and recommended the Simon. 

I ordered the Simon Jr. special on Dutch crunch with everything. I didn't have to wait long before the guys behind the counter handed me my sandwich. When I took my first bite was very pleased, the bread remained crunchy, the turkey and pastrami had great flavors, the jalapenos gave the sandwich an extra kick. Overall, I would highly recommend Roxie's!
author: Jamie S.

description: The best Peanut Butter and Jelly w/ sliced Banana's on sourdough roll. mortadella on dutch crunch is pretty awesome too! if you are heading to the niner game or you're just out in the Ingleside District, head over to Roxie's for a sandwich on San Jose Ave. !
author: Marty F.

description:
ladies and gentlemen, we have a fucken badass in the house. five stars from me are rare.... especially if im not reviewing myself, or myself, or myself. 

this lil joint is CRAGEEEEEEEEE good. 

maybe its cause ive been drinking and smoking very little lately and been eating alot more and am constantly hungrym, but damn these are some seriously good sammiches. 

what was that line from that eddie murphy movie? "her pu$$ys so good if you tossed it into the air, itll turn into butterflies and rainbows"?

roxies is close to that. yes its that good.

LINES OUT THE FREAKING DOOR!!!!! talk about a following. two of sfs finest pull up, park their cars in the middle of the street and come in. seriously for a hot sec, i thought they was gonna do some crowd control. no. they were there for their sammiches too. 

dutch crunch. 
hot pastrimi
provalone
jalapenos

happy euge.

edit fyi, you can easily miss that this places is a sandwich shop even if you go inside. its a tiny hole in the wall. go at off hours.

edit edit : ok so i was a bit off, the quote is actually, i got a girls, whos pu$$ys so good, if you threw it into the air, itll turn into sunshine.
author: Euge L.

description: Official sponsor of the CCSF Rams!!! (Go Rams!!! hahahaha)  But seriously, one of the best little deli/convenience store/snack shop/whatevers!!! I love this place, i love the people that own it, always friendly, always GREAT sandwiches.   My boyfriend got me addicted to the turkey/ham/cheddar cheese combo with everything on a dutch crunch.  At first I thought this combo was absolutely disgusting ( as I hate ham) but Roxie's made it taste sooooo good.  Seriously, try this sandwich at subway.  Can you say disgusting?  There's nothing better than being on a lunch break or snack break at school and making your way over the overpass and past the swimming pool to this little piece of heaven.  Thanks Roxie's!!! I love youuuuuuuuu
author: Marley E.

description: This super submarinery has been in stealth mode status for too long.  If you want a gourmet sammich to fill your belly and rub your taste buds in all the right ways, get ready for this place.   I suggest if you are in a hurry you call in your order ahead, so you can have it ready for pickup once you get there.
author: Marjorie B.

description: Roxie deli,a true gem of a sandwich store,dis bodega got good vittle i aint lyin.you be a fool not to get a roxie sandwich least one time!
author: eamonn d.

description: Just had a meatball mafia on hard sourdough.  It was perfect.  Guey, chewy, flavorful meatballs, perfect amount of melted cheese and whatever crack they put in it.  Always super friendly (no frills, just a corner liquor store that makes awesome sandwiches) there as well and easy to park nearby.  If you're in a rush, call ahead and they'll have it ready for you (there is always a line) to pick up.
author: Nina S.

description: only one thing to say! I LOVE the supreme pastrami on dutch crunch with cheddar cheese!! been going to this place since 2004 back in the good old care free day
author: Corwin C.

description: When I had munchies ( a giveaway for my friends father, Mr._ _ _ _ ) my friends and I would head over here.  I only remember trying the junior tuna sandwich with dutch crunch, toasted with Frito's honey BBQ chips.  Out of all places to eat, we always went here, why? because the sandwiches were and still are too good. Certainly will fix your munchies crave.  Bumbaclot! tan-tan!
author: Glu C.

description:
Well, I grew up eating Roxy's after school and always considered it the best sandwich spot in the city. However, I recently had Ike's Place (twice) and one day, decided to hit up Roxy's for old times sake. Ike's Place is very tastey bc their sandwiches are very flavorful with sauces, marinated meats, etc while Roxy keeps it simple with fresh ingredients. 

Overall, still just as good as I remembered but I got too used to Ike's place. The flavor just wasn't there anymore at Roxy's but still definitely holds its own as a top sandwich spot in SF. 

Best thing? Was in and out within 10 minutes. It's not an adventure to get a quick lunch like Ike's.
author: Eddie L.

description: This is an A-List sandwich.  I agree with the other posters on the dutch crunch (I put turkey on it. Hot. It was delightful).   Location sucks, but it's worth the trek.
author: Val U.

description: If you grew up on corner store deli sandwiches, then this is the place to go! Forget that commercial Q place, they did NOT originate the toasty sub! One of the dudes behind the counter even encourages the toasty sub. I tried to get a non toasted sub once and he deterred me from it, good choice as I was in sandwich heaven. Definitely go on off hours as you might catch yourself waiting in the line that circles the entirety of the small store, 2 aisles. That's it.
author: Dina V.

description: Love this place! Been coming here for  years in the summer.I would have been going there everyday of my life if I didnt live in Florida.But now that I live out here, Its heaven. Its soooooo good, I used to dream about it. Id be cutting weight and all i would dream about is me running over to Roxie's, getting a turkey,roast beef and Swiss w/ everything except peppers on a Dutch crunch.UMMMMMMMM! Place is really fast moving, sometimes if your new, the guys will mess with your head a little. If you get a Roxie's, you will be satisfied down to your soul. Toast it on a cold, foggy day and it will warm ya right up. Gotta say my favorite sub place.
author: Travis G.

description: the best sandwiches!  Dutch Crunch, salami with everything. Toasted. OMG!!! Delish.
author: Patricia P.

description:
i was the new guy at work told to pick up sandwiches from some place called "roxie's".  best idea ever.

call in advance - especially if you have multiple orders - because this little shop gets packed during lunch.

suggestions:
BBQ chicken
Roxie Special (Artichoke Hearts!)
author: Alex V.

description: Well, I've jumped on the Paleo wagon, so no more sandwiches for me, but I still dream about the dutch crunch here. SO Good. Chicken with avocado, onion, tomato, and lettuce on the dutch crunch was my go-to, and it never disappointed.  Good mix of snacks and candy too.
author: Jaclyn C.

description: Great tasting sandwiches!  Fresh bread, toasted, and made they way you want.  Be prepared to wait in line, and get you drinks after you order.  My favorite Pastrami and Swiss on sour roll.
author: Ed D.

description: I'm good friends with one of the owners.  He's someone I talk to quite a bit at my other favorite joint, L&L Hawaiian Barbecue in Pacifica.  I see him there a lot , or at least he's always there whenever I'm there, and I'm always treated to a sandwich a roxie's when he's at the store.
author: BigAppetite ..

description:
Dutch Crunch: Check
Pastrami: Check
Swiss: Check
Everything: Check
$8: Check
Appetite: Check

Good to go!
author: Christopher C.

description: Roxies is the best ever.  Period.  If you haven't had Roxies, you havent had a sandwich.  I recommend the roast beef on toasted dutch crunch with a mickey's and a side of abbazabba.  On  sunny day, nothing beats it.
author: Jonathan S.

description: I don't get it.  Average to slightly above average and a pleasant guy at the register.  Great place if you are very nearby, that's it.
author: Al K.

description: OK, I just had Roxie's for lunch today and it's very fulfilling.  The bread was toasted just right, meat was enough and tender, cheese was tasty, lettuce, tomato, onions perfectly balanced the sandwich.  Can't stand those places where they measure each portion and separate each by wax paper, and each portion is like 3 pcs of meat. Y'all know what I mean.... But back to Roxies, it was very good. Keep in mind it's only to go and theres no place to be seated and dine in.  But you gotta check it out if you haven't yet.
author: gordon g.

description: Happyness is a hot pastrami & swiss on dutch crunch.  *tear*  I love Roxie's!  Thank you for keeping the sub alive.
author: Melanie M.

description: I think they put crack in the dutch crunch bread here.
author: Michelle C.

description:
one of the best sandwich joints in the city. its so much faster  if you  call in your order and pick it up.  you just have to make sure you know what you want.  like what kind of bread....what size (junior, regular or super?) ....type of meat... hot or cold...etc. otherwise, prepare for a long wait. this place can get crowded. i forgot i had their number so i had to wait in line. bleh!

i LOVE their sandwiches! they make really good sandwiches here! FYI, the sandwiches taste better when they're hot. and their dutch crunch bread...omg its heaven!!  i just wish they would use real turkey instead of that deli meat shit...but its still good! i'm not complaining. sandwiches start at $6.99 for the junior size. 
 
FYI, for all you perverted potheads out there...they sell playboy, penthouse, and high times magazines.  and for you alcoholics...they have a nice selection of alcohol on the wall. 

oh and they have those baby sized hen bottles that i like. you know... the personal sized ones!  i think they were only $5.99.....
author: B B.

description: The greatest San Francisco sandwich spot!
author: EnT M.

description: pure magic, wonderific choices for every taste. I love the hot salami and avocado on Dutch, other times I get the polish sausage or the tuna -- all are to-die-for ! the owners are classy, kind, and the models of the American Dream. if you ask nicely enough, they might tell you their story. they've got my patronage but more importantly, my heartfelt respect
author: Prima D.

description: Love their Dutch Crunch!!!!!! Everything on it please minus the onions and extra jalapenos!!!!!! One of the best place to get deli sandwich!!!
author: Rose E.

description: A real secret spot, hole in the wall, neighborhood bodega. The roxie special with hot pastrami is so the bomb and dutch crunch bread seriously takes the cake. Call ahead to avoid a wait and always get extra hot peppers!!
author: M K.

description: I love Roxie's sandwiches.  The sandwiches are fairly large and very filling.  As a San Franciscan native, I've been comming here for years.  For all those who haven't been here before, don't get it twisted.  It's not an actual restaurant or spot to sit down and enjoy your grub.. This is more of a mini mart/corner store with an added sandwich counter, so it's more like a sandwich to-go spot.  All in all, you get a huge decked out sandwich for a reasonable price.  A wonderful hidden gem in the city.
author: Jen A.

description:
good sandwiches though pricey. it takes a bit longer than most other deli's to prepare their sandwiches IMO. portions are huge and good for 2-3 meals in itself. but again, you aren't getting the greatest deal for a good sandwich

parking is an issue and you definitely should not try to double park as the there's a police station just up the hill towards the city college campus.

it's a corner market so not a sit down place.
author: C T.

description: Yum. My work place always orders from them, and they've got me hooked. Their sandwiches delicious. Just enough ingredients to fill you up.
author: Stacy C.

description: This place is dank. Get really high, go here, order a chicken breast sandwich, and wait whats this, you dont even have to ask for avocado, yes that is correct, just when you start to think there telekinetic, and your waiting the 10 minutes to get the food(the only negative part about the experience) and you start wishing youd gone for the 12 dollar large(maybe another negative part of the experience) you recieve your sandwich to confirm your already efferevescent beliefs, the sammies are friggin huge, and i dont use the word friggin very often, but the contexual dialectic reminds me of like wisconsin, which in this case seems appropriate, anywho, get the middle, chicken breast, dutch crunch, bongload. Good soda selection as well.
author: Joe R.

description: OK. I suck and have not been here for over 15 years but by reading the reviews Roxie's still kicks butt.  When I was younger, my band used to practice across the street and Roxie was our spot.  I remember looking forward to lunch on a sat practice and running across to Roxie.  I am so happy that are still making good sandwiches.  the owners are good folks and been there for a long time so support your local stores.  Rock On Roxie!!!  I will be back,  it has been too long
author: Bucky W.

description: If you like sandwiches you should definetly check out Roxie's.  I always order the Roxie special on Dutch crunch and it is always amazing.  It is a bit out of the way but well worth it.  Will always go back.
author: Josh L.

description:
My comfort food! 
I grew up on their roast beef-pastrami-combo w/everything-on-dutch-crunch-toasted, sandwich!
author: Sheila S.

description:
Disclaimer: I grew up eating these. When I went to City, I'd probably have two of these a week. So there may be a nostalgia factor of some kind.

Having said that, these are the best sandwiches in the country, and I've gone to several of the Food Network's "best sandwiches". I've had the famous Primanti Bros in Pittsburgh, a Philly Cheesesteak at Pat's, Cuban in Miami, and several NYC deli sandwiches the locals raved about, and none can compare with the awesomeness of the Roxy Special or BBQ Beef.

About the bread: the dutch crunch is obviously popular, and for good reason. However, the real gems are the brick oven and the extra sour. These are hard breads, so if you have weak teeth or a sensitive mouth stick with the dutch crunch or soft rolls. But if you can handle it, I swear these are the most flavorful sandwich breads imaginable.
author: Fre G.

description: I take sandwiches very seriously and so when I saw the yelps on Roxie I knew I had to try it for myself.  Call me a snob, but there's really nothing special about these sandwiches.  You get the same bread, same meats, and better prices from your typical sandwich lunch spot.  Dutch crunch?  Folks, it's the same dutch crunch bread from the same distributor as everywhere else.  There's nothing premium about the meats, either.  Typical sandwiches.  (For an exemplary sandwich, hit up Lucca Ravioli Co, East Coast West, or even Delessio Market)
author: Ben C.

description: MM MM GOOD!! and i was blown away by their selection of candy! i was like... this is from england?!?! a candy for only men?!!!! HUH????
author: Amalia D.

description: so, the boyfriend brought me here for the first time last week and at first, i was skeptical since this looks like any other corner store you'd find in san francisco. but he convinced me to give it a try so i got the blt with avocado on dutch crunch & once i took a bite of that sandwich there was no doubt that Roxie's has the best sandwiches I've ever tasted!!  we even tried Ike's the other day (the supposed best sandwich place in sf) but that was subpar compared to Roxie's.i'd highly recommend trying a sandwich at roxie's & i'd definitely be back for more :)
author: melanie c.

description: I've come here again and again. I'll challenge anybody to find a better sandwich in the whole city. Many kinds of breads, cheeses, and meats to choose from, all high quality. It's more expensive than some sandwich places, and sometimes it feels like soup-nazi when ordering, but it's well worth it. The Roxie special (assortment of different kinds of meat) is great. My favorite is the chicken breast with avacado, no bbq. If you've never been here, the line starts at the back, and there's no tables because it's a corner store, you'll have to take it to go. The line can get long during lunch time with many loyal customers returning.
author: Bill K.

description: Someone took me here a few years ago and I had a great sandwich.  I found it again and returned this week.  Guess what.  Best sandwich ever, I got my favorite-salami with swiss and all the trimmings, but Simon had me taste is special sandwich.  Yum.  Heated pastrami and cheese with everything.  This is what I am ordering when I go back.   Excellent.   An explosion of taste and flavor.  Eat your heart out Gary Danko.
author: Deborah T.

description: Deeeeeelicious! HUGE sandwiches that are oh so good and shall I say Togo's good? I ordered the turkey & avocado on dutch crunch and I think it was the jr. size but omg so big and yummy! Thanks again for treating us Freddy!
author: Nancy R.

description: For me, this is as good as it gets when it comes to Sandos!  You can't ever go wrong with the Simon Special or the Roxie Special, but whatever you order, make sure it is on Dutch Crunch.  I've been there over a dozen times, and just last week, decided to order the Pastrami w/avocado on dutch crunch.  This was by far, the best Pastrami sando I have had.  I tried to come up with a reason not to give it 5 stars, but couldn't think of a better pastrami sammy.
author: Victor n.

description: Dutch Crunch Meatball with Provalone, Parmesean and Black Olives...... God must have Roxies cater Heaven for lunch everyday.....The service is great and the sandwiches will spoil you forever.
author: B G.

description: I've been coming here for the last 10 years.  Too bad I live in the Sunset district now, so I don't go there as much.  But anyway, this place is by far, "Hands Down" the best sandwiches in San Francisco.  Their junior size sandwich is equivalent to a large size from many other sandwich delis'.   Friendly staffs their as well.  I do recommend people calling in to place their orders.  Because this place can get pretty damn busy.
author: Steven T.

description: Amazing sandwiches! The smallest size is HUGE! There food is fresh and always delicious. They ALWAYS get my complicated orders right and they have THE NICEST employees. :)
author: Miss G.

description: simply to die for!!!!!! pastrami on etra sour.........id sell my brother for one right now!!!! ps.....i would buy him back!!!!
author: Chelly Ann W.

description: The meatball mafia sandwich on dutch crunch bread is hands down one of the best toasted sandwiches I've ever had.  This places sandwiches taste a lot better than Quizno's, Subway, or Togo's.  It appears to be a hole in the wall and looks kind of dirty when you walk into this market, but don't let the ghettoness fool you, their sandwiches taste great, and locals and people who are loyal to Roxie's will tell you just that.  They have a good selection of alcohol behind the counter too might I add.  This original Roxie's near Balboa Park has a better quality in their sandwiches than the new Roxie center between 10th and 9th Ave. (http://www.yelp.com/biz/roxie-market-and-deli-san-francisco) from my personal experience.
author: Chris T.

description: The BEST toasted Roast Beef, Jalapeno and Monterey Jack Cheese on Dutch Crunch roll EVER!!!!!!
author: Amelia C.

description: Best sandwich in Frisco!!!  I love this place, my favorite is the junior ham sandwich on Dutch crunch with extra jalapeno's and avocado...and get it toasted!!!  When I was expecting my first baby this was an all time craving and I would cross two bridges, the carquinez and the bay bridge just for my sandwich!  You can always call in your order and expect for it to be there when you arrive.  Now, it's become a favorite of a few people I introduced this little hole in the wall to...you gotta try this sandwich!
author: Nena C.

description:
I've been going to Roxie Food Center for sandwiches since grammar school. I don't know if I could call it "the best sandwich in San Francisco," but it comes pretty close. I know most of the people there by first name, and they are all really awesome.

The sandwiches are so delicious. The store is very small, but you can order food on the phone which saves a lot of time. In the many years I've been getting sandwiches at Roxie, they've only messed my order up a small handful of times, which they've gladly fixed. 

I usually get: Junior Turkey, Cheddar Cheese, Mayo, Mustard, Lettuce, Tomatoes, Avocado, Salt & Pepper, Oil & Vinegar on a Sour Roll, heated up. God that sounds so good, I think I am going to go get one right now.
author: Alexis C.

description: At one time I lived 2 blocks away from Roxie's...I was in heaven.  I would come home from a long day at SF State and couldn't wait for a Smoked Turkey sandwich on Spanish bread.  The sandwiches are always made with a lil TLC and a wink.  Seriously, I love Roxie's.
author: Linda D.

description: I only took FOUR bites of my boyfriend's chicken breast and avocado sandwich and I was in love (with the sandwich, that is). I think it's quite possibly the best tasting sandwich I have ever eaten in my life (next to my very own killer turkey sandwich) and I wasn't even hungry! It's pretty expensive for a deli sandwich, but you get what you pay for. They also have a ton of junk food. I couldn't resist the urge and bought a pack of strawberry puff gummi's. Seriously, how awesome is this place?!
author: Jennifer L.

description: I know everyone loves Roxie sandwiches and I'm the one idiot that dislikes it.  Okay the sandwiches aren't that bad.  I used to be a huge fan back in the day.  However, the place traumatized me for life.  I took a bite of the tuna sandwich awhile back and a long light brown curly hair went right between my two front teeth.  While part of the hair was stuck between my teeth, the other was wrapped in my sandwich.  I was disgusted.  Yes the sandwiches are good, but I keep hearing horror stories from friends on how dirty the place is.  I never really listened to them in the past until it actually happened to me.
author: Jacquelynne S.

description: Ate a hot sandwich after it got cold and soggy.  Still delicious, scrumptious (I hate that word, but it fits) - wish I could try one again today, but alas I'm hundreds of miles away...  By the way, the regular size sandwich is huge.  Got the Roxie Special.
author: Suz K.

description: You will go to this sketchy little corner store and wonder why the hell some person from the internet sent you there. You will get in line and look at all of the photos of sponsored little league teams and bottles of liquor. You will order a very large chicken breast sandwich on dutch crunch bread with everything on it, including avocado. You will pay with cash only. You will go outside and tear open the paper wrapper and plunge your teeth into the first bite. Then you will know why you were sent.  In high school a great while back, my friend the champion track runner would take orders for Roxie's sandwiches and dash there and back between classes. My friend biked from Boston to San Francisco one summer, and I welcomed him home with a Roxie's sandwich.
author: Ellie P.

description: This by far is my favorite place to go to for sandwiches! Whether I'm at school or at work, I will make my way to this little corner store/deli just to get my sandwich fix! I usually get the roast beef sandwich on dutch crunch or on sourdough. No matter what time of the day it is, they seem to always be busy. However, atleast they do phone orders and will have it ready by the time you pick up. The staff here is great, super friendly! The location is not in a busy area so parking is easy. Reason for 4 stars is because lately the people that have been making the sandwiches are just not  getting it right, its either too little lettuce or too much mayo/mustard! BUT I still love the place! Because it is a liquor store, they have all your other essentials like chips, soda, candy, drinks, etc. Overall, recommend checking it out!
author: Melanie S.

description: Hot sandwiches for cheap prices. Sandwiches come in three sizes--Junior, regular, and super. You'll have to wait in line and it's cramped quarters in the tiny liquor store. A great stop if you're near Balboa Park.
author: Netty L.

description: Last came here after work for the usuals: Hot Pastrami or cold Roast Beef w/everything on it minus the pickles and onions, on dutch crunch bread. Nothing but hands down for the sandwich gods here... Shhhhhhhhhhh!!! the most efficient thing to do in life here is "Always phone your order" , arrive 15-20 minutes later, pay, and be gone ahead of the long line of hungry mammals especially during lunchtime.
author: Art G.

description:
love. the. sandwiches. 

don't be intimidated by crowded aisle and all the people there.  walk in confidently and make eye contact with one of the many people behind the counter.  someone will approach you and ask what you want.  

say DUTCH CRUNCH!  anything inside dutch crunch will be good.  

i ordered the turkey and bacon on dutch crunch.  delicious!  99 cents Sweet Leaf peach iced tea to wash it down.  

can't wait to go back!

*tip* they accept credit cards as long as its over $10.
author: Anon P.

description: Roxie's is just the best.  I have made trips out to SF just to get a sandwich from here.  I know.  Crazy.  But it is the best.  I love to go to 49er games and grab some sandwiches from Roxie's an bring them to the game.  Everyone around me at the games just drool.  Whatever sandwich you get it has to be on Dutch Crunch and toasted.  Nothing could be finer!
author: Bernardo R.

description: Best vegetarian sandwich in the city.  Crunchy dutch crunch roll, with copious amounts of aguacate, cheese, and three-bean salad.  Three-bean salad!  Who'da thought, I know, but it works!  Plus the usual amenities.  Out of the way, but well worth it.
author: Al K.

description: I have to agree with Jeremy S. in that no one would ever even see this place unless they lived close to it, if it weren't for everyone raving about it on Yelp. The truth is, the sandwiches are big and loaded up, very filling, and good. Why only 3 stars? I honestly would have given 4 stars, but 3 because Yelpers have seriously overrated it. The sandwiches are good. I might go as far as saying they are really good, but that's it. It's just a hole in the wall corner market with small deli stuck in it in an 'eh...' neighborhood. I'm not saying don't go if you are around down there, it is worth trying (I said they are pretty good after all), but don't think it'll be the most pant-crappingly delicious and flavorful deli sandwich you'll every experience. You won't be dreaming of this place, and if you do, you need to experience some more delis my friend.
author: Aaron J.

description: I can't believe I ate a whole regular meatball (toasted Dutch crunch, provolone, all the fixings, extra jalepenos).  There was that point at about 1/2 way through it when the rational side of the brain said, "Hold on now, we're sated, and we know how comatose we get after a big lunch."  But then the other side stomped Mr. Rational into the dirt screaming, "MUST STUFF NUMMY SAMMICH IN FACE HOLE NOW!"
author: Drinky C.

description:
super super super good sandwiches.  ghetto little street corner liquor store, but they have the BEST sandwiches!!!  yum!  i went there the other day with a friend and we ordered our sandwiches and had to wait for a while because they got the orders mixed up.  so there we were waiting while others that ordered after us were leaving, but the guy gave us some free deviled eggs (mmm!)... which surprises me because usually at hole in the wall places and or seemingly 'ghetto' places they don't usually care about their clients being that 'happy'... so it really surprised me at their level of customer service!!!

i've tried many other sandwich shops in the sf area, and this i can say is the best so far!
author: Kimberly F.

description: Best Dutch Crunch bread Ive had outside of a bakery.  Once again I go with Hot Pastrami with provalone, Jalapenos, water, reds, and a vega.  Rivals Gene's. Really.  Different but both really good one stop shops.  Logistics mastery, their system rivals the soup nazi on seinfeld, except theyre really nice.  They put out hella sandwiches per hour, dont worry about the line at rush time, theyre quick.  They need another location.  Parking is usually cool too.
author: Hen A.

description: Great fabulous sandwiches.   Hands down the best place to get a combo of meats and cheese on a carb rolll.  But let's not forget, the vegetarian sandwich is filllllled with things in it.  It's making me drool just think about it.   Oh that's it, i'm having it tonight!   Just make sure to call them to put in your order before you come, to prevent the 15 mins wait!
author: Kim N.

description:
the owner was super talkative and proud of his products. confident in  his work and confident in his store. seemed like a real good guy, only interested in getting you what you want, not selling you whatever he can.

sandwiches were good. fresh ingredients. the lightest dutch crunch bread i've had. more cracker like than bread like. kinda weird but it works.
author: Regina C.

description: I have been going to Roxie's since I was a kid and I have to say when you blend a delicious sandwich with extremely friendly staff who remember you everytime you come back, it doesn't matter how small the place is. Any native San Franciscan knows Roxie's has great sandwiches, but it is also the guys that make every cutomer smile that makes the place even better...For $4.95 you get a great sandwich and the feeling that the local neighborhood deli/store really does care about its community...go and see for yourself.
author: Jennifer S.

description: Roxy's is my FAVORITE sandwich spot.. i always order their turkey club! Although their sandwiches are good, the people that make the sandwiches are a lil iffy.. I'll ask for a turkery club and come home to find out it's a turkey sandwich (no bacon or avocado, and i paid for a turkey club!) or sometimes they forget pickles or jalepenos or something.. so just check ur sandwich before you leave! lol..
author: Jess N.

description: This is one the best sandwich spots in the city. The place looks like a regular liquor store but inside resides sandwich SHANGRI LA. The freshest bread and ingredients are used at this joint. ALWAYS. No Exceptions. Whether you're the first customer of the day or the last. All sorts of S.F. people come to this spot and once you've tried their product you'll know why too. Don't worry about waiting because your patience will be rewarded. Live a little and venture out of your neighborhood and into to this one. GO ALREADY!!!!
author: santiago g.

description: I LUH LUH LOOOVEEEEE this place. its small, but wonderful. a hot pastrami sandwich wit cheddar cheese, everything on it. HOLD on the tomatoes. i promise, it'll hit the spot. love the owners, simon, doni and pete. you can never go wrong at roxies.
author: Abby A.

description: the sandwiches are some of the best in San Francisco. Not a fancy place but they deliver big.
author: Bobby P.

description: Damn, guess this little sandwich spot isn't much of a secret anymore! Try the hot pastrami. The owner is a real stand up guy, does a lot for the community and always remembers your name- although lately he spends more time at the 9th Avenue location. But never mind that, still the best secret sandwich spot in a liquor store you'll find in the district. I like that they spruced up the outside of the building w/ a graffiti mural- at least the "bored, nothing better to do but vandalize the local grocer graffiti dorks" won't hit it up every weekend. Rock on Roxie's!
author: Cristy J.

description: Best hot sandwich I love the turkey with swiss on dutch crunch nice & hot .
author: monica f.

description: once you try roxies, you are not going back to ikes. that's the only thing i can say about this place. i stay loyal to this place, it is my all time favorite sandwich spot ever since i moved to SF. my all time favorite is roast beef, IT'S SOO YUMMY, the taste is the same ever since i had it the first time, and i love beef. but you should try the other sandwich too, i usually customize my sandwich tho, when i'm not feeling roast beef. i say you should call to order because it can get crazy busy here. I LOVE ROXIES!!!!! this place should be featured on food network or cooking channel.
author: Toni Rose M.

description:
"1 Turkey w/Swiss and everythAng on Dutch Crunch, please!"  :-9 

Roxie's = Sammich Heaven!  I've been going to Roxie's since my B-A-L boppin' days and to this day their sandwiches always hit the spot!  Their deli meats are always fresh & tasty and the dutch crunch roll is a MUST.  Although they've gone through a few new faces over the years, they still manage to keep their oh-so-tasty sandwiches on point!  Unlike most places where it is evident their portions have shrunk ("honey please, who are ya kidding?!"), Roxie's sandwiches have NOT, which is why I've been a loyal customer for years!  No need to say any more but go see/taste/fall in love for yourself.  

You're welcome! ;-)
author: Rose P.

description: My K-8 used to be nearby (now it's some preschool or something) and they used to take us here sometimes, I forget why.  Pretty awesome school.  So I've loved this place practically my entire life, and other sandwiches just don't compare.  I haven't tried every place in the city, obviously, but I don't really need to.  I'm a vegetarian and really don't have many options when it comes to sandwiches, especially since I'm pretty picky.  The vegetarian sandwich here is the best, I like it simple, the only thing I really make sure to get is artichoke hearts (no mushrooms, no beans, no peppers, and no freaking tomatoes!).  It is absolute heaven.  Just make sure to eat it soon, one time I got it after class and went to work, but I had to do something there before I could eat, and it ended up being like an hour, and it was all wilty and parts of the bread got soggy.  Saddest moment.  But I still ate the whole thing.
author: Meghan E.

description: $15 for a sandwich is a bit much, but it is filling and taste great. I think Ill just get half next time... I was stuffed.
author: Jason C.

description: So I used to come to Roxie's every once in a while about 10 years ago. I always remembered the sandwiches being good. I was not let down. The sandwiches are solid. Nothing too special here, but they do have a very good selection of breads. The people are really nice, but I'm not sure why it takes a team of 5 guys 10 minutes to make 2 sandwiches. Anyway, really good if you're in the area.
author: Erik S.

description: Turkey on dutch, provolone, everything on it, extra jalepenos, and heated.  Besides that their other sandwiches are on point.  Been a customer since knee-high elementary school days and still a number one customer.  You will not be disappointed.  Fun staff and nice owners.  It gets busy here, but its well worth the wait.  You can come in or place an order through the phone and pick it up.  Thank you roxies!!!
author: Elizabeth N.

description: I am in loooove with their hot pastrami on Dutch Crutch with pepper jack cheese.  Their bread is always perfectly toasted and the cheese nicely melted.  There is always a line but totally worth the wait.  Come here and try a piece of heaven...on a bun =)
author: Katelynn L.

description:
I freaking LOVE this place.   The Simon Special is awesome and so is every other sandwich i have gotten here.  

this place gets crazy busy so we always call in the order and pick it up.

I lived back east for several years and therefore am totally spoiled when it comes to hoagies and this place is yum yum yum.  

The people who work here are funny and seem to be having a good time.  This is a true neighborhood gem.    

Did I mention the sandwiches are really good?  because they are.
author: samantha D.

description: I tried this spot for the first time today and was definitely pleased with the Roxie Special. It was first of all huge and the dutch crunch roll was soft and perfectly crunchy. I have no complaints and will definitely be back. One thing to note is that my boyfriend ordered a JR size sandwich which was $2 less than my Regular size yet just as big so might as well order JR. He had the vegetarian sandwich and I think I'll get that next time...it has mushrooms, artichokes, avocado, and green beans...yummy!
author: Cassandra M.

description: I love their sandwiches! Too bad I don't live that close anymore :-(
author: Pippi L.

description: Best sandwiches in San Francisco. I highly recommend everyone to try them.
author: Carlos F.

description:
so my co-worker and i were out in the middle of nowhere doing bulk mailing for our jobs and i was seriously craving a pastrami sandwich. like i was 3 months pregnant kind of cravings. not that i'd know what that feels like but i digress. 

she has this place on SPEEDIAL okay. and im like laughing at her. "who has a deli stop on speedial?!" 

Well. After having the best pastrami sandwich, on dutch crunch bread, with provolone and all the fixins' (except pickles and mayo) this is where I'll be getting my BIG sandwich fix from now on!

We ordered by phone and she got the veggie sandwich (not on menu) and that stuff has mushrooms, avocado, tomatoes, lettuce, and the WORKS of veggies piled in with some melted cheddar cheese. mmm...mmm...gooooooood.

we went a little later, at around 1:30 and there were still a lot of ppl there.  i wonder where all these ppl come from cuz this place seriously in the middle of NOWHERE.

I, too, now have Roxie's on speedial. 
Don't hate. Just go and see for yourself.
author: Peggy W.

description: My hubby has been talking about their sandwiches for years so we FINALLY came by to pick some up. I had the polish sausage, bleh whatever, but my darling hunny had the roxy special, mmmmm yummy. I'm not a sandwich person either, but I'll have to come back for my own roxy at roxy's! to be continued . . . . . .
author: Christina B.

description: Oh my!! Does this place bring back memories!? This was frequented by my homegirls and I during our various high school escapades before, during or after school. Their sandwiches are the BOMB (can I still use that word?!). Turkey w/swiss on a dutch crunch roll with everything......it's like an addiction. You keep on coming back for more!! Yumm--- I think I'll pay this place a visit once again and relive my youth. haha :)
author: La C.

description: Hits the spot. I don't know how they do it in a not so impressive small size shop. Not a fan of the prices though.
author: Haileab B.

description: Hand's down one of the best places to get a sandwich.  My friends and I have been coming to this corner deli for years since high school and it's still a neighborhood favorite.  This is the first sandwich joint to introduce me to Dutch crunch bread.  The service is friendly and they have a lot to offer inside.  Need chips and a soda?  They have an endless amount of options.
author: Chris S.

description:
let's just say, the first time i went to this place, i planned my ENTIRE day around that sandwich, and MAN O MAN was that a glorious day!

you know when you walk into any liquor store and see a random deli counter and a stack of fresh bread you're in for a treat!

yes it's in a liquor store, yes it's DEEP........basically the only reason you ever need to go to that part of San Francisco is for ROXIE'S!!!

get one of the specials.........toasted........you can't go wrong!
author: Eric O.

description: Stop reading and go get a Roxie Sandwich now! Don't forget to get it on Dutch crunch and have it toasted. My usual, Turkey w/everything except mustard & pickles on Dutch Crunch.
author: Peter L.

description: Had a roast beef with provalone on Dutch Crunch, just to see if this place lived to the hype! Yeah---- it pretty much did. My misnomer of a junior sandwich was huge, well worth the $7. Bonus---- it passed the 24-hour-taste test. Not a bit soggy or gross when I had the other half for lunch the following day. Minus a point for the wait. But my patience runs deep for exceptional sandwiches. Will try the turkey next time!
author: Patricia M.

description:
I was 5 years old when we moved down the street from the Roxie and on our first day my mom walked me up to the store and Pete gave me a free Slushee.  Although I still miss that Slushee machine, I have grown up on Roxie sandwiches!  Whenever our dog got out we knew the first place to look, although often someone from the Roxie would call to tell us she was up there before we even knew she was missing!

About 10 years ago Simon recommended a pastrami with provolone on extra sour (I added extra jalapenos) and I haven't ordered a different sandwich since that day.  I moved out to the suburbs 5 years ago and I still crave Roxie sandwiches--every time I go home to visit I have to get my sandwich!  All the guys are like family to me and my family.  Rest in peace Floyd.

And to all you people wining about the long line--get with the program and call ahead to order like the pros do!
author: Lyssa K.

description: You can NEVER go wrong with a Roxie's sandwich. I have never had a bad experience with a Roxie's sandwich no matter the ingredients, but I usually go for a junior pastrami on dutch crunch =) My friends and I would be the envy of all the students and teachers when we would bring out a Roxie's sandwich for class, having passed by Roxie's before class. No other sandwich shop I've tried can compare to the ones here.
author: Katrina C.

description:
It is my prayer that Roxie Food Center is around for ALL of my future generations to enjoy!

Seriously, I have been enjoying Roxie sandwiches since I was maybe 5 years old.  So, these gentlemen have been creating AWESOME food for many years and serving it with LOVE...real love.

It's a small business that deserves every kind word the yelpers have given because they are DARN GOOD at what they do!  I am NEVER disappointed and "if" I ever were to be unhappy with my sandwich (even if it was my mistake...like I forgot to say I wanted DUTCH CRUNCH) ...they would fix it immediately without even a second thought.

These sandwiches are BY FAR THE BEST that I have ever had in the entire USA (that includes Puerto Rico too).  And did you know they cash checks???  They have saved my butt a million times when I was too late to catch the bank.

I love them and their food.  It's ALWAYS packed in Roxie.  So, make sure you have a minute to wait.  It will be the BEST wait of  your food-loving life.  Halleluyer!!!
author: Karla F.

description:
So two memorable quotes/thoughts from my most recent trip to Roxie's were, "dont buy the marshmallows", and "you gotta love a sandwich place that displays tobacco and bacon right next to each other in the fridge!".

The bottles of liquor looked like they hadn't been touched in half a decade, and their hanging menu looked as though it hadn't been updated in even longer. But dont let any of it fool you. Roxie's serves up some sandwiches that pack serious taste. Pastrami with everything, on dutch crunch...HEATED. thank you very much.

My girlfriend asked for her sandwich cold, to which she was asked, "are you sure?"..... moments later... "so you DONT want it heated?".....and yet again..."okay, so one sandwich no heat??" Who knows what they would have done if we came in for the marshmallows. 

The character of this place was enough to earn that extra star. who would have thought that they now make candy in the form of gold teeth?!?!? it's the modern day cigarette gum i guess.

PS. if youre taking your food to go in the bernal heights area, head to the safeway at 30th and San Jo, the drinks and chips are cheaper there...and you might score some ice cream too.
author: joe j.

description: Hands Down, one of the best sandwiches I have ever tasted!  Try their supreme meatball sando with everything on it.
author: Sam D.

description: Ahhhhhh....Roxie's.....MMMMMM....this place has the best sandwiches. Last time I was there I got a turkey and cheddar on dutch crunch but the best part was that the guy who made it put slices of cheddar on both sides of the sandwich so that when it was toasted it made a delicious cheesy pocket of goodness....I still think about that sandwich from time to time.
author: Christina D.

description: This place should not have one bad review... This place is the s**t... i've been coming here for 25 yrs... since i was a kid swimming at Balboa swimming pool across the street i think the owners are the same I remember a sandwich from there use to consist of hard roll bread, mayo, mustard, meat, cheese. Thats is, and the sandwich was good then and its still good now... If you go during lunch be ready to wait in line. but remember its worth the wait... the best sandwich they will make for you in my opinion is ( and its not on the menu ) turkey sandwich with tuna, provalone cheese, mayo, light on the mustard, tomatoes, lettuce, and if you want pepperchinis ( I know thats spelled wrong but you know what i mean)..........
author: DANNY B.

description: I grew up two blocks from here and miss it terribly now that I'm on the East Coast.  I haven't found any deli anywhere (not even in NYC) that's impressed me as much.  My favorite is the exquisite Dutch Crunch bread toasted and piled high with veggie options -- lots of different cheeses, avocado, and bean salad (it sounds crazy but it's amazing).
author: angela n.

description: Been going there 15+ years best sandwich on the bay. I have to go there 1-2 times a week to get my fix. Any sandwich is good put it on Dutch
author: Sant A.

description: There was a brief point when I was younger where I could have eatten a Roxie's Sandwhich everyday. I work not that far away now and with the whole carb thing and getting older I know its crazy, but it's hard to say no when someone wants to know if I want to go get a Roxie's sandwhich with them. This place is a SF relic, and homage is due to the owner. It's old school, and looks like a grimey deli in NY or random corner store, but if you really truly understood the amount of food pumped out of this place everyday, you'd get it. Watch fot the lines, call ahead if you can, because with 3 high schools in the area, and plenty of people double parking outside, it can get packed.
author: Niki M.

description: I have to say the quality of their sandwiches shocked me.  They are the most delicious sandwiches I've ever tasted and all this from some corner liqour store. I wasn't positive about the outcome of my first order given the shady look of the place but give it a chance and you'll love it.  The guys theire are really funny and they always remember their customers.  Be careful are  you might blink and pass it, but if you get around to visiting you'll be thanking me later. Try the chicken on dutch crunch yummmmmmmmyyyyyyyy. The place is tine and can get crowded but wait it out your taste buds will thank you.
author: Marie B.

description: Great sandwiches for a local corner store.  i try and get a sandwich everytime i'm in the area, the regular is huge, most are pretty full with the small which to me isn't much smaller than the regular.  i really like the crab meat on dutch crunch toasted.  friendly service.  get in, get out.
author: Lester A.

description:
phew.. good thing i beat the rush and got a parking space right out in front... once it was my turn to order i couldnt even see who i was ordering from.. (had to tippy-toe) i got junior turkey on dutch crunch.. no onions.. it took a while to get my sandwich but the man on the counter was really nice.. he kept hurrying up the lady to finish making my sandwich.. oh yea this place is cracking around noon.. so beware! because theres not much walkin space/standing space.. i had to stand by the door and it was freeeeeeezing 

i guess the sandwich was good because i ended up eating the whole thing.. even though i told myself i was goin to eat half and save the rest for later.. oh well.. haha... im definitely going back here again
author: JUDY L.

description: One of the best sandwich places I've been to...mouth watering-- but don't judge by the looks and location of this deli.  The tastes and memories will keep you coming back for more.  Near a friend's house, we used to frequent here a bit after classes or after a work out across at the park.  Hot pastrami, roast beef, italian, turkey swiss are my favs.  Take it to go for your picnic in the park or ballgame fare.  After this place, say goodbye! to your subways and quizwhatchamacallits.
author: Eric Y.

description: ROXIES! a San Francisco must! This place is the stuff that New York Deli's are made out of! they ask you for your order straight up- no fancy stuff, just a good sandwich. I always get the chicken breast with everything ( BBQ sauce, swiss cheese, no mayo) toasted. The sandwiches are large, so I reccommend getting the jr. size as the large size is calculated for a giant! My favorite sandwich spot hands down!
author: Young Urban Minority P.

description: Best sandwiches in SF. hands down. Fast, quick, easy.  Grab a few for a picnic or lunch in the park!
author: Ali C.

description:
the best sandwich spot in SF! place looks like a hole in the wall and paying for your order can get confusing at some points because you pay first then wait around for your sandwich...which can take anywhere from 10-30 min. depending on how crowded it is

i usually order the simon special with avocado...but i've tried quite a few of their sandwich's and they are all good. just be sure to get it with DUTCH CRUNCH bread and add avocado!

place gets very crowded around lunch time, so i would call ahead with your order and just pick it up.
author: krystina ann r.

description:
subway sucks, quizno's is worse, little luca's is alright, mr pickles is good, but THEY AINT GOT NOTHIN ON ROXIE'S.

tickle your taste buds dutch crunch bread, fresh toppings, love the jalapeno. the secret to your utter enjoyment: eating it fresh out the toaster. 

6 bucks for a jr, 9-something for a huge one if you've gotta venti appetite. 

I comes back, yes I does, just for the best.
author: ken p.

description: ordered Roxie's special on french roll, imagine tearing open the wax paper and biting into warm crunchy french bread with ham, cheese, artichoke heart in the center.  Yummm!
author: Sydney L.

description:
there dutch crunch is awesome.  i think it's a little overpriced though... but still really good.  try the barbeque beef.  it's a liquor store/deli... wait in line to pay for stuff or get a sammich. 

yeah it's a hole in the wall and theres thugs hanging out int he front.. but thugs get hungry too.
author: Doug ..

description: Meatball sandwich on toasted soft roll, with everything in it (extra spicy).  This is what my boyfriend would consider a 5 star dining experience.  True East Coasters (Bos, NY) will love this place ...so says bf.
author: Mei B.

description: Oven toasted Dutch Crunch sandwiches are a gift from the heavens.  Only reason I gave this place 4 instead of 5 is because it is VERY cramped and crowded in there.  But once you get your sandwich and get home you forget all about it and it's all worth it.
author: Sean V.

description: My favorite place to get a warm, delicious sandwich crammed with goodness. Right by the pool, too. They always have the drinks I want in stock and delicious snacks. They even have Hello Kitty candy, rofl :) My favorite is the Roxie Special with everything on it! They have Dutch Crunch bread, too my favorite. Gets really busy during lunch, though, so it's a bit of a wait sometimes even if you call in first.
author: M J.

description: I went to this place last week after wanting to go for a while.  Very easy to get to from the freeway and eays to find parking so that was a big plus.  Went inside was greeted with very friendly service.  The sanwich was huge and i just got the regular!  I got the Simon's special which consists of Pastarmi's, turkey and melted cheese.  The money was well deserved and everyone in their is awesome.  Thanks Roxie's!!
author: Hanna A.

description: HANDS DOWN...best place to get a sandwhich in the city. I've been going here since as long as I can remember and my parents were going before that. can't go wrong with any of the choices either...they are all great.  worth every penny too. they are always friendly and accommodating as well. writing this is making me crave a hot pastrami!!!
author: Monica T.

description: I've been going to roxies since i was 5 years old and it's still good.  Get the Samoan Mafia with avocados.  It's pretty much a meatball sub with sour cream.  They raised their prices in the last couple of years, but it's still worth the 8 bucks.
author: erik e.

description: Yet another SF secret. Greatest deli sandwich i've had in SF. It's pretty much a liqour store but don't let the environment throw you off. They know their sandwich and they know it well. Dutch crunch warmed up =PERFECT
author: Bowser J.

description: I have going to Roxies since I was 7 years old. I grew up a block away from this store and was very well known by some of the workers there. Now 15 years later their sandwiches taste even better then I remember but I do miss the cheaper prices. My all time favorite is the junior ham on dutch crunch with provolone cheese. This is their smallest sandwich and it does not compare to other places because it is not small and will fill you up. I have never tasted such delicious sandwiches. Everyone I recommend to this place thanks me for it and becomes a frequent customer. They also have a good selection of chips, soda, candy and other things you find at a regular liquor store. Great location, right near Balboa Park...Try them...You wont regret it.
author: Shirley E.

description: After reading so many great reviews I had to get myself down there, aaaand - it was very OK. Had the pastrami on dutch crunch with everything - except mayo - hate the stuff. All in all, a very good sandwich but definitely NOT the best I've had. The wait was not bad and the bread was fresh. The service - friendly. You need to keep in mind that this is a corner liquor store.  Yes, they also have some groceries and tons of candy choices, but it's a liquor store - so yes, you can have a beer or a fifth with your sandwich.  You can take your food across the street and sit at Balboa Park to eat as there is no sitting of any kind here.  Not sure, can you drink liquor at the park?  Probably not - but for such a dinky out of the way place, a real good experience. Will definitely come back if I'm in the area.
author: Mrs N N.

description: I think I'm pretty spoiled when it comes to sandwiches.. I can't help it when I pretty much grew up eating at this place after soccer or baseball practice at Balboa Park.  You wouldn't really want to go shopping here or anything.  and the place is tiny.. But my goodness, the sandwiches.. Quizno's did not invent "toasty" sandwiches.  I love how the dutch crunch bread crackles in my mouth.  I love how all the toppings seem to mingle after it's been toasted.  I have to make a trip every week just to get my fix.. Thank goodness for Roxie's.
author: A. H.

description: YUMMY!!!!!!!  I love their sandwiches.  Hate the line but it goes by pretty quickly.  I used to go there alot when I used to go to school but then since I'm not in that area that often, its been hard to go there.  Every chance I get, I go and grab a sandwich.  I'm usually the turkey person so I get that with everything on it and they make it righti n front of you.  Also grab some tasty drink of the endless choices they offer.  ALSO, the potato salad is REALLY GOOD!!!
author: Wendy K.

description: I have been a die-hard roxie's fan ever since I was wee. These sandwiches are nothing short of amazing. When I'm away at school, this is the number one thing I crave (to all others like me: roxie's sandwiches hold up surprisingly well on a plane. Try it). There is a certain, unmistakable roxie's smell and taste that accompanies every sandwich, no matter what kind it is. It can not be recreated, or even imitated. The store is cramped and dark and definitely does not give off the impression that such remarkable culinary creations come out of it, but this all adds to the charm. At peak times, they can get a little backed up with orders, but it's never too bad of a wait, and it can be easily circumvented by calling ahead. No matter how long the wait is, though, a roxie's sandwich is always worth it.
author: Aly S.

description: Gotta love their turkey and american sandwiches warm with jalapenos. Yeah toasted.
author: Marie G.

description: These sandwiches are legendary.  Their whole sandwich factory process is pretty cool to watch.  3-4 people pumping out sandwiches efficiently.  I like the specials, but all their sandwiches are awesome.  I must say, they've perfected the sandwich making process.  It's a good thing too, cuz I've perfected the eating process!!
author: Jonathan T.

description: One of the best sandwich places in town... I'd give it a 5, but the price is a bit high.  Almost $8 for a regular sandwich... but it's worth it once in awhile.
author: Henry D.

description:
I LOVE ROXIE SANDWICHES!!! 

I've been going to this place for a decade now. Still as good today as it was 10 years ago! Quick, friendly service and the sandwiches are terrific! I don't know how they can make a sandwich so good. It's been a few months since I've been there since I now live in San Mateo - but I can't wait til the next visit for my Junior sandwich. 

Small place, but who cares?? I go there for the sandwiches, not the ambiance!!
author: Anne S.

description: The first time i went to Roxies the workers there were rude... The sandwiches arent that great!!!!  But everyone has their own opinion, i really dont like Roxies...Sorry i had a bad experience here
author: Lennie G.

description: It is a five star sandwich , but the line system sucks , so 4 stars only . I have a construction company and if I buy lunch for the guys I go here . No one ever complains about the Roxie sandwiches . And a fair price as well .
author: Keyser S.

description: Grrrrrreat Sandwiches. Seriously, when I think deli sandwich, I think Roxie's. The Roxie special on soft roll is my favorite.  Second favorite is Crabmeat on Dutch Crunch. Yummmmmmmmm.  Plus they have Tom's hot fries, which I haven't been able to find anywhere else.
author: Nicole C.

description: Best sandwiches anywhere.  Been eating their sandwiches for 20 years and have never found a better sandwich.  Always stop off at Roxie's on the way to 49ers games. The "large" is $11 but it is really 2 large sandwiches.
author: Sam R.

description: I've grown with these sandwiches. I don't know what it is about Roxie's sandwiches but they're awesome. No matter what you order, it is guaranteed to be delicious. My favorite though is roast beef on dutch crunch- lettuce, onions, mayo and black pepper- Toasted!
author: Manny V.

description: Nothing like it.  Friends & i love this place so much we did a video about it.  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kK9WUevcDR8
author: Gus R.

description: Very old Family owned business.  I don't eat these as much as I used to - this place is a city original.  If you don't mind crowded lines and small spaces.  The owner is really a very nice man and his son's are very funny. They always toast my sandwich even when I say "No".  Love this place.
author: Jubei K.
