description: My first direct-from-yelp referral and now I'm hooked.  Needed a place to get cheap lunch on the way to a play at city college.  These sandwiches are insanely delicious and the heated dutch crunch bread has a fabulous somewhat buttery crunchy texture.  While I really enjoyed the turkey with provolone and everything, I tasted the pastrami with cheddar and think it was somewhat more delicious.  (After all, if your going to get a gi-normous liquor store sandwich, you might as well commit.) Getting it toasted w/ everything is definitely key.
author: Eva W.

description: A neighborhood legend, Roxie's is a hidden gem.  A wonderment of sandwhich love lost within the dirty and dungenous confines of a liqour store.  Roxie's has been a childhood haunt for myself and many others.  Unfortunately, despite the awesome, uncomparable taste of what a sandwhich should taste like, Roxie's has consistently given me the runs.  Maybe, it's the oil, maybe it's the cheese.  Hopefully, it's not the quality of the ingredients, but I keep an open mind and won't disregard that the quality of ingredients could be the culprit.  Now a rare sacrifice, Roxie's has become a cruel trade of good eating for bad shitting.
author: Darkie L.

description:
This place is fantastic!  The only place I've ever ordered a "jr" anything and was satisfied post-consumption.  I think the truly special touch is toasting the bread.

Extra points for the liquor store, making this a one-stop shop!
author: Tony C.

description: Roxie's by far has one of the best sandwiches in the city the only thing that sucks is that it takes forever and theres always a line so i reccomend ordering on the phone first!... but damn i love them
author: Shauna P.

description:
Roxies is good, huge and priced perfectly. 

Now I have to say it is not the best, but boy it is close. In fact, when I worked in the city, my co workers and I had a sandwich week to judge all the places we had been and Roxies was tied for first (Little Lucca in SSF was it's rival). I do prefer Little Lucca (the garlic spread), but Roxies natural flavor, size, and price is perfect. 

The place is crowded and the line is long, but aren't all good places? The great thing is as you are in line you get to pick up your chips and drinks on your way up to the counter. It is like an assembly line...what a great concept! Now if you have a large group (tailgating, co workers and such),  order before hand, if you have a group of sandwiches though, the people behind you might get irritated, I know I would...and don't be picky, know what you want so the line moves!

But hands down still one of the best places.
author: Jay S.

description: Roxies is the go-to sandwich place! Funky for sure, but don't let the look turn you away - its all part of the experience. Calling in your order can speed things up, but that's for wimps. Get there, make sure you spend time with the locals and if you bring the pooch you might get a little treat for the dog to boot!
author: Shawn C.

description: Love Roxies. YUMMY sandwiches. Friendly people and usually parking right in front!
author: Jessica S.

description: I've been coming here since I was a kid.  One of the BEST sandwich shop in San Francisco hands down.  See for yourself I always order a turkey sandwich on dutch crunch with EVERYTHING on it!! Iam not picky
author: Joely L.

description:
Ever since i moved to the neighborhood, i order my sandwiches from here whenever I crave for some.  I tend to order on the phone now to save some time (due to long lines at the times i go there) whether I'm driving from somewhere or just coming from home and its ready for me to pick up when i get there.  
I go with the Roxie Special w everything usually on a Dutch Crunch bread, but I've tried others like Pastrami, Roast Beef, Turkey (usually with provolone cheese ) and they were also very good. 
The best sandwiches I've eaten.
author: Jason C.

description: I'm not really sure why all the reviews on this place aren't 5 stars. So what if the place is small...they make AMAZING SANDWICHES!! Quit being so spoiled. This place is hands down the best s;pot in Frisco to get a sandwich. It's been around for years and is practically a neighborhood landmark. The people are friendly and the service is quick. Any sandwich on dutch crunch bread heated up is INSANELY yummy.
author: Sarai S.

description:
Roxie Rocks!
Easily the best sandwiches in San Francisco if not the whole universe.  I usually get the supreme smoked turkey on dutch crunch.  Getting the supreme is a good value as I can split it with my gf.  (she's eats 1/4, I get the rest.  woohoo!).  

Tip o the day.  Call in your order.  While the sandwiches are great the shop is tiny.  When it gets busy like at lunch time, you can end up waiting in a long line in their cramped store.  They do go through the line pretty quickly tho, but call ahead and save yourself some time.
author: Jon F.

description: Roxies is by-far the BEST sandwich spot I have EVER been to! I don't know what it is about Roxies that sets them apart from everyone else but I have had sandwiches from other delis that looked like Roxies sandwiches (size, portions etc.) and they still don't compare! The smallest sandwich size (junior) is really big for a junior.. LOL. You get what you pay for and you won't be dissatisfied! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
author: Sarah E.

description: I love this spot.The small sandwich is like a large and the large is like a foot long but the real deal foot long.The best part is that they can toast it for you.I try to wait till I get home to eat but...I just cant I'm lucky if I make halfway home.You got to try this place you cant go wrong!
author: ren M.

description: Simon and Tony run the best sandwich shop in The City. Come in with a joke and they will give you 50 in return. And their morning coffee is smoove.
author: Stephen S.

description: So far this has been the best sandwich shop near our neighborhood.  My Xo usually orders the pastrami on a soft roll with swiss or provolone cheese & everything on it.  I tried a couple of variations but my fav are the crab & the turkey with no tomatoes but everything else.  I dont like the hard bread or the dutch crunch.  In my opinion, the Dutch crunch is better off eating it alone.  The only thing that sux is there is no parking so it would be best to order in advance by phone.  Its a great place to get the sandwiches before you go to a 49er game =)
author: XoXo X.

description: Best and only real deli style sandwiches in San Francisco. Hella good!
author: Peter B.

description: The Roxie Special on a Dutch Crunch = my favorite deli sandwich in SF!
author: Sue G.

description: I swear there are drugs in these sandwiches...nothing is this good. Turkey and pastrami on dutch crunch should not be this good.  By far the best sandwiches in town.  Well worth the drive from anywhere in town.
author: Reid B.

description: my junior 'simon's special' was super yummy, my fiance loved his medium turkey club, we beat the heat across the street at balboa park swimming pool lawn, where there was a surprising lack of doggy doo doo....and that is only the beginning of the love--our truck wouldn't start when we wanted to head over to Argus to have some margs, and we were parked right outside Roxie, and Tony from Roxie pointed us to the gas station 2 blocks away and lent us his own gas can, as we thought that was the problem. Well, it wasn't gas we needed, and Tony spent at least a half hour troubleshooting what might be the problem. Again, we are talking about a Roxie staff superstar spending his time helping us revive my truck. Not only Tony, but several super friendly guys kept asking us if they could jump our battery or recommend a local mechanic, etc. One fellow even jumped our battery and gave us a watermelon! So, YES a great sandwich, a touching amount of local friendly helping hand flavor, and even though I needed towing, I found my morale higher than it might have been due to how very decent the folks were at and around the Roxie Food Center. besos to Tony and the gang who kicked in trying to lend a hand! and lordy, what a  coupla scrumptious sammies!
author: mimsy b.

description: Anything is good on Dutch crunch. I can eat alot but hardly finish the XL meatball. They do close fairly early.
author: Evan W.

description: Family business that still does it right. A top 5 deli in SF. Meatball on soft roll is great. Roast Beef & Swiss on extra sour, No heat, splash of oil & vin. is also a favorite.
author: Mo G.

description:
This place has been in the neighborhood since I was a kid.  We learned to swim across the street at Balboa Swimming Pool.  These are the best sandwiches in town.  There are an array of meats etc. to choose from, but whatever you order heat it up.  The flavors all melt together and they are so good!!!  Great meal to take to the ballgame or a quick meal.  My favorite is the pastrami.  Even the most picky customer comes out a fan.  

A baby size is good, unless you have a huge appetite or you're sharing.
author: dinorah s.

description:
Turkey with provolone on dutch crunch please.....

From the outside, you'd never think they make great sandwiches..... some people walk in here and disappear for some time only to emerge with a sandwich ordered to their perfection. 

Sandwich heaven.......
author: Emma N.

description: One of the better sandwich places in the city. The place is small but the food is great. However the prices are increasing, but it is everwhere else as well.
author: Brian Y.

description: had the simon special, and it was to die for.  it was so tasty, so i came back for more.  this time around i tried the turkey club.  it was decent, but the simon special knocks it out of the waters!
author: Sheri N.

description: one of the better sandwiches shop in the san francisco... always one of my local favorite since few block walk from me... but im never really a sandwich person but as long it go all the ingredent i tear it all up, been here in high school days...10+ years ago!!!!
author: JessePanda C.

description: I am personally shocked that there is anything less than 5 star reviews for this place, but some people just cannot be pleased.  This is literally the best sandwich I have ever had in my life.  I've been going here since 1997, when my boss at UPS brought me here.  I arrived and was immediately intimidated by the location, the size of the place, and the fact that is was PACKED with people.  ADA certified?  No...  A place I would do my everyday shopping?  No...  The best price for a soda or six pack of beer?  No... And I don't care.  It's the best sandwich on Earth.  They take your bread and cook it in one oven, not a microwave.  They take your meat and cheese and cook it in a seperate oven.  Then all the fixin's you could want and BANG!  You're rocking with the best sandwich you've ever tasted.  Did I mention that?  Anyway, my favorites are the chicken breast and the crab on dutch crunch with provolone.  The Pastrami with chedder is to die for as well.  My wife LOVES the veggie...  I've only had one sandwich here I didn't like, and that was the one I didn't get.  :)  Simon, Tony, and now all the youngsters will do you up...  Good luck trying to park, because the streets are packed with people that got their sandwiches and couldn't wait to put the keys in the ignition before eating them.  Wanna sandwich before a Giants/49ers game?  Better go early and call it in, because the line will be out the door.  Thanks Roxies for being the best place to eat a meal since I lived at home.
author: Chris C.

description:
the BEST sandwiches are the ones that not a whole lotta peeps really know about .. and this is ONE of them ... 

don't even ask how i even stumbled upon this place ... 

anyways ... i'm serious ... it's always those delis .. those mom and pop stores that bring out the biggest, cheesiest smile in all of you ...

custom made, fresh cold cuts .... came here thrice and have not been disappointed ... the guys are super friendly, super fast, and always willing to help ... 

they have salads, side orders, breakfast, desserts and combo platters, but i'm just fine with my junior $6.69 roxie especial ... mortadella, ham, salami, w/2 cheese ... you can also get it with turkey, bacon and avocoado w/mayo, lettuce, tomato and cheese ... splash it all together and you've got yourself ONE HAPPY JEN :)
author: Jennifer S.

description: Half veggie, half BBQ, best sandwich ever! Eating at Subway or Quizno's is just wrong. These guys know how to make a sandwich right! Jummy!
author: Jazmin M.

description: if god got hungry for a sandwich he would part the fog come down and go to roxie.
author: enrique r.

description: So I am a HUGE Ike's fan, but decided to give it a try b/c it was #1. I called in the sandos ahead of time, and they were to be ready in 10 minutes- perfect- we were already in the car on the way there. They were just being finished up as I let them know I was there to pick them up- and then the man gave me the sandos and I left. In the car, they smelled so good, I wanted to check 'em out- So I opened one up to take a peek- and realized they WERE NOT MY SANDWICHES!! OMG- So I called them to let them know and they said they were sorry, and to come back and excahnge for the right sandos. I was already home! -SO, went back, he let me keep the wrong ones, which was a bonus, b/c I got to try a few different things I normally wouldnt order, but I still was not impressed. Just okay for me. The dutch crunch was bomb- but just a regular sandwich, where as IKES or LITTLE LUCCAS has special sauce that makes it even MORE BOMB. So, if you live close, go for it- but if you are coming from across the city just to come and try, kinda not worth it. :(
author: Tara M.

description: Just simply the best sandwich shop ever!! Dutch crunch, roast beef, mayo, lettuce, swiss cheese and ALWAYS toasted please!!! The store is pretty small and hard to get around esp when there's so many people waiting to get their orders but the friendly guys inside will make sure everyone is taken care of.
author: Anonymous P.

description: My lover says it's the best and I agree!
author: Jessica E.

description: o man this place is good.  walk to roxies from l-w on a foggy lunch time for toasty sandwichy goodness.... dutch crunch , turkey, cheddar cheese melty and all the goodies.  i havent been in years but maybe a field trip is in order.....
author: rachel a.

description: Best sandwiches in the city hands down.  I've been going there since I was a child.  I always get the ham sandwich with the dutch crunch bread.  They have a great selection of drinks & chips.  Enjoy!
author: Anna P.

description: I grew up in Frisco and this is one of the last corner deli's that makes bomb ass sandwiches.  Their plain old roast beef sandwich kicks the tar out of any of Ike's gooey sandwich blobs.
author: Jamie A.

description: I have to say, Tony is the man.  I ordered $300 dollars worth of sandwiches one day and that man knew what to do.  I told him to mix it up and he took care of it.  I gave them a couple of hours notice so they were well prepared in time (sorry people waiting in line that day, I ordered a lot).  I had my bud drive down there because they couldn't deliver and even he said it was well worth it.  One thing that kind of surprised me was the tray deposit.  If I had wanted to get a tray I needed to put down a $20 deposit.  Needless to say, I didn't want it.  I also didn't want to have the hassle of driving it back.  At work, my crew just tore into it.  I might have ordered a little too much, but in the end I took some home with me and I am still enjoying them.  Only one person at work knew about Roxie's so I anticipate more people will know about this place.  Sandwiches here are so much better than Subways.
author: David L.

description: best sandwiches here hands down.. i get the warm turkey club with dutch crunch bread.. awesomeness everytime!
author: kevin j.

description: Oh yes.... Now I wasn't totally turned on by the appearance but hearing all the hype, I knew I had to try it. First off, the people there are adorable. They have so much pride in their sandwiches and their history, I love it. I walked out with a smile just from talking and hanging out with the staff while I waited for my sandwich. When I finally ate it, they totally have the right to be proud, these are freakin good! I got the salami on Italian with everything on it. The meat was soo flavorful and fresh. Cant wait for my next sandwich here.
author: R C.

description: the hot link sandwich is pretty bomb.
author: Linda N.

description: dammmnnn the roxie food center. the only sandwich i get here is the large bbq beef. its basically T H E shit. every other kind of sandwich, i think theres a fine line between perfect and fucked up. the bbq beef u cant really fuck up, cuz its so good. make sure u get it on dutch crunch with extra jalapenos. for the price u get a huge sandwich, i usually save half of it, its even better soggy sometimes. this place defiantly fights over ike's place in my sandwich lineup, and usually wins because they don't have a ridiculous wait, and the sammie is just as good, if not better. if ur down with corner store deli sandwiches, u gotta check out the roxie food center.
author: Won L.

description: i don't get it ... they're just sandwiches.  and not even up to the level of sub center.  but sure, their "junior" is humungo!  maybe i'm missing something?  i much rather prefer sub center on ulloa.
author: spiff e.

description: The year 1984. The place"Balboa Swimming Pool". A young boy and his nephews (I'm a young uncle) are each given a dollar for the day. A dollar! C'mon a Dollar! Yup a Dollar. So we head off to the swimming pool and pay a quarter to go swimming.  With 75 cents left we're starving. Across the street is Roxys'. So off we go. I'l have a mustard and mayo sandwich on dutch crunch heated up please, and the 6 ounce half soda. "That will be 75 cents"...perfect.  Now let me tell you, I can actually afford more than a junior sandwich now but to this day.....That mustard and mayo on dutch crunch heated up was probably my most memorable sandwich experience ever to this day. For for 25 years i've been enjoying this place and wiil as long as I live. 1 Simon special to go please......
author: Amado G.

description: This one is right up there with Ike's Place in the Castro. It's tasty. I had a vegi with artichoke hearts, kidney beans. It was interesting, but delicious. Nice people work there too.
author: Lucy G.

description: driving by this lil hidden corner store~u wouldnt dare think this place makes the best/fresh deli sandwiches ever....this place is sooo old school~on a busy day theres a line that stretches around the corner...if your a tuna lover like me~u get a free soda~its always a tough decision between that & the roast beef....
author: elmer d.

description: What makes a good sandwich at this place is the dutch crunch bread, however, the meats are ok.   Not sure if this is worth a drive across town.
author: amy l.

description:
roxie's sandwiches are the bomb...
especially when you're hungover on a sunday...
the guys and gals that work there are true makers of 
the sandwich...deviled eggs are also the best...
have a nice day...and eat your sandwich in the park right
across the street...
author: Alexander S.

description: this place is goood. good prices, great sandwiches, and close to home. portions are awesome, i dont feel skimped at all, unlike places like Vikings at ocean.
author: Danny Y.

description: mmm im already drooling thinking about these sandwhiches. ive tried a bunch but my favorite has to be the vegetarian, hands down. usually when u think of no meat, u think it may be lacking in something even size but not at roxies! the vegetarian which i suggest u get on dutch crunch is packed with oodles of cheese, they weigh it, is how much they put. then theres also avocado which who doesnt appreciate? the most noteworthy touch is the bean salad that they add which is slightly sweet slightly sour and ohh so heavenly. after being toasted a little, it comes out all crunchy with perfectly melted cheese. its also huge! i could barely finish the junior, and the prices- phenomenally cheap for the quality and size. id recommend to vegetarians and non alike. 2 big thumbs up.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Thinking about Roxie's just makes my mouth water, most of their customers are devoted customers who have been coming to them for YEARS..... I happen to one of them. First off, don't the appearance fool you, they make a MEAN sandwich! Yes it looks like a run down sketchy liquor store, BUT they really know how to put together a good tasting Sammie. Their bread is phenomenal, I love to get their Roxie Special on Dutch Crunch which hands down is the best DC I've had. and you need to get any sandwich you get here, toasted! It's like a cardinal ruler and personally, I think it tastes better that way. Thank you for always satisfying my sandwich craving Roxies!
author: S A.

description: My friend Chris took us here to get sandwiches before a SF Giants game. I was impressed by the sandwiches. They were hands down one of the best I've ever had.
author: Brian W.

description: Simon's  special on fresh dutch crunch. A very amazing sandwich.
author: Jordan B.

description:
i only get one sandwich here.  but i dont mind.  its the best turkey-avocado-on-dutch-crunch EVER.

at first, this place might seem like just another cutty liquor store, but when you get a taste of their toasted sandwiches, roxies is heaven on earth.  and yes, i said toasted.  

theres a good variety of cheese, breads, and meats, but i just stick to my usual.  if you dont let them know what extra stuff you want or dont want on your sandwich, they will end up putting EVERYTHING on it.  

the subs are pretty big.  their junior size is as big as a Regular at any other deli.  i think its $5.75 for the Junior size, extra for the avocado.  

these subs are really good and roxies is definitely the place to go.  oh and their dutch crunch is hands down the.  best.  ever.
author: Shelly C.

description: behold the sandwich shop of the gods, bow down yee meeger mortals for you are not worthy of step through the doors of this hallowed hall of sandwichdom. sub shop, yellow submarine, moisha's pic pic, all other sandwichs shops on earth, bah, they quiver at the feet of the holy one. where else on earth can you be bestowed with a seven meat sandwich and get cheese on it? .. not at some jewish deli!!!! 7 different meats on the most holy of breads dutch crunch heated wit everything, lettuce, pickels, tomatos, jalapenos, mayo, mustard, nuff said. all you other shmoes humping the, "oh this place is better then, train, can get just get lost, for you taste buds have been ruined by tossing to much salad!!" peace the mighty brewbacca
author: Brewbacca W.

description: all i gotta say is yummmmmmmmmy roxie's. this is the best sandwich ive ever had in my life and ive quite a bit. if you're hungry for a good satisfying sandwich roxies is the place. but its best to call in your order ahead of time because they get pretty packed in there!!!
author: Christina O.

description: Yummm!  Probably the best sandwich in the city -- especially for the price!  Glad I went at 3:00 cuz the line was relatively short -- I can't imagine what lunchtime is like.  Read all the other yelp reviews, but still didn't expect much cuz  the SF sandwich/deli scene is dismal (with a few exceptions such as Miller's East Coast West.)  You yelpers did not disappoint nor did Roxie's!!!
author: sweaterhead x.

description: this place is better than most samich places but a little over rated. the sandwiches are good but it does not make you say "wow dis some good shit". the place is in a corner store and is small as hell in there. the do toast all of their samiches though so i gotta give them that!
author: RICKY C.

description: wow, talk about hole in the wall.  loved it, great bread, good selection.  it was very NYC deli.  and it was packed, poeple had to wait outside.  totally worth it. grab a sandwich, eat it in balboa park, good times
author: kiki b.

description: This is the BEST sandwich place I've had so far.  Their sandwiches come in different sizes (I think larger sizes usually mean more meat added to your sandwich).  I've been coming here for years.  A friend of mine told me about this place when I used to go to CCSF.  She kept telling me how GOOD their sandwiches were so I went with her to give it a try and after the first bite I had, I was hooked!  They make their sandwiches just the way I like it, toasty and hot.  I also like that they don't charge extra for cheese, but then it's not really a cheap sandwich either.  Go with the dutch crunch, it's so yummy!
author: Katniss B.

description: One of the best sandwich shops in S.F. An institution in the Ingleside. I can still remember going there 20 years ago after little league practice to buy a sandwich and cherry Slush Puppies. Though they no longer have the Slush Puppies, some of the same people still work there. Only knowing each other by face, they still seem to ask how I'm doing even if I haven't been there in months. The pictures of neighborhood families and friends along the walls can atest to the shared respect and gratitude we all have for this place. The kind of place we should support in a time of nameless debit charges to a fast food joint. With all that said... my favorites are the roast beef, Roxie's supreme, and mafia on either soft Spanish roll or dutch crunch in that order
author: Lee O.

description: i lived in this neighborhood for awhile and had sandwiches at Roxie quite a bit when i was attending CCSF. the sandwiches were always pretty good and damn huge- but the service has always been less than courteous. one guy behind the deli counter quotes one price- then the guy at the check stand quotes another inflated price. the guys that work there put on this insincere we're hooking ya up attitude that just leaves me annoyed. the sandwiches are always the same- nothing is more hoked up or different from visit to visit. i stopped going to Roxies because of the people that work there, not because of the food.
author: Ax L.

description: if you are given one last meal you had better choose a sandwich from roxie's market. i have been a costomer of roxie's market's since the tender age of 7. i stand by my turkey sandwiches and i strongly encourage the deprived who have not yet tasted this luxurious and breathtaking sandwich to step outside of their box and be exposed to such an experience that is so undescribable. thank you. roxie's RULES!
author: Angie M.

description: Great people who make amazing sandwiches. If its not right dont worry they will make another without any complaint, its happened once, but I didnt have to worry a bit. These guys are great, they all have great personalities and work real well. Small place and gets crowded but they do their very best to make it work. see you guys in a couple days to get a hot pastrami sandwich.
author: ferd l.

description: i would like to take the opportunity to thank the hubby for introducing me to this place (i know he will be reading this shortly). cold turkey on dutch crunch with american & everything on it except mustard. warm pastrami whith swiss on white. a bag of original lays & a tall can of coke. word.
author: foodi e.

description: Okay, I haven't been to Roxie's in a long time, but I grew up going there to get my sandwiches. This IS the place to get a sandwich.  I moved away about 15 years ago and I still think about my Roxie sandwiches.  Makes me wanna drive down to SF just to get one!
author: Raquel K.

description: Wow. So far the best sandwich place i've been to in the san francisco area! Beats little lucas imo. Very good sandwhics and to me they are very friendly. A must place to eat!
author: Matthew R.

description: LOVE this place! I've tried their roast beef and crab salad sandwiches (both on dutch crunch) but I would have to say that the hot pastrami is my all time favorite!
author: Sharon H.

description: I have no idea why i have waited so long to write a review for Roxie's. I have been eating sandwiches from here for over 10 years, and have tried almost every sandwich they have-Turkey, Pastrami, Roast Beef, Simon's Special, the list goes on....and every single sandwich I have ever had from them has been worthy of some random award on the food network...best sandwich, best service, best everything. Now, I can tell you all about how delicious their food is, how much meat they put in the sandwiches, how they perfectly toast their dutch crunch, how they have the balance of mayo to mustard down to a science, but I'm going to tell you about their service instead. Because honestly, as good as their food is, it would be nothing without the amazing people behind the counter. Every single time I go there, I am greeted with a smile from all the employees. Not only do they take my order, they ask what I'm up to, where I'm coming from, where I'm going. They tell me about their day, how their vacation was, the last crazy who came into the store wanting to sell his kidney. It's something you see on TV-the main character who goes into a coffee shop and everyone knows who she is, and what she wants, and where she sits. It's a pretty damn good feeling. And then you end your experience with the guy at the register lowering the price just for you, or throwing in a piece of candy. Because let's be honest, who doesn't love a free piece of candy, and they know it'll make you happy while you're enjoying your regular toasted simon's special with no jalapenos and salt/pepper. I love you Roxie's, don't ever change.
author: Deena H.

description: i would give this place a 5, i used to go here a lot when i was a wee lad, but unfortunately the sandwich guy passed a few years back (lord bless the dead) and now its average, but in its heyday, it was 5+ easy.
author: rae m.

description: hands down one of the best if not the best places to getta sandwich. its been here forever, and i wont stop going. EVER....i go here before every niner and giants game and the line is packed. place is as traditional and original as it gets. Roxies....a str8 up classic
author: jonathan s.

description: Roxie has the best sandwiches I've ever eaten XD I don't go here often, but it always turns out to be a great treat whenever I do. Definately a place I would recommend everyone to check out
author: Cindy W.

description:
hey whats up.  

this is the best sanwich spot in the  city.  hell my mom ate these sandwiches  when she was pregnat with me.

anyways i wont lie. i work there. i have wored in othe food places and this just has the best food.  its always fresh. i can't remeber how many times Peter, Simon, and Tony yelled at me about keeping things clean and always using fresh food.

anyways i am here to tell you  there is a new roxie opening soon. it will be located in Chico, CA. the address is 3470 hwy 32  Chico , CA.    check it out if your up that way.  

coming on HYW 5 (either north or south)  take hwy 32 chico/ orland exit. take hyw 32 for 10 miles and you will see the welcome to chico sign. we are a mile past on the left.

coming from hyw 99. take either hyw 32 exit. turn on hyw 32 and follow it down. you will see on the right. or you can take east ave. off of hyw99. coming from the north you make a right. coming from the south you make a left.  take east ave for about 2 miles and make a right at  hyw 32. 2 more miles and you see us on the right.

just remeber its a roxie and we have the sandwiches.
author: speero t.

description: I've been going to Roxies for 5 years now and it's still the best place in the city for a sub. I prefer the regular meatball....but still everything on their menu is delicious. The Roxie's special is also a personal favorite, combining everything heavenly in one sandwich. What seems like a "family" store has great service and you can't help smile when the cashier asks you "whatcha get boss?" when you pay. 5 stars!
author: Nathan M.

description: don't be like me and get the roast beef instead of the pastrami on dutch crunch with swiss, now we both know
author: Alan V.

description: i've been going to roxie's since i was a little girl. they have the best sandwiches and they always remember who you are and will already know what you want. try the dutch crunch with ham and provolone cheese heated and side of chips you are all set.
author: Milana S.

description: great warm sandwiches! not to much room and you will wait a few minutes if it's busy and every time i been there it's busy. call ahead
author: Ausewaldoe J.
